01 W Weekly inspection of WL 2 Tollway
01 W Weekly inspection of WL 2 Tollway  - Off Pavement
1. Inspect Off-Pavement Tollway assets weekly as listed on
Regular Weekly  Inspection Report TMF-3012-OP-0002.
Record maintenance requirements.   Reference procedure
TMI-3012-OP-0001.
2. Personnel to carry safety vest, maintenance standards and
rotating vehicle hazard light and a tape recorder as a
minimum requirement.  Vehicle hazard light must be operating
when travelling in the emergency lane.
3. Notify control room if you are required to stop in emergency
lane to carry out further inspections
4. Check by 'drive-by' inspection  using a systematic approach
to encompass all inspection targets, these can be carried
out on separate days of the week ie; drainage and pits one
day and landscape on another, fencing one day and graffiti
on another etc.
Road Reserve pits/culverts for damage and blockage
Road Reserve drainage for blockages or flooding
Shared pathways
Delineators
Noise Barriers
Guard Rail
Fencing & access gates
Litter
Graffiti
Landscape areas
Record any other requirements outside specified maintenance
levels.
5. Make temporary repairs to unsafe items if possible, and if
safe to do so.  (  ie:  sweep stones and any ponding water
from pathways.)
6. Raise new job sheet or add to running jobsheets, any major
corrective maintenance action.
7. Ensure that any minor routine action identified is noted for
action on the current fortnightly litter and landscape
jobsheet.
8. Off-Pavement Inspection
Mon [      ]      Tues [      ]
Wed [      ]      Thurs [      ]
Friday,,[        ]

01 W Inspection of  WL Toll gantry Blue Lighting
Make sufficient copies of form:
TMF-3012-OP-0380 Four arm blue light inspection sheet (2 Required)
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Inspect  the Blue lights installed at each toll point for
operation, as listed below for lamps that have failed.
The Toll Point Gantries are:
1N North Bound (Albion St - 1B)   [_ _]
1S South Bound (Albion St - 1A)   [_ _]
2. As a minimum, personnel are to wear safety vest and use
vehicles equipped with rotating vehicle hazard light.
Vehicle hazard light must be operating when travelling in the
emergency lane.
3. Notify the control room if you are required to stop in the
emergency lane to carry out further inspections.
4. At each location, visually inspect the lighting and record
lamps that are not on and record on the form by
marking with an "X", on TMF-3102-OP-0380.  Use a separate
form for each gantry.
5. Ensure the Job sheet and the completed forms
TMF-3012-OP-0380 and(one form for each gantry) are returned
to the Electrical / Electronics Team leader or his
representative.
6. The Electrical / Electronics Team Leader or his
representative shall schedule the replacement of lamps and or
repair of light fittings.
Work completed as above work plan by Siros

06 M Maint of Gantry Tolling Equipment
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Carry out the six monthly planned maintenance defined in the
CML RSE Users Manual maintenance schedule, document no.
M-MCL-ET-1225.
2. Perimeter access gate at technical shelter key required.
3. To access the 400W VDC lamps on the right hand side, set up a
lane closure as per work instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002 and the
TLO procedure PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 17, 18 and Plan 2, 12 for the
left hand side access.
Note: In locations where a rear gantry exists the 400W VDC
lamps are located and accessed via the rear gantry structure.
Note: Any changes made to the closure in Work Done area of
the Job Sheet.
4. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment and
or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to safety
instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 Working  on Gantry
Structures.
5. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical Shelter.
6. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plan  PL-MCL-ET-100001.
7. Record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet any
outstanding works requiring further attention.
Create a new Job sheet for any outstanding works and notify
the Team Leader or his representative of the outstanding
works.
Record the New job number in the Work Done area of this
job sheet and in the Related Job field of both jobs.
8. Notify Control Room prior to departing from the Technical
Shelter."

01 W Weekly inspection of ESEP tollway  - Pavement
1. Inspect On-Pavement Tollway assets weekly as listed on
Regular Weekly  Inspection Report TMF-3012-OP-0046.
Record maintenance requirements. Reference procedure
TMF-3012-OP-0001.
2. Personnel to carry safety vest, maintenance standards and
rotating vehicle hazard light and tape recorder as a minimum
requirement.  Vehicle hazard light must be operating
during inspection routine.
3. Notify control room if you are required to stop in emergency
lane for further inspection.
4. Check by 'drive-by' inspection  using a systematic approach
to encompass all inspection targets, these can be carried out
on separate days of the week ie; inspect pavement defects one
day, signs and road furniture another day, line markings etc,
on main carriageway one day and ramps on another, etc.
Pavement defects
Shoulder defects
Drainage for blockages or flooding.
Kerb & channel defects
Pavement Pits/Culverts for damage or blockage
Line marking
Raised pavement markers damaged or missing
New Jersey Barriers for damage
Impact Attenuators
Warning signs
Road signs
General signs
Litter
Graffiti
Record any other requirements outside specified maintenance
levels.
5. Make temporary repairs to unsafe items if possible,  pick up
potential traffic hazards if safe to do so.
6. Raise new  job sheet or add to running jobsheets, any major
corrective maintenance action ie; all pot hole and pavement
defects to be added to the 'Work Done' section running
Pavement Repairs  Jobsheet.
7. Ensure that any minor routine action identified is noted for
action on the current fortnightly litter and landscape
jobsheet.
8. On-Pavement inspection:
Monday   [        ]    Tuesday  [        ]
Wednesday  [       ]   Thursday  [        ]
Friday     [        ]

12 M Inspect of HV RMU batteries and chargers
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1.  Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2.  Refer to M Brodribb Model D5414 24V 10A DC Charger System
manual M-STG-EL-24028.
3.  Carry out the following checks in co-operation with the HV
sub-contractor.
Check the RMU battery charger in the sub-station by:
(a) Initiate a ""Low Voltage"" alarm and "Charger Fail"
alarm by switching OFF the charger with full load applied to
the charger.   [_ _]
(b) A "Charger Fail" alarm (Red LED) should occur.  [_ _]
(c) A "Low Voltage" alarm should occur on.  [_ _]
(d) Turn on the supply to the Charger, alarm should be
reset.  [_ _]
(e) Check that all pc cards are tight in sockets.  [_ _]
(f) Clean and remove any accumulated dirt, debris, vermin
etc.  [_ _]
4.  Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet any
outstanding works requiring further
attention.  Raise a job sheet for any outstanding works.
5.  Notify the TCRO when the job is completed.
"

01 W Clean up OMB Workshop
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Remove any accumulated rubbish, debris and equipment
from garage floor.
2. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces in garage area.
3. Mop all floor surfaces in garage area.
Errect "wet floor sign" in moped areas.

03 M Inspection of SL TSH UPS - Fentons systems
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to entering each Technical
Shelter.
2. Three Month Service Plan Reference :  Fenton Users
Manual - Uninterruptible Power Supplies""  On-Line Series
UME V. 5.2 4kVA, 6kVA, 8kVA, 10kVA.
3. Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
charged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 13.5
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will
indicate a battery fault. ]
4. (a) Press the ""Control"" button on the UPS, followed by the
"Down Arrow"" button until the message  CONTROL BYPASS MODE
appears.
(b) Press the "Control" button and "Enter" button
simultaneously, the UPS will transfer into the bypass
mode.
,,   **If at anytime during load transfer the UPS ,,,,,,
malfunctions, notify TCR prior to continuing.**
c) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.  The
"Bypass O/P" indicator should be illuminated.   [_ _]
(d) Contact the Traffic Control Room to confirm receipt of
alarm condition.   [_ _]
(e) Scroll through menu using the "Display" button followed
by the "Down Arrow"
(f) Remove side covers from the UPS.   WARNING THE UPS IS
STILL ALIVE.
(g) Visually inspect the interior of the UPS for accumulated
dust, connections or other components that may show
obvious distress.   [_ _]
(h) Check that both the front and rear fans are operating
(The front fan is thermostatically controlled).    [_ _]
(i) Press the "Control" button, then press the "Down Arrow"
until the message "CONTROL INVERTOR MODE" appears. [_ _]
(j) Press the "Control" button and the "Enter" button
simultaneously, wait approx 10 seconds  until the UPS
reverts back to its normal operation.   [_ _]
5. (a) Contact TCR prior to isolating.
,,   Switch to the OFF position the wall mounted isolator or
CB1, on the rear  of the UPS to transfer the load to the
batteries. Check with TCR once load has been transferred
to batteries that a power failure has not occurred.
,,   **Do not turn isolator back on for 20 seconds as this may
cause damage to the equipment.**
NOTE: Ensure that the Circuit breaker (C/B2) on the rear of
the UPS is not accidentally turned off at  this stage
as CB2 isolates the batteries.
(b) Continue with the UPS supplying the load from the
batteries for at least 10 minutes.
(c) Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
discharged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 13.5
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will
indicate a battery fault. ]
(d) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.  The
"On Battery " indicator should be illuminated.    [_ _]
(e) Scroll through menu using the "Display" button followed
by the "Down Arrow".  Record the voltage and current
details on form UPS Battery Test Sheet
TMF-3012-OP-0037   [_ _].
(f) Switch to the ON position the wall mounted isolator or
CB1, on the rear  of the UPS to transfer the load to the
normal supply.
6. Battery Panel.
(a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
Batteries.
(b) Ensure the Circuit Breaker operating handle, on side
panel door, is in the upright position and is not
tripped.  [_ _]
(c) Measure and record the overall charge voltage across the
CB ( nominally 217V. )    [_ _]
7. Record any result outside normal parameters, in the " Work
Done " area of the job sheet.
8. Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
9. Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
"
Works completed as above work plan

04 M Inspect & clean of VSS controller and camera enclosure
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the emergency
lane
2. Access to this camera is:
(a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
(b) Lane Closure: Emergency lane.
3. Set up lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12.
4. Reference Manual, SAAB Combitech Traffic Systems AB, Basic 4,
M-MCL-ET-1225.
5. Indoor Equipment.
WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
(a) Check for mechanical damage on the Controller rack and
the monitor.
(b) Check for mechanical damage on the cabling.

(d) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
mounts. [_ _]
7. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.

03 M Electrical Inspection and Clean LV Switchboards
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning and
inspections of the Building
and Electrics, prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths,
lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,
Rubbish bags, Filter
material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Cold Gal, Wire Brush,
Thinners, Absorbent,
Rodent bait station
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Equipment Rooms, as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of
the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Equipment Rooms ERE01 - ERE 16 and ERW 01 - ERW 06)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Equipment rooms, Technical
shelters and
Substations.
2. On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans, if
operating (fans not
required to be  switched OFF in technical shelters and appropriate
equipment
rooms).   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including theoperational
tube within
EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all accessible
equipment and
components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus
10°C should be
considered abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of
the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. Raise a new
job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and
components  for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
raise a new jobsheet
for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or his
representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering,
arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and escutcheons
for serviceability and general operation, lubricate as required.
Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
damage.  [_ _]
10. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
required. [_ _]
12. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out
repairsor indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
[_ _]
13.  PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
toindicate abnormal
conditions are to be logged in the work done area of the job
sheet and a new job sheet
raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are not
loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the enclosure and
PLC modules
are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
14. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
accumulation, where applicable.
15. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for operation
and security.  Check
with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of
analarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
16.   Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective
actions.  Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and
thisjob, the job number
of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
Inspect for source of
any water.  Record any details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job
sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and or
stored items.  Remove
any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets, ledges,
cable trays,
cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces,
e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]
4. At equipment rooms (ERE03 - ERE16 & ERW 02 - ERW 05), replace
Absorbent.  [_ _]
5. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  Replace bait station
if bait is near
exhausted.  [_ _]
6. Check telephone for operation.  [_ _]
7. Inspect all metal work for corrosion, clean of corrosion and recover
with cold gal area
cleaned.   [_ _]
8. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved cleaning
materials .  [_ _]
9. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light fittings
,cable trays and
ceilings.  [_ _]
10. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
11. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
12. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.   Record
any abnormal
parameter in the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet.   Raise a
new jobsheet for any
outstanding corrective actions.  [_ _]
13. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.  [_ _]
14. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g. Fans,
Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
15.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this job,
thejob number of
the alternate Job.   [_ _] [_ _]
16. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
"

01 M Inspect of O & M B Comp Room Air Conditioning Units
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
2. Reference manual A E Smith, Operating & Maintenance Manual for
Mechanical Services
serving Melbourne City Link project Southern Link. Operations &
Maintenance Building
Balston Street Sth Melbourne.  M-OMB-OM-20000.
3. This job is to be carried out by the sub-contracter under the
supervision of the Electrical
Electronic Technician.
4. Work plan for the EDP Processing Room - Air Conditioning Unit No. 2
4.1. Check the filters for blockages,  install new filters if required.
[_ _]
Filters:
AC 2 & 3 - 750mm x 460mm x 100mm (2off)
AC 4 & 5 - 790mm x 760mm x 100mm (2off)
4.2. Check the V-belt for deterioration.  Install new belt and
re-tension, if required.    [_ _]
4.3. Check the pulleys for alignment and undue wear.  Realign and
install new pulleys if
required.    [_ _]
4.4. Check the fan bearings, as well as check that the fan can rotate
freely.   [_ _]
4.5. Measure the fan motor current and compare with the rated current.
[_ _]
4.6. Clean the condensate tray of accumulated dust and debris.  Clean
the tray and the drain
if required.    [_ _]
4.7. Check the humidifier bottle and electrodes for scale. Descale if
required.    [_ _]
4.8. Check the electrical connection to the electrodes, for spacing,
isolation and security.    [_ _]
4.9. Check the steam hoses for support and condition.    [_ _]
4.10. Check the manual flush operation.    [_ _]
4.11. Clean accumulated dirt and debris from the humidifier tray , and
ensure the drain is
clear.    [_ _]
4.12. Charge the humidifier with clean water and check the time taken toboil.
[_ _]
4.13. Check that the wet floor sensor is mounted securely, and clear of
all debris that may
restrict its operation.    [_ _]
4.14. Check that the control panel functions correctly.    [_ _]
4.15. Check for any loose connections.    [_ _]
4.16. Check the connections of the electrical heater mounted in the AC
unit, repair if
required.    [_ _]
4.17. Measure the phase currents of the heaters and record any readings
out of
parameters.    [_ _]
4.18. Check the heater mounts for security.    [_ _]
5. (a) Repeat step 4 for Toll Computer Room Air Conditioning Unit - AC
3.    [_ _]
(b) Repeat step 4 for Communications Room Air Conditioning Unit -A C
4.    [_ _]
(c) Repeat step 4 for Communications Room Air Conditioning Unit -A C
5.    [_ _]
(d) Repeat step 4 for Fan Coil Unit No. 1 for EDP Processing Room.
[_ _]
6. On completion of the job, record anything outside of normal
parameters in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.
7. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
"

03 M Inspection & test of the Standby elect supply
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering each technical
shelter.
3. Carry out this job on the UPS to exercise the system and
confirm UPS system operation.
4. Check the operational condition of the Technical Shelter 10
Uninterruptable Power Supply to ensure it is operating in the
normal standby-back-up mode and there are no alarms.  [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TEST IF THE UPS IS IN
THE BYPASS MODE.
5. Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP Electrical Pty Ltd
Main Switchboard O<(>&<)>M Manual Section PI [M-MCL-ME-20016]
(a) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from the "AUTOMATIC CONTROL" position to the "EMERGENCY
SUPPLY + TEST " position.  A changeover will occur and
the technical shelter load will be supplied from the
emergency power supply.  Operate the system in this
mode for 10 minutes.
(b) Measure the voltage and load current per phase.   [_ _]
(c) Using an optical thermometer, measure the temperature
of the terminals in the emergency power supply circuit.
Record in the Work Done any terminal whose temperature
increases unduly during this operation.   [_ _]
(d) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
back to the "AUTOMATIC CONTROL" position.  The
technical shelter load will revert to the main power
supply after a time delay has confirmed the normal
supply is healthy.   [_ _]
6. (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
7. Record anything outside normal parameters in the  Work Done
area of the job sheet.  Raise a new job sheet if there is
work requiring further attention.  Priority P1.
8. Fill in the Log Book in the Technical Shelter.
9. Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
Work completed as above work plan

01 M Night insp of carriageway & ramp lights - WL
1. Inspections of Western Link street lighting on main

03 M Inspect & Clean TSH Equipment and Bldgs
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the
cleaning and inspections of the Building and Electrics<(>,<)>
prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and
external lighting, Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material<(>,<)>
Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Rodent Bait Station
This job should be carried in conjunction with the Monthly
job at the Technical Shelters
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
electrical installations of Technical Shelters, as well the
cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the relevant
areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Technical Shelters TSH1-6, TSH10-14 )
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant Technical
shelters.
2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere<(>,<)>
use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
abnormal events.  [_ _]
3. At Technical shelters, fill-in the log-book [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation<(>,<)>
including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace
faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of
ambient plus 10°C should be considered abnormal and must be
noted in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all
cables, terminals, equipment and components  for evidence
of burn marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for any corrective action.
Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Inspect the surges diverters where applicable, and either
replace spent surge diverters when less than 80% or raise a
new Job Sheet for works to be carried out.   [_ _]
9. At Technical Shelters,  visually inspect external Lightning
Protection System connections for damage and or corrosion.
Record anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for any corrective
action.  Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is
informed of the abnormality.  [_ _]
10.Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware<(>,<)>
gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and
general operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out
any required repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any
outstanding actions.  [_ _]
11.Inspect single line drawings for legibility.  Record
details of drawings requiring replacement in the ""Work
Done"" area and report to the Team leader or his
representative.
12.Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating<(>,<)>
looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
13.Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally
for dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
14.Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of
obstructions.  Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
15.Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s)<(>,<)>
for faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
actions.   [_ _]
16.PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect  the PLC status and error indicators.
Indicators found to indicate abnormal conditions are
to be logged in the ""Work Done"" of the Job Sheet and
a new job sheet raised to invetigate and correct the
error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g.
plug connections, screw connections for security.
[_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush, ensure the
enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated
dust and debris.  [_ _]
17.Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.
18.Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for
operation and security.  Check with the Traffic Control
Room Operator to confirm the receipt of an alarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of
outstanding defects in the Work Done area of the Job
Sheet.  [_ _]
19.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective actions.
Include in the Related Job field of the new and this
job, the job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of
moisture ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record
any details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and
inform the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings
and or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Inspect the area of the generator in Tech Shelters and air
conditioning unit, for leaks of fuel, coolants or
lubricants.  Clean any spillage and if any leaks are
evident record in the ""Work Done "" area and raise a new
jobsheet for any corrective action required. Inform the
Team Leader or his representative of  these required
actions.  [_ _]
5. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets<(>,<)>
ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle
on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
6. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
cleaning materials .  [_ _]
7. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light
fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]
8. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
9. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
10.Carry out Exterior Checks of Technical Shelters.
(a) Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the
building (if applicable) for damage, erosion<(>,<)>
graffiti.  [_ _]
(b) Visually inspect the building (if applicable) walls<(>,<)>
roof, guttering and and downpipes for damage, leaks
and or blockages, remove any debris or materials
that could cause a blockage.  [_ _]
(c) Inspect (if applicable) the general area surrounding
the building for erosion and damage to surfaces<(>,<)>
fences, gates, pavements   [_ _]
11.Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  replace
bait station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
12.Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of
the job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
corrective actions.  [_ _]
13.Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.
[_ _]
14.Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
(d)  Generators in Tech Shelters to be left in a state of
readiness for operation.  [_ _]
(e)  UPS in Tech Shelters to be left in state of readiness
for operation. [_ _]
15.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this
job, the job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
16.Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
Work completed as above work plan

TS5 - UPS Fault
17.09.2014 03:38:17 Brenton ROWE (ROWEB)
TS5 - UPS Fault
* 17.09.2014 03:38:17 Brenton ROWE (ROWEB)
* TS5 - UPS Fault
TS5 - UPS Fault
TCR said TSH5 UPS was in fault. I went to TSH5 and found (initially) no
fault showing on UPS but PLC had a UPS fault. I traced the fault back to
the motherboard within the UPS which has the alarm relay mounted. I
disconnected the cables to the alarm relay then reconnected then after
proving they were ok. Oncei reconnected the cables the fault cleared.

01 M Inspection & test running of the WL TSH generators
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
Supply to ensure it is operating in the normal
standby-back-up mode.   [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
MODE.
4. Refer to reference manual Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
5.   (a) Check that the generator was left in  "AUTO" [_ _]
(b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuel and water.   [_ _]
(c) Check oil level.   [_ _]
(d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
(e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).   [_ _]
(f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts   [_ _]
(g) Record the battery voltage in the "Work Done" area
of the job sheet. [_ _]
(h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
Physically open the cap, as the gauge could be
misleading.  [_ _]
(j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours
with the last entry.  [_ _]
6. Reference manual, Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP
Electrical Pty Ltd Main Switchboard O<(>&<)>M Manual Section PI
[M-MCL-ME-20016]
7.  (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch on the generator
DC panel to "" RUN "" let the engine run for at least 5
minutes, then turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch
back to "" AUTO ""
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from "" AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" to ""EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST
"" run the generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared<(>,<)>
and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
[_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure<(>,<)>
water temperature.   [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back
to " AUTOMATIC CONTROL" the generator will continue to
run for about 8 minutes before stopping.   [_ _]
(g) Record the hours run, from the hours run meter,  in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet.
8.  (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
9. Fill in the Generator Log Book and record anything outside
normal parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job
sheet.  Raise a new job for any works requiring further
repairs.  Priority High P1.
10.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
11.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
12.Record the Hours run in Mainpac under "Plant" use RH mouse
click then select "Open"      then select "Meter
Readings" in edit mode add the Meter Reading for the
appropriate TSH Generator.
Hours Run - 150.9
Batteries 13.2 VDC
Power did not return to normal after generator stopped, tden needs
replacing
Work completed as above work plan
"

4. Carry out visual inspection externally and internally of the
cabinets, sign, external cables and conduits for vandalism,
mechanical damage, water ingress, condensation or insect
infestation. Also check inside cabinets for tripped circuit
breakers, disconnected wires, burn marks from excessive
heat.   [_ _]
5. Visually check for loose or missing nuts and bolts, and for
rusted areas, rusted nuts or bolts.  Clean with wire brush
and spray with Cold Gal or equivalent. This shold be
done with care and to avoid overspray. [_ _]
6. Inspect the external window  for dirt and clean with
Windex or equivalent and clean  rags if required.[_ _]
7. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area and raise corrective Job
Sheet if required.  [_ _]
8. Notify control room prior to departure."

03 M Inspect and maintain Yarra Crossing Escape Stair Fan
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job as well as prior
to entering the stairwell.
2. (a) Refer to Maintenance Manual, ""Operating and Maintenance manual
for Mechanical
Services - MCL Tunnels"" M-STG-ME-27400.
(b) Refer to AS 1668.1 - Appendix A for detail and methodology of
stair pressurisation
commissioning tests.
3. Check the exhaust grill in the wall of the stairwell to ensure it is
free of debris that would
restrict the flow of air.   [_ _]
4. Ensure that the door between the Domain Tunnel and the stairwell is
closed.
5. Check that the door in the link walkway, isolating the stairwell
fromthe sub-station is closed.
6. Check that both the inlet and exhaust silencers are free from debris
(Use a torch from the
inlet)
7. Request the traffic control operator to start the fan SA-YPS-01
(ESF-P06) from the TCR.
Ensure the fan starts. Check that the airflow direction is into the
stairwell. [_ _]
8.   NOTE:  The alarm to be raised will not call the fire brigade.  It
will register on the local FIP
and CCCS as a local alarm.
Remove the access cover over the smoke detector, direct ""test
smoke"" from a smoke
generator, as specified on the container, onto the smoke detector
(on the inlet duct).  Check
that an alarm actuates on the local fire indicator panel.   The
smoke detector must be in
fault for approx 2½ mins for the fan to stop and for an alarm to
generate on the CCCS. [_ _]
9. Check and inspect the Stairwell area.
(a) Check the inlet grill to the substation, to ensure that it is
notdamaged and is free of debris
that would restrict the free flow of air.   [___]
(b) Ensure that the door between the Domain Tunnel and the stairwell
area is closed.
(c) Check each door for damage, as well check the rollers, runners,
hinges, handles,
catches, and counter-weights for efficient operation.  [_ _]
(d) With the supply air fan SA-YPS-01 ( ESF-P06) operating, record
the differential air
pressure within the stairwell and at substation level.  Record
readings less than 50Pa in
the ""Work Done' area of the Job sheet. Notify the
superintendent for further
investigation.  [_ _]
(e) At each of the doors, starting from the tunnel and working
towards the fan.
Arrange the door catch to be non-functioning, then using a
spring balance, measure the
force required to open the door.  Record the results in the
""Work Done"" area of the Job
sheet if a force greater than 11kg is required, as well advise
the maintenance
superintendent for further investigation.   [_ _]
(f ) Check the time taken for the air pressure to return to the
static reading.  Record in the
""Work Done"" area of the job sheet if time is greater than 2
minutes. Notify the
superintendent for further investigation.
(g) Chock each door open, then using an anemometer, measure the
velocity of air out of the
open door.  The reading is to be with the door fully open and
with no obstructions.
Record the results in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job sheet
if the air flow is less
than 1 meter /sec as well advise the maintenance
superintendent for further
investigation.  [_ _]
(h) Check the fan and motor for undue noise and vibrations.   [_ _]
(i ) Check the fan bearings for noise.   [_ _]
(j ) Check the fan unit for damage, corrosion, missing panel
fixings, as well as checking
the fixings of the unit for security.  [_ _]
10. Ensure the action of opening a stairwell door;
(a) Generates an alarm at the TCR workstation.
(b) Causes the fan speed to vary to maintain a positive pressure
inthe stairwell.
(c) To replicate the action of the smoke detector, remove the
YARRACROSSING EGRESS
STAIR FAN RELAY (mounted in the rear compartment of the
localFIP) for at least two and
a half minutes to ensure the fan stops.  Replace the relay
once the action is
confirmed  [_ _] (A local alarm will register on the CCCS.
The fire brigade
will not be called)
11. Run the fan for a further 5 minutes, with the door in both the open
and the closed position
then advise the traffic control room to shut the fan down and to
turn OFF the lighting after
leaving the stairwell, ensuring that the door to the tunnel is
closed.
12. Ensure the stairwell is clean and all rubbish and debris is removed
from the stairwell.  [_ _]
13. Record anything outside normal parameters in the ""Work Done"" area
of the Job Sheet.
14. Ensure the door between the stairwell and the Domain Tunnel is
closed.
15. Notify the Control Room on completion of the job.
"

04 M Insp/cln of  SL CCTV cams, EWP, BT & DT LHL
Perform this job at the same time as the AIDs cameras in LHS of
the tunnel.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Work shall be carried out in designated times approved by the
TCR.
2. Notify the control room prior to stopping in LHL
3. Access to this camera group is:
(a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
(b) Position 0 and 1.
(c) Lane Closure: LHL
(d) Electrical Cabinet Location: Above LHL
4. Set up the lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink  Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 21, 24, 26.
5. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,
Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
6. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
(a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
necessary.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
(c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,
re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
(d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
fastened to the PT300.
WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
(e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if
not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]
(f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
(Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the camera).
Ensure the   co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
module and is secure.  [_ _]
7. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
(unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
of the PTZ .  [_ _]
8. Camera and Camera Housing;
WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
ALIVE.
(a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface insect
spray may be applied if necessary to the housing exterior
but must not be applied to the interior of the housing or
to the housing glass.  If ingress of moisture or insect
infestation is evident then carry out steps (d) and
(e).  [_ _]
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
mounts. [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
Rain-X cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm.
WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.  If
the heaters are not warm, spray the heater thermostat (HTR)
with FREEZE IT, then again check the operation of the
heater. [_ _]
(e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
9. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
controller.  [_ _]
10. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait
2 minutes then check again.  [_ _]
11. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
attention of the Team Leader Electrical or his
representative.
12. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.

12 M Inspect Clean Mezzanine area
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to leaving
the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for
fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,
Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders. Industrial Vacuum
Cleaner to be used for the Mezzanine Level.  Hire to be arranged
prior to commencing the job.
A INTRODUCTION
1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2. This Job is for the inspection and clean of the Mezzanine
area.   [_ _]
3. On entering the Mezzanine area, be aware of the atmosphere,
use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of the
job sheet.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
corrective actions.  [_ _]
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations and cleaning of the relevant areas.
B ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
1. Check the lighting of the mezzanine area for operation,
including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace or
repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
2. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,
gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general
operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
actions.  [_ _]
3. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
4. Inspect all electrical enclosures (where appropriate)
internally for dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures
of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
5. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of
obstructions.  [_ _]
6. Visually inspect systems, mounted within the relevant areas
(where appropriate), for faulty indicators, faulty meters,
damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out repairs or
indicator lamp replacement or raise a new job sheet for any
outstanding actions.   [_ _]
7. Clean lighting diffusers (including emergency and Exit
lighting) and lens of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
8. Check and clean cable trays for accumulated debris, evidence
of water accumulation.  Record anything  abnormal in the Work
Done area of the job sheet.  Record anything abnormal in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or
his representative of outstanding actions.  [_ _]
Mezzanine Level Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the mezzanine area is not obstructed by
furnishings and or stored items.  Remove any
obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Check the doors and windows for damage, operation, lubricate
and repair as required and record in the Work Done area of
the Job Sheet.  Inform the Team Leader or his representative
of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
4. Clean and remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of
cabinets, ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will
settle on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets,
tops of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
5. Clean exterior surfaces of cabinets as required.  [_ _]
6. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets and
ceilings.  [_ _]
7. Remove from site all accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
8. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
9. Clean hand rails (if applicable) of dust and dirt.  [_ _]
10. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds
(where appropriate).  [_ _]
11. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b) All Enclosures closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]

12 M Minor inspect & test run of the SL TSH generators
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. The generator minor service ""TYPE A"" , as set out in the
Cummins Maintenance Report, shall be carried out by the
sub-contractor on the generator.
2. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
3. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
4. Minor Service TYPE A Reference: Cummins Onan Operator's
Manual 960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012].
The sub-contractor shall carry out the service as per items
listed on the maintenance report column A and test as per
paragraph 5.
5. Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP Electrical Pty Ltd
Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI [M-MCL-ME-20016]
(a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the RUN / OFF / AUTO Switch on the generator DC
panel to RUN let the engine run for at least 5 minutes,
then turn the RUN / OFF / AUTO Switch back to AUTO
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from AUTOMATIC CONTROL to EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST run the
generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared,
and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations. [_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure,
water temperature. [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switch board back
to AUTOMATIC CONTROL the generator will continue to run
for about 8 minutes before stopping. [_ _]
6. Record the hours run for each generator (from the hour run
meter) and record in the Mainpac Hours Run system for the
appropriate machine on the Plant Usage Tab.
7. Fill in the Generator Log Book
8. Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
(a) Sub-contractors Maintenance Report No  [________]
(b) Sub-contractors  Field Report No  [__________]
(c) Hours run ( from the hour run meter )  [___________]
9. Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
10. Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.

01 M Inspection of the ERTs in the DT
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Use Vehicle arrow board and short term emergency lane
stoppage as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,
TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059
Plan 22.
3. For the Domain Tunnel right hand lane and at each Emergency
Roadside Telephone:
(a) Visually inspect the telephone for graffiti, damage and
or insect infestation.
(b) Clean the telephone of grime and residues, use spray-on
Nifty and a clean cloth.
(c) Test the operation of the telephone with the control
room.  Using the Emergency Roadside telephone, contact
the Traffic Control Room and confirm operation of the
phone communication then have the control room call back
to the ERT to check the reverse operation.
4. For each ERT
(a) record the result of the inspection
(b) that the ERT has been cleaned and
(c) the result of the communication test
for each telephone on the attached form METS  as set out in
METS Inspection (Monthly) Southern link (Domain Tunnel
Lane 1) Form No. TMF-3012-OP-0071.
5. Record the details of any further corrective actions that are
required in the comments area of the form.
6. Notify the control room on the completion of the Job.
7. Return the completed job sheet as well as the form METS as
set out in METS Inspection (Monthly) Southern link (Domain
Tunnel Lane 1) Form No. TMF-3012-OP-0071 to the Electrical /
Electronics Team Leader or his representative.
8. The Electrical ./ Electronics Team leader or his
representative is to raise a new job sheet for any corrective
actions required.

12 M Test & inspection of the BT deluge installation
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. The twelve monthly deluge system inspection and test shall be
carried out in conjunction with  the fire-protection
sub-contractor and the Traffic Control Room Officers (TRCO).
2. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing the job.
(a). A tunnel closure is required.  A Memorandum of Consent
(MOC) and a Permit to Work approval is required from
Translink Operations, the Maintenance Manager or his
representative prior to commencing work.
(b) Access to the Burnley tunnel shall be as per Work
Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and
Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan Domain Tunnel
Portal Closure.
3. Reference Drawings SLG-FS- 30900 to SLG-FS-30911.
4. Prior to testing the deluge zone spray system:
(a) Ensure that the maximum capacity is available in the
dirty water sump and holding tank at the Yarra Crossing
Dirty Water Pit and the Swan Street Water Treatment
Plant.    [_ _]
(b) Request the TCRO to close the bypass valve between the
pump station dirty water and the ground water sump
pits.    [_ _]
(c) Install the bungs in the TAM sensors.,,[_ _]
6. Discharge the Deluge Spray Zones.
(a) Request the TCRO to actuate one (1) specified deluge
spray zones, starting at the West Portal then progressing
eastward.  Spray pattern may take 30 seconds to
establish.
(b) Observe that the spray pattern provides coverage of the
tunnel floor area and note defective sprays and faulty
equipment for replacement.  Observe for 15 seconds.
(c) Request the TCRO to close the one (1) specified deluge
zones.
(d) Functional test should take approximately one minute
between activation and closing the valve.
(e) Check that the deluge valve has fully closed.
(f) It should take approximately 5 minutes for each zone.
(g) It is important that the levels at the Yarra Crossing
Dirty Water Pit and the Swan St Pit are monitored at all
times by the TCRO during testing.  Testing must cease if
the pit levels are high and then only resume when the pit
levels have dropped sufficiently to accommodate the
deluge water.
7. Carry out step 6 for the remaining deluge zones, one zone at
time.  After activating zone FSP E068, activate both zones
FSP E068 and FSP E069 together, checking that there is no
Low Water Pressure alarm, record results on form BURNLEY
TUNNEL DELUGE TEST (EAST END)  - 12 M OPERATIONAL TEST OF
BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE SYSTEM TMF-3012-OP-0266
8. Manually operate the six (6) sectioning valves, in the fire
main, through a close and open cycle.  Confirm with TCRO the
operational status of the valve as it is operated.    [_ _]
9. Record on forms
BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE TEST (WEST END)  - 12 M OPERATIONAL
TEST OF BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE SYSTEM TMF-3012-OP-0262 and
BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE TEST (EAST END)  - 12 M OPERATIONAL
TEST OF BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE SYSTEM""  TMF-3012-OP-0266, the
result of the tests for each deluge zone and sectioning
valve.
10. Request the TCRO to open bypass valves between the pump
station dirty water and ground water sump pits and to ensure
that operation of the pumps have returned to normal.  Only
ground water pump in operation and the dirty water is
flowing via the triple interceptor.  Perform regular visual
inspections to ensure that there is no overflow from
the dirty water tundish.
11. Remove the bungs in the TAM sensors once the deluge test is ,,
completed  [_ _]
12. Record any follow up requirements in the Work Done area of
the Job sheet and raise a Job Sheet for any outstanding
works.   Priority High P1.
13. Record the sub-contractors work sheet number in the Work
Done area of the job sheet and forward the sub-contractor
confirmation sheet to the Team Leader - Electrical or his
representative.
14. Notify the control room on completion of the work.
15. Forward completed check form,
BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE TEST (WEST END)  - 12 M OPERATIONAL
TEST OF BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE SYSTEM TMF-3012-OP-0262 and
BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE TEST (EAST END)  - 12 M OPERATIONAL
TEST OF BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE SYSTEM  TMF-3012-OP-0266, to
the Team Leader - Electrical or his representative upon
completion of the job.

03 M Maint of the Variable Message Sign
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in emergency lane.
2. Access keys required for Sound Wall Gate, to access VMS 07.
Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,
TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059
Plan 12 or 13 (Short term and low traffic volume).  Vic Roads
approval required prior to doing job.
Access to VMS 6 is from the car park below the elevated road.
3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment and
or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to Safety
Instructions  TMI-3012-SA-0101, Working  on Gantry
Structures.
4. Arrange with the TCR for a Test Message to be displayed on
the VMS.  Monitor operation and repair as required.  Monitor
the LED Arrays and the Flashers for failed LEDS and
record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet if the failed
LEDs exceed 10% of the array.
Arrange a new Job sheet for any outstanding works, recording
the appropriate Job numbers in the Related Jobs  field
and Notify the Team Leader or his representative
of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
5. Carry out visual inspection externally and internally of the
cabinets, sign, external cables and conduits for vandalism,
mechanical damage, water ingress, condensation or insect
infestation. Also check inside cabinets for tripped circuit
breakers, disconnected wires, burn marks from excessive heat.
[_ _]
6. Visually check for loose or missing nuts and bolts, and for
rusted areas, rusted nuts or bolts. Cleans with wire brush
and spray with Cold Gal or equivalent. This should be
done with care and to avoid overspray. [_ _]
7. Inspect the external face of the lenses (for each pixel) for
dirt and clean with Windex or equivalent  and clean rags
if required.[_ _]
8. Note any corrective action required in the Work Done area
of the Job Sheet and raise new Job Sheet if required.
9. Notify control room on departure.
"

03 M Inspect and maintain Swan St Pump Stn Exhaust Fan
Access to the fan is via a ladder to the roof of Substation 2,
other components are accessed via the lift and stairwell to the pump
room at the base of the shaft.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. Refer to Maintenance Manual, Operating and Maintenance Manual
for Mechanical Services - MCL Tunnels M-STG-ME-27400.
WARNING:  THE PUMP SUMP IS CLASSIFIED AS A CONFINED SPACE AND
A ZONE 1 CLASS 1 HAZARDOUS AREA.
3. (a) At the roof mounted fan unit (EF-SS2-3), check the
exhaust grilles for debris that would restrict air
flow.   [_ _]
(b) Check the fan unit panels and ducting for damage,
corrosion and fixings.   [_ _]
4. (a) At the pump sumps, check the inlet grilles (2), for
debris or damage that would restrict air flow.    [_ _]
(b) At the transfer air duct (from stair well area to sump
pump), check the grill for damage.  [_ _]
(c) Check the fire damper for damage and premature
operation.   [_ _]
(d) Check the outlet grill for debris and damage that would
restrict air flow.   [_ _]
5. Work plan for the Swan St Pump Station Exhaust Fan  EF-SS2-3.
(a) At switchboard Sub2 A/C 2AMEB, switch the fan circuit
breaker OFF.  isolate and tag in accordance with
TMI-3012-SA- 0103, Low Voltage Work Instruction.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect the fan housing and roof penetration flashing for
damage.  [_ _]
(c) Check the fan for free movement and any damage to the
blades.   [_ _]
(d) Switch the fan ON, using the circuit breaker in the
switchboard Sub2 A/C 2AMEB.  [_ _]
(e) Check the fan for unusual noises and vibrations.  [_ _]
(f) Check the motor bearings and lubricate if
required.  [_ _]
(g) Leave the fan switched ON.   [_ _]
6. (a) At the roof mounted fan unit (EF-SS2-8), check the
exhaust grilles for debris that would restrict air
flow.   [_ _]
(b) Check the fan unit panels and ducting for damage,
corrosion and fixings.   [_ _]
(c) Check the vent in the fan room for debris and
blockages.   [_ _]
7. Work plan for the Swan St Fan Room Vent Fan SF-SS2-8.
(a) At switchboard Sub2 A/C 2BMEB, switch the fan circuit
breaker OFF.  isolate and tag in accordance with
TMI-3012-SA- 0103, Low Voltage Work Instruction.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect the fan housing and roof perntration flashing for
damage.  [_ _]
(c) Check the fan for free movement and any damage to the
blades.   [_ _]
(d) Switch the fan ON, using the circuit breaker in the
switchboard Sub2 A/C 2BMEB.  [_ _]
(e) Check the fan for unusual noises and vibrations.  [_ _]
(f) Check the motor bearings and lubricate if
required.  [_ _]
(g) Leave the fan switched ON.   [_ _]
8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

03 M Electrical Inspection / Clean RRBroadcast rooms
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to
leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths,
lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting,
Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon
Lubricant Spray, Rodent bait station,
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
electrical installations of Radio Rebroadcast Rooms 01, 02 &
03 as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the
relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( RRB 01, 02 & 03)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Radio Rebroadcast
rooms.
2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,
use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
abnormal events.  [_ _]
3. Check the interior lighting for operation, including the
operational tube within EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or
repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
4. For RRB 01 only, go to Step 8.
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
accessible equipment and components within distribution
panels.  Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures
of ambient plus 10°C should be considered abnormal and must
be noted in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and components  for evidence of burn
marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record anything
abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and raise
a new jobsheet for any corrective action.  Ensure the Team
Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. [_ _]
7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,
gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general
operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
actions. [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
10.Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for
dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11.Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.
Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
12.Inspect systems, mounted within the Technical Shelters, for
faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp replacement
or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
13.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]
C  RRB room 01, 02 & 03  Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
details in the "Work Done" area of the job sheet and inform
the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and
or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets,
ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on
all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops of
cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
4. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
cleaning materials .  [_ _]
5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light
fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]
6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris. [_ _]
7. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait, replace bait
station if bait is nearly exhausted.  [_ _]
8. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
9. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of the
job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
corrective actions.  [_ _]
10.Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
(b)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
11.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]
12. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
"

c)    Pour in Rapid set grout to height then lay in SL81
Mesh with 50mm cover and trowel off. (allow 2 x hours)
Total 4/5 hours (So 01:30 - 02:30 finish).
10.00pm mill Inbound lane 10.30pm prepare surface for crack sealing and
bitac plus asphalt
11.00pm Commence placement of asphalt on inbound lane
01.30am Prepare surface on fast lane for asphalt placing layers of
asphalt in test hole and compacting
2.00am crack seal joints around test repair place tack and place Bitac
crack seal all other cracks and place Bitac
3.00am resurface area 3.00am Line mark.
4:00am Pack up road closure
4:30am Open road to public
------------------------------------------------------------------------
---------
Report -
Works were completed to the above schedule however -
1 -It was discovered when opening the road that a concrete base was
existing at approx 380mm below the asphalt surface, hence scope of works
changed to include only insertion of 50mm compacted layers asphalt to
fill the void.
2- Line marking was delayed to another day due to wet weather
conditions.
Photos of works completed have been sent to Lachlan via e-mail on
15.10.2014.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

06 M clean of tunnel lighting photometers
At the photometer **COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2. This job is to be carried out during a tunnel shut.
3. Clean the external surfaces, including glass window, of
accumulated dirt and dust.  Use Rain-x and soft cloth.
4. Visually inspect the mounting components for damage<(>,<)>
corrosion (Remove and repair any corrosion found) and
security of fixings.
5. Visually check the cabling to the photometer for damage or
any required repairs (Repairs as required).
6. Check the general alignment of the Photometer for accuracy.
Methodology for Alignment Check:
**The alignment point needs to be defined by taping the distance
betweenthe walls of the Tunnel entrance to identify the centre, then
taping from the pavement upto 1.5m above. The target needs to be this
point, taking into account that the laser beam would be generated
parallel to the centre of the photometer.
At the photometer, a laser level needs to be placed on top of the
photometer and the unit then needs to be adjusted until the beam hits
the target. The process must be repeated with the laser placed on each
side of the unit, meaning the adjustment on the target**
7. Record any outstanding works required.
8. Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works.
9. Notify the TCRO on completion of the Job

01 W Inspect & report of Egress tunnel features
Before you start the inspection, make sure that you are carrying the
camera, so that you can take any photographs of your observations.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this work.
2. Have the Traffic Control Room turn all lights on.
3. Enter the Burnley Tunnel Emergency Egress Tunnel (EET) at the Burnley
Stairwell and
carry out the following inspections over the entire length of the
EET.
4. Visually inspect the EXIT signs for operation (12 off).  Record on
the form ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 any  EXIT
sign that is not functioning correctly.
5. Visually inspect the stairwell and EET lighting for operation.
Record  on the form
""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374
all instances of three (3) successive light fittings not functional.
6. Visually inspect all signage for cleanliness, damage and or damage
tofixings. Record
on the form  ""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly
Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374 any signage requiring further attention.
7. Visually inspect walls, floors and roofs for ground water leaks.
Record on the form
""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374
any leaks. Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage), LEAK TYPE
(Drip, Spray,
Running), POSITION (Roof, North wall, South wall, Floor).
8. Visually inspect floor for Trip Hazards e.g. raised grates,
accumulated debris, deposits of
leak sealant, water puddles etc.  Remove temporary hazards and
recordall occurrences
of hazards and their location on the form  ""Emergency  Egress Tunnel
Inspection Record  -
Weekly Inspection"" TMF- 3012-OP-0374
9. Visually inspect
(a) and operate all emergency egress doors (e.g. Tunnel to EET - at
each cross passage
and
(b) doors within egress tunnel - for operation and or damage and
(c)  ensure all doors to equipment rooms are locked.  Record on the
form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""  TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the
door location and a description of the repairs required.
10. Visually inspect all drainage and pits for evidence of blockage and
water over the floor.
Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage) TYPE (Pit, Drain, Pipe)
POSITION (North side, South side, Centre).  Record on the form
""Emergency Egress
Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF- 3012-OP-0374
the location and
description of any blockage or flooding.
11. Visually inspect all EET and Stairwell fitments for damage,
corrosion, trip hazards,
obstructions (from walls or roofs) that are apparent.  Record on
the form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the location
and a description of the repairs and or obstruction.
12. Visually inspect for evidence of rodent infestation.  Record on the
form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the location
of any sightings.
13. Remove all accumulated debris from the egress tunnel.
14. On completion have the Traffic Control Room switch all lights OFF.
15. Record in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet any abnormal
parameters found.
Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works.
16. Ensure the form  ""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  -
Weekly  Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374 is returned to the CIVIL team leader or his
representative for
evaluation and recording of new leaks onto the Burnley Tunnel
Emergency Egress
Tunnel Leak Repair programme.  The Civil team leader is to ensure
any
outstanding works are scheduled.
17. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the work."
