03 M Inspect & Test YC Pump Station pumps
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Control room prior to commencing this work.
2. Reference manual Operation and Maintenance Manual for
Melbourne Citylink Project - Yarra Crossing Groundwater
Pumping Station Upgrade  R-YPS-CO-100000.
3. WARNING:  BOTH THE WET WELLS AND THE VALVE PIT ARE DESIGNATED
CONFINED SPACES AND  MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED
SPACE CONDITIONS.
Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry
TMI-3012-SA-0015.
4. At the Local Control Panel A1
(a) Check the switchboard, situated in switchroom above the
pump station, for local alarm conditions.    [_ _]
(b) Carry out visual inspections both internally and
externally of the control panels for damage, corrosion,
evidence of insect infestation, ingress of moisture, dust
and grime (clean as required).  [_ _]
(c) Check the cable connections for tightness and signs of
overheating and inspect electrical the control equipment
for evidence of overheating.    [_ _]
(d) Check control panel indicators for operation, repair as
necessary.  [_ _]
(e) Check control switches are left in the Auto
position.  [_ _]
(f) Record the readings of  the hour run meters, for each
pump, in the Work Done area of  job sheet.  [_ _]
5. Repeat step 4 for Control Panel A2.  [_ _]
6. Repeat step 4 for Control Panel A3.  [_ _]
7. Repeat step 4 for Control Panel B1.  [_ _]
8. Repeat step 4 for Control Panel B2.  [_ _]
9. Inspect the pump wet wells and the valve pit.
(a) Inspect the wet wells through the access ladder hatch for
general cleanliness and any accumulated debris, inspect
for any evidence of leakage.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the external conditions of the pipework and the
valves for corrosion (Rust).  Minor corrosion (rust) is
to be removed with a wire brush and the cleaned surface
painted with Coldgal.   [_ _]
(c) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet evidence of
leaks and any corrective works that are outstanding.
Raise a new jobsheet for any corrective works
outstanding.   [_ _]
(d) Lubricate Isolating Valves with Loctite Silver Grade Anti ,,
Seize Lubricant or Equivalent.  [_ _]
(e) Operate all pump manual isolating valves through AT LEAST
THREE (3) OPEN/CLOSED cycles to confirm valve
operationally.  Ensure the valves are left in the fully
open position on completion.  [_ _]
10. Test the function of the Hydrocarbon detector, to test use a
small LPG bottle and release a small amount of gas in the
vicinity of the detector.  Check with the control room that
an alarm was received.    [_ _]
11. Dirty Water Pumps
(a) Check the inlet tundish for any blockage or accumulated
debris.  Clean if necessary    [_ _]
(b) Check the triple interceptor trap for evidence of oil on
the surface, turbidity and the correct operation of the
discharge valve.    [_ _]
12. Switch the pump PSYCDWP1 AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to
the MANUAL position.  [_ _]
(a) Check and note the position of pump non-return valve
counterweight before starting the pump.   [_ _]
(b) Check the cabling to the pump for damage and that it is
clear from possible damage.  [_ _]
CAUTION:  Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
alarm point as lack of submergence may cause pumpset damage
13. Start the pump PSYCDWP1 by pressing the START push
button.   [_ _]
(a) Measure the operating current of the pump in the Work
Done area of the job sheet.  If the current drawn is
greater than FLC 55A then record in the Work Done
area of the Jobsheet .   [_ _]
(b) Observe pump operation for smooth running, vibration and
abnormal noises.  [_ _]
(c) Observe pump discharge rate is sufficient to draw down
level of water in sump.   [_ _]
(d) Visually check piping for leaks, damage and corrosion,
clean corrosion and repair with Cold Gal.  If leaks or
damage is apparent, record in the Work Done area of the
job sheet and raise a new job sheet for the corrective
maintenance.  Ensure the Team Leader or his
representative is notified.  [_ _]
(e) Observe the level controller readout for variations,
with respect to the pump operations.    [_ _]
(f) Stop the pump by pressing the  STOP pushbutton.  Check
the operation of the non-return valve (NRV), as the
water flow stops.
(i) The NRV should close with a sharp audible metallic
sound,
(ii) Backflow through the pump should cease within 30
seconds.
(iii) If a faulty closure is suspected, the pump should be
re-started then be monitored again.
(iv) If a faulty valve closure is still suspected, record
in the Work Done area of the job sheet and raise a
new job sheet for the corrective maintenance.  [_ _]
14. Repeat steps 12 and 13 for PSYCDWP2.   [_ _]
15. Repeat steps 12 and 13 for PSYCDWP3.   [_ _]
16. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the  AUTO
position.   [_ _]
17. Check the operation of the float switches by manually
operating the floats.  The floats are situated in the corner
of the wet well and are accessible from the ladder with the
use of a special hook to reach the cables. Lift the
High/High float and invert it 90 deg to trigger alarm.  Lift
the Low/Low float and invert through 90 deg, checking that
the alarms are received at the Traffic Control Room. [_ _]
18. When this job falls in either December, March, June or
September.  Lift the level controller sensor out of the
protective conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in the
sensor base of all dirt or debris.   [_ _]
19. Check the operation of each of the isolating valves, by
partially closing then fully opening again.  [_ _]
20. Work plan for the Ground Water Pumps
21. Switch pump PSSWGWP1 AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the
MANUAL position.  [_ _]
(a) Check the cabling to the pump for damage and that it is
clear from possible damage.  [_ _]
CAUTION:  Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
alarm point as lack of submergence may cause pumpset damage
22. Start the pump PSYCGWP1 by pressing the START
pushbutton.  [_ _]
(a) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work
Done area of the job sheet if the current drawn is
greater than. (FLC 40A.).   [_ _]
(b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running, vibration
and/or abnormal noises.    [_ _]
(c) Observe that pump discharge rate is sufficient to draw
down water level in sump  [___]
(d) Observe the level controller readout for variations,
with respect to the pump operations.   [_ _]
(e) Shut off  the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton.
Check the operation of the non-return  valve (NRV). The
NRV is constructed of PVC.  The NRV should close once
flow, through the pump, has ceased.  If a flow
continues, then the pump should be re-started and run
for 2 minutes and the non-return valve monitored again.
If a faulty closure is still suspected, record in the
Work Done area of the job sheet and raise a new job
sheet for the outstanding corrective works.  [_ _]
23. Repeat steps 20 to 22 for pump PSYCGWP2.  [_ _]
24. Repeat steps 20 to 22 for pump PSYCGWP3 ONLY IF A PUMP IS CONNECTED.
[_ _]
25. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to AUTO
position.  [_ _]
26. Check the operation of the float switches by manually
operating the floats.  The floats are situated in the corner
of the wet well and are accessible from the ladder with the
use of a special hook to reach the cables. Lift the
High/High float and invert it 90 deg to trigger alarm.  Lift
the Low/Low float and invert through 90 deg, checking that
the alarms are received at the Traffic Control Room. [_ _]
27. When this job falls in either January, March, June or
September.  Lift level controller sensor out of the
protective conduit, then carefully, clean recess in
the sensor base of all dirt or debris.   [_ _]
28. Check the operation of the isolating valves by partially
closing then opening fully again.    [_ _].
29. Check that the wet well ventilation system fan is
operational and sucking air.     [_ _]
30. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area
of the job sheet.    [_ _]
31. A Confined Space Entry permit is required prior to entering
the sump
32. At the pump motor control panel, switch the pumps from
Automatic Mode to Manual Mode.
Caution DO NOT OPERATE THE PUMPS WITHOUT WATER COVERAGE.  THE
PUMPS NEED TO BE SUBMERGED TO OBTAIN ADEQUATE COOLING
OTHERWISE DAMAGE WILL OCCUR.
33. At the pump sump
(a) Inspect the triple interceptor for debris, silt deposits
and foreign objects, remove and clean if required.
(b) Inspect the pump sump for debris, silt deposits and
foreign objects, remove and clean if required.
34. Ensure the Triple Interceptor bypass valve is OPEN.
35. This test is to record the flow rate in litres per second
for each pump.  It is only necessary to operate the pumps,
in each case, for a time sufficient to allow the readings to
stabilise.  Record all results on form TMF-3012-OP-0272 -
Domain Tunnel Groundwater Pump Calibration.
(a) Close valve Pump 2
(b) Start Pump 1 using the On/Off Push Buttons
(c) Allow sufficient time for readings to settle
(d) Record the flow rate (Lt/Sec) from the 2 Magflow flow
meters (Large digits).
(e)Turn pump 1 OFF.
36. Close Pump 1 valve and Open Pump 2 valve.  Repeat step 35
for pump 2.
37. Ensure the combined flowrate is between 15 and 16 litres per
second for each pump.  Adjust the flowrate, if required, by
adjusting the butterfly valve on the 100mm and 80mm
lines.  [_ _]
38. Once the test is complete, ensure both pump valves are fully
open, pump isolators are switched ON and the float switches
are free to operate. [_ _]
39. At the pump motor control panel, switch the pumps from
Manual mode to Automatic Mode.
40. Record in the Work Done area of the Job sheet any
outstanding works that require further work.  Raise a new
job sheet for any outstanding work that is required.
41. Record the hours run for each pump in the Work Done area of
the Job Sheet.  The hour run meters are on the panel door.
42. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the pump station and
equipment etc,  in the Work Done section of the job
sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
43. Notify the traffic control room on completion of the job.
44. Ensure the completed from TMF-3012-OP-0272  Domain Tunnel
Groundwater Pump Calibration is returned to the Electrical
Electronic Team leader or his representative for recording
of the data.  Enter data into file at
G:\TFM\Operations\Tunnel drainage\Domain Tunnel drainage\
Yarra Xing pump Flows.xls
\ Data Entry.  Print Graph and forward to Maintenance
Operations Manager for information and forwarding to
relevant authorities.

12 M Minor inspection & test run of each WL TSH generator
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. The generator minor service ""TYPE A"", as set out in the
Cummins Maintenace report, shall be carried out by the
sub-contractor on the WL technical shelter generators access
gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Minor Service ""TYPE A"" Reference: Cummins Onan Operator's
Manual 960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012].
The sub-contractor shall carry out the service as per items
listed on the maintenance report column ""A"" and test as per
par 5.
4. Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP Electrical Pty Ltd
Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI [M-MCL-ME-20016]
(a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the ""RUN / OFF / AUTO"" Switch on the generator DC
panel to ""RUN"" let the engine run for at least 5
minutes, then turn the ""RUN / OFF / AUTO"" Switch
back to ""AUTO""
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from ""AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" to ""EMERGENCY SUPPLY &
TEST"" run the generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared,
and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
[_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure,
water temperature    [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switch board back
to ""AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" the generator will continune to
run for about 8 minutes before stopping.  [_ _]
5. Fill in the Generator Log Book
6. Record the
(a) Sub-contractors Maintenance Report No   [____________]
(b) Sub-contractors  Field Report No    [__________]
(c) Generator Hours run ( from the hour run meter )
[__________].  Enter the Reading of the hours run meter
into the meter readings screen on the Plant usage Tab.
7. Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
8. Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
"

03 M Inspection of WIM & TCS Systems on the SL Tollway
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the emergency
lane.
2. Set up short term emergency lane closure incorporating,
symbolic worker, lateral shift, vehicle arrow board and cones
as per Work Instruction , Traffic Control TMI-3012-OP 0002
and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12.
3. Reference: Central Weighing Australasia, Roadside Maintenance
Training Manual, Doc. PL-MCL-TM-1631, Rev 0 and for operation
of laptop computer,  Weigh-in-Motion & Counting Stations,
Operator's  Manual for WIMS Front End Computer,
Doc.   PL-MCL-TM-1630, Rev A, Section 3 Telecom- DOS
operator's Manual . (Status Information 6.1.2 page 145)
4. At SL WIM/TCS Systems 04A control cabinet, check the
following;
(a) Internal and external condition of the cabinet.   [_ _]
(b) Check wiring for tightness and for any evidence of
overheating.  [_ _]
(c) Check that the Tx and Rx LEDs (on the modem) flash at
least each minute.  [_ _]
(d) Check that the battery charger LED is ON.  [_ _]
(e) Using a vacuum cleaner, clean the cabinet
interior.   [_ _]
5. Use laptop computer to carry out the following:
(a) Plug the 9 pin serial lead from the computer to the
controller input/output board.
(b) Switch ON the computer.
(c) Click on Telecom WIMS Icon
(d) Select Comms by pressing the 'C' Key
(e) Select LOGGER/ONLINE, then press Enter.
(f) Check that the laptop computer communicates with the
logger correctly.  [_ _]
(g) Confirm the logger parameters, shown in the CURRENT
SITE (MCL) on page no. 1, area match those listed in
the document  Site Configuration and Set up Details
(stored cabinet).  [_ _]
(h) Press key Page Down to go to screen page 2. [_ _]
(i) Record on the form attached loop frequencies and weigh
responses.  [_ _]
(j) Record value of Power Status on page 2 of the
computer screen.  The battery should read approx 13
volts. [_ _]
(k) When a truck crosses the sensors check on page 2
(computer screen) that all sensors, in each lane are
operating correctly (an asterisk will appear momentarily
alongside the appropriate loops as the truck crosses).
This check should only be done with trucks and not cars
(weighing sites only), as all sensors may not be displayed
for cars.  [_ _]
(l) Select LOGGER/OFFLINE, then press Enter
(m) Select 'Quit', then press Enter
(n) Then select 'Quit' again, press Enter again.
(o) Select 'Yes' to quit Telecom system.
6. Switch computer OFF and then unplug the 9 pin serial
lead. [_ _]
7. From the side of the road, visually check the conditions of
the road sensors, for condition, no (loose bolts) metal
vibration or exposed wires visible. [_ _]
8. Repeat steps 4 to 7 for WIM/TCS System 04B   [_ _].
9. Repeat steps 4 to 7 for WIM/TCS System 04C   [_ _].
10. Repeat steps 4 to 7 for WIM/TCS System 05A & B   [_ _].
11. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
12. Notify the control room  prior to departure."

06 W Inspect RHS spoon drain
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this Job.
2. Refer to TMI-3012-OP-0031 Burnley Tunnel Drainage
3. Lane closures to access the Burnley Tunnel shall be as per
Work Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and
Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 22, 23, 25.
4. Inspect spoon drain along the RHS new Jersey Barrier for
debris, accumulated silt and or foreign materials that may
cause damming or blockages.  Remove any loose items that may
cause problems in the drainage system.
5. Inspect transitions from spoon drains to down pipes for
materials liable to cause blockages.  Remove all material
from transition point.
6. Inspect the Edge Pavement Drain (cut into road pavement) for
debris and blockages, remove any loose debris from within the
drain.
7. Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet any outstanding
works requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new job
sheet for these works.
8. Record results on form TMF-3012-OP-0271- BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAIN
INSPECTIONS
9. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the job.
10. Ensure completed form TMP-3012-OP-0271 - BURNLEY TUNNEL
DRAIN INSPECTIONS is forwarded to the Civil Team leader or
his representitive on compeltion of the job.

01 W Mon, m'sure & report  Swan St pump stn flows
The measure of water flowing from the Swan Street pump station
is a measure of all the water collected in the Burnley Tunnel
drainage systems, from both dirty and Groundwater sources.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL
DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0031.
3. The Civil Team leader is to provide a copy of the previous
WEEKLY BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0233 for
detail of the previous readings.
4. At the Swan Street Pump Station Motor Control Centre, record
the Time and the Total flow in kilo litres for the pump
station on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233.
5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
6. Ensure a copy of the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
evaluation on completion  of the job.
Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
in excess of  0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
job to investigate to check the various bay flows for the
reason to the change in water flowrate.

03 M Load test of the MGE UPS
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
2. Check with the control room if any UPS alarms are relevant.
3. Refer to MGE UPS Systems Manual, Galaxy User Manual
E-679380XT/FA, M-STG-EL-24009, and Schnieder Electric Tunnel
Electrical Services Training Notes, M-STG-EL-24001,
Section 9.
WARNING
THE UPS BATTERY POTENTIAL IS APPROXIMATELY 380 VOLTS AND IS
EARTHED.  THE BATTERIES CAN DELIVER A FAULT CURRENT OF
APPROXIMATELY 9000 AMPS.  EXPOSED BATTERY TERMINALS ARE
DANGEROUS AND MUST NOT BE TOUCHED.  IN THE VICINITY OF THE
BATTERIES USE ONLY TOOLS WHICH ARE FULLY INSULATED.
SAFETY GLASSES MUST BE WORN WHEN CARRYING OUT  MEASUREMENTS
ON THE BATTERIES.
4. Check the UPS control panel readout for alarms and or normal
status.  If an alarm is found, record the alarm in the Work
Done Area of the Job Sheet. Do Not Continue with this Job if
an alarm is present.  [_ _]
5. Record measurements on form 03 M MGE Uninterruptible Power
Supply Battery Inspection and Test, TMF-3012-OP-0099.
6. Measure and record the UPS room temperature.   [_ _]
7. Check and record DC voltage and AC ripple voltage for each
bank of batteries.  If a discrepancy is found then record in
the Work Done Area of the Job Sheet.  Do Not Continue
this job sheet if there is a discrepancy in the readings
recorded and the readings expected.  [_ _]
8. To simulate a power failure, Open Mains 1 Isolator (Q1), the
UPS operation will change to the batteries.  [_ _]
9. Operate the UPS, in this mode, for at least 10
minutes.  [_ _]
10. Measure and record the DC voltage for each shelf of the
battery banks.
11. Measure and record the DC current flow in each battery bank.
12. Return the UPS to normal operation by closing Mains 1
Isolator Q1.  [_ _]
13. With an Optical thermometer measure the temperature of the
batteries and their inter-connections.  Temperature readings
should approximate ambient room temperature.  When a
connection is found to having a temperature greater than 5
degrees above room  temperature, in the Work Done Area of
the Job Sheet, record the battery location, terminal
identification, measured  temperature.  [_ _]
14. With an Optical thermometer measure the average temperature
of the two (AC & DC) capacitor banks and record the result.
15. With an anemometer measure and record the airflow from each
of the UPS cooling fans.
16. With the Optical thermometer measure and record the
temperature of each of the UPS cooling fans.  [_ _]
17. Ensure Normal operation of the UPS.  [_ _]
18. Sweep and clean the UPS room:
Sweep the floor and remove accumulated webs from the
walls.   [___]
Sweep the control panel room floors as well, vacuum the
control panel enclosures and any surfaces that will collect
dust deposits.   [___]
Clean the front panel of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
19. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the UPS room and
equipment etc,  in the "Work Done"section of the job
sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
20. Leave a duplicate 03M MGE Uninterruptible Power Supply
Battery Inspection and  test form in the UPS room.  Compare
previously recorded data and record in the Work Done
Area of the Job Sheet any data that shows any degradation.
21. Notify the control room on completion of the job."

01 W Inspect & report of Egress tunnel features
Before you start the inspection, make sure that you are carrying the
camera, so that you can take any photographs of your observations.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this work.
2. Have the Traffic Control Room turn all lights on.
3. Enter the Burnley Tunnel Emergency Egress Tunnel (EET) at the Burnley
Stairwell and
carry out the following inspections over the entire length of the
EET.
4. Visually inspect the EXIT signs for operation (12 off).  Record on
the form ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 any  EXIT
sign that is not functioning correctly.
5. Visually inspect the stairwell and EET lighting for operation.
Record  on the form
""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374
all instances of three (3) successive light fittings not functional.
6. Visually inspect all signage for cleanliness, damage and or damage
tofixings. Record
on the form  ""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly
Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374 any signage requiring further attention.
7. Visually inspect walls, floors and roofs for ground water leaks.
Record on the form
""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374
any leaks. Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage), LEAK TYPE
(Drip, Spray,
Running), POSITION (Roof, North wall, South wall, Floor).
8. Visually inspect floor for Trip Hazards e.g. raised grates,
accumulated debris, deposits of
leak sealant, water puddles etc.  Remove temporary hazards and
recordall occurrences
of hazards and their location on the form  ""Emergency  Egress Tunnel
Inspection Record  -
Weekly Inspection"" TMF- 3012-OP-0374
9. Visually inspect
(a) and operate all emergency egress doors (e.g. Tunnel to EET - at
each cross passage
and
(b) doors within egress tunnel - for operation and or damage and
(c)  ensure all doors to equipment rooms are locked.  Record on the
form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""  TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the
door location and a description of the repairs required.
10. Visually inspect all drainage and pits for evidence of blockage and
water over the floor.
Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage) TYPE (Pit, Drain, Pipe)
POSITION (North side, South side, Centre).  Record on the form
""Emergency Egress
Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF- 3012-OP-0374
the location and
description of any blockage or flooding.
11. Visually inspect all EET and Stairwell fitments for damage,
corrosion, trip hazards,
obstructions (from walls or roofs) that are apparent.  Record on
the form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the location
and a description of the repairs and or obstruction.
12. Visually inspect for evidence of rodent infestation.  Record on the
form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the location
of any sightings.
13. Remove all accumulated debris from the egress tunnel.
14. On completion have the Traffic Control Room switch all lights OFF.
15. Record in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet any abnormal
parameters found.
Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works.
16. Ensure the form  ""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  -
Weekly  Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374 is returned to the CIVIL team leader or his
representative for
evaluation and recording of new leaks onto the Burnley Tunnel
Emergency Egress
Tunnel Leak Repair programme.  The Civil team leader is to ensure
any
outstanding works are scheduled.
17. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the work."

04 M Insp & cln of AID cams with EWP in DT LHS lane
Perform this job at the same time as the CCTV, Speed cameras,
AID Equipment boxes and the AID Junction Boxes whilst a 2 lane
LHL closure of the tunnel is in place.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Work shall be carried out within designated times approved by
the TCRO.
2. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
3. Access to this camera group is:
(a) AID Cameras
802, 804, 806, 808, 810, 812, 814, 816, 818, 820,
822, 824, 826 and 828 are located over the Left hand
lane.
(b) Access Vehicle: EWP.
(c) Lane Closure: LH and centre lane
(d) AID Camera Equipment  Box Location:
Refer to Device Location Guide Ver 5.01 for locations.
4. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 27 (40 kmh) and 39 (60kmh).
5. Reference Manual, Traffic Management Systems - CCTV & AID
Systems - Operators and Maintenance Manual,  (M-MCL-TM-1 511)
6. If it is necessary to isolate the camera power supply (24Vac)
can be switched off at a GPO mounted in the junction box that
services up to four AID cameras mounted locally to the
cameras.
7. Camera and Camera Housing;
(a) Visually inspect for vandalism, damage, corrosion,
external evidence of moisture and any insect infestation.
Surface insect spray  may be applied if necessary to the
housing exterior but must not be applied to the interior
of the housing or to the housing glass.
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to
mounts.   [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
Rain-X cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(e) Only If there is evidence of moisture and or insect
infestation within the camera housing, then open the AID
camera housing.  Remove any moisture or insect
infestation and discard the previously used Silica Gel
packs and replace with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel
packs.    [_ _]
Only if it has been necessary to remove the camera
housing cover visually inspect the condition of cables
and connections and clean, if required, within the camera
enclosure    [_ _]
Carefully replace the cover and ensuring the enclosure
seal is effective.   [_ _]
8. If the power has been isolated, re-instate the 24V power
supply to the camera.  [_ _]
9. Check with the Traffic Control Room that the AID camera is
functioning correctly and that the MASK is correctly
aligned.   [_ _]
10. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
attention of the Electrical Supervisor or his
representative.  [_ _]
11. On completion of job, record any outstanding works that
require further corrective works in the Work Done area of
the job sheet, raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
works as required.
12. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

06 M Insp of Substation HV equip
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner,
Cloths, Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon
Lubricant Spray
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of Substations as well the cleaning, inspections
and maintenance of the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
(Substations 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 - General )
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant Substations
areas.
2. A visual inspection of substations 1- 5 and substation 6
(Ground type outdoor) is to be carried out with attention
given to the following:
(a) On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF
ventilation fans, if operating, toreduce ambient
noise.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect for water in any cable trenches.
(c) Visually inspect for evidence of condensation in
buildings.  [_ _]
(d) Visually inspect equipment enclosures and metal
structures and fixtures for evidence of corrosion or
other environmental conditions.  [_ _]
(e) Any unusual smell which may indicate overheating.  [_ _]
(f) Listen for any noise which may indicate an electrical
discharge or looseness of components.  [_ _]
(g) Visually inspect the main earthing busbars and
connections for degradation and damage.  [_ _]
(h) Remove any rubbish, dust, debris, materials or equipment
that serves no purpose within or near substations.  [_ _]
(i) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet,
inspection results requiring further corrective actions.
Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works and
notify the Team Leader or his representative.  Include
in the Related Job field of the new and this job, the
job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
(j) Prior to leaving the Substation ensure the ventilation
fans are returned to service.  [_ _]
3. Inspect the doors and locking facilities of substations,
enclosures within, outdoor enclosures, for operation, damage,
leaks and or corrosion.  [_ _]
4. Ensure all danger notices and labels are in place and are
maintained in a legible condition.  Any single line diagram
(or similar) is easily readable.  [_ _]
(Dry Type Transformers - Cast Resin 1A, 1B, 2A, 2B, 3A, 3B,
4A, 4B, 5A & 5B )
5. (a) Visually inspect transformer enclosures for evidence of
corrosion and or damage.   [_ _]
(b) Check that the Winding temperature instrument is
operational and that the alarm is connected to the PMCS
and the Traffic Control Room.   [_ _]
(c) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection
results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a
new job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the
Team Leader or his representative.  Include in the
Related Job field of the new and this job, the job number
number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
(HV Protection Systems)
6. (a) Visually inspect that the battery supply is available for
the incoming and distribution overcurrent and earth fault
relay systems. e.g. all protection displays are
operational.   [_ _]
(b) Reset any relay operational targets on protection devices
AS required.   [_ _]
(c) Visually inspect the Capacitive voltage neon indicators
for correct operation.   [_ _]
(d) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection
results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a
new job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the
Team Leader or his representative.  Include in the
Related Job field of the new and this job, the job number
number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
(High Voltage SM6 Schneider Switchgear)
7. (a) Visually inspect the enclosures and control panels for
evidence of damage and or corrosion.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the outside of the switchboard and remove
accumulated dust and dirt and clean.   [_ _]
(c) Visually check all auxiliary wiring, plugs and
terminations in low voltage instrument compartment. [_ _]
(d) Visually inspect that the battery supply is available for
the incoming and distribution overcurrent and earth fault
relay systems. e.g. all protection displays are
operational.   [_ _]
(e) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection
results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a
new job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the
Team Leader or his representative.  Include in the
Related Job field of the new and this job, the job number
number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
8. At Sub-stations fill-in the log-book [_ _]

06 M Jet Fan maintenance and lubrication.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1.  Works to be carried out on one jet fan at a time so as to
not affect the operation of total tunnel ventilation
2.  Notify control room prior to commencing work.
3.  Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002
and Translink Operations Procedure PR-RS-OP-IR-020 Plan 27
or 28.
4.  Reference Manual;  Witt & Sohn, Operations and Maintenance
Manual , Certificate 18. (M-STG-VE-29047 )
5.  In associated equipment room switch jet fan AUTO/OFF/MAN
selector switch to MAN and REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL switch to LOCAL
to enable control adjacent to jet fan.  [_ _]
6.  Running visual inspection
WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF BODY IN INLET OR OUTLET
AIR STREAM WHEN FAN IS RUNNING.
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN.
(a) Start fan locally by pressing the START button on the
panel adjacent to the fan.   [_ _]
(b) Check for any abnormal noise or movement from the
fan.  [_ _]
(c) Check the fan unit vibration mountings and safety rods
for loose nuts and bolts.  [_ _]
(d) Stop fan locally with the EMERGENCY STOP button.  [_ _]
(e) If any non-conforming items are found, investigate
further in the static fan inspection.  [_ _]
7.  Static fan inspection
(a) Ensure the local  EMERGENCY STOP button is engaged. [_ _]
(b) Conduct a thorough visual inspection for damage and
corrosion of the silencers, impeller, inlet cone, cable
connections, mounting frame and vibration attenuators.
Any cracks identified in the vicinity must be noted in
the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _] Photo of Cracks found
will be required.
Any damage, especially to surface protection, must be
noted in the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _]
(c) Carry out careful inspection of all supporting hardware
and screw connections, including the eight vibration bracket
installations and the four safety rod brackets.  Using a
torque wrench, ensure that the accessible supporting screw
connections are secured and fixed with the correct torque
settings.  [_ _]
NOTE: Torque Settings
M10 = 37Nm
M12 = 65Nm
M16 = 150Nm
M20 = 300Nm      as per reference manual
in step 4
Bolts with Nylon washers should only be checked for
tightness. Do not torque as nylon washer get damaged
Do not torque anchor bolts in tunnel roof. Check for
tightness only.
(d) If any non-conforming items are found, record in the
"Work Done" area of the job sheet and rectify immediately
where possible to the requirements of the Witt & Sohn <(>,<)>
Operations and Maintenance Manual , Certificate 18.
(M-STG-VE-29047).   This inspection is carried out
externally via the inlet and exhaust ends using a
torch.  [_ _]
(e) Remove cover to motor junction box and check the cable
connections visually for tightness and evidence of
overheating.
8.  Lubrication
(a) Release the key operated EMERGENCY STOP button, restart
fan  locally.
(b) Regrease bearings using grease gun on nipples onside of
fan with  Mobilith SHC220 (TF000021) grease, 10 pumps of
hand grease gun per grease nipple.
Note:  Lubrication should be carried out between 3,000
and 4,000 hours running time when access is available.
Do not over grease.    [_ _]
(c) Stop fan using local EMERGENCY STOP button
(d) Release the EMERGENCY STOP button using a Key.  (Remove
the key)   [_ _]
9.  Equipment Room Control Panel.
(a) Switch fan REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to REMOTE to
enable control at panel
(b) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of the
control panel for damage evidence of insect infestation<(>,<)>
ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as
required).  [_ _]
(c) Check cable connections visually for tightness and signs
of overheating and inspect electrical control
equipment [_ _]
(d) Start fan with START pushbutton on panel and leave
running for approximately 5 minutes
(e) Check ammeter at electrical panel to verify fan is
operating within current limits FLC 100A.  [_ _]
(f ) Using an infra red thermometer check the temperature of
the connections and power cables to the motor.   Record in
the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet if the temperature
recorded is more that 10º to 15º C above ambient.   [_ _]
(g) Record the "hours run" from the Jet Fan hour run meter
on the panel door in the "Work Done"" area of the job
sheet.   [_ _]
Note:  Hour run meters are on the control panels for
non-reversing fans only.
Reversing fans hour run readings are obtainable
from the PMCS screens in the control room
10. Return the LOCAL/OFF/REMOTE switch to the OFF position and
the AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector switch to the AUTO
position.   [_ _]
11. Advise the Traffic control room operator that control of the
fan is returned to the control room.    [_ _]
12. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable<(>,<)>
Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework<(>,<)>
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and bring to the attention
of the Team Leader Electrical or his representative.
13. Notify control room on completion of work.
14. Enter the hours run for the jet fan into the Plant item
screen, then select the usage tab.

04 M Insp/cln of  WL CCTV cams, EWP, Centre of Road"
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the right hand
lane or mounting the median strip
2. Access to this camera group is:
(a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
(b) Position 0 and 1.
(c) Lane Closure: RHS lane
(d) Electrical Cabinet Location: Tollway
3. Set up the lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink  Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12.
4. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,
Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
(a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
necessary.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
(c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,
re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
(d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
fastened to the PT300.
WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
(e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if
not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]
(f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
(Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the camera).
Ensure the co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
module and is secure.  [_ _]
6. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
(unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
of the PTZ .  [_ _]
7. Camera and Camera Housing;
WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
ALIVE.
(a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface insect
spray may be applied if necessary to the housing exterior
but must not be applied to the interior of the housing or
to the housing glass.  If ingress of moisture or insect
infestation is evident then carry out
steps (d) and (e).  [_ _]
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
mounts. [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
"Rain-X " cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm.
WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.
If the heaters are not warm, spray the heater thermostat
(HTR) with FREEZE IT, then again check the operation of the
heater. [_ _]
(e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
8. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
controller.  [_ _]
9. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait 2
minutes then check again.  [_ _]
10. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job sheet.

06 M Jet Fan maintenance and lubrication.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1.  Works to be carried out on one jet fan at a time so as to
not affect the operation of total tunnel ventilation
2.  Notify control room prior to commencing work.
3.  Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002
and Translink Operations Procedure PR-RS-OP-IR-020 Plan 27
or 28.
4.  Reference Manual;  Witt & Sohn, Operations and Maintenance
Manual , Certificate 18. (M-STG-VE-29047 )
5.  In associated equipment room switch jet fan AUTO/OFF/MAN
selector switch to MAN and REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL switch to LOCAL
to enable control adjacent to jet fan.  [_ _]
6.  Running visual inspection
WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF BODY IN INLET OR OUTLET
AIR STREAM WHEN FAN IS RUNNING.
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN.
(a) Start fan locally by pressing the START button on the
panel adjacent to the fan.   [_ _]
(b) Check for any abnormal noise or movement from the
fan.  [_ _]
(c) Check the fan unit vibration mountings and safety rods
for loose nuts and bolts.  [_ _]
(d) Stop fan locally with the EMERGENCY STOP button.  [_ _]
(e) If any non-conforming items are found, investigate
further in the static fan inspection.  [_ _]
7.  Static fan inspection
(a) Ensure the local  EMERGENCY STOP button is engaged. [_ _]
(b) Conduct a thorough visual inspection for damage and
corrosion of the silencers, impeller, inlet cone, cable
connections, mounting frame and vibration attenuators.
Any cracks identified in the vicinity must be noted in
the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _] Photo of Cracks found
will be required.
Any damage, especially to surface protection, must be
noted in the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _]
(c) Carry out careful inspection of all supporting hardware
and screw connections, including the eight vibration bracket
installations and the four safety rod brackets.  Using a
torque wrench, ensure that the accessible supporting screw
connections are secured and fixed with the correct torque
settings.  [_ _]
NOTE: Torque Settings
M10 = 37Nm
M12 = 65Nm
M16 = 150Nm
M20 = 300Nm      as per reference manual
in step 4
Bolts with Nylon washers should only be checked for
tightness. Do not torque as nylon washer get damaged
Do not torque anchor bolts in tunnel roof. Check for
tightness only.
(d) If any non-conforming items are found, record in the
"Work Done" area of the job sheet and rectify immediately
where possible to the requirements of the Witt & Sohn ,
Operations and Maintenance Manual , Certificate 18.
(M-STG-VE-29047).   This inspection is carried out
externally via the inlet and exhaust ends using a
torch.  [_ _]
(e) Remove cover to motor junction box and check the cable
connections visually for tightness and evidence of
overheating.
8.  Lubrication
(a) Release the key operated EMERGENCY STOP button, restart
fan  locally.
(b) Regrease bearings using grease gun on nipples onside of
fan with  Mobilith SHC220 (TF000021) grease, 10 pumps of
hand grease gun per grease nipple.
Note:  Lubrication should be carried out between 3,000
and 4,000 hours running time when access is available.
Do not over grease.    [_ _]
(c) Stop fan using local EMERGENCY STOP button
(d) Release the EMERGENCY STOP button using a Key.  (Remove
the key)   [_ _]
9.  Equipment Room Control Panel.
(a) Switch fan REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to REMOTE to
enable control at panel
(b) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of the
control panel for damage evidence of insect infestation,
ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as
required).  [_ _]
(c) Check cable connections visually for tightness and signs
of overheating and inspect electrical control
equipment [_ _]
(d) Start fan with START pushbutton on panel and leave
running for approximately 5 minutes
(e) Check ammeter at electrical panel to verify fan is
operating within current limits FLC 100A.  [_ _]
(f ) Using an infra red thermometer check the temperature of
the connections and power cables to the motor.   Record in
the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet if the temperature
recorded is more that 10º to 15º C above ambient.   [_ _]
(g) Record the "hours run" from the Jet Fan hour run meter
on the panel door in the "Work Done"" area of the job
sheet.   [_ _]
Note:  Hour run meters are on the control panels for
non-reversing fans only.
Reversing fans hour run readings are obtainable
from the PMCS screens in the control room
10. Return the LOCAL/OFF/REMOTE switch to the OFF position and
the AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector switch to the AUTO
position.   [_ _]
11. Advise the Traffic control room operator that control of the
fan is returned to the control room.    [_ _]
12. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and bring to the attention
of the Team Leader Electrical or his representative.
13. Notify control room on completion of work.
14. Enter the hours run for the jet fan into the Plant item
screen, then select the usage tab.

Power Street - EXPJ Replacement
07.08.2014 10:29:07 Jason Ng (NGJ)
Verbal, confirmation to go ahead and use XJS to repair the joint from
David Reeves to John De Luca, provided that XJS does not take longer to
implement then like for like repair. As XJS does not take longer, the
joint will be replaced with XJS.
From: Forsterling, Karsten [mailto:Karsten.Forsterling@aecom.com]
Sent: Monday, 4 August 2014 6:13 PM
To: David Reeves; John De Luca
Cc: Ivan Glavan; Lamb, Michael
Subject: RE: Power St expansion joint.
David, John,
I met with Ivan earlier this afternoon to discuss installation of XJS at
Power St to replace the existing damaged FIRMSEC joint. I suggested that
a check was needed to ensure that the range of the existing joint did
not preclude use of XJS at this location.  I have since confirmed that
the XJS would provide adequate range to replicate the existing joint.
Refer attached drawing and XJS spec which show:
EThe existing FIRMSECEFMS- D100 joint with nominal capacity of 100mm.
EIf we were to replace with the XJS, the maximum standard joint width
is 75mm with +100% / -50% movement range (+75mm / - 38mm = 113mm range).
Based on these observations we could:
1. Replace like-for-like using FIRMSEC or similar equivalent.
2. Replace existing joint with XJS with nominal 65mm joint width to
provide +65mm / -33mm = 98mm to give equivalent movement range to
existing.
I am of the opinion that 2. is preferable given issues to date with the
existing FIRMSEC and preference for TSL for XJS.  Both options are
proprietary systems and used widely.
I note also that creep and shrinkage 10-years post construction should
reduce the movement demand on the joint.
Also, observation of the joint at 3pm today at 15degC showed gap to be
60-70mm.  Assuming temperatures roughly consistent with this during
installation, the installed XJS gap width at 65mm would roughly match
that of the existing joint.
For your consideration.  Perhaps give me a call if you have any
questions.
Regards
Karsten Forsterling
Principal Structural Engineer

Karsten.Forsterling@aecom.com
AECOM
Level 9, 8 Exhibition Street, Melbourne, VIC 3000

www.aecom.com

12 M Inspect and maintain Swan St Pump Stn Exhaust Fan
Access to the fan is via a ladder to the roof of Substation 2
and to other components via the lift and stairwell to the pump
room at the base of the shaft.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. Refer to Maintenance Manual, Operating and Maintenance Manual
for Mechanical Services - MCL Tunnels M-STG-ME-27400.
WARNING: THE PUMP SUMP IS CLASSIFIED AS A CONFINED SPACE AND A
ZONE 1 CLASS 1 HAZARDOUS AREA.
3. Work plan for EF-SS2-3
(a) At the switchboard SUB 2 A/C 2A MEB, switch the fan
circuit breaker to OFF.  Isolate and tag in accordance
TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low Voltage Safety Work
Instruction.   [_ _]
(b) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
windings.  Record results in the Work Done area of the
job sheet that does not meet specifications set out in
AS3000.   [_ _]
(c) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
anti-condensation heater.  Record any results in the Work
Done area of the job sheet that does not meet
specifications set out in AS3000.   [_ _]
(d) Check the impellor for build-up of dirt, clearances from
housing and alignment.  [_ _]
(e) At the switchboard SUB 2 A/C 2A MEB, switch the fan
circuit breaker to ON.   [_ _]
(f) Check the fan and motor bearings, lubricate where
applicable.  [_ _]
(g) Measure and record the motor current and compare with the
rated current.  Record in the Work Done area of the job
sheet, any results out of limits..    [_ _]
(h) Check the condition of any flexible duct
connections. [_ _]

01 W Mon, m'sure & report  Swan St pump stn flows
The measure of water flowing from the Swan Street pump station
is a measure of all the water collected in the Burnley Tunnel
drainage systems, from both dirty and Groundwater sources.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL
DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0031.
3. The Civil Team leader is to provide a copy of the previous
WEEKLY BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0233 for
detail of the previous readings.
4. At the Swan Street Pump Station Motor Control Centre, record
the Time and the Total flow in kilo litres for the pump
station on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233.
5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
6. Ensure a copy of the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
evaluation on completion  of the job.
Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
in excess of  0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
job to investigate to check the various bay flows for the
reason to the change in water flowrate.
Work completed as above work plan.

03 M Electrical Inspection / Clean RRBroadcast rooms
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to
leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths,
lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting,
Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon
Lubricant Spray, Rodent bait station,
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
electrical installations of Radio Rebroadcast Rooms 01, 02 &
03 as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the
relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( RRB 01, 02 & 03)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Radio Rebroadcast
rooms.
2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,
use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
abnormal events.  [_ _]
3. Check the interior lighting for operation, including the
operational tube within EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or
repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
4. For RRB 01 only, go to Step 8.
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
accessible equipment and components within distribution
panels.  Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures
of ambient plus 10°C should be considered abnormal and must
be noted in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and components  for evidence of burn
marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record anything
abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and raise
a new jobsheet for any corrective action.  Ensure the Team
Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. [_ _]
7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,
gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general
operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
actions. [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
10.Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for
dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11.Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.
Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
12.Inspect systems, mounted within the Technical Shelters, for
faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp replacement
or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
13.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]
C  RRB room 01, 02 & 03  Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
details in the "Work Done" area of the job sheet and inform
the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and
or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets,
ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on
all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops of
cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
4. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
cleaning materials .  [_ _]
5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light
fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]
6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris. [_ _]
7. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait, replace bait
station if bait is nearly exhausted.  [_ _]
8. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
9. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of the
job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
corrective actions.  [_ _]
10.Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
(b)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
11.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]
12. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.

03 M Inspection of Thytec UPS system in WL TSH's
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
3. Refer to Manual: Thytec 30KVA UPS 12 Pulse
[ M-MCL-ME20000/20011 ] Manual.
4. Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
charged ) record results in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
5. At By-pass Switch (Wall Mounted)
(a) Press the TRANSFER button, on the UPS control panel, to
transfer the UPS  to the by-pass mode.
(b) Wait until the amber By-Pass led is illuminated.
(c) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet<(>,<)>
to the OFF position, to isolate the batteries.
(d) Press the OFF button, on the UPS control panel,  to
switch OFF the UPS unit.
(e) Switch the EXTERNAL BY-PASS switch (wall mounted above
UPS) to the BY-PASS position.  The UPS unit is now
by-passed.
WARNING: DO NOT USE THE INTERNAL BY-PASS SWITCH, AS THIS
SWITCH IS NOT INTERLOCKED.
(f) Switch the EXTERNAL by-pass switch to the NORMAL
position.
(g) Press the ON button, on the UPS control panel.  An UPS
start is initiated.
(h) Wait for INV. ON green led to illuminate.
(i) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet<(>,<)>
to the ON position to connect the batteries to the UPS.
(j) After about 30 secconds the BYPASS led will go OFF and
the INVERTER led will illuminate, indicating the load is
on the inverter.  A noticeable change in the operating
noise of the UPS will also indicate the change of load.
6. UPS Unit.
(a) Do not operate the EMERGENCY STOP push button, on the
front of the UPS Panel, unless in extreme emergency, as
damage to the UPS electrical equipment can occur.
(b) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.
[_ _]
(c) Remove the air filter, clean and re-install, ( replace
air filter if necessary )   [_ _]
(d) Check for air flow above grills on top of the panel.
( with fan in operation )   [_ _]
(e) Visual Inspection of capacitors for any oil leaks.  [_ _]
(f) Switch OFF the ""MAIN UPS"" electrical supply.  The load
should then transfer to the UPS, supplying from the
batteries.
(g) Check and monitor, on the UPS display, the load current
(max. 42A per phase 30kVA UPS or max 55A per phase 40kVA
UPS).
(h) Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
discharged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
(i) Leave the UPS supply the load for at least ten minutes.
(j) Switch the Normal electricity supply isolator to the ON
position.  The load will revert to the Normal power
supply.
7. Battery Panel.
(a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
Batteries.
(b) Ensure the Circuit Breaker operating handle, on Panel
Door, is in the upright position and is not tripped.
[_ _]
(c) Measure and record the overall charge voltage across the
CB ( nominally 270V. )    [_ _]
8. Record any result outside normal parameters, in the "" Work
Done "" area of the job sheet.
9.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
10.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
Works completed as above work plan
"

03 M Maint of Gantry Tolling Equipment
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

the CML RSE Users Manual maintenance schedule, document no.
M-MCL-ET-1225.

and or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to safety
instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 "Working on Gantry Structures
4. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
5. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plan PL-MCL-ET-100001.
Preventative Maintenance No.0301
When carrying out the cleaning of VDC sensors (in 0301),
inspect the area around the connectors for evidence of
corrosion.
If corrosion is evident, then clean the area as described
below.
Where cleaning is to be also carried out, use extreme care
to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter any
connectors.
The Fibre Optic Connector is to be only removed on the
12 Monthly  Cycle (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
Prior to removing any connector or cover socket, clean
surface corrosion and deposits from around connectors,
socket covers and the surrounding surfaces use a tooth
brush to assist if necessary.
Remove the three socket covers (remove only if possible
using fingers) and apply a light spray of silicon to
the three (3) socket covers, replacing and exercising
the threads.
With all caps and plugs re-installed apply a light spray of
silicon to the area around the plugs and caps.
Check for silicon overspray on the VDC sensor window and
clean if necessary.
Where connectors or socket covers cannot be easily removed,
record details in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and
report the fact to the Team Leader or his representative.

job at the Technical Shelters
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
electrical installations of Technical Shelters, as well the
cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the relevant
areas.

( Technical Shelters TSH1-6, TSH10-14 )

abnormal events.  [_ _]

including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace
faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]

accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
and distribution panels.

noted in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and

the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
action [_ _]

12.Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating<(>,<)>

02 M Record Extensometer Readings of the BT slabs
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control prior to commencing the work.
2. Lane closures to access the Burnley tunnel shall be as per
Work Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and
Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059  * Plan 39. ( 60kph ).
3. Reference documents:
(a) Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE
TMI-3012-OP-0031.
(b) Melbourne CityLink Project, Southern Link, Operations and
Maintenance Manual Tunnel Drainage Stage 2. R-STG-EN-006
and Transfield Obayashi JV,
(c) Operations & Maintenance Tanked Tunnel Drainage Works
Report PSM407.R34 December 2000 R-SDG-TU-134.
(d) Transfield Obayashi Joint Venture, Burnley Tunnel Long
Term Monitoring of Twin Anchored Slabs. Report PSM407.R30
September 2000, R-SDG-TU-130.
(f) Transfield Obayashi Joint Venture, Burnley Tunnel
Extensometer and Piezometer Reading Procedures. Report
PSM500.R11 June 2001, R-SDG-TU-211.
4. Location:
Twenty-eight extensometers are located along the length of
the twin anchor zone of the tanked section of the Burnley
Tunnel, roughly in the centre of the middle lane.
5. Purpose:
The extensometers monitor any movement of the invert (floor)
slab.  Small variations in the extensometer tips can be
measured and assessed to indicate whether a slab has moved
and whether the twin anchors have become overloaded
(Ref. R-SDG-TU 130 Rev B) due to the slab movement.
6. Carry out Extensometer measurement.
6.1 (a) Clean the base of the extensometer probe with a clean
rag. (Note: Ensure extra battery is in pouch) prior to
performing readings.
(b) Plug the lead for the extensometer probe into readout
unit, switch the extensometer on using the right button,
select channel 1 with the knob.
(c) With the probe vertical and the base clear of any
obstructions, ensure the digital readout  reads approx.
11.5mm.  This represents the djusted zero value.
(d) Ensure the extensometer probe is kept free of grit at
all times.
6.2 (a) Locate the cast iron cover over the extensometer tip in
road surface.  Spray the bolts liberally with CRC.
(b) Using the socket, slowly and carefully remove the
stainless steel bolts.  If the bolt(s) are excessively
tight, apply more CRC and allow  sufficient time for the
CRC to penetrate down the thread.
(c) Lift the cast iron cap off and place to one side.
6.3 (a) Remove the plastic cap covering the brass bush and pin.
Do not loose the plastic cap.
(b) If the recess housing the bush or pin, contains water,
then remove the water using the wet/dry vacuum
(Ensure you take a Generator & leads).
Wipe the brass bush and pin surface areas are thoroughly
cleaned of all dirt and grit.
(c) Both the bush and pin must be clean and remain clean
during reading (i.e. no grit shall be allowed to wash
back onto the bush or pin surfaces).
6.4 (a) Place the extensometer probe over the brass pin and hold
the probe perpendicular to the surface of the bush
(i.e. generally  vertical).
(b) Apply a firm downwards pressure to the probe and allow
10 seconds for the reading to be established.
6.5 Record the readings on form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL - SLAB
MOVEMENT TMF-3012-OP-0259.  Compare with previous reading,
and if the difference is 0.2mm or more, check for
cleanliness of the extensometer surface and repeat the
reading.
6.6 (a) Replace the plastic cap, and cast iron cover.
(b) Apply grease to thread of the bolts, and screw the bolts
back into their holes using the socket, until they are a
snug tight fit.  Report in the Work Done area of Job
sheet any covers with bolts missing, Replace missing
bolts during inspection.
7. Repeat step 6 for each extensometer test point along the
tunnel.
8. Notify the Control room on completion of the Job.
9. Ensure a copy of the completed form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL -
SLAB MOVEMENT TMF-3012-OP-0259 is forwarded to the Civil Team
Leader or his representative for evaluation on completion of
the job.

01 M Inspection & test running of the WL TSH generators
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
Supply to ensure it is operating in the normal
standby-back-up mode.   [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
MODE.
4. Refer to reference manual Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
5.   (a) Check that the generator was left in  "AUTO" [_ _]
(b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuel and water.   [_ _]
(c) Check oil level.   [_ _]
(d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
(e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).   [_ _]
(f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts   [_ _]
(g) Record the battery voltage in the "Work Done" area
of the job sheet. [_ _]
(h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
Physically open the cap, as the gauge could be
misleading.  [_ _]
(j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours
with the last entry.  [_ _]
6. Reference manual, Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP
Electrical Pty Ltd Main Switchboard O<(>&<)>M Manual Section PI
[M-MCL-ME-20016]
7.  (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch on the generator
DC panel to "" RUN "" let the engine run for at least 5
minutes, then turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch
back to "" AUTO ""
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from "" AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" to ""EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST
"" run the generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared<(>,<)>
and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
[_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure<(>,<)>
water temperature.   [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back
to " AUTOMATIC CONTROL" the generator will continue to
run for about 8 minutes before stopping.   [_ _]
(g) Record the hours run, from the hours run meter,  in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet.
8.  (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
9. Fill in the Generator Log Book and record anything outside
normal parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job
sheet.  Raise a new job for any works requiring further

03 M Inspect & Clean TSH Equipment and Bldgs
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the
cleaning and inspections of the Building and Electrics<(>,<)>
prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and
external lighting, Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material<(>,<)>
Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Rodent Bait Station
This job should be carried in conjunction with the Monthly
job at the Technical Shelters
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
electrical installations of Technical Shelters, as well the
cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the relevant
areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Technical Shelters TSH1-6, TSH10-14 )
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant Technical
shelters.
2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere<(>,<)>
use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
abnormal events.  [_ _]
3. At Technical shelters, fill-in the log-book [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation<(>,<)>
including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace
faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of
ambient plus 10°C should be considered abnormal and must be
noted in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all
cables, terminals, equipment and components  for evidence
of burn marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for any corrective action.
Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Inspect the surges diverters where applicable, and either
replace spent surge diverters when less than 80% or raise a
new Job Sheet for works to be carried out.   [_ _]
9. At Technical Shelters,  visually inspect external Lightning
Protection System connections for damage and or corrosion.
Record anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for any corrective
action.  Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is
informed of the abnormality.  [_ _]
10.Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware<(>,<)>
gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and
general operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out
any required repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any
outstanding actions.  [_ _]
11.Inspect single line drawings for legibility.  Record
details of drawings requiring replacement in the ""Work
Done"" area and report to the Team leader or his
representative.
12.Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating<(>,<)>
looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
13.Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally
for dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
14.Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of
obstructions.  Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
15.Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s)<(>,<)>
for faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
actions.   [_ _]
16.PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect  the PLC status and error indicators.
Indicators found to indicate abnormal conditions are
to be logged in the ""Work Done"" of the Job Sheet and
a new job sheet raised to invetigate and correct the
error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g.
plug connections, screw connections for security.
[_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush, ensure the
enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated
dust and debris.  [_ _]
17.Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.
18.Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for
operation and security.  Check with the Traffic Control
Room Operator to confirm the receipt of an alarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of
outstanding defects in the Work Done area of the Job
Sheet.  [_ _]
19.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective actions.
Include in the Related Job field of the new and this
job, the job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of
moisture ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record
any details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and
inform the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings
and or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Inspect the area of the generator in Tech Shelters and air
conditioning unit, for leaks of fuel, coolants or
lubricants.  Clean any spillage and if any leaks are
evident record in the ""Work Done "" area and raise a new
jobsheet for any corrective action required. Inform the
Team Leader or his representative of  these required
actions.  [_ _]
5. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets<(>,<)>
ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle
on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
6. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
cleaning materials .  [_ _]
7. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light
fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]
8. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
9. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
10.Carry out Exterior Checks of Technical Shelters.
(a) Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the
building (if applicable) for damage, erosion<(>,<)>
graffiti.  [_ _]
(b) Visually inspect the building (if applicable) walls<(>,<)>
roof, guttering and and downpipes for damage, leaks
and or blockages, remove any debris or materials
that could cause a blockage.  [_ _]
(c) Inspect (if applicable) the general area surrounding
the building for erosion and damage to surfaces<(>,<)>
fences, gates, pavements   [_ _]
11.Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  replace
bait station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
12.Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of
the job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
corrective actions.  [_ _]
13.Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.
[_ _]
14.Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
(d)  Generators in Tech Shelters to be left in a state of
readiness for operation.  [_ _]
(e)  UPS in Tech Shelters to be left in state of readiness
for operation. [_ _]
15.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this
job, the job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
16.Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.

12 M Lev 2 Inspect of HV system for operation & Faults
All TS procedures in TMI-3012-SA-0102 High Voltage Safety Work
Instruction.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2. The following work is to be carried by the sub-contractor
under the supervision of an electrical/electronics
technician.
3. Ensure that the Three monthly HV electric inspection has been
carried out and that
(a) The General Section of the above job has been completed
and
(b) Inspect the earthing conductors, earthing electrodes and
connections ensuring all cabling, connections and
installation meet the AS 3000 standard.
4. (Schneider SM6 Switchboard, Circuit Breakers and Isolators)
(a) Read and record the number of operation cycles for each
Circuit Breaker and Isolator.  [_ _]
5. (Substation Earthing Systems)
The result of all tests, inspections and observations
including date of test, ground and weather conditions are to
be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
leader or his representative.
(a) At each substation and HV switchroom, carry out an
earthing resistance test in accordance with AS3000.
(b) Examine each earthing system in turn and check for
tightness of connections, and the condition of system
components e.g. Earthing electrodes, earthing
connections, conductors etc.
6. (RMU Battery Supply and Chargers)
The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to
be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
leader or his representative.
(a) Inspect the battery compartment for damage, appearance
and cleanliness.
(b) Check that the charger is functional.
(c) Check the battery voltage on float charge.
(d) Check that the battery compartment ventilation vents are
clean and clear.
(e) Check the external battery connections for tightness and
corrosion.  Clean and tighten as required.
(f) Check battery cases and or covers are not cracked or
distorted.
(g) Carry out a performance test of the battery bank.
(i) Discharge the batteries, via a load, over a two hour
period. Record both terminal and battery voltage and
battery temperature prior to commencing the test as
well as at completion of test.  Where the battery or
terminal voltage at completion of test is less than
80% of nominal voltage, then the battery is
approaching the end of it's serviceable life and
replacement options should be recommended.
(h) Check and record the on-load charger output (Voltage and
current)
(i)  Check the charger electrical connections and wiring for
damage etc.
7. Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection
results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new
job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative.  Include in the Related Job
field of the new and this job, the job number of the
alternate Job.   [_ _]
