(e)  UPS in Tech Shelters to be left in state of readiness
for operation. [_ _]
15.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this

01 W Mon, m'sure & report  Swan St pump stn flows
The measure of water flowing from the Swan Street pump station
is a measure of all the water collected in the Burnley Tunnel
drainage systems, from both dirty and Groundwater sources.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL
DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0031.
3. The Civil Team leader is to provide a copy of the previous
WEEKLY BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0233 for
detail of the previous readings.
4. At the Swan Street Pump Station Motor Control Centre, record
the Time and the Total flow in kilo litres for the pump
station on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233.
5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
6. Ensure a copy of the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
evaluation on completion  of the job.
Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
in excess of  0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
job to investigate to check the various bay flows for the
reason to the change in water flowrate.

03 M Insp Thytec UPS System SL TSH's
03 M Inspection of Thytec UPS system in SL TSH's
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
3. Refer to Manual: Thytec 30KVA UPS 12 Pulse
[ M-MCL-ME20000/20011 ] Manual.
4. Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
charged ) record results in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
5. At By-pass Switch (Wall Mounted)
(a) Press the TRANSFER button, on the UPS control panel, to
transfer the UPS  to the by-pass mode.
(b) Wait until the amber By-Pass led is illuminated.
(c) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet,
to the OFF position, to isolate the batteries.
(d) Press the OFF button, on the UPS control panel,  to
switch OFF the UPS unit.
(e) Switch the EXTERNAL BY-PASS switch (wall mounted above
UPS) to the BY-PASS position.  The UPS unit is now
by-passed.
WARNING: DO NOT USE THE INTERNAL BY-PASS SWITCH, AS THIS
SWITCH IS NOT INTERLOCKED.
(f) Switch the EXTERNAL by-pass switch to the NORMAL
position.
(g) Press the ON button, on the UPS control panel.  An UPS
start is initiated.
(h) Wait for INV. ON green led to illuminate.
(i) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet,
to the ON position to connect the batteries to the UPS.
(j) After about 30 secconds the BYPASS led will go OFF and
the INVERTER led will illuminate, indicating the load is
on the inverter.  A noticeable change in the operating
noise of the UPS will also indicate the change of load.
6. UPS Unit.
(a) Do not operate the EMERGENCY STOP push button, on the
front of the UPS Panel, unless in extreme emergency, as
damage to the UPS electrical equipment can occur.
(b) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.
[_ _]
(c) Remove the air filter, clean and re-install, ( replace
air filter if necessary )   [_ _]
(d) Check for air flow above grills on top of the panel.
( with fan in operation )   [_ _]
(e) Visual Inspection of capacitors for any oil leaks.  [_ _]
(f) Switch OFF the ""MAIN UPS"" electrical supply.  The load
should then transfer to the UPS, supplying from the
batteries.
(g) Check and monitor, on the UPS display, the load current
(max. 42A per phase 30kVA UPS or max 55A per phase 40kVA
UPS).
(h) Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
discharged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
(i) Leave the UPS supply the load for at least ten minutes.
(j) Switch the Normal electricity supply isolator to the ON
position.  The load will revert to the Normal power
supply.
7. Battery Panel.
(a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
Batteries.
(b) Ensure the Circuit Breaker operating handle, on Panel
Door, is in the upright position and is not tripped.
[_ _]
(c) Measure and record the overall charge voltage across the
CB ( nominally 270V. )    [_ _]
8. Record any result outside normal parameters, in the "" Work
Done "" area of the job sheet.
9.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
10.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.

02 W Record Piezometer Readings BT water table pressures
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control prior to commencing the work.
2. Lane closures to access the Burnley tunnel shall be as per
Work Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and
Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 25 or 26.
3. Reference documents:
(a) Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE
TMI-3012-OP-0031.
(b) Melbourne CityLink Project, Southern Link, Operations and
Maintenance Manual Tunnel Drainage Stage 2. R-STG-EN-006
and Transfield Obayashi JV,
(c) Operations & Maintenance Tanked Tunnel Drainage Works
Report PSM407.R34 December 2000 R-SDG-TU-134.
(d) Transfield Obayashi Joint Venture, Burnley Tunnel Long
Term Monitoring of Twin Anchored Slabs.  Report
PSM407.R30 September 2000, R-SDG-TU-130.
(e) Transfield Obayashi Joint Venture Extensometer and
Piezometer Readings Procedures Report PSM500.R11  June
2001   R-SDG-TU-211  Rev A.
4. Location:
Eighty-six piezometers are located along the length of the
tanked section of the Burnley Tunnel.  Forty-three are
mounted on the south side wall, and Forty-three mounted on
the north side wall.  They highest test point is located up
to 3.5m above the road surface on the tunnel walls.
5. Purpose:
The Piezometer test points are used to monitor groundwater
pressures on the outside of the tunnel wall.  The pressure
reading is then directly related to the groundwater head.
6. Carry out Piezometer readings:
6.1 (a) Loosen the bolt on one side of the stainless steel cover
and rotate the cover to reveal the quick connect
pressure coupling behind.
(b) Wipe the quick connect pressure coupling clean with a
rag.
(c) A ladder will be required to reach the piezometers in
the central section of the tunnel.  A second person may
be required to hold the ladder in place.
6.2 (a) Prior to each reading, Vent the Druck digital pressure
indicator using the tap on the hose of the machine to
allow the pressures within the instrument to equalise.
(b) Connect the Druck digital pressure indicator to the
quick connect coupling.  Pull back the sleeve on the
Druck digital pressure indicator connection and then
push the connection of the Druck digital pressure
indicator connection onto the piezometer connection.
6.3 (a) Press the  I/O button to switch the unit on.
(b) Ensure the reading is set to Kilopascals (kpa) and set
to zero.
(c) To obtain consistent readings, hold the Druck digital
pressure indicator at the same level as the piezometer
tip during the reading.
(d) Allow the reading to stabilise, and record reading on
form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL - GROUNDWATER PRESSURE
TMF-3012-OP-0229.
Note that some of  the readings may stabilise in a few
seconds, although some other readings may require a few
minutes to stabilise.
(e) Vent the Druck digital pressure indicator between
readings.
6.4 Record the results on form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL -
GROUNDWATER PRESSURE"" TMF-3012-OP-0229.
6.5 Replace the stainless steel cover and re-tighten the bolt.
7. Repeat Step 6 for the balance of the piezometer test points.
8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet & also ,,
inform the Team Leader.
9. Notify the Control room on completion of the Job.
10. Ensure a copy of the completed form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL -
GROUNDWATER PRESSURE TMF-3012-OP-0229 is forwarded to the
Civil Team Leader or his representative for evaluation on
completion of the job.  Results that are not in accordance
with baseline values would indicate a change in the state of
the groundwater storage.  The operation of the Groundwater
recharge systems should be checked for correct operation.

12 M Inspection of Cast Resin HV Transformers
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
All work on High Voltage equipment must be carried out in
accordance with Transfield's procedure number TMI-3012-SA-0102
High Voltage Safety Work Instructions.
1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2. (Cast Resin Dry Type Transformers 1A, 1B, 2A,2B, 3A, 3B, 4A,
4B, 5A & 5B)
The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to
be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
leader or his representative.
(a) Examine and clean all bushings, insulators, terminals,
cable connections, for partial discharge, ingress of
moisture or damage.
(b) Inspect Operation of the Winding temperature sensor.
Carry out functional testing to ensure correct Alarming
and trip operation via the PMCS to the Traffic Control
Room.
(c) Check tightness (Torque test) of all earthing and cable
connections (MEN, Bushings and tank) and inspect for
evidence of overheating of broken strands. Tighten
connections where necessary.
(d) Inspect transformer coils, core and frame, for evidence
of corrosion, dirt, or foreign material buildup.  Clean
coils , core and frame and treat and recoat any surface
rust spots.
3. Record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet, inspection
results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new
Job Sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative.  Include in the Releated Job
field of the new and this job, the job number of the
alternate Job.   [_ _]

03 M Inspection of Thytec UPS system in WL TSH's
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
3. Refer to Manual: Thytec 30KVA UPS 12 Pulse
[ M-MCL-ME20000/20011 ] Manual.
4. Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
charged ) record results in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
5. At By-pass Switch (Wall Mounted)
(a) Press the TRANSFER button, on the UPS control panel, to
transfer the UPS  to the by-pass mode.
(b) Wait until the amber By-Pass led is illuminated.
(c) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet,
to the OFF position, to isolate the batteries.
(d) Press the OFF button, on the UPS control panel,  to
switch OFF the UPS unit.
(e) Switch the EXTERNAL BY-PASS switch (wall mounted above
UPS) to the BY-PASS position.  The UPS unit is now
by-passed.
WARNING: DO NOT USE THE INTERNAL BY-PASS SWITCH, AS THIS
SWITCH IS NOT INTERLOCKED.
(f) Switch the EXTERNAL by-pass switch to the NORMAL
position.
(g) Press the ON button, on the UPS control panel.  An UPS
start is initiated.
(h) Wait for INV. ON green led to illuminate.
(i) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet,
to the ON position to connect the batteries to the UPS.
(j) After about 30 secconds the BYPASS led will go OFF and
the INVERTER led will illuminate, indicating the load is
on the inverter.  A noticeable change in the operating
noise of the UPS will also indicate the change of load.
6. UPS Unit.
(a) Do not operate the EMERGENCY STOP push button, on the
front of the UPS Panel, unless in extreme emergency, as
damage to the UPS electrical equipment can occur.
(b) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.
[_ _]
(c) Remove the air filter, clean and re-install, ( replace
air filter if necessary )   [_ _]
(d) Check for air flow above grills on top of the panel.
( with fan in operation )   [_ _]
(e) Visual Inspection of capacitors for any oil leaks.  [_ _]
(f) Switch OFF the ""MAIN UPS"" electrical supply.  The load
should then transfer to the UPS, supplying from the
batteries.
(g) Check and monitor, on the UPS display, the load current
(max. 42A per phase 30kVA UPS or max 55A per phase 40kVA
UPS).
(h) Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
discharged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
(i) Leave the UPS supply the load for at least ten minutes.
(j) Switch the Normal electricity supply isolator to the ON
position.  The load will revert to the Normal power
supply.
7. Battery Panel.
(a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
Batteries.
(b) Ensure the Circuit Breaker operating handle, on Panel
Door, is in the upright position and is not tripped.
[_ _]
(c) Measure and record the overall charge voltage across the
CB ( nominally 270V. )    [_ _]
8. Record any result outside normal parameters, in the "" Work
Done "" area of the job sheet.
9.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
10.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
"

03 M Inspect of ERE16 & RRB03 Liebert AC units in Sub 3 Bldg
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Access to the air conditioners within equipment room ERE16
and RRB03, is via an external door situated on the Burnley
Tunnel walkway 20 metres west of Burnley Portal.
Access to the condensers is via external doors, on south side
of Bldg, into substation 3B.
3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne City
Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
vibration.   [_ _]
4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
setting.   [_ _]
b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
the following steps
(i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
displayed)
(ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
(iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
setting.
(iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
(v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
(vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that
temperature shown on unit  is consistent with new
setpoint and verify temperature is consistent with
ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
c. Repeat above steps to restore the setpoint to the
original setting.   [_ _]
d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
point is reached and verify that the temperature is
consistent with ambient using the portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary.   Filter type
Liebert size 650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm drain line
clear.   [_ _]
4.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
5. ACC Condenser Unit
5.1. Inspect the condensor unit and check for undue cycling
operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local isolating
switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the fan isolator.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
Unit.   [_ _]
6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
will collect dust deposits.   [___]
6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
Clear any blockages.
6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
7.0 Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record the
results on form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347.
Ensure the form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347
is returned to the Electrical / Electronics Supervisor or
his representative.  Raise a new jobsheet for any
outstanding works.
8.0 On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done  section of the job sheet and
report to the Team Leader or his representative and raise a
new job for any repairs.
9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

03 M Inspect of Liebert AC units accessed via the EE Tunnel.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.   [_ _]
2. Access is via the Emergency Egress Tunnel from the entry
adjacent to the Burnley Vent Station stack.
(a) Arrange for the control room to start Supply Air fan
ESFP01. ESFP01 is the Supply Air for the Emergency Egress
Tunnel.
(b) Arrange for the control room to switch on the Emergency
Egress Tunnel lighting prior to entering the tunnel.
3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne City
Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
vibration.   [_ _]
4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
setting.   [_ _]
b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
the following steps
(i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
displayed)
(ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
(iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
setting.
(iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
(v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
(vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that temperature
shown on unit is consistent with new setpoint and
verify temperature is consistent with ambient
(+ or - 1 deg) using portable  thermometer.   [_ _]
c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
original setting.   [_ _]
d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
point is reached and verify that the temperature is
consistent with ambient using the portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary.  Filter type
Liebert size 650x590x75 mm
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
is clear.
4.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.
5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local fan isolating
switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local fan isolator.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
Unit.   [_ _]
6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
will collect dust deposits.   [___]
6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage
problems.  Clear any blockages.
6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and
rubbish.   [_ _]
7.0 Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record the
results on form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347.
Ensure the form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347
is returned to the Electrical Electronics Supervisor or his
representative.  Raise a new job for any outstanding works.
8.0 On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters  in the Work Done section of the job sheet and
report to the Supervisor or his representative and raise a
new job for any outstanding  repairs.
9.0 Notify the control room on completion of the job and arrange
for the control room to switch off the emergeny egress
tunnel lighting as well as the supply air fan.

04 M Insp/cln of  SL CCTV cams, EWP, BT & DT RHS lane
Perform this job at the same time as the AIDs cameras in RHS
lane of the tunnel.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Work shall be carried out in designated times approved by
the TCR.
2. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the RHL lane
3. Access to this camera group is:
(a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
(b) Position 0 and 1.
(c) Lane Closure:RHL lane.
(d) Electrical Cabinet Location: Above LHS
4. Set up the lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink  Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 22, 23, 25.
5. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,
Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
6. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
(a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
necessary.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
(c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,
re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
(d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
fastened to the PT300.
WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
(e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if
not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]
(f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
(Connect the WFM90 directly to the lead from the camera).
Ensure the co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
module and is secure.  [_ _]
7. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
(unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
of the PTZ .  [_ _]
8. Camera and Camera Housing;
WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
ALIVE.
(a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface insect
spray may be applied if necessary to the housing exterior
but must not be applied to the interior of the housing or
to the housing glass.  If ingress of moisture or insect
infestation is evident then carry out steps (d)
and (e).  [_ _]
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
mounts. [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
Rain-X  cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm.
WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.
If the heaters are not warm, spray the heater thermostat
(HTR) with FREEZE IT, then again check the operation of
the heater. [_ _]
(e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
9. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
controller.  [_ _]
10. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait
2 minutes then check again.  [_ _]
11. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
attention of the Team Leader Electrical or his
representative.
12. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
ASSET CONDITION RATING
Rate the Condition of the Asset.
Note:
[ 1 ] - Excellent.
Asset is new or in as new condition
[ 2 ] - Good.
Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing
it's intended function.
[ 3 ] - Fair.
Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
deterioration that will result is some intervention
works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
performing it's intended function to the full degree.
[ 4 ] - Poor.
Asset is functional and operational but showing major
signs of deterioration that will require intervention
works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
intended function.
CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations
in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

12 M Joint Leakage Drain Inspections & Cleaning
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction Traffic
Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
Plans 21, 22, 23, 24, 25, 26.
In the work done area record:
a. Any deviations from the plan.
b. Lane closure start time.
c. Lane closure finish time.
d. Weather conditions.
3. Joint Leakage Drains (JLD) are located on the outside of the
left and right hand lanes of the tanked section of the
Burnley Tunnel.
4. Inspect JLDrains for water flow, blockages, deposits and
conditions.  Record the details for each drain on form
Burnley Tunnel Joint Leakage Drain  TMF-3012-OP-0275.
5. The JLD's are inspected via an inspection point which is a
square Gatic plate with a hinged lid. This lid is held secure
in position by a Philips head screw.
6. Access both ends of drain by unscrewing covers in both the
LHL and the RHL.
(a) To inspect the drain sets, shine the torch down one open
cover, then at the corresponding open cover, using the
extendable mirror, look for the lighted torch.
(b) Record the condition of the pipe e.g. the cleanliness
and / or blockage of the drain on form Burnley Tunnel
Joint Leakage Drain  TMF-3012-OP-0275.
(c) Record the condition of each drain e.g. buildup of
calcite, slime, silt etc and whether or not there is a
flow of water present.
**Use Condition Words :  WET,  DRY,  CLEAR, OBSTRUCTED and
if obstructed record the action that was taken to clear
the obstruction ( ie:  hydrant flushed or Jet flushed).
7. If there is water flow present, then at the dirty water pit,
inspect the Dirty Water pit where the flow enters (If it does
enter into a pit).  Measure and record the flow and elapsed
time for on form Burnley Tunnel Joint Leakage Drain
TMF-3012-OP-0275.
8. Record all details on the inspection sheet, as all the
information is important.
9. Ensure all the pit covers and Gatic covers are closed and
secured on completion of each inspection.
10. Ensure a completed copy of the form Burnley Tunnel Joint
Leakage Drain TMF-3012-OP-0275. are forwarded to  the Civil
Team Leader or representative on completion of the job and
prior to end of shift.  Civil Team Leader or representative
is to record and sign off each form and raise any actions
(job sheets) for further inspection or cleaning

07 W Inspect LHS spoon drain
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this Job.
2. Refer to TMI-3012-OP-0025 Domain Tunnel Drainage
3. Lane closures to access the Domain Tunnel shall be as per
Work Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and
Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 21, 24, 26.
4. Inspect spoon drain along the LHS new Jersey Barrier for
debris, accumulated silt and or foreign materials that may
cause damming or blockages.  Remove any loose items
that may cause problems in the drainage system.

materials liable to cause blockages.  Remove all material
from transition point.
6. Inspect the Edge Pavement Drain (cut into road pavement) for
debris and blockages, remove any loose debris from within the
drain.
7. Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet any outstanding
works requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new job
sheet for these works.
8. Record results on form TMF-3012-OP-0270 - DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAIN
INSPECTION
9. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the job.
10. Ensure the completed form TMF-3012-OP-0270 DOMAIN TUNNEL
DRAIN INSPECTION is forwarded to the Civil Team or his
representative on completion of the job.

01 M Inspection & test running of the WL TSH generators
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
Supply to ensure it is operating in the normal
standby-back-up mode.   [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
MODE.
4. Refer to reference manual Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
5.   (a) Check that the generator was left in  "AUTO" [_ _]
(b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuel and water.   [_ _]
(c) Check oil level.   [_ _]
(d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
(e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).   [_ _]
(f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts   [_ _]
(g) Record the battery voltage in the "Work Done" area
of the job sheet. [_ _]
(h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
Physically open the cap, as the gauge could be
misleading.  [_ _]
(j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours
with the last entry.  [_ _]
6. Reference manual, Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP
Electrical Pty Ltd Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI
[M-MCL-ME-20016]
7.  (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch on the generator
DC panel to "" RUN "" let the engine run for at least 5
minutes, then turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch
back to "" AUTO ""
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from "" AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" to ""EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST
"" run the generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared,
and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
[_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure,
water temperature.   [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back
to " AUTOMATIC CONTROL" the generator will continue to
run for about 8 minutes before stopping.   [_ _]
(g) Record the hours run, from the hours run meter,  in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet.
8.  (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
9. Fill in the Generator Log Book and record anything outside
normal parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job
sheet.  Raise a new job for any works requiring further
repairs.  Priority High P1.
10.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
11.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
12.Record the Hours run in Mainpac under "Plant" use RH mouse
click then select "Open"      then select "Meter
Readings" in edit mode add the Meter Reading for the
appropriate TSH Generator.
"

JFE35 - Common Trip
TCR called me about common trip alarmon JFE35. When i got to ERE15 found
the fan in fault. I reset the fault but it returned immediately. I
logged on to protection device and scrolled through settings and found
one setting had changed from normal set up. I corrected this and asked
TCR to start and stop fan as the fan went into fault when TCR "stopped"
the fan. After tcr started and stopped the fan twice i left site.

01 M Inspection of  Grant St. Vent Station Axial Fans
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Works to be carried out between 21:00 & 05:00. Three day notice of
pending works to
be given verbally to TLO Maintenance Manager.
2. Obtain the Permit to Work for entry to the ventilation rooms and to
interrupt  operations.
TLO Maintenance Manager to sign Work Permit and works to be carried
only within times
approved on the Work Permit.
3. Inform the control room prior to commencing the work and brief
TCRO'son interruptions
and expected alarms.
4. Reference Manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance
Instructions Manual
(M-STG-VE-26059).
5. At the PMCS in the control room
(a) Check the motor balance vibration reading on the PMCS for all
fans.  If any  reading is in
excess of 6.5mm/s record the result in the ""Work Done"" area
of the job sheet  for further
action.    [_ _]
(b) Check the trend log for the last month, looking for abnormal
events. Record any
abnormalities in the"" Work Done"" area of Job Sheet.  Report
any events and or trends to
the Maintenance Superintendent  that may suggest some abnormal
function.  [_ _]
(c) Check  the running current and record in the ""Work Done"" area
if greater than
FLC 349A for further action.[__]
(d) Check the drive and non drive end bearing temperatures for the
operating fan motor.
Record the details for those bearings with a temperature
greater than 80°C in  the
""Work Done"" area of the job sheet  for further action.  [_ _]
(e) Check the CO levels in the tunnels and the Grant Street Stack on
PMCS screen in the
control room and ensure less than 30ppm prior to commencing
work.  [_ _]
6. Access to the Grant St ventilation station, on the mezzanine level,
is via the Grant St.
stairwell adjacent to the vent stack.  Access to substation 1 is
through the mezzanine
level walkway, north of the smoke duct, then crossing over the smoke
duct twice using
the service ladders to the roof of the substation, then down a
serviceladder  to the tunnel
and then along the tunnel walkway to the substation.
WARNINGS:
DO NOT CARRY OUT THESE CHECKS  WHENEVER THERE ARE MORE THAN 2 FANS
ARE OPERATIONAL.
DO NOT ENTER THE AIRLOCK TO THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM ALONE. TWO OR
MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT WHENEVER ANY  WORK  IS CARRIED OUT IN
THIS AREA.  OBSERVE ALL NOTICES ON THE AIRLOCK DOORS
DO NOT ENTER A SMOKE DUCT UNLESS A PERMIT HAS BEEN OBTAINED FOR
WORK  IN THIS AREA.  TO CROSS THE DUCT A SERVICE LADDER MUST BE USED
AT ALL TIMES
7. Prior to entering the Grant St Stairwell, contact the TCR and requestthey
select manual
control for all Grant St fans and to lock in fan EFW 01 for
continuing operation.
(NOTE: There must be at least one fan operation at all times).
8. Fan Chamber  Access
(a) Enter the fan room airlock from the mezzanine floor, not the
smoke duct.  To open the
airlock doors will require considerable force.  Equalise
thepressure in the air lock
and the fan room using the hatches in the wall before
entering the fan room.   [_ _]
WARNING:
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN, WHEN YOU ARE IN THE FAN
CHAMBER.
DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF THE BODY OR MATERIALS WITHIN 1  METRE OF AN
OPERATING FAN INLET GUARD,  AS THE AIR IS FLOWING AT APPROX  35 kph
9. Work plan for fan EFW 02.
9.1 Fan Room Static Checks
(a) Engage the EMERGENCY STOP button adjacent to the motor.  [_ _]
(b) Check the condition of anti-vibration mountings and ensure
that the rubber bushing
is moved freely, adjust if required.  [_ _]
(c) Examine the grease that has been discharged from motor
bearings for any noticeable
colour change.   [_ _]
(d) Open local electrical junction box e.g. : 1A EFW 02 JB-2
Inspect electrical wiring and
connections, inspect all glands for tightness.  [_ _]
(e) Visually inspect the motor for evidence of condensation, white
powder or similar.
Record in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet any
evidence of condensation,
powder and the like and notify the Team Leader or his
representative.  [_ _]
(f) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and
heater windings.
(i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
(ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor
Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has been
isolated and is to remain
isolated.
(a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
(where connected) and
bridge heater terminals.
(b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
terminals.
(iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the
motorwindings and the
winding heater bridge.  Record the result in the ""Work
Done"" area.
(iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
connections and carry out
an Insulation resistance test between this common bridge
and earth.  Record
the result in the ""Work Done"" area.
(v) Remove all temporary connections.
(vi) If the heater was connected on arrival, then re-instate
theheater connections,
otherwise leave the motor winding heater terminations
isolated.
(vii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
(viii) Where any insulation resistance reading is less than 2
megohm, then Record
in the ""Work Done""area of the Job Sheet and raise a
new job for the outstanding
works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
""Related Job"" field as well
as in the alternate.  Notify the Team Leader or his
representative of any
outstanding works.
9.2 Running Checks.
(a) Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton and contact the TCR to
start the
fan.  [_ _]
(b) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan starts.
[_  _]
(c) Check the fan for abnormal noise.    [_ _]
(d) Check the flexible connections for wear and leakage.    [_ _]
(e) Check the anti-vibration mountings for operation and
structural soundness.    [_ _]
(f ) Check the operation of the local monitor.    [_ _]
(g) Record any abnormalities in the ""'Work Done"" area of Job
Sheet for further
action.    [_ _]
(h) Shutdown the fan motor using the Local EMERGENCY STOP
pushbutton.
(f  ) Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
9.3 Running Fan Check and Lubrication
CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
REQUIRED
AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
(a) On completion of  the Static Fan Checks, return to
substation1, then remove the
safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then remove
the fan motor isolation
at  the MCC.
Note:  Ensure that only one non-operational fan is isolated at
any one time.
(b) Switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF position
to the MANUAL and
the  REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch from the REMOTE position
to the LOCAL
position.
(c) Return to the ventilation room; there start the fan, that is
being maintained,  by                     releasing the lo cal STOP
pushbutton at the fan and then pressing START pushbutton.
(d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan
starts.
(e) Add Shell Stamina RL2 grease or equivalent, to the bearings,
only while the fan is
running.  Ten pumps per bearing.
(f ) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the
bearings, using the retrieval
system.  Examine the grease for changes of colour.   [_ _]
(g) Check the fan for any abnormal noises or vibrations.     [_
_]
(h) Shutdown the fan motor using the local EMERGENCY STOP
pushbutton.
(i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
10. Repeat step 9  for fan EFW 03.   [_ _]
11. Repeat step 9  for fan EFW 04.   [_ _]
12. Repeat step 9  for fan EFW 05.   [_ _]
14. Contact the TCR and request they start fan EFW 05.  [_ _]
13. Repeat step 9 for fan EFW 01.   [_ _]
15. (a) Ensure all EMERGENCY STOP pushbuttons are disengaged.    [_ _]
(b) Collect all tools and materials, leave the fan room, again
equalise the corridor and the
fan room pressures.  [_ _]
16. At Sub 1, inspect the fan starter cabinet for loose connections, hot
connections, accumulated
debris and any abnormal conditions.  [_ _]
17. Repeat step 16 for fan EFW 02.   [_ _]
18. Repeat step 16 for fan EFW 03.   [_ _]
19. Repeat step 16 for fan EFW 04.   [_ _]
20. Contact the TCR and request the TCR to start an additional fan from
EFW 01 to
EFW 04.  [_ _]
21. Once the additional fan has started, request the TCR to stop EFW 05.
[_ _]
22. Repeat step 16 for fan EFW 05.   [_ _]
23. (a) Check the lighting within the fan chamber for operation.  [_ _]
(b) Repair any light found to be not operating or raise a new
jobsheet for the repair of
the fan chamber lighting.
24. Notify the control room on completion of the work and advise that
the fan control has been
returned to the TCR and that automatic operation can be resumed.
[_ _]
25.  Return to control room and ensure all fans are operational.
EMERGENCY OPERATION
In the event of notification by TCR Operators that a tunnel incident hasoccurred
requiring the
use of fans for smoke extraction.
1. Ensure all emergency stop buttons are released and that all fans are
available for
operation.  [_ _]
2. Advise the TCR of any abnormal condition that will restrict
operationof any fan.  [_ _]
3. Vacate the ventilation fan chamber immediately, ensuring the sliding
door to the airlock is
closed and sealed.   [_ _]
4. Advise the traffic control room when all personnel are clear of the
air lock.
On completion of the job, the ""Hours Run"" detail, for each fan is to
be entered into the
hours run table of each Fan Item.  Select the Plant Item,  then right
mouse click, select
""Open"" and then select  ""Meter Readings"".  Select edit mode and
enter data.

12 M Minor inspection of the ADS
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

and controller.

(a) ADS 23, ADS24 & ADS 25 - Accessible by ladder from

roundabout.

06 M Inspection of shared pathway sump pits & pumps
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate keys and access bollard padlock keys
are  required..
2. Provide signs warning the public of restricted pathway
access.
3. WARNING:  POSSIBLE SHARPS HAZARDS EXISTS.  Refer Work
Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0005.
4. Inspection and Cleaning of  the Bath Tub.
(a) Be aware that sump pits could constitute a confined space
and appropriate safety measures should be taken.
(b) Clean out the bath tub and remove all silt, rubbish and
debris.
(d) Check the pump outlet pipe is not blocked (clear blockage
if necessary).
5. Inspect the Pump Pit
(a) Electrically isolate the pump prior to its removal from
the sump.
(b) Clean out the pump pit and grate, remove all silt,
rubbish and debris.
6. Inspect Sump Pump
(a) Check that the visible parts of the pump e.g. lead,
enclosure, outlet pipe connection are in good condition.
(b) Check that the impellor can move freely.
(c) On completion of the check reinstate power supply to the
pump.
7. Inspect Pump Local Control Panel
(a) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of
control panel for damage, evidence of insect infestation,
ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as required).
(b) Check cable connections for tightness and signs of
overheating and inspect electrical contral equipment.
(c) Check for correct operation of level switch and alarm
light (Flashing Amber).
8. Record any corrective action required, in the "Work Done"
area of the job sheet.

each calibration vehicle.

Calibration TMF-3012-OP-0361 and  Weigh in Motion
Calibration TMF-OP-3012-0362.  A copy of the results are to
forwarded to the Electrical Electronics Team Leader on

01 W Mon, m'sure & report  YC pump stn flows"
The measure of  water flowing from the Yarra Crossing pump
station is a measure of all the water collected in the Domain
tunnel drainage systems, from both dirty and clean water
sources.
Note: NEW CHANGES TO ITEM 4
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, DOMAIN TUNNEL
DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0025.
3. The Civil Team Leader is to provide a copy of the previous
DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOW TMF-3012-OP-0203 for details of
the previous readings.
4. Record the Time and the Total Flow at Magflow 1 (in K.litres)
and the Total Flow at Magflow 2 (in m3) for the pump station,
on form  DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0203.
5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
6. Ensure a copy of the form  DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0203 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
evaluation on completion of the job.
Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
in excess of 0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
job to investigate to check the various bay flows for
the reason to the change in water flowrate.

12 M Routine Maint. of Swan St  Vent Station Fans
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
WARNING:
1.    CHECKS SHOULD NOT BE CARRIED OUT IF MORE THAN 1 FAN IS OPERATING
IN THE
SWAN ST SHAFT VENT STATION.
2.    NO PERSON SHALL ENTER THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM ALONE.
TWO OR MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT AT ALL TIMES WHEN WORK IS BEING
CARRIED OUT IN ANY CHAMBER OF THE VENT STATION
3.    TAKE HEED OF NOTICES ON THE AIRLOCK DOORS.
1. Obtain a Permit to Work for entry to substation 2,  the Swan Street
ventilation rooms and to
interrupt operations.
2.  Inform the control room prior to commencing work.   Maintain radio
contact at all times.
3.  Reference manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance
Instructions Manual
(M-STG-VE-26058)
4. Carry out the monthly checks on the PMCS in the Traffic Control Room.
5. Access to the ventilation fan is via ladders in the Swan Street Shaftlift
well and Substation 2
is accessed from Swan Street.
6.(a) On the MCC in Substation No 2,  select ONE axial fan to be
operational while
the maintenance is being carried out  on other fans.  Switch
the nominated
AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch to the MANUAL position and the
REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL
selector switch to the REMOTE postion, then press the START
pushbutton.
(b) Switch ALL non-operational axial fans OFF, by switching the
AUTO/OFF/MAN selector
switches to the OFF position.  All electrical isolation
procedures are to be in
accordance to Work Instruction TMI -3012-SA -0103,  Low
VoltageIsolation Procedures.
7. In Substation No 2
(a) Measure the insulation resistance of the motor stator windings
and record in the ""Work
Done"" section of the Job Sheet.   [_ _]
(b) Measure the current of the anti-condensation heater and compare
with the rated current.
(c) Inspect the motor control panel both internally and externally
for damage, corrosion,
evidence of overheating,  ingress of moisture, dust and grime
(clean or repair if required).
8. (a) The fan rooms which are on levels 4, 5 & 6 are accessed from the
Note: HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN IN ANY
VENTILATION
FAN CHAMBER.
(b) Measure the CO levels in the fan rooms, through the doorway,
prior to entering the fan
room, then at regular intervals during the fan checks.
(c)  WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF THE BODY OR MATERIALS WITHIN
1 METRE OF AN OPERATING FAN INLET GUARD.
Airflow velocity nears 35 km/h.
9. Static Fan Check.
(a) Ensure that the fan selected for maintenance is electrically
isolated,  press the START
pushbutton on the local push button station at Level 5.  The
fan should not start.
(b) On level 5 open fan blade inspection hatch.
(c) Examine the impeller for
(i) Dirt and foreign matter on the blades (clean if required)
[_ _]
(ii) Wear or damage on the blade tips   [_ _]
(ii) Wear or damage on the blade leading edges   [_ _]
(iv) Loose bolts and or blade fixings at the hub   [_ _]
(d) Examine the electrical cable for security of fixings, damage dueto
fraying, scuffing or
similar and for damage at locations where the cables
penetratepanels or
housings.    [_ _]
(e) Check any grease discharged from the motor bearings, since the
last lubrication is not
excessive.   [_ _]
(f ) Examine the discharged grease for any noticable colour change.
Ensure that the grease
nipples are clean.  [_ _]
(g)  Inspect the cable connections to the motor for evidence of
overheating.  [_ _]
(h) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and heater
windings.
(i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
(ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor
Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has been
isolated and is to remain
isolated.
(a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
(where connected) and
bridge heater terminals.
(b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
terminals.
(iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the
motorwindings and the
winding heater bridge.  Record the result in the ""Work
Done"" area.
(iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
connections and carry out
an Insulation resistance test between this common bridge
and earth.  Record
the result in the ""Work Done"" area.
(v) Remove all temporary connections.
(vi) Remove supply lines to the motor and carry out an
insulation resistance test
on the motor windings, Between phase winding to phase
winding and between
each phase winding and earth.  Record results in the Work
Done area of the
Job sheet.
(vii) If the heater was connected on arrival, then re-instate
the heater connections,
otherwise leave the motor winding heater terminations
isolated.
(viii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
(x)  Where any insulation resistance reading is less than 2
megohm, then Record
in the ""Work Done""area of the Job Sheet and raise a
new job for the outstanding
works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
""Related Job"" field as well
as in the alternate.  Notify the Team Leader or his
representative of any
outstanding works.
(i) On leaving the fan inlet cowl grill hatch, replace the hatch
cover immediately.  [_ _]
(j)  Manually check the operation of the Rotork actuator and
associated linkages that
operate the exit dampers, use the local control panel switch.
(k ) Remove any mechanical interlocks blocking the fan operation.
[_ _]
10. Running Fan Check and Lubrication
CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
REQUIRED
AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
(a) When the Static Fan Checks are complete, return to substation
3and remove the
safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then removethe
fan motor isolation
at the MCC.
Note:  Ensure that all non-operational fans are isolated, in
accordance
TMI-3012-SA-0103, and that the only fan not
isolated, is the fan to be maintained.
(b) Switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF position
to the MANUAL
position, then switch the REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch
from the REMOTE
position to the LOCAL position.
(c) Return to the ventilation room and start the fan, that is
beingmaintained, by releasing
the Local STOP pushbutton, then pressing the START
pushbutton.
Note: The motor must not be started more that four times in
an hour.
(d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan starts.
(e) Lubricate the motor bearings with fresh grease, while the motor
running.
DE = 100 gr / NDE - 120 gr  Use Shell Stamina RL2 grease or
equivalent only.
(f ) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the bearings
using the retrieval
system.  Examine the grease for changes of colour.  [_ _]
(g) Monitor the fan and motor for abnormal noises.      [_ _]
(h) Stop the fan motor using Local EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
(i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
11. On completion, collect all materials and leave the fan room after
equalizing the
differential pressures.
12. In Substation No 2
(a) Remove all safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103,
then remove the
motor isolation for all the fans at the MCC.  Return all
theREMOTE/OFF/LOCAL
selector switches to the REMOTE position,  and the
AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector
switches to the AUTO position.
(b) Check that one fan is operational and no alarms are present
13. Record anything outside normal parameters in the 'Work Done' sectionof
the Job Sheet.
14. Notify the control room on the completion of the job.
EMERGENCY OPERATION
In the event of notification by TCR Operators that a tunnel incident
hasoccured requiring the
use of fans for smoke extraction.
1. Immediately leave the fan chambers on Level 4 and Level 6 and ensure
the doors to the lift
shaft are secured.
2. Notify TCR Operator when Level 4 and level 6 have been evacuated so
that smoke
extraction can commence.
3. If  the fan being checked is running, advise TCR that it is
currentlyrunning under LOCAL
control and will be returned to AUTO control.  Stop  the fan using
the Emergency STOP
pushbutton on Level 5.
4. Release the STOP pushbutton and leave Level 5 ensuring that the door
to the lift shaft is
secured
5. If the fan is isolated or not running, vacate all fan chambers
immediately and secure doors.
6. Notify TCR when all personnel have left the fan chambers, the doors
secured and all the
personnel are accounted for and in the lift shaft.
7. Only if a fan was running and operational - In Substation 2  switch
the
REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to the REMOTE position, as well
switch the
AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch to the AUTO position.
8. Stop the operational fan then return the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector
switchto the AUTO
position and restart the fan.
9. Notify TCR Operators that they have control.

phase to phase

o earth

12 M Inspection of Cast Resin HV Transformers
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
All work on High Voltage equipment must be carried out in
accordance with Transfield's procedure number TMI-3012-SA-0102
High Voltage Safety Work Instructions.
1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2. (Cast Resin Dry Type Transformers 1A, 1B, 2A,2B, 3A, 3B, 4A,
4B, 5A & 5B)
The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to
be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
leader or his representative.
(a) Examine and clean all bushings, insulators, terminals,
cable connections, for partial discharge, ingress of
moisture or damage.
(b) Inspect Operation of the Winding temperature sensor.
Carry out functional testing to ensure correct Alarming
and trip operation via the PMCS to the Traffic Control
Room.
(c) Check tightness (Torque test) of all earthing and cable
connections (MEN, Bushings and tank) and inspect for
evidence of overheating of broken strands. Tighten
connections where necessary.
(d) Inspect transformer coils, core and frame, for evidence
of corrosion, dirt, or foreign material buildup.  Clean
coils , core and frame and treat and recoat any surface
rust spots.
3. Record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet, inspection
results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new
Job Sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative.  Include in the Releated Job
field of the new and this job, the job number of the
alternate Job.   [_ _]

on the HV terminal and the tapping link bars

M14                  58.8Nm

for the LV bars (Both Nut and Bolts).

M14                 68.6Nm
M16                 98.0Nm

01 M Inspection & test running of the WL TSH generators
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
Supply to ensure it is operating in the normal
standby-back-up mode.   [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
MODE.
4. Refer to reference manual Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
5.   (a) Check that the generator was left in  "AUTO" [_ _]
(b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuel and water.   [_ _]
(c) Check oil level.   [_ _]
(d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
(e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).   [_ _]
(f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts   [_ _]
(g) Record the battery voltage in the "Work Done" area
of the job sheet. [_ _]
(h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
Physically open the cap, as the gauge could be
misleading.  [_ _]
(j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours
with the last entry.  [_ _]
6. Reference manual, Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP
Electrical Pty Ltd Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI
[M-MCL-ME-20016]
7.  (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch on the generator
DC panel to "" RUN "" let the engine run for at least 5
minutes, then turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch
back to "" AUTO ""
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from "" AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" to ""EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST
"" run the generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared,
and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
[_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure,
water temperature.   [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back
to " AUTOMATIC CONTROL" the generator will continue to
run for about 8 minutes before stopping.   [_ _]
(g) Record the hours run, from the hours run meter,  in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet.
8.  (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
9. Fill in the Generator Log Book and record anything outside
normal parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job
sheet.  Raise a new job for any works requiring further
repairs.  Priority High P1.
10.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
11.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
12.Record the Hours run in Mainpac under "Plant" use RH mouse
click then select "Open"      then select "Meter
Readings" in edit mode add the Meter Reading for the
appropriate TSH Generator.
"

06 M Jet Fan maintenance and lubrication.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1.  Works to be carried out on one jet fan at a time so as to
not affect the operation of total tunnel ventilation
2.  Notify control room prior to commencing work.
3.  Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002
and Translink Operations Procedure PR-RS-OP-IR-020 Plan 27
or 28.
4.  Reference Manual;  Witt & Sohn, Operations and Maintenance
Manual , Certificate 18. (M-STG-VE-29047 )
5.  In associated equipment room switch jet fan AUTO/OFF/MAN
selector switch to MAN and REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL switch to LOCAL
to enable control adjacent to jet fan.  [_ _]
6.  Running visual inspection
WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF BODY IN INLET OR OUTLET
AIR STREAM WHEN FAN IS RUNNING.
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN.
(a) Start fan locally by pressing the START button on the
panel adjacent to the fan.   [_ _]
(b) Check for any abnormal noise or movement from the
fan.  [_ _]
(c) Check the fan unit vibration mountings and safety rods
for loose nuts and bolts.  [_ _]
(d) Stop fan locally with the EMERGENCY STOP button.  [_ _]
(e) If any non-conforming items are found, investigate
further in the static fan inspection.  [_ _]
7.  Static fan inspection
(a) Ensure the local  EMERGENCY STOP button is engaged. [_ _]
(b) Conduct a thorough visual inspection for damage and
corrosion of the silencers, impeller, inlet cone, cable
connections, mounting frame and vibration attenuators.
Any cracks identified in the vicinity must be noted in
the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _] Photo of Cracks found
will be required.
Any damage, especially to surface protection, must be
noted in the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _]
(c) Carry out careful inspection of all supporting hardware
and screw connections, including the eight vibration bracket
installations and the four safety rod brackets.  Using a
torque wrench, ensure that the accessible supporting screw
connections are secured and fixed with the correct torque
settings.  [_ _]
NOTE: Torque Settings
M10 = 37Nm
M12 = 65Nm
M16 = 150Nm
M20 = 300Nm      as per reference manual
in step 4
Bolts with Nylon washers should only be checked for
tightness. Do not torque as nylon washer get damaged
Do not torque anchor bolts in tunnel roof. Check for
tightness only.
(d) If any non-conforming items are found, record in the
"Work Done" area of the job sheet and rectify immediately
where possible to the requirements of the Witt & Sohn <(>,<)>
Operations and Maintenance Manual , Certificate 18.
(M-STG-VE-29047).   This inspection is carried out
externally via the inlet and exhaust ends using a
torch.  [_ _]
(e) Remove cover to motor junction box and check the cable
connections visually for tightness and evidence of
overheating.
8.  Lubrication
(a) Release the key operated EMERGENCY STOP button, restart
fan  locally.
(b) Regrease bearings using grease gun on nipples onside of
fan with  Mobilith SHC220 (TF000021) grease, 10 pumps of
hand grease gun per grease nipple.
Note:  Lubrication should be carried out between 3,000
and 4,000 hours running time when access is available.
Do not over grease.    [_ _]
(c) Stop fan using local EMERGENCY STOP button
(d) Release the EMERGENCY STOP button using a Key.  (Remove
the key)   [_ _]
9.  Equipment Room Control Panel.
(a) Switch fan REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to REMOTE to
enable control at panel
(b) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of the
control panel for damage evidence of insect infestation<(>,<)>
ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as
required).  [_ _]
(c) Check cable connections visually for tightness and signs
of overheating and inspect electrical control
equipment [_ _]
(d) Start fan with START pushbutton on panel and leave
running for approximately 5 minutes
(e) Check ammeter at electrical panel to verify fan is
operating within current limits FLC 100A.  [_ _]
(f ) Using an infra red thermometer check the temperature of
the connections and power cables to the motor.   Record in
the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet if the temperature
recorded is more that 10º to 15º C above ambient.   [_ _]
(g) Record the "hours run" from the Jet Fan hour run meter
on the panel door in the "Work Done"" area of the job
sheet.   [_ _]
Note:  Hour run meters are on the control panels for
non-reversing fans only.
Reversing fans hour run readings are obtainable
from the PMCS screens in the control room
10. Return the LOCAL/OFF/REMOTE switch to the OFF position and
the AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector switch to the AUTO
position.   [_ _]
11. Advise the Traffic control room operator that control of the
fan is returned to the control room.    [_ _]
12. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable<(>,<)>
Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework<(>,<)>
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and bring to the attention
of the Team Leader Electrical or his representative.
13. Notify control room on completion of work.
14. Enter the hours run for the jet fan into the Plant item
screen, then select the usage tab.

04 M Insp/cln of  SL CCTV cams, EWP, BT & DT LHL
Perform this job at the same time as the AIDs cameras in LHS of
the tunnel.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Work shall be carried out in designated times approved by the
TCR.
2. Notify the control room prior to stopping in LHL
3. Access to this camera group is:
(a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
(b) Position 0 and 1.
(c) Lane Closure: LHL
(d) Electrical Cabinet Location: Above LHL
4. Set up the lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink  Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 21, 24, 26.
5. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,
Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
6. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
(a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
necessary.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
(c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,
re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
(d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
fastened to the PT300.
WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
(e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if
not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]
(f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
(Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the camera).
Ensure the   co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
module and is secure.  [_ _]
7. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
(unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
of the PTZ .  [_ _]
8. Camera and Camera Housing;
WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
ALIVE.
(a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface insect
spray may be applied if necessary to the housing exterior
but must not be applied to the interior of the housing or
to the housing glass.  If ingress of moisture or insect
infestation is evident then carry out steps (d) and
(e).  [_ _]
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
mounts. [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
Rain-X cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm.
WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.  If
the heaters are not warm, spray the heater thermostat (HTR)
with FREEZE IT, then again check the operation of the
heater. [_ _]
(e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
9. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
controller.  [_ _]
10. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait
2 minutes then check again.  [_ _]
11. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
attention of the Team Leader Electrical or his
representative.
12. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.

03 M Inspection of the OHVD System
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Control room prior to accessing the OHVD
system,  [___]
2. Reference Manual is Securite & Signalisation Preventative
Maintenance ED/RH/TRAIN/04.  This manual or section can be
found in Alstom - VMS/ADS/LUS/OHVD Contract Manuals
M-MCL-TM-1569.
3. Set up lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12,13 & 14  [_ _]
4. Clean, inspect and check alignment of the OHVD Receivers and
Transmitters.   [_ _]
5. Check the operation of the detectors by breaking the detector
paths in the correct sequence.   The correct sequence is that
the two beams must be broken in the direction of the traffic
flow and the second beam must be broken within two seconds
of the first being broken.  Visually check that the sign
operates correctly and that the TCR receive an alarm  [___]
6. Inspect the cabinet at the height detector for damage and
corrosion and insect infestation.  [___]
7. Check the equipment within the cabinet for loose connections
and evidence of burnt components.  [_ _]
8. Clean the front panel and inspect the OHVD message sign for
damage & corrosion.  [_ _]
9. Inspect the cabinet and equipment within at the OHVD message
sign for damage, loose connections, evidence of burnt
components and insect infestation.  [_ _]
10. Check operation of the sign by pressing the test pushbutton
on the CD501 boards.   [___]
11. Check the local controller cabinet for any sign of damage &
corrosion.  [___]
12. Check the components in the local controller cabinet for
burnt components, insect infestation and loose
connections  [___]
13. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done section of the Job Sheet.  Raise
a new jobsheet for any corrective works that are
outstanding.
14. Notify the control room prior to leaving OHVD site.

01 W Mon, m'sure & report  Swan St pump stn flows
The measure of water flowing from the Swan Street pump station
is a measure of all the water collected in the Burnley Tunnel
drainage systems, from both dirty and Groundwater sources.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL
DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0031.
3. The Civil Team leader is to provide a copy of the previous
WEEKLY BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0233 for
detail of the previous readings.
4. At the Swan Street Pump Station Motor Control Centre, record
the Time and the Total flow in kilo litres for the pump
station on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233.
5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
6. Ensure a copy of the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
evaluation on completion  of the job.
Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
in excess of  0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
job to investigate to check the various bay flows for the
reason to the change in water flowrate.

03 M Inspection & test of the Standby elect supply
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering each technical
shelter.
3. Carry out this job on the UPS to exercise the system and
confirm UPS system operation.
4. Check the operational condition of the Technical Shelter 10
Uninterruptable Power Supply to ensure it is operating in the
normal standby-back-up mode and there are no alarms.  [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TEST IF THE UPS IS IN
THE BYPASS MODE.
5. Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP Electrical Pty Ltd
Main Switchboard O<(>&<)>M Manual Section PI [M-MCL-ME-20016]
(a) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from the "AUTOMATIC CONTROL" position to the "EMERGENCY
SUPPLY + TEST " position.  A changeover will occur and
the technical shelter load will be supplied from the
emergency power supply.  Operate the system in this
mode for 10 minutes.
(b) Measure the voltage and load current per phase.   [_ _]
(c) Using an optical thermometer, measure the temperature
of the terminals in the emergency power supply circuit.
Record in the Work Done any terminal whose temperature
increases unduly during this operation.   [_ _]
(d) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
back to the "AUTOMATIC CONTROL" position.  The
technical shelter load will revert to the main power
supply after a time delay has confirmed the normal
supply is healthy.   [_ _]
6. (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
7. Record anything outside normal parameters in the  Work Done
area of the job sheet.  Raise a new job sheet if there is
work requiring further attention.  Priority P1.
8. Fill in the Log Book in the Technical Shelter.
9. Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
Work completed as above work plan

03 M Maint of Gantry Tolling Equipment
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Carry out the three monthly planned maintenance defined in
the CML RSE Users Manual maintenance schedule, document no.
M-MCL-ET-1225.
2. Perimeter access gate at technical shelter key required.
3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment
and or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to safety
instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 "Working on Gantry Structures
4. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
5. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plan PL-MCL-ET-100001.
Preventative Maintenance No.0301
When carrying out the cleaning of VDC sensors (in 0301),
inspect the area around the connectors for evidence of
corrosion.
If corrosion is evident, then clean the area as described
below.
Where cleaning is to be also carried out, use extreme care
to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter any
connectors.
The Fibre Optic Connector is to be only removed on the
12 Monthly  Cycle (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
Prior to removing any connector or cover socket, clean
surface corrosion and deposits from around connectors,
socket covers and the surrounding surfaces use a tooth
brush to assist if necessary.
Remove the three socket covers (remove only if possible
using fingers) and apply a light spray of silicon to
the three (3) socket covers, replacing and exercising
the threads.
With all caps and plugs re-installed apply a light spray of
silicon to the area around the plugs and caps.
Check for silicon overspray on the VDC sensor window and
clean if necessary.
Where connectors or socket covers cannot be easily removed,
record details in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and
report the fact to the Team Leader or his representative.
0301: Check image quality and
,,,, alignment with CML Clean glass regardless of image.
,,,, Lubrication of mounting bracket carried out on removal
,,,, only.  Lightly spray with lubricant.
0302: Clean external glass of front and rear VR sensors.
Inspect mounting brackets and lubricate as required.
Ensure pins are cleaned and lubricated using silicon
spray prior to installing.
0303: Check VR Illuminator that there are less than 10%
defective IR LEDs,Advice CML if suspect below 10%
0304: Clean front surface of TRX, inspect mtg bracket and
lubricate as required
0305: Clean outside of glass cover of VDC, Replace failed
lamps, Lubricate arms as required.
Inspect VDC arm locating pins and chains. Record any
works required and report any equipment that needs
repair.
0306: Road Markers: Inspect for clarity & Cleanliness.( High ,,
,, contrast between marker & road). (If road markers need
to be changed, inform the Team Leader.)
0307: Clean the glass of VSS sensor
0308: Inspect Distribution Cabinet for loose or damaged   ,,
cables. Clean cabinet for insects or moisture.
6. Record in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet any
outstanding works requiring further attention.  Create a
new Job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative of the outstanding works.
Record the New job number in the "Work Done" area of this
job sheet and in the "Related Job" field of both jobs.
7. Notify Control Room prior to departing from the Technical
Shelter."

03 M Maint of the Variable Message Sign
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in emergency lane.
2. Access keys required for Sound Wall Gate, to access VMS 07.
Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,
TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059
Plan 12 or 13 (Short term and low traffic volume).  Vic Roads
approval required prior to doing job.
Access to VMS 6 is from the car park below the elevated road.
3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment and
or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to Safety
Instructions  TMI-3012-SA-0101, Working  on Gantry
Structures.
4. Arrange with the TCR for a Test Message to be displayed on
the VMS.  Monitor operation and repair as required.  Monitor
the LED Arrays and the Flashers for failed LEDS and
record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet if the failed
LEDs exceed 10% of the array.
Arrange a new Job sheet for any outstanding works, recording
the appropriate Job numbers in the Related Jobs  field
and Notify the Team Leader or his representative
of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
5. Carry out visual inspection externally and internally of the
cabinets, sign, external cables and conduits for vandalism,
mechanical damage, water ingress, condensation or insect
infestation. Also check inside cabinets for tripped circuit
breakers, disconnected wires, burn marks from excessive heat.
[_ _]
6. Visually check for loose or missing nuts and bolts, and for
rusted areas, rusted nuts or bolts. Cleans with wire brush
and spray with Cold Gal or equivalent. This should be
done with care and to avoid overspray. [_ _]
7. Inspect the external face of the lenses (for each pixel) for
dirt and clean with Windex or equivalent  and clean rags
if required.[_ _]
8. Note any corrective action required in the Work Done area
of the Job Sheet and raise new Job Sheet if required.
9. Notify control room on departure.
