01 W Inspect & report of Egress tunnel features
Before you start the inspection, make sure that you are carrying the
camera, so that you can take any photographs of your observations.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this work.
2. Have the Traffic Control Room turn all lights on.
3. Enter the Burnley Tunnel Emergency Egress Tunnel (EET) at the Burnley
Stairwell and
carry out the following inspections over the entire length of the
EET.
4. Visually inspect the EXIT signs for operation (12 off).  Record on
the form ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 any  EXIT
sign that is not functioning correctly.
5. Visually inspect the stairwell and EET lighting for operation.
Record  on the form
""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374
all instances of three (3) successive light fittings not functional.
6. Visually inspect all signage for cleanliness, damage and or damage
tofixings. Record
on the form  ""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly
Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374 any signage requiring further attention.
7. Visually inspect walls, floors and roofs for ground water leaks.
Record on the form
""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374
any leaks. Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage), LEAK TYPE
(Drip, Spray,
Running), POSITION (Roof, North wall, South wall, Floor).
8. Visually inspect floor for Trip Hazards e.g. raised grates,
accumulated debris, deposits of
leak sealant, water puddles etc.  Remove temporary hazards and
recordall occurrences
of hazards and their location on the form  ""Emergency  Egress Tunnel
Inspection Record  -
Weekly Inspection"" TMF- 3012-OP-0374
9. Visually inspect
(a) and operate all emergency egress doors (e.g. Tunnel to EET - at
each cross passage
and
(b) doors within egress tunnel - for operation and or damage and
(c)  ensure all doors to equipment rooms are locked.  Record on the
form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""  TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the
door location and a description of the repairs required.
10. Visually inspect all drainage and pits for evidence of blockage and
water over the floor.
Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage) TYPE (Pit, Drain, Pipe)
POSITION (North side, South side, Centre).  Record on the form
""Emergency Egress
Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF- 3012-OP-0374
the location and
description of any blockage or flooding.
11. Visually inspect all EET and Stairwell fitments for damage,
corrosion, trip hazards,
obstructions (from walls or roofs) that are apparent.  Record on
the form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the location
and a description of the repairs and or obstruction.
12. Visually inspect for evidence of rodent infestation.  Record on the
form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the location
of any sightings.
13. Remove all accumulated debris from the egress tunnel.
14. On completion have the Traffic Control Room switch all lights OFF.
15. Record in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet any abnormal
parameters found.
Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works.
16. Ensure the form  ""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  -
Weekly  Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374 is returned to the CIVIL team leader or his
representative for
evaluation and recording of new leaks onto the Burnley Tunnel
Emergency Egress
Tunnel Leak Repair programme.  The Civil team leader is to ensure
any
outstanding works are scheduled.
17. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the work."

06 M Night inspection of tollway in wet weather - WL
1. Inspect Tollway assets at night during wet weather on
six-monthly intervals as listed on the Regular Night
Inspection Report TMF-3012-OP-0003.  Record maintenance
requirements.  Reference procedure TMI-3012-OP-0001.
2. Personnel to carry safety vest, maintenance standards and
rotating vehicle hazard light and tape recorder as a minimum
requirement.  Vehicle hazard light must be operating when
travelling in the emergency lane.
3. Notify control room if you are required to stop in emergency
lane for further inspections.
4. Check by 'drive-by' inspection;
Line marking
Raised pavement markers damaged or missing
Delineators
Warning signs
Road signs
General signs
Tollway lighting
Ramp lighting
Record any other requirements outside specified maintenance
levels.
5. Raise job sheet for any corrective or programmed maintenance
actions
6. Make temporary repairs to unsafe items if possible, and if
safe to do so.

06 M Insp of Substation HV equip
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner,
Cloths, Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon
Lubricant Spray
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of Substations as well the cleaning, inspections
and maintenance of the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
(Substations 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 - General )
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant Substations
areas.
2. A visual inspection of substations 1- 5 and substation 6
(Ground type outdoor) is to be carried out with attention
given to the following:
(a) On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF
ventilation fans, if operating, toreduce ambient
noise.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect for water in any cable trenches.
(c) Visually inspect for evidence of condensation in
buildings.  [_ _]
(d) Visually inspect equipment enclosures and metal
structures and fixtures for evidence of corrosion or
other environmental conditions.  [_ _]
(e) Any unusual smell which may indicate overheating.  [_ _]
(f) Listen for any noise which may indicate an electrical
discharge or looseness of components.  [_ _]
(g) Visually inspect the main earthing busbars and
connections for degradation and damage.  [_ _]
(h) Remove any rubbish, dust, debris, materials or equipment
that serves no purpose within or near substations.  [_ _]
(i) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet,
inspection results requiring further corrective actions.
Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works and
notify the Team Leader or his representative.  Include
in the Related Job field of the new and this job, the
job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
(j) Prior to leaving the Substation ensure the ventilation
fans are returned to service.  [_ _]
3. Inspect the doors and locking facilities of substations,
enclosures within, outdoor enclosures, for operation, damage,
leaks and or corrosion.  [_ _]
4. Ensure all danger notices and labels are in place and are
maintained in a legible condition.  Any single line diagram
(or similar) is easily readable.  [_ _]
(Dry Type Transformers - Cast Resin 1A, 1B, 2A, 2B, 3A, 3B,
4A, 4B, 5A & 5B )
5. (a) Visually inspect transformer enclosures for evidence of
corrosion and or damage.   [_ _]
(b) Check that the Winding temperature instrument is
operational and that the alarm is connected to the PMCS
and the Traffic Control Room.   [_ _]
(c) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection
results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a
new job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the
Team Leader or his representative.  Include in the
Related Job field of the new and this job, the job number
number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
(HV Protection Systems)
6. (a) Visually inspect that the battery supply is available for
the incoming and distribution overcurrent and earth fault
relay systems. e.g. all protection displays are
operational.   [_ _]
(b) Reset any relay operational targets on protection devices
AS required.   [_ _]
(c) Visually inspect the Capacitive voltage neon indicators
for correct operation.   [_ _]
(d) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection
results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a
new job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the
Team Leader or his representative.  Include in the
Related Job field of the new and this job, the job number
number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
(High Voltage SM6 Schneider Switchgear)
7. (a) Visually inspect the enclosures and control panels for
evidence of damage and or corrosion.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the outside of the switchboard and remove
accumulated dust and dirt and clean.   [_ _]
(c) Visually check all auxiliary wiring, plugs and
terminations in low voltage instrument compartment. [_ _]
(d) Visually inspect that the battery supply is available for
the incoming and distribution overcurrent and earth fault
relay systems. e.g. all protection displays are
operational.   [_ _]
(e) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection
results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a
new job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the
Team Leader or his representative.  Include in the
Related Job field of the new and this job, the job number
number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
8. At Sub-stations fill-in the log-book [_ _]

Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
Plan 22, 25  if required to access from the tunnel.
4. Civil Team Leader or his representative is to:
(a) Select groundwater pits to be inspected on form Burnley
Tunnel Emergency Egress Tunnel - Groundwater Pit
Inspections  TMF-3012-OP-0301.  Selection should be
with the knowledge of past results and a  random
selection including examination of previous inspections.
(b) Previous inspection forms are to be issued to the
maintenance crew to compare results when carrying out
inspections.
5. (a) Inspect the groundwater pits circled on form Burnley
Tunnel Emergency Egress Tunnel - Groundwater Pit
Inspections  TMF-3012-OP-0301.
(b) Use a torch to to inspect each pipe and associated pits
for cleanliness and the accumulation of calcites.
(c) Record the buildup of calcites in the pipes and pits in
millimetres (mm).  When a buildup of 20mm occurs in a
100mm pipe, cleaning is required.
(d) If readings differ markedly from previous reading, then
take measurements again to confirm results.
6. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area
of the job sheet.  Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
actions required.
7. During the inspection, note any structural leaks in the roof,
wall and floor in the comment section of the form Burnley
Tunnel Emergency Egress Tunnel - Groundwater Pit Inspections
TMF-3012-OP-0301, recording the adjacent chainage marker and
adjacent cross passages.
8. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of this work.
9. Ensure a completed copy of the forms Burnley Tunnel Emergency
Egress Tunnel - Groundwater Pit Inspections  TMF-3012-OP-0301
is returned to the civil Team Leader or his representative to
record and sign off, and raise any actions (job sheets) for
further inspection or cleaning.

03 M Inspection of ERE17 AC unit
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne City
Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
3. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
3.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
vibration.   [_ _]
3.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
setting.   [_ _]
b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
the following steps
(i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
displayed)
(ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
(iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
setting.
(iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
(v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
(vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that
temperature shown on unit  is consistent with new
setpoint and verify temperature is consistent with
ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
c. Repeat above steps to restore the setpoint to the
original setting.   [_ _]
d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
point is reached and verify that the temperature is
consistent with ambient using the portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
cycle.
3.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
3.4. Check filters and replace if necessary.   Filter type
Liebert size 650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
3.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm drain line
clear.   [_ _]
3.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
4. ACC Condenser Unit
4.1. Inspect the condensor unit and check for undue cycling
operation.   [_ _]
4.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
running.   [_ _]
4.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local isolating
switch.   [_ _]
4.4. Inspect for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
4.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
4.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
4.7. Switch the fan ON at the fan isolator.   [_ _]
4.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
Unit.   [_ _]
5.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
5.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
5.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
will collect dust deposits.   [___]
5.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
5.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
5.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
Clear any blockages.
5.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
6.0 Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record the
results on form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347.
Ensure the form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347
is returned to the Electrical / Electronics Supervisor or
his representative.  Raise a new jobsheet for any
outstanding works.
7.0 On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done  section of the job sheet and
report to the Team Leader or his representative and raise a
new job for any repairs.
8. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

01 W Weekly inspection of WL tollway  - Pavement
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

otating vehicle hazard light and tape recorder as a minimum
requirement.  Vehicle hazard light must be operating
during inspection routine.

to encompass all inspection targets, these can be carried out

another day, line markings etc, on main carriageway one day

Raised pavement markers damaged or missing
New Jersey Barriers for damage
Impact Attenuators
Warning signs
Road signs
General signs
Litter
Graffiti
Record any other requirements outside specified maintenance
levels.

potential traffic hazards if safe to do so.

corrective maintenance action ie; all pot hole and pavement
defects to be added to the Work Done section running
Pavement Repairs Jobsheet.

action on the current fortnightly litter and landscape
jobsheet.

04 M Inspect & clean of AIDS , EWP, Southbank area"
This group of AIDs are around the Southbank area, and may
require refinement.
AID 602 is on the Power St Overpass Looking at the Grant St
Portal.
AID 604 is located on the on the Westgate looking westbound at
the Kingsway exit..
AID 605 is on a pole mounted in the central median strip looking
westbound.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the lane to
service the camera..
2.  Access to this camera group is:
(a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
(b) Position 0 and 1.
(c) Lane closure: LHS & RHS Lanes.
(d) Electrical cabinet location: Tollway.
3. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plans 1, 2, 3.
4. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,
Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
(a) Check for vandalism, damage,  corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
necessary.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the cabinet and check that the equipment mounted
in the cabinet is secure. [_ _]
(c) Check the cables and terminations for signs of
degradation, re-terminate if necessary.
(d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and securely fastened
to the PT140 and the LED is green, if the LED is red
there is no signal from the camera.
WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF THE FIBRE OPTIC
CABLE, AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.  [_ _]
(e) Check that the surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is
lit, if not record the fact, for later
replacement.  [_ _]
(f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
(Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the camera)
.  Ensure the co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT140
module and is secure.  [_ _]
6. Isolate the 240V power supply to the camera heaters.
7. Camera and Camera Housing;
(a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, external
evidence of moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface
insect spray  may be applied if necessary to the housing
exterior but must not be applied to the interior of the
housing or to the housing glass.
If there is evidence of insect infestation or moisture,
then open camera housing and carry out steps 7. (d) and
(e)  [_ _]
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
mounts.   [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
Rain-X  cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(d) Check that the camera heaters are operational, ie warm.
WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.  [_ _].
(e) Discard the previously used Silica Jell pack and replace
with a new uncontaminated Silica Jell pack.
8. Re-instate the 240V power supply to the camera
heaters.  [_ _]
9. Check with the control centre that the AID camera is
functioning correctly and that the MASK is aligned.   [_ _]
10. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
11. Notify the control room on completion.

03 M Inspect of Liebert AC units accessed via the EE Tunnel.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.   [_ _]
2. Access is via the Emergency Egress Tunnel from the entry
adjacent to the Burnley Vent Station stack.
(a) Arrange for the control room to start Supply Air fan
ESFP01. ESFP01 is the Supply Air for the Emergency Egress
Tunnel.
(b) Arrange for the control room to switch on the Emergency
Egress Tunnel lighting prior to entering the tunnel.
3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne City
Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
vibration.   [_ _]
4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
setting.   [_ _]
b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
the following steps
(i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
displayed)
(ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
(iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
setting.
(iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
(v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
(vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that temperature
shown on unit is consistent with new setpoint and
verify temperature is consistent with ambient
(+ or - 1 deg) using portable  thermometer.   [_ _]
c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
original setting.   [_ _]
d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
point is reached and verify that the temperature is
consistent with ambient using the portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary.  Filter type
Liebert size 650x590x75 mm
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
is clear.
4.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.
5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local fan isolating
switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local fan isolator.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
Unit.   [_ _]
6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
will collect dust deposits.   [___]
6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage
problems.  Clear any blockages.
6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and
rubbish.   [_ _]
7.0 Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record the
results on form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347.
Ensure the form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347
is returned to the Electrical Electronics Supervisor or his
representative.  Raise a new job for any outstanding works.
8.0 On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters  in the Work Done section of the job sheet and
report to the Supervisor or his representative and raise a
new job for any outstanding  repairs.
9.0 Notify the control room on completion of the job and arrange
for the control room to switch off the emergeny egress
tunnel lighting as well as the supply air fan.

06 W Meas, report on BT V-Ntch  flow, GW & DW Pits, Bore Lvl
** Prior to commencement Maintenance Crew to be issued white
disposable overalls to be worn  whilst carrying out Tunnel
Drainage tasks.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic
Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
Plans 21, 22, 25, 26
3. Reference:
(a) Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE
TMI-3012-OP-0031.
(b) Operation & Maintenance Manual - Tunnel Drainage Stage 2
Design Report R-STG-EN-006 Rev 1.
4. Civil Team Leader or representative is to:
(a) Select groundwater and dirty water pits to be inspected
on forms BURNLEY TUNNEL GROUND WATER INSPECTIONS
TMF-3012-OP-0232 and
BURNLEY TUNNEL DIRTY WATER PIT INSPECTIONS
TMF-3012-OP-0253 respectively.  Selection should be with
the knowledge of past results and a random selection
including examination of previous inspections carried out
as part of the V Notch and Bay Flow inspections
(b) Previous inspection forms are to be issued to the
maintenance crew to compare results when carrying out
inspections.
(c) V-Notch Pits 14A, 66, 204 & 237 shall be inspected on
each occasion.
5. (a) Inspect the groundwater pits circled on BURNLEY TUNNEL
GROUNDWATER PIT INSPECTION""  TMF-3012-OP-0232.
(i) Use a torch to inspect each pipe and associated pits
for cleanliness and the accumulation of calcites.
(ii) Record the build up of calcites in the pipes and pits
in Millimetres (mm).  When a build up of 50mm occurs
in a 200mm pipe or a 25mm in a 100mm pipe.  Cleaning
is required.
(iii) Record a description of the calcite. e.g. slimy,
milky or hard etc.
(iv) Record the results on form BURNLEY TUNNEL GROUNDWATER
PIT INSPECTIONS TMF-3012-OP-0232.
(b) Inspect the Dirtywater pits circled on BURNLEY TUNNEL
DIRTY WATER PIT INSPECTION TMF-3012-OP-0253. Use a torch
to inspect each pipe and associated pits for cleanliness
and the accumulation of debris.  Record the related
details regarding accumulation of silts, debris, and
other foreign materials within pits on the form.
(c) Ensure pit covers are replaced and seated correctly after
each pit inspection.
6. V-Notch Readings
(a) Prior to taking readings of dirty water (Right hand side
of tunnel) pit numbers 14A & 66 and Ground water (Left
hand side of tunnel) pit numbers 204 & 237, ensure the
V-notch  weir is clear of calcites and debris.  Clean
thoroughly if required.
(b) Use a measuring stick obtain the depth of the V-notch
flow by
(i) Place the stick in the cup
(ii) Remove the stick and measure the height of the water
mark on the stick.
(c) Record the depth of water flowing over the V-Notch weir
in mm on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE - SEGMENT
FLOWS, GROUNDWATER BORE LEVELS & RATE OF RISE
TMF-3012-OP-0234.
(d) If readings differ markedly from previous readings, then
take measurement again to confirm results.
(e) Note that inspection V-Notch pits is to be carried out
as per step 5.
7. Swan Street Groundwater Pit Inflow Readings
(a) Once V-Notch 221has been read, then proceed to the Swan
Street Pumping Station to take the rate of inflow
reading.
(b) Proceed to the Pump Control centre
(c) Notify the TCR that all pumps are to be switched OFF.
(d) Switch OFF all pumps (Have an electrician perform this
duty).
(e) Return back to the sump pumping room and close all three
gate valves.
(f) Return to the pump control centre and start by recording
the sump level, then 10 minutes later take another
reading of the sump level.
(g) Record the sump start and finish level, in millimetres,
on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE - SEGMENT FLOWS,
GROUNDWATER BORE LEVELS & RATE OF RISE TMF-3012-OP-0234.
(h) Record on the inspection sheet any thing out of the
ordinary.
(i) Return all gate valves to their normal OPEN condition and
switch the pumps back to automatic operation. Then
proceed with the rest of the readings and inspections.
8. Burnley Tunnel Groundwater Bore Level  (located between fire
cabinets B45 & B46 RHS).
(a) Remove the BT bore-hole cover, then lower a string with a
weight attached into the bore-hole until the weight
touches the bottom of the bore-hole.
(b) Mark the string with a marker or pen, ensuring that the
weight is just touching the bottom and that there is no
undue slack in the string.
(c) Measure and record the total length of the string (Total
depth of bore-hole in millimetres)
(d) Measure and record the total length of the string that
was submerged in the bore-hole water (Depth of
groundwater in bore-hole in millimetres).
(e) Record the details on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE -
SEGMENT FLOWS, GROUNDWATER BORE LEVELS & RATE OF RISE
TMF-3012-OP-0234.
(f ) Ensure the cover is replaced and seated correctly.
9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
10. Ensure a completed copy of the forms BURNLEY TUNNEL
GROUNDWATER PIT INSPECTION TMF-3012-OP-0232, BURNLEY
TUNNEL DIRTY WATER PIT INSPECTIONS  TMF-3012-OP-0253 and
BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE - SEGMENT FLOWS, GROUNDWATER BORE
LEVELS & RATE OF RISE TMF-3012-OP-0234 are forwarded to the
Civil Team Leader or representative on completion of the job
and prior to end of shift.  Civil Team Leader or
representative is to record and sign off each form and raise
any actions (job sheets) for further inspection or cleaning
Increases in the flows measured in groundwater pits 204 &
237 should be followed up with a piezometer measurement for
the Burnley Tunnel.

12 M Inspect test BT Emerg Egress Tunnel Supply Air Fans
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Obtain a Permit to work for entry to the Emergency Egress Tunnel.
2. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
3. Refer to Fantech Pty Ltd Maintenance Manual, ""Emergency Egress
Tunnel Axial Fans
& Associated  Attenuators Maintenance Manual"" M-EET-VE-26250.
4. Access to the emergency egress tunnel is via a doorway in a brick
structure 20m
south-west of the Burnley Vent Station and down the stairwell to
Emergency Egress
Tunnel entry door.  SF-EET-001 is accessed via a hatch in the
stairwell wall.
5. Carry out the 03 monthly inspection and test of fan functionality.
[_ _]
6. Notify the TCR of the intention to use the local control of the fan
for maintenance
purposes.  [_ _]
7. At the Equipment Room switchboard, switch the fan AUTO/MANUAL/OFF
control to the
MANUAL position and the ON/OFF control to the ON position to start
the fan.  [_ _].
NOTE:   Do not use the local fan motor ON/OFF isolator, located near
the motor, to start
motor.  Leave motor isolator in the ON position and use the
EquipmentRoom switchboard
ON/OFF switch for motor starting and stopping
8. Check the condition of the flexible duct connections. [_ _]
9. At the switchboard, switch the fan AUTO/MANUAL/OFF control switch to
the OFF position
and the ON/OFF control switch to the OFF position.   Isolate and tag
in accordance with
TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low Voltage Safety Work Instruction.   [_ _]
10. Check the fan mounting supports, springs and fastenings for
securityand re-tension
where required. [_ _]
11. Check the impeller for build-up of dirt, clearances from the
housingand alignment.  [_ _]
12. (a) Carry out an insulation  resistance test of the motor windings.
Record any results in the
""Work Done "" area of the job sheet that does not meet
specifications set  out in
AS 3000.   [_ _]
(b) Carry out an insulation  resistance test of the motor
anti-condensation heater.  Record
any results in the ""Work Done "" area of the job sheet
that does not meet specifications
set  out in AS 3000.   [_ _]
13. At the Equipment Room switchboard, switch the fan ON/OFF control
switch to the ON
position and the AUTO/MANUAL/OFF control switch to the AUTO
position to return control
of the fans to the TCR.  [_ _]
14. Lubricate the motor bearings of SF-EET-001 and SF-EET-002 with
ShellAlvania R3
grease.   Grease while the fan is rotating until new grease
emergesfrom the grease
relief port. [_ _]
NOTE:  SF-EET-003 and SF-EET-004 are fitted with sealed
bearings and cannot be
greased using external grease supply.
15. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal parameters
in the ""Work Done""
area of the job Sheet.   [_ _]
16. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
"

06 M Inspect & Clean the Tunnel air velocity and Temp sensor
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1 Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
2. Reference manual Erwin Sick Operating Instructions - Flowsic 200
AirVelocity of Flow
Measuring Device - [M-STG-EL-24004].
3. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control
TMI-3012-OP- 0002 and
Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 23 & 24 (or to be defined).
4. Tunnel Sending/Receiving sensor units.
WARNING:
DO NOT LOOK INTO THE LASER LIGHT USED TO ALIGN TRANSDUCERS.  THE
LASER
LIGHT CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO EYES.
WARNING:
DO NOT PUT YOUR EARS INTO THE ULTRASONIC SIGNAL PATH.  ULTRASONIC
SIGNALS CAN DAMAGE HEARING.  IT IS ADVISED TO WEAR HEARING
PROTECTION
WHEN WORKING IN THE VICINITY OF THE TRANSDUCERS.
CAUTION:
FIT PROTECTIVE CAPS TO THE SAFETY TUBES OF THE SENDER AND RECEIVER
DURING CLEANING.
PROTECT THE ULTRASONIC  TRANSDUCER FROM WATER AT ALL TIMES.
DO NOT TOUCH THE ULTRASONIC TRANSDUCERS EITHER BY HAND OR WITH ANY
CLEANING MEDIUM.
(a) Inspect both the sending and receiving for damage and or
corrosion.  [_ _]
(b) Using a cap, cover the safety tube that protects the transducer,
then clean the external
surfaces of the Flowsic 200 with a cleaning cloth, optical
cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(c) Remove the safety tube cap, then clean the internal surfaces of
the safety tube as well
as the transducer surface using a gentle stream of air ONLY.
[_ _]
(d) Check that the cable connection to the sensor unit is tight and
that the cable is suitably
supported and secure.  [_ _]
(e) Check that the mounting bracket and the bolts holding the unit
are secure.  If any of the
bolts need to be tightened, the alignment of the sensors must
be checked.  Alignment
is confirmed using a laser pointer and must be within the
range of 1º in all planes.   [__]
( f) Check with the control room that system is functioning
correctly prior to leaving the
unit.  [_ _]
5.  Record anything outside normal parameters in the ""Work Done "" area
of the job sheet.
6.  Notify the Control room on completion of the job."

06 M Inspection of shared pathway sump pits & pumps
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate keys and access bollard padlock keys
are  required..
2. Provide signs warning the public of restricted pathway
access.
3. WARNING:  POSSIBLE SHARPS HAZARDS EXISTS.  Refer Work
Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0005.
4. Inspection and Cleaning of  the Bath Tub.
(a) Be aware that sump pits could constitute a confined space
and appropriate safety measures should be taken.
(b) Clean out the bath tub and remove all silt, rubbish and
debris.
(d) Check the pump outlet pipe is not blocked (clear blockage
if necessary).
5. Inspect the Pump Pit
(a) Electrically isolate the pump prior to its removal from
the sump.
(b) Clean out the pump pit and grate, remove all silt,
rubbish and debris.
6. Inspect Sump Pump
(a) Check that the visible parts of the pump e.g. lead,
enclosure, outlet pipe connection are in good condition.
(b) Check that the impellor can move freely.
(c) On completion of the check reinstate power supply to the
pump.
7. Inspect Pump Local Control Panel
(a) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of
control panel for damage, evidence of insect infestation,
ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as required).
(b) Check cable connections for tightness and signs of
overheating and inspect electrical contral equipment.
(c) Check for correct operation of level switch and alarm
light (Flashing Amber).
8. Record any corrective action required, in the "Work Done"
area of the job sheet.

03 M Inspection of Smoke Exhaust Fans Olympic Park
WARNING:
ELECTRIC MOTORS CAN OPERATE AT A TEMPERATURE WHICH MAY CAUSE BURNS.
EXERCISE CAUTION WHEN ABOUT TO TOUCH MACHINERY WHICH MAY BE HOT.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Obtain a Permit to Work for entry to ventilation rooms and to
interrupt operations.
2. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
3. Reference manual, Fantech Pty Ltd. Olympic Park Portal Centrifugal
Fans.  Operations and
Maintenance Manual. M-STG-VE-26200.
4. Check the fan outlet stacks and the protective mesh for accumulated
debris that may restrict
outlet damper operation.  Use an extension ladder.  (3m. wall)  in
accordance with work    instruction TM1-3012-SA-0121 Ladders- Safe use
to remove any debris.  [_ _]
3. Fan Operation
WARNING:
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN YOU ARE IN THE FAN
CHAMBER.
CAUTION:  DO NOT RUN MORE THAN 2 FANS AT ANY TIME.
Request the control room to open at least four tunnel smoke inlet
dampers.
CAUTION:  A MINIMUM OF 4 INLET DAMPERS MUST BE OPEN BEFORE
OPERATING
THE  FANS.
(a) Switch the fan AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the MANUAL
position and start
the fan using the START/STOP/RESET pushbutton.  Run the fan
for 30 minutes.
(b) Check that the outlet damper opens fully.  [_ _]
The following checks shall be made using touch, sight and hearing.
Perceived problems
will be further investigated using instrumentation.
(a) Check the fan bearings for uneven rumbling or hammering noise.
[_ _]
(b) Check the fan bearings for overheating by using hand held
infrared temperature sensor.              [_ _]
(c) Check the fans for excessive vibration (surging or beating
sound) shuddering on start
up or run down.   [_ _]
(d) Check the safety guards and other safety features for safe
operating condition.  [_ _]
(e) Check the flexible connection of ducting, for leaks, tearing
andfraying.  [_ _]
(f ) Check the drive belts for condition.   [_ _]
4. Motor Operation
(a) Check the motor bearings for noisy running and excessive
vibration.  [_ _]
(b) Check the motor and the bearings for excessive heating.   [_ _]
(c) Check that external ventilation airways are clear. [_ _]
5. On completion of all checks switch the fan OFF using the
START/STOP/RESET pushbutton.
Check that the outlet damper closes fully on shutdown.   [_ _]
6. Record ""Hours Run""  for fan in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job
Sheet.
7. Request the control room to close the inlet smoke dampers.  [_ _]
8. Ensure the fan AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switches are set to the AUTO
position.  [_ _]
9. Ensure the fan station is clean and remove all accumulated debris andrubbish.
[_ _]
10. Record anything outside normal parameters, in the ""Work Done""
areaof the job
sheet.  [_ _]
11. On the completion of the job notify the control room.  [_ _]
12. On completion of the job, the ""Hours Run"" detail, for each fan is
to be entered into the
hours run table in Plant Item.  Select the Plant Item,  then right
mouse click, select
""Open"" and then select  ""Meter Readings"".  Select edit mode and
enter reading.
Record Readings Below
Hours Run  [         ]
Bearing Temp.    [         ] deg. C.
"

03 M Insp Thytec UPS System SL TSH's
03 M Inspection of Thytec UPS system in SL TSH's
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
3. Refer to Manual: Thytec 30KVA UPS 12 Pulse
[ M-MCL-ME20000/20011 ] Manual.
4. Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
charged ) record results in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
5. At By-pass Switch (Wall Mounted)
(a) Press the TRANSFER button, on the UPS control panel, to
transfer the UPS  to the by-pass mode.
(b) Wait until the amber By-Pass led is illuminated.
(c) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet<(>,<)>
to the OFF position, to isolate the batteries.
(d) Press the OFF button, on the UPS control panel,  to
switch OFF the UPS unit.
(e) Switch the EXTERNAL BY-PASS switch (wall mounted above
UPS) to the BY-PASS position.  The UPS unit is now
by-passed.
WARNING: DO NOT USE THE INTERNAL BY-PASS SWITCH, AS THIS
SWITCH IS NOT INTERLOCKED.
(f) Switch the EXTERNAL by-pass switch to the NORMAL
position.
(g) Press the ON button, on the UPS control panel.  An UPS
start is initiated.
(h) Wait for INV. ON green led to illuminate.
(i) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet<(>,<)>
to the ON position to connect the batteries to the UPS.
(j) After about 30 secconds the BYPASS led will go OFF and
the INVERTER led will illuminate, indicating the load is
on the inverter.  A noticeable change in the operating
noise of the UPS will also indicate the change of load.
6. UPS Unit.
(a) Do not operate the EMERGENCY STOP push button, on the
front of the UPS Panel, unless in extreme emergency, as
damage to the UPS electrical equipment can occur.
(b) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.
[_ _]
(c) Remove the air filter, clean and re-install, ( replace
air filter if necessary )   [_ _]
(d) Check for air flow above grills on top of the panel.
( with fan in operation )   [_ _]
(e) Visual Inspection of capacitors for any oil leaks.  [_ _]
(f) Switch OFF the ""MAIN UPS"" electrical supply.  The load
should then transfer to the UPS, supplying from the
batteries.
(g) Check and monitor, on the UPS display, the load current
(max. 42A per phase 30kVA UPS or max 55A per phase 40kVA
UPS).
(h) Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
discharged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
(i) Leave the UPS supply the load for at least ten minutes.
(j) Switch the Normal electricity supply isolator to the ON
position.  The load will revert to the Normal power
supply.
7. Battery Panel.
(a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
Batteries.
(b) Ensure the Circuit Breaker operating handle, on Panel
Door, is in the upright position and is not tripped.
[_ _]
(c) Measure and record the overall charge voltage across the
CB ( nominally 270V. )    [_ _]
8. Record any result outside normal parameters, in the "" Work
Done "" area of the job sheet.
9.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
10.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
NEW-PAGE
Works completed as above work plan

01 M Inspection & test running of the WL TSH generators
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
Supply to ensure it is operating in the normal
standby-back-up mode.   [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
MODE.
4. Refer to reference manual Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
5.   (a) Check that the generator was left in  "AUTO" [_ _]
(b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuel and water.   [_ _]
(c) Check oil level.   [_ _]
(d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
(e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).   [_ _]
(f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts   [_ _]
(g) Record the battery voltage in the "Work Done" area
of the job sheet. [_ _]
(h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
Physically open the cap, as the gauge could be
misleading.  [_ _]
(j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours
with the last entry.  [_ _]
6. Reference manual, Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP
Electrical Pty Ltd Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI
[M-MCL-ME-20016]
7.  (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch on the generator
DC panel to "" RUN "" let the engine run for at least 5
minutes, then turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch
back to "" AUTO ""
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from "" AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" to ""EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST
"" run the generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared,
and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
[_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure,
water temperature.   [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back
to " AUTOMATIC CONTROL" the generator will continue to
run for about 8 minutes before stopping.   [_ _]
(g) Record the hours run, from the hours run meter,  in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet.
8.  (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
9. Fill in the Generator Log Book and record anything outside
normal parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job
sheet.  Raise a new job for any works requiring further
repairs.  Priority High P1.
10.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
11.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
12.Record the Hours run in Mainpac under "Plant" use RH mouse
click then select "Open"      then select "Meter
Readings" in edit mode add the Meter Reading for the
appropriate TSH Generator.
"

03 M Inspect of Liebert AC units accessed via the EE Tunnel.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.   [_ _]
2. Access is via the Emergency Egress Tunnel from the entry
adjacent to the Burnley Vent Station stack.
(a) Arrange for the control room to start Supply Air fan
ESFP01. ESFP01 is the Supply Air for the Emergency Egress
Tunnel.
(b) Arrange for the control room to switch on the Emergency
Egress Tunnel lighting prior to entering the tunnel.
3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne City
Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
vibration.   [_ _]
4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
setting.   [_ _]
b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
the following steps
(i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
displayed)
(ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
(iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
setting.
(iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
(v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
(vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that temperature
shown on unit is consistent with new setpoint and
verify temperature is consistent with ambient
(+ or - 1 deg) using portable  thermometer.   [_ _]
c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
original setting.   [_ _]
d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
point is reached and verify that the temperature is
consistent with ambient using the portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary.  Filter type
Liebert size 650x590x75 mm
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
is clear.
4.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.
5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local fan isolating
switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local fan isolator.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
Unit.   [_ _]
6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
will collect dust deposits.   [___]
6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage
problems.  Clear any blockages.
6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and
rubbish.   [_ _]
7.0 Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record the
results on form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347.
Ensure the form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347
is returned to the Electrical Electronics Supervisor or his
representative.  Raise a new job for any outstanding works.
8.0 On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters  in the Work Done section of the job sheet and
report to the Supervisor or his representative and raise a
new job for any outstanding  repairs.
9.0 Notify the control room on completion of the job and arrange
for the control room to switch off the emergeny egress
tunnel lighting as well as the supply air fan.

06 M Inspect & Clean the Tunnel air velocity and Temp sensor
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1 Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
2. Reference manual Erwin Sick Operating Instructions - Flowsic 200
AirVelocity of Flow
Measuring Device - [M-STG-EL-24004].
3. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control
TMI-3012-OP- 0002 and
Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 23 & 24 (or to be defined).
4. Tunnel Sending/Receiving sensor units.
WARNING:
DO NOT LOOK INTO THE LASER LIGHT USED TO ALIGN TRANSDUCERS.  THE
LASER
LIGHT CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO EYES.
WARNING:
DO NOT PUT YOUR EARS INTO THE ULTRASONIC SIGNAL PATH.  ULTRASONIC
SIGNALS CAN DAMAGE HEARING.  IT IS ADVISED TO WEAR HEARING
PROTECTION
WHEN WORKING IN THE VICINITY OF THE TRANSDUCERS.
CAUTION:
FIT PROTECTIVE CAPS TO THE SAFETY TUBES OF THE SENDER AND RECEIVER
DURING CLEANING.
PROTECT THE ULTRASONIC  TRANSDUCER FROM WATER AT ALL TIMES.
DO NOT TOUCH THE ULTRASONIC TRANSDUCERS EITHER BY HAND OR WITH ANY
CLEANING MEDIUM.
(a) Inspect both the sending and receiving for damage and or
corrosion.  [_ _]
(b) Using a cap, cover the safety tube that protects the transducer,
then clean the external
surfaces of the Flowsic 200 with a cleaning cloth, optical
cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(c) Remove the safety tube cap, then clean the internal surfaces of
the safety tube as well
as the transducer surface using a gentle stream of air ONLY.
[_ _]
(d) Check that the cable connection to the sensor unit is tight and
that the cable is suitably
supported and secure.  [_ _]
(e) Check that the mounting bracket and the bolts holding the unit
are secure.  If any of the
bolts need to be tightened, the alignment of the sensors must
be checked.  Alignment
is confirmed using a laser pointer and must be within the
range of 1º in all planes.   [__]
( f) Check with the control room that system is functioning
correctly prior to leaving the
unit.  [_ _]
5.  Record anything outside normal parameters in the ""Work Done "" area
of the job sheet.
6.  Notify the Control room on completion of the job."

station is a measure of all the water collected in the Domain
tunnel drainage systems, from both dirty and clean water
sources.
Note: NEW CHANGES TO ITEM 4

telephone:

infestation

room.  Using the Emergency Roadside telephone, contact

01 M Inspection & test running of the WL TSH generators
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
Supply to ensure it is operating in the normal
standby-back-up mode.   [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
MODE.
4. Refer to reference manual Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
5.   (a) Check that the generator was left in  "AUTO" [_ _]
(b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuel and water.   [_ _]
(c) Check oil level.   [_ _]
(d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
(e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).   [_ _]
(f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts   [_ _]
(g) Record the battery voltage in the "Work Done" area
of the job sheet. [_ _]
(h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
Physically open the cap, as the gauge could be
misleading.  [_ _]
(j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours
with the last entry.  [_ _]
6. Reference manual, Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP
Electrical Pty Ltd Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI
[M-MCL-ME-20016]
7.  (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch on the generator
DC panel to "" RUN "" let the engine run for at least 5
minutes, then turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch
back to "" AUTO ""
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from "" AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" to ""EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST
"" run the generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared,
and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
[_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure,
water temperature.   [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back
to " AUTOMATIC CONTROL" the generator will continue to
run for about 8 minutes before stopping.   [_ _]
(g) Record the hours run, from the hours run meter,  in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet.
8.  (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
9. Fill in the Generator Log Book and record anything outside
normal parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job
sheet.  Raise a new job for any works requiring further
repairs.  Priority High P1.
10.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
11.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
12.Record the Hours run in Mainpac under "Plant" use RH mouse
click then select "Open"      then select "Meter
Readings" in edit mode add the Meter Reading for the
appropriate TSH Generator.
"

06 M Jet Fan maintenance and lubrication.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1.  Works to be carried out on one jet fan at a time so as to
not affect the operation of total tunnel ventilation
2.  Notify control room prior to commencing work.
3.  Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002
and Translink Operations Procedure PR-RS-OP-IR-020 Plan 27
or 28.
4.  Reference Manual;  Witt & Sohn, Operations and Maintenance
Manual , Certificate 18. (M-STG-VE-29047 )
5.  In associated equipment room switch jet fan AUTO/OFF/MAN
selector switch to MAN and REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL switch to LOCAL
to enable control adjacent to jet fan.  [_ _]
6.  Running visual inspection
WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF BODY IN INLET OR OUTLET
AIR STREAM WHEN FAN IS RUNNING.
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN.
(a) Start fan locally by pressing the START button on the
panel adjacent to the fan.   [_ _]
(b) Check for any abnormal noise or movement from the
fan.  [_ _]
(c) Check the fan unit vibration mountings and safety rods
for loose nuts and bolts.  [_ _]
(d) Stop fan locally with the EMERGENCY STOP button.  [_ _]
(e) If any non-conforming items are found, investigate
further in the static fan inspection.  [_ _]
7.  Static fan inspection
(a) Ensure the local  EMERGENCY STOP button is engaged. [_ _]
(b) Conduct a thorough visual inspection for damage and
corrosion of the silencers, impeller, inlet cone, cable
connections, mounting frame and vibration attenuators.
Any cracks identified in the vicinity must be noted in
the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _] Photo of Cracks found
will be required.
Any damage, especially to surface protection, must be
noted in the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _]
(c) Carry out careful inspection of all supporting hardware
and screw connections, including the eight vibration bracket
installations and the four safety rod brackets.  Using a
torque wrench, ensure that the accessible supporting screw
connections are secured and fixed with the correct torque
settings.  [_ _]
NOTE: Torque Settings
M10 = 37Nm
M12 = 65Nm
M16 = 150Nm
M20 = 300Nm      as per reference manual
in step 4
Bolts with Nylon washers should only be checked for
tightness. Do not torque as nylon washer get damaged
Do not torque anchor bolts in tunnel roof. Check for
tightness only.
(d) If any non-conforming items are found, record in the
"Work Done" area of the job sheet and rectify immediately
where possible to the requirements of the Witt & Sohn <(>,<)>
Operations and Maintenance Manual , Certificate 18.
(M-STG-VE-29047).   This inspection is carried out
externally via the inlet and exhaust ends using a
torch.  [_ _]
(e) Remove cover to motor junction box and check the cable
connections visually for tightness and evidence of
overheating.
8.  Lubrication
(a) Release the key operated EMERGENCY STOP button, restart
fan  locally.
(b) Regrease bearings using grease gun on nipples onside of
fan with  Mobilith SHC220 (TF000021) grease, 10 pumps of
hand grease gun per grease nipple.
Note:  Lubrication should be carried out between 3,000
and 4,000 hours running time when access is available.
Do not over grease.    [_ _]
(c) Stop fan using local EMERGENCY STOP button
(d) Release the EMERGENCY STOP button using a Key.  (Remove
the key)   [_ _]
9.  Equipment Room Control Panel.
(a) Switch fan REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to REMOTE to
enable control at panel
(b) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of the
control panel for damage evidence of insect infestation<(>,<)>
ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as
required).  [_ _]
(c) Check cable connections visually for tightness and signs
of overheating and inspect electrical control
equipment [_ _]
(d) Start fan with START pushbutton on panel and leave
running for approximately 5 minutes
(e) Check ammeter at electrical panel to verify fan is
operating within current limits FLC 100A.  [_ _]
(f ) Using an infra red thermometer check the temperature of
the connections and power cables to the motor.   Record in
the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet if the temperature
recorded is more that 10º to 15º C above ambient.   [_ _]
(g) Record the "hours run" from the Jet Fan hour run meter

04 M Insp/cln of  SL CCTV cams, EWP, BT & DT LHL
Perform this job at the same time as the AIDs cameras in LHS of
the tunnel.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Work shall be carried out in designated times approved by the
TCR.
2. Notify the control room prior to stopping in LHL
3. Access to this camera group is:
(a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
(b) Position 0 and 1.
(c) Lane Closure: LHL
(d) Electrical Cabinet Location: Above LHL
4. Set up the lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink  Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 21, 24, 26.
5. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,
Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
6. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
(a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
necessary.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
(c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,
re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
(d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
fastened to the PT300.
WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
(e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if
not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]
(f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
(Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the camera).
Ensure the   co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
module and is secure.  [_ _]
7. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
(unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
of the PTZ .  [_ _]
8. Camera and Camera Housing;
WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
ALIVE.
(a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface insect
spray may be applied if necessary to the housing exterior
but must not be applied to the interior of the housing or
to the housing glass.  If ingress of moisture or insect
infestation is evident then carry out steps (d) and
(e).  [_ _]
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
mounts. [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
Rain-X cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm.
WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.  If
the heaters are not warm, spray the heater thermostat (HTR)
with FREEZE IT, then again check the operation of the
heater. [_ _]
(e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
9. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
controller.  [_ _]
10. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait
2 minutes then check again.  [_ _]
11. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
attention of the Team Leader Electrical or his
representative.
12. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.

01 W Mon, m'sure & report  YC pump stn flows"
The measure of  water flowing from the Yarra Crossing pump
station is a measure of all the water collected in the Domain
tunnel drainage systems, from both dirty and clean water
sources.
Note: NEW CHANGES TO ITEM 4
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, DOMAIN TUNNEL
DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0025.
3. The Civil Team Leader is to provide a copy of the previous
DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOW TMF-3012-OP-0203 for details of
the previous readings.
4. Record the Time and the Total Flow at Magflow 1 (in K.litres)
and the Total Flow at Magflow 2 (in m3) for the pump station,
on form  DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0203.
5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
6. Ensure a copy of the form  DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0203 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
evaluation on completion of the job.
Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
in excess of 0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
job to investigate to check the various bay flows for
the reason to the change in water flowrate.
"

03 M Inspection of the OHVD System
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Control room prior to accessing the OHVD
system,  [___]
2. Reference Manual is Securite & Signalisation Preventative
Maintenance ED/RH/TRAIN/04.  This manual or section can be
found in Alstom - VMS/ADS/LUS/OHVD Contract Manuals
M-MCL-TM-1569.
3. Set up lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12,13 & 14  [_ _]
4. Clean, inspect and check alignment of the OHVD Receivers and
Transmitters.   [_ _]
5. Check the operation of the detectors by breaking the detector
paths in the correct sequence.   The correct sequence is that
the two beams must be broken in the direction of the traffic
flow and the second beam must be broken within two seconds
of the first being broken.  Visually check that the sign
operates correctly and that the TCR receive an alarm  [___]
6. Inspect the cabinet at the height detector for damage and
corrosion and insect infestation.  [___]
7. Check the equipment within the cabinet for loose connections
and evidence of burnt components.  [_ _]
8. Clean the front panel and inspect the OHVD message sign for
damage & corrosion.  [_ _]
9. Inspect the cabinet and equipment within at the OHVD message
sign for damage, loose connections, evidence of burnt
components and insect infestation.  [_ _]
10. Check operation of the sign by pressing the test pushbutton
on the CD501 boards.   [___]
11. Check the local controller cabinet for any sign of damage &
corrosion.  [___]
12. Check the components in the local controller cabinet for
burnt components, insect infestation and loose
connections  [___]
13. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done section of the Job Sheet.  Raise
a new jobsheet for any corrective works that are
outstanding.
14. Notify the control room prior to leaving OHVD site.

01 W Weekly inspection of SL tollway  - Pavement
,,**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Inspect On-Pavement Tollway assets weekly as listed on
Regular Weekly  Inspection Report TMF-3012-OP-0046.
Record maintenance requirements. Reference procedure
TMF-3012-OP-0001.
2. Personnel to carry safety vest, maintenance standards and
rotating vehicle hazard light and tape recorder as a minimum
requirement.  Vehicle hazard light must be operating
during inspection routine.
3. Notify control room if you are required to stop in emergency
lane for further inspection.
4. Check by 'drive-by' inspection  using a systematic approach
to encompass all inspection targets, these can be carried out
on separate days of the week ie; inspect pavement defects one
day, signs and road furniture another day, line markings etc,
on main carriageway one day and ramps on another, etc.
Pavement defects
Shoulder defects
Drainage for blockages or flooding.
Kerb & channel defects
Pavement Pits/Culverts for damage or blockage
Line marking
Raised pavement markers damaged or missing
New Jersey Barriers for damage
Impact Attenuators
Warning signs
Road signs
General signs
Litter
Graffiti
Record any other requirements outside specified maintenance
levels.
5. Make temporary repairs to unsafe items if possible,  pick up
potential traffic hazards if safe to do so.
6. Raise new  job sheet or add to running jobsheets, any major
corrective maintenance action ie; all pot hole and pavement
defects to be added to the 'Work Done' section running
Pavement Repairs  Jobsheet.
7. Ensure that any minor routine action identified is noted for
action on the current fortnightly litter and landscape
jobsheet.
8. On-Pavement inspection:
Monday   [        ]    Tuesday  [        ]
Wednesday  [       ]   Thursday  [        ]
Friday     [        ]

01 W Mon, m'sure & report  YC pump stn flows"
The measure of  water flowing from the Yarra Crossing pump
station is a measure of all the water collected in the Domain
tunnel drainage systems, from both dirty and clean water
sources.
Note: NEW CHANGES TO ITEM 4
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, DOMAIN TUNNEL
DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0025.
3. The Civil Team Leader is to provide a copy of the previous
DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOW TMF-3012-OP-0203 for details of
the previous readings.
4. Record the Time and the Total Flow at Magflow 1 (in K.litres)
and the Total Flow at Magflow 2 (in m3) for the pump station<(>,<)>
on form  DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0203.
5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
6. Ensure a copy of the form  DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0203 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
evaluation on completion of the job.
Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
in excess of 0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
job to investigate to check the various bay flows for
the reason to the change in water flowrate.
Work completed as above work plan.

03 M Maint of Gantry Tolling Equipment
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Carry out the three monthly planned maintenance defined in
the CML RSE Users Manual maintenance schedule, document no.
M-MCL-ET-1225.
2. Perimeter access gate at technical shelter key required.
3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment
and or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to safety
instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 "Working on Gantry Structures
4. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
5. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plan PL-MCL-ET-100001.
Preventative Maintenance No.0301
When carrying out the cleaning of VDC sensors (in 0301),
inspect the area around the connectors for evidence of
corrosion.
If corrosion is evident, then clean the area as described
below.
Where cleaning is to be also carried out, use extreme care
to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter any
connectors.
The Fibre Optic Connector is to be only removed on the
12 Monthly  Cycle (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
Prior to removing any connector or cover socket, clean
surface corrosion and deposits from around connectors<(>,<)>
socket covers and the surrounding surfaces use a tooth
brush to assist if necessary.
Remove the three socket covers (remove only if possible
using fingers) and apply a light spray of silicon to
the three (3) socket covers, replacing and exercising
the threads.
With all caps and plugs re-installed apply a light spray of
silicon to the area around the plugs and caps.
Check for silicon overspray on the VDC sensor window and
clean if necessary.
Where connectors or socket covers cannot be easily removed<(>,<)>
record details in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and
report the fact to the Team Leader or his representative.
0301: Check image quality and
,,,, alignment with CML Clean glass regardless of image.
,,,, Lubrication of mounting bracket carried out on removal
,,,, only.  Lightly spray with lubricant.
0302: Clean external glass of front and rear VR sensors.
Inspect mounting brackets and lubricate as required.
Ensure pins are cleaned and lubricated using silicon
spray prior to installing.
0303: Check VR Illuminator that there are less than 10%
defective IR LEDs,Advice CML if suspect below 10%
0304: Clean front surface of TRX, inspect mtg bracket and
lubricate as required
0305: Clean outside of glass cover of VDC, Replace failed
lamps, Lubricate arms as required.
Inspect VDC arm locating pins and chains. Record any
works required and report any equipment that needs
repair.
0306: Road Markers: Inspect for clarity & Cleanliness.( High ,,,,
contrast between marker & road). (If road markers need            to be
changed, inform the Team Leader.)
0307: Clean the glass of VSS sensor
0308: Inspect Distribution Cabinet for loose or damaged   ,,
cables. Clean cabinet for insects or moisture.
6. Record in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet any
outstanding works requiring further attention.  Create a
new Job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative of the outstanding works.
Record the New job number in the "Work Done" area of this
job sheet and in the "Related Job" field of both jobs.
7. Notify Control Room prior to departing from the Technical
Shelter."

03 M Inspect & Clean TSH Equipment and Bldgs
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the
cleaning and inspections of the Building and Electrics<(>,<)>
prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and
external lighting, Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material<(>,<)>
Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Rodent Bait Station
This job should be carried in conjunction with the Monthly
job at the Technical Shelters
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
electrical installations of Technical Shelters, as well the
cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the relevant
areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Technical Shelters TSH1-6, TSH10-14 )
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant Technical
shelters.
2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere<(>,<)>
use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
abnormal events.  [_ _]
3. At Technical shelters, fill-in the log-book [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation<(>,<)>
including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace
faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of
ambient plus 10°C should be considered abnormal and must be
noted in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all
cables, terminals, equipment and components  for evidence
of burn marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for any corrective action.
Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Inspect the surges diverters where applicable, and either
replace spent surge diverters when less than 80% or raise a
new Job Sheet for works to be carried out.   [_ _]
9. At Technical Shelters,  visually inspect external Lightning
Protection System connections for damage and or corrosion.
Record anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for any corrective
action.  Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is
informed of the abnormality.  [_ _]
10.Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware<(>,<)>
gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and
general operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out
any required repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any
outstanding actions.  [_ _]
11.Inspect single line drawings for legibility.  Record
details of drawings requiring replacement in the ""Work
Done"" area and report to the Team leader or his
representative.
12.Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating<(>,<)>
looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
13.Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally
for dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
14.Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of
obstructions.  Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
15.Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s)<(>,<)>
for faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
actions.   [_ _]
16.PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect  the PLC status and error indicators.
Indicators found to indicate abnormal conditions are
to be logged in the ""Work Done"" of the Job Sheet and
a new job sheet raised to invetigate and correct the
error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g.
plug connections, screw connections for security.
[_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush, ensure the
enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated
dust and debris.  [_ _]
17.Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.
18.Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for
operation and security.  Check with the Traffic Control
Room Operator to confirm the receipt of an alarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of
outstanding defects in the Work Done area of the Job
Sheet.  [_ _]
19.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective actions.
Include in the Related Job field of the new and this
job, the job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of
moisture ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record
any details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and
inform the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings
and or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Inspect the area of the generator in Tech Shelters and air
conditioning unit, for leaks of fuel, coolants or
lubricants.  Clean any spillage and if any leaks are
evident record in the ""Work Done "" area and raise a new
jobsheet for any corrective action required. Inform the
Team Leader or his representative of  these required
actions.  [_ _]
5. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets<(>,<)>
ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle
on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
6. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
cleaning materials .  [_ _]
7. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light
fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]
8. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
9. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
10.Carry out Exterior Checks of Technical Shelters.
(a) Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the
building (if applicable) for damage, erosion<(>,<)>
graffiti.  [_ _]
(b) Visually inspect the building (if applicable) walls<(>,<)>
roof, guttering and and downpipes for damage, leaks
and or blockages, remove any debris or materials
that could cause a blockage.  [_ _]
(c) Inspect (if applicable) the general area surrounding
the building for erosion and damage to surfaces<(>,<)>
fences, gates, pavements   [_ _]
11.Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  replace
bait station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
12.Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of
the job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
corrective actions.  [_ _]
13.Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.
[_ _]
14.Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
(d)  Generators in Tech Shelters to be left in a state of
readiness for operation.  [_ _]
(e)  UPS in Tech Shelters to be left in state of readiness
for operation. [_ _]
15.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this
job, the job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
16.Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
Work completed as above work plan
"
