CABINET.  THE DOOR IS OPENED UNDER NEGATIVE PRESSURE.  USE THE
HANDLES PROVIDED TO PULL THE DOOR OPEN.  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART
OF THE BODY BETWEEN THE DOOR AND THE DOOR FRAME.
5. Work plan for SF-SS1-1

below assumes SF-SS1-1 is the duty fan.
(a) At the switchboard, switch the fan OFF using the circuit
breaker in control panel (SUB1 A/C 1A MEB) or (SUB1 A/C
1B MEB).  Isolate and tag in accordance

flashing for damage.    [_ _]

and fixings that may be loose or missing.   [_ _]

passage of air.   [_ _]
(e) Check the fan for free movement and any damage to the
blade.   [_ _]
(f) Check the fan belts and pulleys for serviceability and
tension.  Adjust or replace as necessary.   [_ _]
(g) Check the fan and motor mountings for security.  [_ _]
(h) Check and replace filters as required.

9 off Air-Guard DP2-610x610x100mm)
(i) Switch the fan ON, using the circuit breaker in control

or (SUB1 A/C 1B MEB).   [_ _]

(k) Check for fan and motor for unusual noises and
vibrations.   [_ _]
(l) Check the motor bearings, lubricate if required.   [_ _]
SF-SS1-2
(m) Switch OFF the circuit breaker for the fan SF-SS1-2 and

(n) Inspect the fan housing, ducting and roof penetration

(o) Check the fan panels and fixings for damage, corrosion
and fixings that may be loose or missing.   [_ _]
(n) Check the fan cowls and grilles for debris blocking the

blade.   [_ _]
(q) Check the fan belts and pulleys for serviceability and

NOTE:  Belts must be replaced as matched set. Replaced all

(r) Check the fan and motor mountings for security.  [_ _]

(9 off Air-Guard CP9-4-610x610x555mm and
9 off Air-Guard DP2-610x610x100mm)

04 M Insp/cln of  WL CCTV cams, EWP, emerg lane & Grdn bed"
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the emergency
lane or entering the garden bed area.

(b) Position 0 and 1.

Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
(a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
necessary.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
(c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,
re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
(d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
fastened to the PT300.
WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.

(Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the

Ensure the   co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300

6. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect

inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
of the PTZ .  [_ _]
7. Camera and Camera Housing;
WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
ALIVE.
(a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation.
Surface insect spray may be applied if necessary to the
housing exterior but must not be applied to the interior
of the housing or to the housing glass.  If ingress of
moisture or insect infestation is evident then carry out
steps (d) and (e).  [_ _]
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
mounts. [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
Rain-X  cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm.
WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.
If the heaters are not warm, spray the heater
thermostat (HTR) with FREEZE IT, then again check the
operation of the heater. [_ _]
(e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
8. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
controller.   [_ _]
9. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait 2
minutes then check again.  [_ _]

01 W Inspect & report of Egress tunnel features
Before you start the inspection, make sure that you are carrying the
camera, so that you can take any photographs of your observations.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this work.
2. Have the Traffic Control Room turn all lights on.
3. Enter the Burnley Tunnel Emergency Egress Tunnel (EET) at the Burnley
Stairwell and
carry out the following inspections over the entire length of the
EET.
4. Visually inspect the EXIT signs for operation (12 off).  Record on
the form ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 any  EXIT
sign that is not functioning correctly.
5. Visually inspect the stairwell and EET lighting for operation.
Record  on the form
""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374
all instances of three (3) successive light fittings not functional.
6. Visually inspect all signage for cleanliness, damage and or damage
tofixings. Record
on the form  ""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly
Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374 any signage requiring further attention.
7. Visually inspect walls, floors and roofs for ground water leaks.
Record on the form
""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374
any leaks. Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage), LEAK TYPE
(Drip, Spray,
Running), POSITION (Roof, North wall, South wall, Floor).
8. Visually inspect floor for Trip Hazards e.g. raised grates,
accumulated debris, deposits of
leak sealant, water puddles etc.  Remove temporary hazards and
recordall occurrences
of hazards and their location on the form  ""Emergency  Egress Tunnel
Inspection Record  -
Weekly Inspection"" TMF- 3012-OP-0374
9. Visually inspect
(a) and operate all emergency egress doors (e.g. Tunnel to EET - at
each cross passage
and
(b) doors within egress tunnel - for operation and or damage and
(c)  ensure all doors to equipment rooms are locked.  Record on the
form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""  TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the
door location and a description of the repairs required.
10. Visually inspect all drainage and pits for evidence of blockage and
water over the floor.
Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage) TYPE (Pit, Drain, Pipe)
POSITION (North side, South side, Centre).  Record on the form
""Emergency Egress
Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF- 3012-OP-0374
the location and
description of any blockage or flooding.
11. Visually inspect all EET and Stairwell fitments for damage,
corrosion, trip hazards,
obstructions (from walls or roofs) that are apparent.  Record on
the form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the location
and a description of the repairs and or obstruction.
12. Visually inspect for evidence of rodent infestation.  Record on the
form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the location
of any sightings.
13. Remove all accumulated debris from the egress tunnel.
14. On completion have the Traffic Control Room switch all lights OFF.
15. Record in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet any abnormal
parameters found.
Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works.
16. Ensure the form  ""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  -
Weekly  Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374 is returned to the CIVIL team leader or his
representative for
evaluation and recording of new leaks onto the Burnley Tunnel
Emergency Egress
Tunnel Leak Repair programme.  The Civil team leader is to ensure
any
outstanding works are scheduled.
17. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the work."

installations and cleaning of the Refuge areas.

of Refuges 1, 2 and 3.

use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
abnormal events.  [_ _]

lighting) and lens of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]

Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative
of outstanding actions.  [_ _]

of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding defects

anything  abnormal in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
Record anything abnormal in the Work Done area of the Job
Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of
outstanding actions.  Include in the Related Job field of
the new and this job, the job number of the alternate
job.  [_ _]

3. Check the doors for damage and operation, lubricate and
repair as required and record in the Work Done area of the

of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
4. Clean exterior surfaces of cabinets where necessary.  [_ _]
5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets and
ceilings.  [_ _]
6. Remove from site all accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
7. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces as well as
stairways.  [_ _]
8. Clean hand rails (if applicable) of dust and dirt.  [_ _]
9. Visually inspect the metal upstands (external aids assisting

03 M Load test of the MGE UPS
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
2. Check with the control room if any UPS alarms are relevant.
3. Refer to MGE UPS Systems Manual, Galaxy User Manual
E-679380XT/FA, M-STG-EL-24009, and Schnieder Electric Tunnel
Electrical Services Training Notes, M-STG-EL-24001,
Section 9.
WARNING
THE UPS BATTERY POTENTIAL IS APPROXIMATELY 380 VOLTS AND IS
EARTHED.  THE BATTERIES CAN DELIVER A FAULT CURRENT OF
APPROXIMATELY 9000 AMPS.  EXPOSED BATTERY TERMINALS ARE
DANGEROUS AND MUST NOT BE TOUCHED.  IN THE VICINITY OF THE
BATTERIES USE ONLY TOOLS WHICH ARE FULLY INSULATED.
SAFETY GLASSES MUST BE WORN WHEN CARRYING OUT  MEASUREMENTS
ON THE BATTERIES.
4. Check the UPS control panel readout for alarms and or normal
status.  If an alarm is found, record the alarm in the Work
Done Area of the Job Sheet. Do Not Continue with this Job if
an alarm is present.  [_ _]
5. Record measurements on form 03 M MGE Uninterruptible Power
Supply Battery Inspection and Test, TMF-3012-OP-0099.
6. Measure and record the UPS room temperature.   [_ _]
7. Check and record DC voltage and AC ripple voltage for each
bank of batteries.  If a discrepancy is found then record in
the Work Done Area of the Job Sheet.  Do Not Continue
this job sheet if there is a discrepancy in the readings
recorded and the readings expected.  [_ _]
8. To simulate a power failure, Open Mains 1 Isolator (Q1), the
UPS operation will change to the batteries.  [_ _]
9. Operate the UPS, in this mode, for at least 10
minutes.  [_ _]
10. Measure and record the DC voltage for each shelf of the
battery banks.
11. Measure and record the DC current flow in each battery bank.
12. Return the UPS to normal operation by closing Mains 1
Isolator Q1.  [_ _]
13. With an Optical thermometer measure the temperature of the
batteries and their inter-connections.  Temperature readings
should approximate ambient room temperature.  When a
connection is found to having a temperature greater than 5
degrees above room  temperature, in the Work Done Area of
the Job Sheet, record the battery location, terminal
identification, measured  temperature.  [_ _]
14. With an Optical thermometer measure the average temperature
of the two (AC & DC) capacitor banks and record the result.
15. With an anemometer measure and record the airflow from each
of the UPS cooling fans.
16. With the Optical thermometer measure and record the
temperature of each of the UPS cooling fans.  [_ _]
17. Ensure Normal operation of the UPS.  [_ _]
18. Sweep and clean the UPS room:
Sweep the floor and remove accumulated webs from the
walls.   [___]
Sweep the control panel room floors as well, vacuum the
control panel enclosures and any surfaces that will collect
dust deposits.   [___]
Clean the front panel of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
19. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the UPS room and
equipment etc,  in the "Work Done"section of the job
sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
20. Leave a duplicate 03M MGE Uninterruptible Power Supply
Battery Inspection and  test form in the UPS room.  Compare
previously recorded data and record in the Work Done
Area of the Job Sheet any data that shows any degradation.
21. Notify the control room on completion of the job."

12 M Routine Maint. of Burnley Vent Station Fan
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
WARNINGS:
1. CHECKS SHOULD NOT BE CARRIED OUT IF MORE THAN 2 FANS ARE OPERATING IN
THE SECONDARY VENT STATION.
2. NO PERSON SHALL ENTER THE ACCESS AIRLOCK TO THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM
ALONE.
TWO OR MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT AT ALL TIMES WHEN WORK IS BEING
CARRIED OUT IN THE AIRLOCK OR VENT STATION
3. TAKE HEED OF NOTICES ON THE AIRLOCK DOORS.
1. Obtain a Permit to Work for entry to substation 3,  the ventilation
rooms and to interrupt
operations.
2.  Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.  Maintain
radiocontact at all times.
3.  Reference manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance
Instructions Manual
(M-STG-VE-26058)
4. Access to the Burnley ventilation station is through a locked airlock(Key2-LV)
on the
stairway  adjacent to the south west corner of the Burnley vent
stack.
Access to substation 3 is via external doors adjacent to the Burnley
Portal.
5. Ensure the 3 monthly check of the fans, carried out at the PMCS,
havebeen completed.
6. At the MCC in Substation No 3
Select one axial fan to be operational while the maintenance is being
carried out on
the other fans.  The fan selected can be any fan other than the fan
to be maintained
(preferably a fan located the furthest from the fan to be
maintained).
(a) If the selected fan is not running, then have the TCR start the
selected fan.
(b) Isolate the remaining non-operational axial fans, by switching
the AUTO/OFF/MAN
selector switches to the OFF position.  Carry out the
electrical isolation procedures
as defined in the Work Instruction TMI -3012-OP - 0103,  Low
Voltage Isolation
Procedures.
7.  Electrical checks in Substation No 3
(a)  Measure the insulation resistance of the stator windings and
record in the ""Work Done""
section of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
(b)  Measure the current of the anti-condensation. Heater current
isapprox. 1 amp.
(c)  Visually inspect both internally and externally, the control
panel for damage, corrosion
as well as the ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as
required)
8. (a) Enter the fan room from the entry stairway after equalizing
pressure in airlock.
WARNING: HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION SHOULD BE WORN IN
VENTILATION
FAN CHAMBER
(b) Check CO levels in fan room through doorway before entering and
at intervals during
fan checks.
(c)  WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF BODY OR MATERIALS WITHIN 1
METRE
OF AN OPERATING FAN INLET GUARD.  Airflow strength 35 km/h.
9. Static Fan Checks for each fan.
(a) Confirm that both the fan and motor are electrically and
mechanically isolated prior to
commencing any work on the fan or the motor.
(b) Enter the fan inlet cowl via the entry cowl safety grill hatch.
(c) Examine the impeller for
(i) Dirt and foreign matter on the blades (clean if required)
[_ _]
(ii) Wear or damage on the blade tips   [_ _]
(ii) Wear or damage on the blade leading edges   [_ _]
(iv) Loose bolts and or blade fixings at the hub   [_ _]
(d) Examine the electrical cable for security of fixings, damage due
to fraying, scuffing or
similar and for damage at locations where the cables penetrate
panels or
housings.    [_ _]
(e) Check any grease discharged from the motor bearings, since the
last lubrication is not
excessive.   [_ _]
(f ) Examine the discharged grease for any noticeable colour change.
Ensure that the
grease nipples are clean.  [_ _]
(g)  Inspect the cable connections to the motor for evidence of
overheating.  [_ _]
(h) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and heater
windings.
(i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
(ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor
Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has been
isolated and is to remain
isolated.
(a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
(where connected) and
bridge heater terminals.
(b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
terminals.
(iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the motorwindings
and the
winding heater bridge.  Record the result in the ""Work
Done"" area.
(iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
connections and carry out
an Insulation resistance test between this common bridge
and earth.  Record
the result in the ""Work Done"" area.
(v) Remove all temporary connections.
(vi) Remove supply lines to the motor and carry out an
insulation resistance test
on the motor windings, Between phase winding to phase
winding and between
each phase winding and earth.  Record results in the Work
Done area of the
Job sheet.
(vii) If the heater was connected on arrival, then re-instate
the heater connections,
otherwise leave the motor winding heater terminations
isolated.
(viii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
(x)  Where any insulation resistance reading is less than 2
megohm, then Record
in the ""Work Done""area of the Job Sheet and raise a
new job for the outstanding
works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
""Related Job"" field as well
as in the alternate.  Notify the Team Leader or his
representative of any
outstanding works.
(i) On leaving the fan inlet cowl grill hatch, replace the hatch
cover immediately.  [_ _]
(j) Manually check the operation of the Rotork actuator and
associated linkages that
operate the exit dampers, use the local control panel switch.
(k ) Remove any mechanical interlocks blocking the fan operation.
[__]
10. Running Fan Check and Lubrication
CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
REQUIRED
AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
(a) When the Static Fan Checks are complete, return to substation
3and remove the
safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then
removethe fan motor isolation
at the MCC.
Note:  Ensure that all non-operational fans are isolated, in
accordance
TMI-3012-SA-0103, and that the only fan not
isolated, is the fan to be maintained.
(b) Return the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF position
to the AUTO position.
(c) Return to the ventilation room and have TCR start the fan,
thatis being maintained.
Note: The motor must not be started more that four times in
an hour.
(d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan starts.
(e) Lubricate the motor bearings with fresh grease, while the motor
running.
DE = 100 gr / NDE - 120 gr  Use Shell Stamina RL2 grease or
equivalent only.
(f ) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the bearings
using the retrieval
system.  Examine the grease for changes of colour.  [_ _]
(g) Monitor the fan and motor for abnormal noises.      [_ _]
(h) Stop the fan motor using Local EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
(i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
11. On completion, collect all materials and leave the fan room after
equalizing the
differential pressures.
12. In Substation No 3
(a) Remove all safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103,
then remove the
motor isolation for all the fans at the MCC.  Return all
theREMOTE/OFF/LOCAL
selector switches to the REMOTE position,  and the
AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector
switches to the AUTO position.
(b) Check that one fan is operational and no alarms are present
13. Record anything outside normal parameters in the 'Work Done' sectionof
the Job Sheet.
14. Notify the control room on the completion of the job.
EMERGENCY OPERATION
In the event of notification by TCR Operators that a tunnel incident
hasoccurred requiring the
use of fans for smoke extraction.
1. If the fan being checked is operating, advise the traffic control
room  that it is currently
operating under LOCAL control and will be returned to AUTO control.
Stop fan using
the Emergency STOP pushbutton adjacent to the fan.
2. Release the STOP pushbutton .
3. Leave the fan chamber immediately by either the north or south exit
ladders ensuring
that the door to the stairwell airlock is secured.
4. Advise the traffic control room when all personnel are all accounted
for and at the surface
adjacent to the Burnley Vent Stack.
5. In Substation 3 Switch the REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to the
REMOTE position,
as well switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN fan selector switch to the AUTO
position.
6. Switch the operational fan AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch to the AUTO
position and start
the fan.
7. Notify TCR Operators that they have control.
On completion of the job, the ""Hours Run"" detail, for each fan is to
be entered into the
hours run table in the Plant Item.  Select the Plant Item,  then right
mouse click, select
""Open"" and then select  ""Meter Readings"".  Select edit mode and
enter data.
Record Readings Below

phase to phase

o earth

03 M Load test of the MGE UPS
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
2. Check with the control room if any UPS alarms are relevant.
3. Refer to MGE UPS Systems Manual, Galaxy User Manual
E-679380XT/FA, M-STG-EL-24009, and Schnieder Electric Tunnel
Electrical Services Training Notes, M-STG-EL-24001,
Section 9.
WARNING
THE UPS BATTERY POTENTIAL IS APPROXIMATELY 380 VOLTS AND IS
EARTHED.  THE BATTERIES CAN DELIVER A FAULT CURRENT OF
APPROXIMATELY 9000 AMPS.  EXPOSED BATTERY TERMINALS ARE
DANGEROUS AND MUST NOT BE TOUCHED.  IN THE VICINITY OF THE
BATTERIES USE ONLY TOOLS WHICH ARE FULLY INSULATED.
SAFETY GLASSES MUST BE WORN WHEN CARRYING OUT  MEASUREMENTS
ON THE BATTERIES.
4. Check the UPS control panel readout for alarms and or normal
status.  If an alarm is found, record the alarm in the Work
Done Area of the Job Sheet. Do Not Continue with this Job if
an alarm is present.  [_ _]
5. Record measurements on form 03 M MGE Uninterruptible Power
Supply Battery Inspection and Test, TMF-3012-OP-0099.
6. Measure and record the UPS room temperature.   [_ _]
7. Check and record DC voltage and AC ripple voltage for each
bank of batteries.  If a discrepancy is found then record in
the Work Done Area of the Job Sheet.  Do Not Continue
this job sheet if there is a discrepancy in the readings
recorded and the readings expected.  [_ _]
8. To simulate a power failure, Open Mains 1 Isolator (Q1), the
UPS operation will change to the batteries.  [_ _]
9. Operate the UPS, in this mode, for at least 10
minutes.  [_ _]
10. Measure and record the DC voltage for each shelf of the
battery banks.
11. Measure and record the DC current flow in each battery bank.
12. Return the UPS to normal operation by closing Mains 1
Isolator Q1.  [_ _]
13. With an Optical thermometer measure the temperature of the
batteries and their inter-connections.  Temperature readings
should approximate ambient room temperature.  When a
connection is found to having a temperature greater than 5
degrees above room  temperature, in the Work Done Area of
the Job Sheet, record the battery location, terminal
identification, measured  temperature.  [_ _]
14. With an Optical thermometer measure the average temperature
of the two (AC & DC) capacitor banks and record the result.
15. With an anemometer measure and record the airflow from each
of the UPS cooling fans.
16. With the Optical thermometer measure and record the
temperature of each of the UPS cooling fans.  [_ _]
17. Ensure Normal operation of the UPS.  [_ _]
18. Sweep and clean the UPS room:
Sweep the floor and remove accumulated webs from the
walls.   [___]
Sweep the control panel room floors as well, vacuum the
control panel enclosures and any surfaces that will collect
dust deposits.   [___]
Clean the front panel of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
19. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the UPS room and
equipment etc,  in the "Work Done"section of the job
sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
20. Leave a duplicate 03M MGE Uninterruptible Power Supply
Battery Inspection and  test form in the UPS room.  Compare
previously recorded data and record in the Work Done
Area of the Job Sheet any data that shows any degradation.
21. Notify the control room on completion of the job."

03 M Inspect Clean Emergency stairways thru'out the project
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
and inspections of the Stairway and Electrics, prior to leaving
the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for
fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,
Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray,
Rodent bait station, Cold Gal.
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations and cleaning of the stairway areas.
A  INTRODUCTION
1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2. This Job is for the inspection and clean of the emergency
stairways e.g. External and Internal stairway to YC Pump Stn,
External Stairway to SUB 04, External Stairway to
SUB 05.   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,
use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
abnormal events.  [_ _]
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
1. Check the interior and external lighting for operation,
including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace or
repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
2. Clean lighting diffusers (including emergency and Exit
lighting) and lens of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
3. Check and clean cable trays for accumulated debris.  Record
anything abnormal in the Work Done area of the job sheet and
inform the Team Leader or his representative of outstanding
actions.  [_ _]
C  Stairway Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the relevant stairway(s) are not obstructed by
furnishings and or stored items.  Remove any
obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Check the doors for damage and operation, lubricate and
repair as required and record in the Work Done area of the
Job Sheet.  Inform the Team Leader or his representative
of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
4. Clean dust and remove cobwebs from interior walls and
ceilings.  [_ _]
5. Remove from site all accumulated rubbish and debris,
including accumulated leaves and debris at top of
stairways.  [_ _]
6. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces and stairs.  [_ _]
7. Clean hand rails (if applicable) of dust and dirt.  [_ _]
9. Visually inspect all metalwork for damage or corrosion.
Repair and or remove corrosion and clean then cover with
Cold Gal.  [_ _]
10. Carry out Exterior Checks of relevant area(s) (where
applicable).
(a) Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the building
(if applicable) for damage, erosion,  graffiti,
corrosion.  [_ _]
(b) Visually inspect the building (if applicable) walls,
roof, guttering and and downpipes for damage, leaks and
or blockages, remove any debris or materials that could
cause a blockage.  [_ _]
(c) Inspect (if applicable) the general area surrounding the
building for erosion and damage to surfaces, fences,
gates, pavements   [_ _]
11. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds
(where appropriate).  [_ _]
12. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
13. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.

03 M Insp Thytec UPS System SL TSH's
03 M Inspection of Thytec UPS system in SL TSH's
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
3. Refer to Manual: Thytec 30KVA UPS 12 Pulse
[ M-MCL-ME20000/20011 ] Manual.
4. Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
charged ) record results in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
5. At By-pass Switch (Wall Mounted)
(a) Press the TRANSFER button, on the UPS control panel, to
transfer the UPS  to the by-pass mode.
(b) Wait until the amber By-Pass led is illuminated.
(c) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet<(>,<)>
to the OFF position, to isolate the batteries.
(d) Press the OFF button, on the UPS control panel,  to
switch OFF the UPS unit.
(e) Switch the EXTERNAL BY-PASS switch (wall mounted above
UPS) to the BY-PASS position.  The UPS unit is now
by-passed.
WARNING: DO NOT USE THE INTERNAL BY-PASS SWITCH, AS THIS
SWITCH IS NOT INTERLOCKED.
(f) Switch the EXTERNAL by-pass switch to the NORMAL
position.
(g) Press the ON button, on the UPS control panel.  An UPS
start is initiated.
(h) Wait for INV. ON green led to illuminate.
(i) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet<(>,<)>
to the ON position to connect the batteries to the UPS.
(j) After about 30 secconds the BYPASS led will go OFF and
the INVERTER led will illuminate, indicating the load is
on the inverter.  A noticeable change in the operating
noise of the UPS will also indicate the change of load.
6. UPS Unit.
(a) Do not operate the EMERGENCY STOP push button, on the
front of the UPS Panel, unless in extreme emergency, as
damage to the UPS electrical equipment can occur.
(b) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.
[_ _]
(c) Remove the air filter, clean and re-install, ( replace
air filter if necessary )   [_ _]
(d) Check for air flow above grills on top of the panel.
( with fan in operation )   [_ _]
(e) Visual Inspection of capacitors for any oil leaks.  [_ _]
(f) Switch OFF the ""MAIN UPS"" electrical supply.  The load
should then transfer to the UPS, supplying from the
batteries.
(g) Check and monitor, on the UPS display, the load current
(max. 42A per phase 30kVA UPS or max 55A per phase 40kVA
UPS).
(h) Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
discharged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
(i) Leave the UPS supply the load for at least ten minutes.
(j) Switch the Normal electricity supply isolator to the ON
position.  The load will revert to the Normal power
supply.
7. Battery Panel.
(a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
Batteries.
(b) Ensure the Circuit Breaker operating handle, on Panel
Door, is in the upright position and is not tripped.
[_ _]
(c) Measure and record the overall charge voltage across the
CB ( nominally 270V. )    [_ _]
8. Record any result outside normal parameters, in the "" Work
Done "" area of the job sheet.
9.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
10.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
Works completed as above work plan
Replaced cooling fan, rear fan right hand side.

01 W Inspect & report of Egress tunnel features
Before you start the inspection, make sure that you are carrying the
camera, so that you can take any photographs of your observations.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this work.
2. Have the Traffic Control Room turn all lights on.
3. Enter the Burnley Tunnel Emergency Egress Tunnel (EET) at the Burnley
Stairwell and
carry out the following inspections over the entire length of the
EET.
4. Visually inspect the EXIT signs for operation (12 off).  Record on
the form ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 any  EXIT
sign that is not functioning correctly.
5. Visually inspect the stairwell and EET lighting for operation.
Record  on the form
""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374
all instances of three (3) successive light fittings not functional.
6. Visually inspect all signage for cleanliness, damage and or damage
tofixings. Record
on the form  ""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly
Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374 any signage requiring further attention.
7. Visually inspect walls, floors and roofs for ground water leaks.
Record on the form
""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374
any leaks. Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage), LEAK TYPE
(Drip, Spray,
Running), POSITION (Roof, North wall, South wall, Floor).
8. Visually inspect floor for Trip Hazards e.g. raised grates,
accumulated debris, deposits of
leak sealant, water puddles etc.  Remove temporary hazards and
recordall occurrences
of hazards and their location on the form  ""Emergency  Egress Tunnel
Inspection Record  -
Weekly Inspection"" TMF- 3012-OP-0374
9. Visually inspect
(a) and operate all emergency egress doors (e.g. Tunnel to EET - at
each cross passage
and
(b) doors within egress tunnel - for operation and or damage and
(c)  ensure all doors to equipment rooms are locked.  Record on the
form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""  TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the
door location and a description of the repairs required.
10. Visually inspect all drainage and pits for evidence of blockage and
water over the floor.
Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage) TYPE (Pit, Drain, Pipe)
POSITION (North side, South side, Centre).  Record on the form
""Emergency Egress
Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF- 3012-OP-0374
the location and
description of any blockage or flooding.
11. Visually inspect all EET and Stairwell fitments for damage,
corrosion, trip hazards,
obstructions (from walls or roofs) that are apparent.  Record on
the form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the location
and a description of the repairs and or obstruction.
12. Visually inspect for evidence of rodent infestation.  Record on the
form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the location
of any sightings.
13. Remove all accumulated debris from the egress tunnel.
14. On completion have the Traffic Control Room switch all lights OFF.
15. Record in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet any abnormal
parameters found.
Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works.
16. Ensure the form  ""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  -
Weekly  Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374 is returned to the CIVIL team leader or his
representative for
evaluation and recording of new leaks onto the Burnley Tunnel
Emergency Egress
Tunnel Leak Repair programme.  The Civil team leader is to ensure
any
outstanding works are scheduled.
17. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the work."

12 M Inspection & calibration of WIM & TCS Systems
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Access keys for the WIM/TCS controller cabinets are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to accessing the WIM/TCS
equipment.
3. Set up short term emergency lane closure incorporating,
symbolic worker, lateral shift, vehicle arrow board and cones
as per Work Instruction , Traffic Control TMI-3012-OP 00002
and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12.
4. Reference Transfield Procedures TMI -3012-OP-0045  WIMS -
Speed Calibration and TMI-3012-OP-0046  Weigh in Motion
Calibration.
5. Re-calibrate the weigh sensor, using both a 6 axle
articulated vehicle and the Transfield Services street
sweeper vehicle.
6. Re-calibrate speeds using a hand held laser gun. Use the
average of ten runs per lane for each calibration vehicle.
7. At the counting sites, re-calibrate the speed using a hand
held laser gun.  Use the average of ten runs per lane for
each calibration vehicle.
8. The results of test are to be recorded on forms WIMS Speed
Calibration TMF-3012-OP-0361 and  Weigh in Motion
Calibration TMF-OP-3012-0362.  A copy of the results are to
forwarded to the Electrical Electronics Team Leader on
completion of the job.
9. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.  [_ _]
10.Notify the control room  prior to departure from the WIM/TCS
site.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Traffic Control room prior to commencing this
work.
2  This work is to be carried by a sub-contractor under TS
supervision
3. Traffic management as per Work Instruction Traffic Control
TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 11
to be provided by Transfield Services.
In the work done area record:
a. Any deviations from the plan.
b. Lane closure start time.
c. Lane closure finish time.
d. Weather conditions.
4. Carry out a roughness survey of the SL
5. Carry out a computerised and automated logging of visual
defects and video survey of the pavement defects.
6. Carry out a falling weight deflectometer survey along the
route length of the SL.
7. Provide a detailed report on the complete SL detailing the
current conditions of the SL road pavement.
8. Manage automated pavement management database to provide an
on-going and updated data related to the SL pavement and its
on-going operational condition.
9. Record in the Work done area of the Job Sheet the job Report
No. and the date.
10. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the job.

01 W Inspect & report of Egress tunnel features
Before you start the inspection, make sure that you are carrying the
camera, so that you can take any photographs of your observations.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this work.
2. Have the Traffic Control Room turn all lights on.
3. Enter the Burnley Tunnel Emergency Egress Tunnel (EET) at the Burnley
Stairwell and
carry out the following inspections over the entire length of the
EET.
4. Visually inspect the EXIT signs for operation (12 off).  Record on
the form ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 any  EXIT
sign that is not functioning correctly.
5. Visually inspect the stairwell and EET lighting for operation.
Record  on the form
""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374
all instances of three (3) successive light fittings not functional.
6. Visually inspect all signage for cleanliness, damage and or damage
tofixings. Record
on the form  ""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly
Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374 any signage requiring further attention.
7. Visually inspect walls, floors and roofs for ground water leaks.
Record on the form
""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374
any leaks. Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage), LEAK TYPE
(Drip, Spray,
Running), POSITION (Roof, North wall, South wall, Floor).
8. Visually inspect floor for Trip Hazards e.g. raised grates,
accumulated debris, deposits of
leak sealant, water puddles etc.  Remove temporary hazards and
recordall occurrences
of hazards and their location on the form  ""Emergency  Egress Tunnel
Inspection Record  -
Weekly Inspection"" TMF- 3012-OP-0374
9. Visually inspect
(a) and operate all emergency egress doors (e.g. Tunnel to EET - at
each cross passage
and
(b) doors within egress tunnel - for operation and or damage and
(c)  ensure all doors to equipment rooms are locked.  Record on the
form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""  TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the
door location and a description of the repairs required.
10. Visually inspect all drainage and pits for evidence of blockage and
water over the floor.
Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage) TYPE (Pit, Drain, Pipe)
POSITION (North side, South side, Centre).  Record on the form
""Emergency Egress
Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF- 3012-OP-0374
the location and
description of any blockage or flooding.
11. Visually inspect all EET and Stairwell fitments for damage,
corrosion, trip hazards,
obstructions (from walls or roofs) that are apparent.  Record on
the form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the location
and a description of the repairs and or obstruction.
12. Visually inspect for evidence of rodent infestation.  Record on the
form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the location
of any sightings.
13. Remove all accumulated debris from the egress tunnel.
14. On completion have the Traffic Control Room switch all lights OFF.
15. Record in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet any abnormal
parameters found.
Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works.
16. Ensure the form  ""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  -
Weekly  Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374 is returned to the CIVIL team leader or his
representative for
evaluation and recording of new leaks onto the Burnley Tunnel
Emergency Egress
Tunnel Leak Repair programme.  The Civil team leader is to ensure
any
outstanding works are scheduled.
17. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the work."

12 M Inspection & calibration of WIM & TCS Systems
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Access keys for the WIM/TCS controller cabinets are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to accessing the WIM/TCS
equipment.
3. Set up short term emergency lane closure incorporating,
symbolic worker, lateral shift, vehicle arrow board and cones
as per Work Instruction , Traffic Control TMI-3012-OP 00002
and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12.
4. Reference Transfield Procedures TMI -3012-OP-0045  WIMS -
Speed Calibration and TMI-3012-OP-0046  Weigh in Motion
Calibration.
5. Re-calibrate the weigh sensor, using both a 6 axle
articulated vehicle and the Transfield Services street
sweeper vehicle.
6. Re-calibrate speeds using a hand held laser gun. Use the
average of ten runs per lane for each calibration vehicle.
7. At the counting sites, re-calibrate the speed using a hand
held laser gun.  Use the average of ten runs per lane for
each calibration vehicle.
8. The results of test are to be recorded on forms WIMS Speed
Calibration TMF-3012-OP-0361 and  Weigh in Motion
Calibration TMF-OP-3012-0362.  A copy of the results are to
forwarded to the Electrical Electronics Team Leader on
completion of the job.
9. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.  [_ _]
10.Notify the control room  prior to departure from the WIM/TCS
site.

03 M Electrical Inspection and Clean LV Switchboards
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning and
inspections of the Building
and Electrics, prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths,
lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,
Rubbish bags, Filter
material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Cold Gal, Wire Brush,
Thinners, Absorbent,
Rodent bait station
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Equipment Rooms, as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of
the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Equipment Rooms ERE01 - ERE 16 and ERW 01 - ERW 06)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Equipment rooms, Technical
shelters and
Substations.
2. On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans, if
operating (fans not
required to be  switched OFF in technical shelters and appropriate
equipment
rooms).   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including theoperational
tube within
EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all accessible
equipment and
components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus
10°C should be
considered abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of
the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. Raise a new
job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and
components  for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
raise a new jobsheet
for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or his
representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering,
arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and escutcheons
for serviceability and general operation, lubricate as required.
Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
damage.  [_ _]
10. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
required. [_ _]
12. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out
repairsor indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
[_ _]
13.  PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
toindicate abnormal
conditions are to be logged in the work done area of the job
sheet and a new job sheet
raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are not
loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the enclosure and
PLC modules
are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
14. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
accumulation, where applicable.
15. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for operation
and security.  Check
with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of
analarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
16.   Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective
actions.  Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and
thisjob, the job number
of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
Inspect for source of
any water.  Record any details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job
sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and or
stored items.  Remove
any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets, ledges,
cable trays,
cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces,
e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]
4. At equipment rooms (ERE03 - ERE16 & ERW 02 - ERW 05), replace
Absorbent.  [_ _]
5. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  Replace bait station
if bait is near
exhausted.  [_ _]
6. Check telephone for operation.  [_ _]
7. Inspect all metal work for corrosion, clean of corrosion and recover
with cold gal area
cleaned.   [_ _]
8. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved cleaning
materials .  [_ _]
9. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light fittings
,cable trays and
ceilings.  [_ _]
10. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
11. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
12. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.   Record
any abnormal
parameter in the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet.   Raise a
new jobsheet for any
outstanding corrective actions.  [_ _]
13. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.  [_ _]
14. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g. Fans,
Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
15.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this job,
thejob number of
the alternate Job.   [_ _] [_ _]
16. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.

equipment.
3. Set up short term emergency lane closure incorporating<(>,<)>
symbolic worker, lateral shift, vehicle arrow board and cones
as per Work Instruction , Traffic Control TMI-3012-OP 00002
and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12.
4. Reference Transfield Procedures TMI -3012-OP-0045  WIMS -
Speed Calibration and TMI-3012-OP-0046  Weigh in Motion
Calibration.
5. Re-calibrate the weigh sensor, using both a 6 axle
articulated vehicle and the Transfield Services street
sweeper vehicle.
6. Re-calibrate speeds using a hand held laser gun. Use the
average of ten runs per lane for each calibration vehicle.
7. At the counting sites, re-calibrate the speed using a hand
held laser gun.  Use the average of ten runs per lane for
each calibration vehicle.
8. The results of test are to be recorded on forms WIMS Speed
Calibration TMF-3012-OP-0361 and  Weigh in Motion
Calibration TMF-OP-3012-0362.  A copy of the results are to
forwarded to the Electrical Electronics Team Leader on
completion of the job.
9. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.  [_ _]
10.Notify the control room  prior to departure from the WIM/TCS
site.

03 M Inspect, Test & Clean Southbank Interchange PS"
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to leaving
the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for
fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,
Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
2. On accessing the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,
use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
abnormal events.  [_ _]
3. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of
the job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
corrective actions.  [_ _]
4. Reference Manual TOJV Pump Station Operation and Maintenance
Manuals - M-STG-ME-20001. Volume 3.
WARNING:  BOTH THE WET WELL AND THE VALVE PIT ARE DESIGNATED
CONFINED SPACES AND  MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED
SPACE CONDITIONS.
Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry
TMI-3012-SA-0015.
5. At the Local Control Panel
(a) Check the switchboard, situated adjacent to the pump well
for local alarm conditions.   [_ _]
(b) Carry out visual inspections both internally and
externally of the control panel for damage, corrosion,
evidence of insect infestation, ingress of moisture, dust
and grime (clean as required).   [_ _]
(c) Check cable connections for tightness and signs of
overheating and inspect electrical control
equipment.   [_ _]
(d) Record readings of the hour run meters, for each pump, in
the Work Done area of the job sheet.
6. Inspect the pump wet well and the valve pit.
Remove the gatic covers from both the wet well and the valve
pit, enter the well and inspect for general cleanliness and
accumulated debris in the wet well, valve pit and the
condition of the pipework and valves and any evidence of
corrosion.   [_ _]
7. Switch the pump  PSSBP1 AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to
the MANUAL position.   [_ _]
(a) Measure the operating current and compare with the rated
current. ( 170A).  Record the results in the Work Done
area of the job sheet.  [_ _]
(b) Check the cabling to the pump for damage and that it is
clear from possible damage.  [_ _]
CAUTION:  Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
alarm point as the lack of submergence may cause damage to
the pumpset.
8. Start the pump PSSBP1 by pressing the START button.
(a) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work
Done area of the job sheet.  (FLC 170A.).
(b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running, vibration
and abnormal noises.
(c) Observe the level controller readout for variations, with
respect to the pump operations.    [_  _]
(d) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton.  Check the
operation of each non-return valve (NRV), as the water
flow stops.  The NRV should close with an sharp audible
metallic sound, as well, backflow through the pump should
cease within 30 seconds. If a faulty closure is
suspected, the pump should be re-started,  operated
for 2 minutes and the operation of the NRV should then be
monitored again.    [_ _]
9. Repeat steps 7 and 8 for PSSBP2.
10. Repeat steps 7 and 8 for PSSBP3.
11. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
position.   [_ _]
12. Check the operation of the float switches, by removing
circular plate in the wet well roof, then manually trip the
floats by lifting up the High/High float and Low/Low float
respectively with a hook bar and checking that the alarms
are received at the Control Room.    [_ _]
13. When this job falls in either January, February or March.
Lift the level controller sensor out of the protective
conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in the sensor base
of all dirt and debris.   [_ _]
14. Check the operation of each of the isolating valves, in
turn,  by partially closing then fully opening
again.    [_ _]
ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
1. Check the interior and external lighting for operation,
including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace or
repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
2. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient
plus 10°C should be considered abnormal and must be noted in
the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team
Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality.  [_ _]
3. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
equipment and components for evidence of burn marks, unusual
odours and overheating.  record anything abnormal in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team
Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality.  [_ _]
4. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
5. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,
gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general
operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
actions.  [_ _]
6. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
7. Inspect all electrical enclosures internally for dust, grime
and condensation, clean enclosures of any accumulated dust,
dirt and debris.  [_ _]
8. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of
obstructions.  [_ _]
9. Visually inspect systems, mounted within the building or
room(s), for faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged
switches and buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
actions.   [_ _]
10. PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following.
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators
found to indicate abnormal conditions are to be logged in
the work done area of the job sheet and a new job sheet
raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the
enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated dust
and debris.  [_ _]
11. Clean lighting diffusers (including emergency and Exit
lighting) and lens of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
12. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.   Record
anything  abnormal in the Work Done area of the job
sheet.   Record anything abnormal in the Work Done area of
the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his
representative of outstanding actions.  [_ _]
Building (Control Panel) Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the control panel interior for evidence of moisture
ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform
the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check the doors and windows for damage, operation, lubricate
and repair as required and record in the Work Done area
of the Job Sheet.  Inform the Team Leader or his
representative of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
3. Clean and remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of
cabinets, ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.
Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops
of cabinets, tops of cabinet doors, tops of meter escutcheons
etc.  [_ _].
4. Clean exterior surfaces of cabinets where necessary.  [_ _]
5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets and
ceilings.  [_ _]
6. Remove from site all accumulated rubbish and debris.  Empty
rubbish bins and replace liners.  [_ _]
7. Sweep, vacuum and remove all accumulated dirt and dust from
control panel interior.  [_ _]
8. Carry out Exterior Checks of control panel(s).
(a) Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the control
panels for damage, erosion and graffiti.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect (if applicable) the general area surrounding the
control panel for erosion and damage to surfaces, fences,
gates, pavements   [_ _]
9. Remove any accumulated debris from the surrounds.  [_ _]
10. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g.
pumps etc.  [_ _]
(b) All Enclosures closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
11. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the Pump Station and
equipment etc,  in the Work Done  section of the job
sheet and report to the Team Leader or his representative
and raise a new job for any repairs.
12. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done
area of the job sheet.
13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

01 M Check of  Burnley Vent Station Primary Axial Fans
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Works to carried out at non-peak times.
2. Obtain a Permit to Work for entry to substation 3, the
ventilation rooms and to interrupt operations.
3. Inform the control room prior to commencing the work and
brief TCRO's on interruptions and expected alarms.  Maintain
radio contact at all times.
4. Reference manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance
Instructions Manual (M-STG-VE-26058)
5. At the PMCS in the control room.
(a) Check the motor balance vibration readings on the PMCS
for all fans.  If any reading is in excess of 6.5mm/s<(>,<)>
record the result in the "Work Done" area of the job
sheet for further action.   [_ _]
(b) Check the trend log for the last month, looking for
abnormal events.   Any events and or trends that are
abnormal are to be recorded in the work done area of the
Jobsheets and a new job sheet raised to investigate and
correct the abnormality.  [_ _]
(c) Check the running current and record in the "Work Done"
area if greater than Primary fans FLC 349A    Secondary
fans FLC 310A.
(d) Check the drive and non drive end bearing temperatures
for the operating fan motor.  Record the details for
those bearings with a temperature greater then 80°C in
the "Work Done" area of the job sheet for further
action   [_ _]
(e) Record Hours run in Work Done.  [_ _]
6. Access to the  Burnley ventilation station is through the
locked airlock on stairway adjacent to the south west corner
of the Burnley vent stack.  Access to substation 3 is via
external doors adjacent to the Burnley Portal.
WARNING:
DO NOT CARRY OUT THESE CHECK WHENEVER MORE THAN 2 FANS ARE
OPERATIONAL
DO NOT ENTER THE ACCESS AIRLOCK TO THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM
ALONE.  TWO OR MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT WHENEVER WORK IS
BEING CARRIED OUT IN THIS AREA.  OBSERVE ALL NOTICES ON THE
AIRLOCK DOORS.
7. In substation 3;
(a) Switch the Main Isolator for EFE 01 OFF.  (NOTE:- The
order of fan selection is dependant on fan requirements.
A minimum of one fan must be running at any time).  Open
the starter cubicle & inspect the cubicle & wiring
connections.  Upon completion close the door, and return
the Main Isolator to the ON position.  [_ _]
(b) Switch the Main Isolators for all the other non
operational axial fans, one at a time EFE 02 thru to
EFE10 to the OFF position, then inspect the starter
cubicles.  Once the inspections are complete, ensure the
cabinet doors are closed and the isolators are returned
to the ON positions.  [_ _]
8.1 Fan Room Access
(a)  Enter the fan room from the entry stairway after
equalizing differential pressure in the airlock.
WARNING:
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN YOU ARE IN THE FAN
CHAMBER.
DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF THE BODY OR MATERIALS WITHIN 1 METRE OF
AN OPERATING FAN INLET GUARD, AS THE AIR IS FLOWING AT APPROX
35kmh .
8.2 Static Checks
(a) Press the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton adjacent to the
motor.
(b) Check the condition of anti-vibration mountings and
ensure that the rubber bushing is moved freely, adjust if
required.  [_ _]
(c) Examine the grease that has been discharged from the
motor bearings for any noticeable colour changes.  [_ _]
(d) Open the local electrical junction box, inspect the
electrical wiring and connections, inspect all glands for
tightness.  [_ _]
(e) Visually inspect the motor for evidence of condensation<(>,<)>
white powder or similar.  Record in the "Work Done" area
of the Job Sheet any evidence of condensation, powder and
the like and notify the Team Leader or his
representative.  [_ _]
(f) Carry out the following insulation/resistance test of the
motor and heater windings.
(i)  Ensure fan motor is isolated.
(ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor
Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has
been isolated and is to remain isolated.
(a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
(where connected) and bridge heater terminals.
(b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
terminals.
(iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the
motor windings and the winding heater bridge.  Record
the result in the ""Work Done"" area.
(iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
connections and carry out an Insulation resistance
test between this common bridge and earth.  Record
the result in the "Work Done" area.
(v) Remove all temporary connections.
(vi) If the heater was connected on arrival, then
re-instate the heater connections, otherwise leave the
motor winding heater terminations isolated.
(vii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
(viii) Where any insulation resistance reading is less than
2 megohm, then Record in the "Work Done"area of the
Job Sheet and raise a new job for the outstanding
works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
"Related Job" field as well as in the alternate.
Notify the Team Leader or his representative of any
outstanding works.
8.3  Running Checks.
(a) Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton and contact the TCR
to start the fan.  [_ _]
(b) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan
starts.
(c) Check the fan for any abnormal noise or vibrations.  _ _]
(d) Check the flexible connections for wear and leakage of
air.  [_ _]
(e) Check anti-vibration mountings for operation and
structural soundness [_ _]
(f ) Check the operation of the local vibration
monitor.   [_ _]
(g) Record any abnormalities in the "Work Done" area of the
Job Sheet for further action.  [_ _]
(h) Shutdown the fan motor using the Local EMERGENCY STOP
pushbutton.
(i) Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
8.4 Running Fan Check and Lubrication
CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
REQUIRED AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
(a) On completion of  the Static Fan Checks, return to
substation 3, then remove the safety tags, in accordance
with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then remove the fan motor
isolation at the MCC.
Note: Ensure that only one non-operational fan is
isolated at any one time.
(b) Switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF
position to the MANUAL and the  REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL
selector switch from the REMOTE position to the LOCAL
position.
(c) Return to the ventilation room; there start the fan<(>,<)>
that is being maintained, by releasing the local STOP
pushbutton at the fan and then pressing START
pushbutton.
(d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan
starts.
(e) Add Shell Stamina RL2 grease or equivalent, to the
bearings, only while the fan is running.  Ten pumps per
bearing.
(f ) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the
bearings, using the retrieval system.  Examine the
grease for changes of colour.   [_ _]
(g) Check the fan for any abnormal noises or
vibrations.     [_ _]
(h) Shutdown the fan motor using the local EMERGENCY STOP
pushbutton.
(i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
9. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 02.  [_ _]
10. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 03.  [_ _]
11. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 04.  [_ _]
12. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 05.  [_ _]
13. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 06.  [_ _]
14. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 07.  [_ _]
15. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 08.  [_ _]
16. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 09.  [_ _]
17. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 10.  [_ _]
18. (a) Ensure all EMERGENCY STOP pushbuttons are
disengaged.  [_ _]
(b) Collect all tools and materials, leave the fan room<(>,<)>
again equalise the corridor and the fan room pressures.
19. (a) Check the lighting within the fan chamber for
operation.  [_ _]
(b) Repair any light found to be not operating or raise a
new jobsheet for the repair of the fan chamber lighting.
20. Record anything outside normal parameters in the 'Work Done'
section of the Job Sheet.
21. Notify the control room on completion of work.
22. Return to the control room and ensure all fans are
operational.
EMERGENCY OPERATION
In the event of notification by TCR Operators that a tunnel incident has
occurred requiring the
use of fans for smoke extraction.
Note:  Depending on the position of an event, Substation 1 may be
inaccessible.
1. If Substation 3 is not accessible
(a). If a fan that is being checked is running,  advise the
traffic control room that the fan  is running under
LOCAL control. Unless advice is received, from the
control room,  that fan should remain under LOCAL
control.
(b). Vacate the ventilation fan chamber, ensuring the sliding
door to the airlock is closed and sealed.
(c). Advise the traffic control room when all personnel are
in or have left the air lock.
2. Substation 3 is accessible
(a) Ensure all EMERGENCY STOP pushbuttons are disengaged
(b) Return to substation 3 and switch all the fan
REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switches to the REMOTE position

04 M Insp/cln of  SL CCTV cams, EWP, BT & DT Centre lane
Perform this job at the same time as the AIDs cameras in RHS
lane of the tunnel.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Work shall be carried out in designated times approved by the
TCR.
2. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the Centre lane
3. Access to this camera group is:
(a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
(b) Position 0 and 1.
(c) Lane Closure: Centre lane.
(d) Electrical Cabinet Location: Above LHS
4. Set up the lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink  Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 27.
5. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,
Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
6. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
(a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
necessary.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
(c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,
re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
(d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
fastened to the PT300.
WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
(e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if
not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]
(f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
(Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the camera).
Ensure the co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
module and is secure.  [_ _]
7. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
(unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
of the PTZ .  [_ _]
8. Camera and Camera Housing;
WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
ALIVE.
(a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface insect
spray may be applied if necessary to the housing exterior
but must not be applied to the interior of the housing or
to the housing glass.  If ingress of moisture or insect
infestation is evident then carry out steps (d)
and (e).  [_ _]
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
mounts. [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
Rain-X  cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm.
WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.  If
the heaters are not warm, spray the heater thermostat (HTR)
with FREEZE IT, then again check the operation of the
heater.   [_ _]
(e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
9. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
controller.  [_ _]
10. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait 2
minutes then check again.  [_ _]
11. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
attention of the Team Leader Electrical or his
representative.
12. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.

06 M Jet Fan maintenance and lubrication.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1.  Works to be carried out on one jet fan at a time so as to
not affect the operation of total tunnel ventilation
2.  Notify control room prior to commencing work.
3.  Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002
and Translink Operations Procedure PR-RS-OP-IR-020 Plan 27
or 28.
4.  Reference Manual;  Witt & Sohn, Operations and Maintenance
Manual , Certificate 18. (M-STG-VE-29047 )
5.  In associated equipment room switch jet fan AUTO/OFF/MAN
selector switch to MAN and REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL switch to LOCAL
to enable control adjacent to jet fan.  [_ _]
6.  Running visual inspection
WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF BODY IN INLET OR OUTLET
AIR STREAM WHEN FAN IS RUNNING.
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN.
(a) Start fan locally by pressing the START button on the
panel adjacent to the fan.   [_ _]
(b) Check for any abnormal noise or movement from the
fan.  [_ _]
(c) Check the fan unit vibration mountings and safety rods
for loose nuts and bolts.  [_ _]
(d) Stop fan locally with the EMERGENCY STOP button.  [_ _]
(e) If any non-conforming items are found, investigate
further in the static fan inspection.  [_ _]
7.  Static fan inspection
(a) Ensure the local  EMERGENCY STOP button is engaged. [_ _]
(b) Conduct a thorough visual inspection for damage and
corrosion of the silencers, impeller, inlet cone, cable
connections, mounting frame and vibration attenuators.
Any cracks identified in the vicinity must be noted in
the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _] Photo of Cracks found
will be required.
Any damage, especially to surface protection, must be
noted in the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _]
(c) Carry out careful inspection of all supporting hardware
and screw connections, including the eight vibration bracket
installations and the four safety rod brackets.  Using a
torque wrench, ensure that the accessible supporting screw
connections are secured and fixed with the correct torque
settings.  [_ _]
NOTE: Torque Settings
M10 = 37Nm
M12 = 65Nm
M16 = 150Nm
M20 = 300Nm      as per reference manual
in step 4
Bolts with Nylon washers should only be checked for
tightness. Do not torque as nylon washer get damaged
Do not torque anchor bolts in tunnel roof. Check for
tightness only.
(d) If any non-conforming items are found, record in the
"Work Done" area of the job sheet and rectify immediately
where possible to the requirements of the Witt & Sohn <(>,<)>
Operations and Maintenance Manual , Certificate 18.
(M-STG-VE-29047).   This inspection is carried out
externally via the inlet and exhaust ends using a
torch.  [_ _]
(e) Remove cover to motor junction box and check the cable
connections visually for tightness and evidence of
overheating.
8.  Lubrication
(a) Release the key operated EMERGENCY STOP button, restart
fan  locally.
(b) Regrease bearings using grease gun on nipples onside of
fan with  Mobilith SHC220 (TF000021) grease, 10 pumps of
hand grease gun per grease nipple.
Note:  Lubrication should be carried out between 3,000
and 4,000 hours running time when access is available.
Do not over grease.    [_ _]
(c) Stop fan using local EMERGENCY STOP button
(d) Release the EMERGENCY STOP button using a Key.  (Remove
the key)   [_ _]
9.  Equipment Room Control Panel.
(a) Switch fan REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to REMOTE to
enable control at panel
(b) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of the
control panel for damage evidence of insect infestation<(>,<)>
ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as
required).  [_ _]
(c) Check cable connections visually for tightness and signs
of overheating and inspect electrical control
equipment [_ _]
(d) Start fan with START pushbutton on panel and leave
running for approximately 5 minutes
(e) Check ammeter at electrical panel to verify fan is
operating within current limits FLC 100A.  [_ _]
(f ) Using an infra red thermometer check the temperature of
the connections and power cables to the motor.   Record in
the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet if the temperature
recorded is more that 10º to 15º C above ambient.   [_ _]
(g) Record the "hours run" from the Jet Fan hour run meter
on the panel door in the "Work Done"" area of the job
sheet.   [_ _]
Note:  Hour run meters are on the control panels for
non-reversing fans only.
Reversing fans hour run readings are obtainable
from the PMCS screens in the control room
10. Return the LOCAL/OFF/REMOTE switch to the OFF position and
the AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector switch to the AUTO
position.   [_ _]
11. Advise the Traffic control room operator that control of the
fan is returned to the control room.    [_ _]
12. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable<(>,<)>
Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework<(>,<)>
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and bring to the attention
of the Team Leader Electrical or his representative.
13. Notify control room on completion of work.
14. Enter the hours run for the jet fan into the Plant item
screen, then select the usage tab.
