12 M Inspection of Cast Resin HV Transformers
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
All work on High Voltage equipment must be carried out in
accordance with Transfield's procedure number TMI-3012-SA-0102
High Voltage Safety Work Instructions.
1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2. (Cast Resin Dry Type Transformers 1A, 1B, 2A,2B, 3A, 3B, 4A,
4B, 5A & 5B)
The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to
be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
leader or his representative.
(a) Examine and clean all bushings, insulators, terminals,
cable connections, for partial discharge, ingress of
moisture or damage.
(b) Inspect Operation of the Winding temperature sensor.
Carry out functional testing to ensure correct Alarming
and trip operation via the PMCS to the Traffic Control
Room.
(c) Check tightness (Torque test) of all earthing and cable
connections (MEN, Bushings and tank) and inspect for
evidence of overheating of broken strands. Tighten
connections where necessary.
(d) Inspect transformer coils, core and frame, for evidence
of corrosion, dirt, or foreign material buildup.  Clean
coils , core and frame and treat and recoat any surface
rust spots.
3. Record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet, inspection
results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new
Job Sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative.  Include in the Releated Job
field of the new and this job, the job number of the
alternate Job.   [_ _]
The following torque settings are:
Connections of HV connectors - Connections tightening torque
on the HV terminal and the tapping link bars
Bolts             Tightening Torque Nm
M8                    9.8Nm
M10                  19.6Nm
M12                  34.3Nm
M14                  58.8Nm
Connections of LV connectors - Connection tightening torque
for the LV bars (Both Nut and Bolts).
M8                  12.25Nm
M10                 24.5Nm
M12                 44.0Nm
M14                 68.6Nm
M16                 98.0Nm

01 W Mon, m'sure & report  Swan St pump stn flows
The measure of water flowing from the Swan Street pump station
is a measure of all the water collected in the Burnley Tunnel
drainage systems, from both dirty and Groundwater sources.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL
DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0031.
3. The Civil Team leader is to provide a copy of the previous
WEEKLY BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0233 for
detail of the previous readings.
4. At the Swan Street Pump Station Motor Control Centre, record
the Time and the Total flow in kilo litres for the pump
station on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233.
5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
6. Ensure a copy of the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
evaluation on completion  of the job.
Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
in excess of  0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
job to investigate to check the various bay flows for the
reason to the change in water flowrate.

01 W Check & record water lvls
01 W Check & record water lvls in the Batch & Storage Tanks
This procedure can only be carried out by persons who hold a
current HV vicinity permit.
The water management plant toolbox is located inside Sub 2.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Check with the TCR and confirm if there is any discharge from
the Waste Water Management Plant to the sewer in progress.
If a discharge is in progress then disregard this job for
this week.
2. (a) Check the water level in the Storage Tank and record in
the Work Done area of the Job Sheet only if the water
level is greater than 0.5 mts.  Water level is to be ,,,,,,
recorded by using the dip-stick.
(b) Ensure the gatic cover is replaced correctly on
completion.  [_ _]
3. (a) Check  the water level in the Batch Tank and record in
the Work Done area of the Job Sheet only if the water
level is greater then 0.5 mts.  Water level is to be ,,,,,,

03 M Electrical Inspection and Clean LV Switchboards
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning and
inspections of the Building
and Electrics, prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths,
lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,
Rubbish bags, Filter
material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Cold Gal, Wire Brush,
Thinners, Absorbent,
Rodent bait station
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Equipment Rooms, as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of
the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Equipment Rooms ERE01 - ERE 16 and ERW 01 - ERW 06)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Equipment rooms, Technical
shelters and
Substations.
2. On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans, if
operating (fans not
required to be  switched OFF in technical shelters and appropriate
equipment
rooms).   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including theoperational
tube within
EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all accessible
equipment and
components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus
10°C should be
considered abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of
the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. Raise a new
job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and
components  for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
raise a new jobsheet
for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or his
representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering,
arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and escutcheons
for serviceability and general operation, lubricate as required.
Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
damage.  [_ _]
10. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
required. [_ _]
12. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out
repairsor indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
[_ _]
13.  PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
toindicate abnormal
conditions are to be logged in the work done area of the job
sheet and a new job sheet
raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are not
loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the enclosure and
PLC modules
are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
14. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
accumulation, where applicable.
15. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for operation
and security.  Check
with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of
analarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
16.   Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective
actions.  Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and
thisjob, the job number
of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
Inspect for source of
any water.  Record any details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job
sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and or
stored items.  Remove
any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets, ledges,
cable trays,
cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces,
e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]
4. At equipment rooms (ERE03 - ERE16 & ERW 02 - ERW 05), replace
Absorbent.  [_ _]
5. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  Replace bait station
if bait is near
exhausted.  [_ _]
6. Check telephone for operation.  [_ _]
7. Inspect all metal work for corrosion, clean of corrosion and recover
with cold gal area
cleaned.   [_ _]
8. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved cleaning
materials .  [_ _]
9. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light fittings
,cable trays and
ceilings.  [_ _]
10. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
11. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
12. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.   Record
any abnormal
parameter in the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet.   Raise a
new jobsheet for any
outstanding corrective actions.  [_ _]
13. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.  [_ _]
14. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g. Fans,
Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
15.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this job,
thejob number of
the alternate Job.   [_ _] [_ _]
16. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
"

D/T FTS D19 & D21
Went to ERE03 and found fault with EXT213. I rebooted FTS but fault
didn't clear. I disconnected EXT213 at chrome block and fault cleared. i
swapped ext 215 (ERE03 F/Tphone) and asked control room to ring EXT213
and the phone rang. Fault must be in either cable or at phone in field
SM 20/07/14.
Went to D/G F/Telephone found no dial tone. returned to ERE3 no dialtone
at krome block and disconnected field cable, dial tone returned at krone
block. returned to d/g and disconnected phone pairs and reconnected
cables in ERE03 krone block. dial tone was present at dig while cables
were disconnected from 610 socket. found ext ringer was bringing phone
line down.
The ext ringer reconnected phone line to 610 socket and plugged
everything back in. tested dg f/telephone ext 213 to TCR and back works
fine.

06 W Inspect, Meas, Report on DT GW drn pits, V-Notch-pipes
** Prior to commencement Maintenance Crew to be issued white
disposable overalls to be worn  whilst carrying out Tunnel
Drainage tasks.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic
Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
Plans 21, 22, 25, 26
3. Reference:
(a) Work Instruction, DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE
TMI-3012-OP-0025.
(b) Operation & Maintenance Manual - Tunnel Drainage Stage 2
Design Report R-STG-EN-006 Rev 1.
4. Civil Team Leader or representative is to:
(a) Select groundwater and dirty water pits to be inspected
on forms DOMAIN TUNNEL GROUND WATER PIT INSPECTIONS
TMF-3012-OP-0231 and DOMAIN TUNNEL DIRTY WATER PIT
INSPECTIONS TMF-3012-OP-0255 respectively.  Selection
should be with the knowledge of past results and a random
selection including examination of previous inspections
carried out as part of the V Notch and Bay Flow
inspections
(b) Previous inspection forms are to be issued to the
maintenance crew to compare results when carrying out
inspections.
(c) V-Notch Pits 14A, 66, 204 & 237 shall be inspected on
each occasion.
5. (a) Inspect the groundwater pits circled on DOMAIN TUNNEL
GROUNDWATER PIT INSPECTION  TMF-3012-OP-0231.
(i) Use a torch to inspect each pipe and associated pits
for cleanliness and the accumulation of calcites.
(ii) Record the build up of calcites in the pipes and pits
in Millimetres (mm).  When a build up of 50mm occurs
in a 200mm pipe or a 25mm in a 100mm pipe cleaning is
required.
(iii) Record a description of the calcite. e.g. slimy,
milky or hard etc.
(iv) Record the results on form  DOMAIN TUNNEL GROUNDWATER
PIT INSPECTIONS TMF-3012-OP-0231.
(b) Inspect the Dirtywater pits circled on DOMAIN TUNNEL
DIRTY WATER PIT INSPECTION  TMF-3012-OP-0255.
Use a torch to inspect each pipe and associated pits for
cleanliness and the accumulation of debris.  Record the
related details regarding accumulation of silts, debris,
and other foreign materials within pits on the form.
(c) Ensure pit covers are replaced and seated correctly after
each pit inspection.
6. V-Notch Readings
(a) Prior to taking readings of ground water (Right hand side
of tunnel) pit numbers 325, 323, 321 & 316  and the dirty
water (Left hand side of tunnel) pit numbers 142, 139,
137 & 124, ensure the V-notch weir is clear of calcites
and debris.  Clean thoroughly if required.
(b) Use a measuring stick obtain the depth of the V-notch
flow by
(i) Place the stick in the cup
(ii) Remove the stick and measure the height of the water
mark on the stick.
(c) Record the depth of water flowing over the V-Notch weir
in mm on the form DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE - SEGMENT FLOWS,
GROUNDWATER BORE LEVELS & YARRA CROSSING GROUNDWATER PIT
INFLOW  TMF-3012-OP-0204.
(d) If readings differ markedly from previous readings, then
take measurement again to confirm  results.
(e) Note that inspection V-Notch pits is to be carried out
as per step 5.
7. (a) Once V-Notch 323 has been read, then proceed to the sump
pumping room to take a water inflow reading.
(b) Proceed up the exit stairs to the pump control room
(c) Notify the control room that all pumps are to be switched
OFF.
(d) Switch OFF all the pumps (Have an electrician perform
this duty).
(e) Return back down to the sump pumping room and close all
three gate valves
(f) Return back up stairs to the pump control room and start
by recording the sump level, then 10 minutes later take
another reading of the sump level.
(g) Record the sump start and finish level, in millimetres,
on the form DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE - SEGMENT FLOWS,
GROUNDWATER BORE LEVELS & YARRA CROSSING GROUNDWATER PIT
INFLOW  TMF-3012-OP-0204.
(h) Record on the inspection sheet anything out of the
ordinary.
(i) Return all  gate valves to their normal OPEN condition
and switch the pumps back to automatic operation.  Then
proceed with the rest of the readings and inspections.
8. Domain Tunnel Groundwater Bore Level (located between fire
cabinets D16 & D17 LHS).
(a) Remove the DT bore-hole cover, then lower a string with a
weight attached into the bore-hole until the weight
touches the bottom of the bore-hole.
(b) Mark the string with a marker or pen, ensuring that the
weight is just touching the bottom and that there is no
undue slack in the string.
(c) Measure and record the total length of the string (Total
depth of bore-hole in millimetres)
(d) Measure and record the total length of the string that
was submerged in the bore-hole water (Depth of
groundwater in bore-hole in millimetres).
(e) Record the details on the form DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE -
SEGMENT FLOWS, GROUNDWATER BORE LEVELS & YARRA CROSSING
GROUNDWATER PIT INFLOW TMF-3012-OP-0204..
(f ) Ensure the cover is replaced and seated correctly.
9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
10. Ensure a completed copy of the forms
DOMAIN TUNNEL GROUNDWATER PIT INSPECTION TMF-3012-OP-0231,
DOMAIN TUNNEL DIRTY WATER PIT INSPECTIONS  TMF-3012-OP-0255
and DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE - SEGMENT FLOWS, GROUNDWATER BORE
LEVELS & YARRA CROSSING GROUNDWATER PIT INFLOW
TMF-3012-OP-0204. are forwarded to the Civil Team Leader or
his representative on completion of the job and prior to end
of shift.  Civil Team Leader or representative is to record
and sign off each form and raise any actions (job sheets)
for further inspection or cleaning

03 M Maint of Gantry Tolling Equipment
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Carry out the three monthly planned maintenance defined in
the CML RSE Users Manual maintenance schedule, document no.
M-MCL-ET-1225.
2. Perimeter access gate at technical shelter key required.
3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment
and or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to safety
instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 "Working on Gantry Structures
4. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
5. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plan PL-MCL-ET-100001.
Preventative Maintenance No.0301
When carrying out the cleaning of VDC sensors (in 0301),
inspect the area around the connectors for evidence of
corrosion.
If corrosion is evident, then clean the area as described
below.
Where cleaning is to be also carried out, use extreme care
to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter any
connectors.
The Fibre Optic Connector is to be only removed on the
12 Monthly  Cycle (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
Prior to removing any connector or cover socket, clean
surface corrosion and deposits from around connectors,
socket covers and the surrounding surfaces use a tooth
brush to assist if necessary.
Remove the three socket covers (remove only if possible
using fingers) and apply a light spray of silicon to
the three (3) socket covers, replacing and exercising
the threads.
With all caps and plugs re-installed apply a light spray of
silicon to the area around the plugs and caps.
Check for silicon overspray on the VDC sensor window and
clean if necessary.
Where connectors or socket covers cannot be easily removed,
record details in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and
report the fact to the Team Leader or his representative.
0301: Check image quality and
,,,, alignment with CML Clean glass regardless of image.
,,,, Lubrication of mounting bracket carried out on removal
,,,, only.  Lightly spray with lubricant.
0302: Clean external glass of front and rear VR sensors.
Inspect mounting brackets and lubricate as required.
Ensure pins are cleaned and lubricated using silicon
spray prior to installing.
0303: Check VR Illuminator that there are less than 10%
defective IR LEDs,Advice CML if suspect below 10%
0304: Clean front surface of TRX, inspect mtg bracket and
lubricate as required
0305: Clean outside of glass cover of VDC, Replace failed
lamps, Lubricate arms as required.
Inspect VDC arm locating pins and chains. Record any
works required and report any equipment that needs
repair.
0306: Road Markers: Inspect for clarity & Cleanliness.( High ,,
,, contrast between marker & road). (If road markers need
to be changed, inform the Team Leader.)

01 M Inspection & test running of the WL TSH generators
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
Supply to ensure it is operating in the normal
standby-back-up mode.   [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
MODE.
4. Refer to reference manual Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
5.   (a) Check that the generator was left in  "AUTO" [_ _]
(b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuel and water.   [_ _]
(c) Check oil level.   [_ _]
(d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
(e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).   [_ _]
(f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts   [_ _]
(g) Record the battery voltage in the "Work Done" area
of the job sheet. [_ _]
(h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
Physically open the cap, as the gauge could be
misleading.  [_ _]
(j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours
with the last entry.  [_ _]
6. Reference manual, Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP
Electrical Pty Ltd Main Switchboard O<(>&<)>M Manual Section PI
[M-MCL-ME-20016]
7.  (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch on the generator
DC panel to "" RUN "" let the engine run for at least 5
minutes, then turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch
back to "" AUTO ""
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from "" AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" to ""EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST
"" run the generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared<(>,<)>
and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
[_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure<(>,<)>
water temperature.   [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back
to " AUTOMATIC CONTROL" the generator will continue to
run for about 8 minutes before stopping.   [_ _]
(g) Record the hours run, from the hours run meter,  in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet.
8.  (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
9. Fill in the Generator Log Book and record anything outside
normal parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job
sheet.  Raise a new job for any works requiring further
repairs.  Priority High P1.
10.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
11.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
12.Record the Hours run in Mainpac under "Plant" use RH mouse
click then select "Open"      then select "Meter
Readings" in edit mode add the Meter Reading for the
appropriate TSH Generator.
Work completed as above work plan
Hours Run - 9.3
Battery Volts - 13.2
"

representative.  [_ _]

03 M Inspect & Clean TSH Equipment and Bldgs
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the
cleaning and inspections of the Building and Electrics<(>,<)>
prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and
external lighting, Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material<(>,<)>
Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Rodent Bait Station
This job should be carried in conjunction with the Monthly
job at the Technical Shelters
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
electrical installations of Technical Shelters, as well the
cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the relevant
areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Technical Shelters TSH1-6, TSH10-14 )
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant Technical
shelters.
2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere<(>,<)>
use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
abnormal events.  [_ _]
3. At Technical shelters, fill-in the log-book [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation<(>,<)>
including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace
faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of
ambient plus 10°C should be considered abnormal and must be
noted in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all
cables, terminals, equipment and components  for evidence
of burn marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for any corrective action.
Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Inspect the surges diverters where applicable, and either
replace spent surge diverters when less than 80% or raise a
new Job Sheet for works to be carried out.   [_ _]
9. At Technical Shelters,  visually inspect external Lightning
Protection System connections for damage and or corrosion.
Record anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for any corrective
action.  Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is
informed of the abnormality.  [_ _]
10.Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware<(>,<)>
gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and
general operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out
any required repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any
outstanding actions.  [_ _]
11.Inspect single line drawings for legibility.  Record
details of drawings requiring replacement in the ""Work
Done"" area and report to the Team leader or his
representative.
12.Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating<(>,<)>
looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
13.Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally
for dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
14.Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of
obstructions.  Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
15.Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s)<(>,<)>
for faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
actions.   [_ _]
16.PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect  the PLC status and error indicators.
Indicators found to indicate abnormal conditions are
to be logged in the ""Work Done"" of the Job Sheet and
a new job sheet raised to invetigate and correct the
error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g.
plug connections, screw connections for security.
[_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush, ensure the
enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated
dust and debris.  [_ _]
17.Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.
18.Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for
operation and security.  Check with the Traffic Control
Room Operator to confirm the receipt of an alarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of
outstanding defects in the Work Done area of the Job
Sheet.  [_ _]
19.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective actions.
Include in the Related Job field of the new and this
job, the job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of
moisture ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record
any details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and
inform the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings
and or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Inspect the area of the generator in Tech Shelters and air
conditioning unit, for leaks of fuel, coolants or
lubricants.  Clean any spillage and if any leaks are
evident record in the ""Work Done "" area and raise a new
jobsheet for any corrective action required. Inform the
Team Leader or his representative of  these required
actions.  [_ _]
5. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets<(>,<)>
ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle
on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
6. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
cleaning materials .  [_ _]
7. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light
fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]
8. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
9. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
10.Carry out Exterior Checks of Technical Shelters.
(a) Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the
building (if applicable) for damage, erosion<(>,<)>
graffiti.  [_ _]
(b) Visually inspect the building (if applicable) walls<(>,<)>
roof, guttering and and downpipes for damage, leaks
and or blockages, remove any debris or materials
that could cause a blockage.  [_ _]
(c) Inspect (if applicable) the general area surrounding
the building for erosion and damage to surfaces<(>,<)>
fences, gates, pavements   [_ _]
11.Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  replace
bait station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
12.Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of
the job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
corrective actions.  [_ _]
13.Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.
[_ _]
14.Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
(d)  Generators in Tech Shelters to be left in a state of
readiness for operation.  [_ _]
(e)  UPS in Tech Shelters to be left in state of readiness
for operation. [_ _]
15.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this
job, the job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
16.Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
Work completed as above work plan
"

03 M Electrical Inspection and Clean LV Switchboards
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning and
inspections of the Building
and Electrics, prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum

lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,

material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Cold Gal, Wire Brush,
Thinners, Absorbent,
Rodent bait station
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Equipment Rooms, as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of
the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Equipment Rooms ERE01 - ERE 16 and ERW 01 - ERW 06)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Equipment rooms, Technical
shelters and
Substations.
2. On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans, if
operating (fans not
required to be  switched OFF in technical shelters and appropriate
equipment
rooms).   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including theoperational
tube within
EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all accessible
equipment and
components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus
10°C should be
considered abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of
the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. Raise a new
job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and
components  for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
raise a new jobsheet
for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or his
representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering,
arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and escutcheons
for serviceability and general operation, lubricate as required.
Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
damage.  [_ _]
10. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
required. [_ _]
12. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out
repairsor indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
[_ _]
13.  PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
toindicate abnormal
conditions are to be logged in the work done area of the job
sheet and a new job sheet
raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are not
loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the enclosure and
PLC modules
are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
14. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
accumulation, where applicable.
15. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for operation
and security.  Check
with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of
analarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
16.   Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective
actions.  Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and
thisjob, the job number
of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
Inspect for source of
any water.  Record any details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job
sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and or
stored items.  Remove
any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets, ledges,
cable trays,
cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces,
e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]
4. At equipment rooms (ERE03 - ERE16 & ERW 02 - ERW 05), replace
Absorbent.  [_ _]
5. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  Replace bait station
if bait is near
exhausted.  [_ _]
6. Check telephone for operation.  [_ _]
7. Inspect all metal work for corrosion, clean of corrosion and recover
with cold gal area
cleaned.   [_ _]
8. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved cleaning
materials .  [_ _]
9. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light fittings
,cable trays and
ceilings.  [_ _]
10. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
11. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
12. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.   Record
any abnormal
parameter in the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet.   Raise a
new jobsheet for any
outstanding corrective actions.  [_ _]
13. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.  [_ _]
14. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g. Fans,
Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
15.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work

Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this job,

the alternate Job.   [_ _] [_ _]

(d) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection

Team Leader or his representative.  Include in the
Related Job field of the new and this job, the job number

(High Voltage SM6 Schneider Switchgear)
7. (a) Visually inspect the enclosures and control panels for

03 M inspect of LIEBERT AC units mounted within Mezz Lvl
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Access to the Mobile telephone rooms, RRB room, ERE 00 and
ERE01 is via the Grant Street Stairwell.  The rooms are
located on the mezzanine floor adjacent to ERE01.
The Air Conditioners and the condensers are separate units.
3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Unit
4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
vibration.   [_ _]
4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
temperature should be within 2 degrees of the
thermostat setting.   [_ _]
b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
the following steps
(i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
displayed)
(ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
(iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
setting.
(iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
(v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
(vi) Wait until unit cuts out,  and verify that
temperature shown on unit  is consistent with
new setpoint and verify temperature is consistent
with ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
original setting.   [_ _]
d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
point is reached and verify that the temperature is
consistent with ambient using the portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
4.4. Check the filters and replace if necessary
(a) RRB Room and ERE 01 - Filter type Liebert size
650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
(b) ERE 00 - Filter type Liebert size 500 x 450 x
50mm.   [_ _]
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm drain line is
clear.   [_ _]
4.6. Restart unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFFusing the local isolating switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the fan isolating switch.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
Unit.   [_ _]
6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
will collect dust deposits.   [___]
6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
Clear any blockages.
6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
7.0. Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record
the results on form Equipment Room Inspections
TMF-3012-OP-0347.  Ensure the form Equipment Room
Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347 is returned to the Electrical
Electronics Supervisor or his representative.  Raise a new
jobsheet for any outstanding works.
8.0 On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done section of the job sheet and
report to the Team Leader or his representative and raise a
new job for any repairs.
9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

(iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
(v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
(vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that temperature
shown on unit is consistent with new setpoint and
verify temperature is consistent with ambient
(+ or - 1 deg) using portable  thermometer.   [_ _]
c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
original setting.   [_ _]
d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
point is reached and verify that the temperature is
consistent with ambient using the portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary.  Filter type
Liebert size 650x590x75 mm
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
is clear.
4.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.
5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local fan isolating
switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local fan isolator.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
Unit.   [_ _]
6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
will collect dust deposits.   [___]
6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage
problems.  Clear any blockages.
6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and
rubbish.   [_ _]

results on form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347.
Ensure the form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347

06 M Inspect, repair and clean Egress tunnel lighting
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this
work.
2. Have the Traffic Control Room turn all lights on.
3. Check emergency egress tunnel lighting and the lighting of
the escape stairway for operation, repair any  faulty lights
found.
4. Check emergency egress tunnel emergency lighting and the
emergency lighting for the escape stairway for operation,
repair any faulty lights found.
5. Refer to Australian Standard AS/NZS 2293.2 : 1995.  This
standard sets out the procedure to be adopted when testing
and proving the operation of battery backed emergency
lighting.
6. Ensure that no interruption to the normal supply has taken
place for a period of at least 16 hours prior to conducting
this discharge test.   [_ _]
7. Replace fluorescent lamps that exhibit excessive
end-blackening, even when the lamps still operate.   Record
in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet, only those fittings
in which the tubes have been replaced.
FA - 2 x 36w tube
FB -2 x 36w tube (Haz area)
FC - 1 x 18w tube
EM2 - 2 x 36w tube
EM3 - 2 x 36w tube
EM4 - 2 x 18w tube
EX1 - 2 x 10w tube
EX2 - 2 x 10w tube
EX3 - 2 x 10w tube
EX4 - 2 x 10w tube
EX5 - 2 x 10W tube
EXB1 - 1 x 10w tube.
8. Simulate a failure of the monitored power supply for
90 minutes.  Monitor the lights and record in the Work Done
Area of the Job Sheet only those lights which does not
provide suitable area lighting for the required 90 minutes.
9. Restore the emergency lights and exit signs to normal
condition and then check that the battery charger operation
indicator functions correctly.  Record in the Work Done Area
of the Job Sheet only those light fittings that the battery
charger operation indicator does not function correctly.
10. Repair the emergency light fittings to full operation.
11. Remove accumulated debris from light fittings and clean
diffusers of accumulated dirt.
12. Remove all accumulated debris from the egress tunnel.
13. On completion have the Traffic Control Room switch all
lights OFF.
14. Record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet any abnormal
parameters found.  Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
works.
15. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the work.

03 M Maint of the Variable Message Sign
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in emergency lane.
2. Access keys required for Sound Wall Gate, to access VMS 07.
Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,
TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059
Plan 12 or 13 (Short term and low traffic volume).  Vic Roads
approval required prior to doing job.
Access to VMS 6 is from the car park below the elevated road.

and Notify the Team Leader or his representative

mechanical damage, water ingress, condensation or insect
infestation. Also check inside cabinets for tripped circuit
breakers, disconnected wires, burn marks from excessive heat.
[_ _]

rusted areas, rusted nuts or bolts. Cleans with wire brush
and spray with Cold Gal or equivalent. This should be
done with care and to avoid overspray. [_ _]

dirt and clean with Windex or equivalent  and clean rags
if required.[_ _]

of the Job Sheet and raise new Job Sheet if required.

3.  Reference manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance
Instructions Manual
(M-STG-VE-26058)
4. Access to the Burnley ventilation station is through a locked airlock(Key2-LV)
on the
stairway  adjacent to the south west corner of the Burnley vent
stack.
Access to substation 3 is via external doors adjacent to the Burnley
Portal.
5. Ensure the 3 monthly check of the fans, carried out at the PMCS,
havebeen completed.
6. At the MCC in Substation No 3
Select one axial fan to be operational while the maintenance is being
carried out on
the other fans.  The fan selected can be any fan other than the fan
to be maintained
(preferably a fan located the furthest from the fan to be
maintained).
(a) If the selected fan is not running, then have the TCR start the
selected fan.
(b) Isolate the remaining non-operational axial fans, by switching
the AUTO/OFF/MAN
selector switches to the OFF position.  Carry out the
electrical isolation procedures
as defined in the Work Instruction TMI -3012-OP - 0103,  Low
Voltage Isolation
Procedures.
7.  Electrical checks in Substation No 3
(a)  Measure the insulation resistance of the stator windings and
record in the ""Work Done""
section of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
(b)  Measure the current of the anti-condensation. Heater current
isapprox. 1 amp.
(c)  Visually inspect both internally and externally, the control
panel for damage, corrosion
as well as the ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as
required)
8. (a) Enter the fan room from the entry stairway after equalizing
pressure in airlock.
WARNING: HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION SHOULD BE WORN IN
VENTILATION
FAN CHAMBER
(b) Check CO levels in fan room through doorway before entering and
at intervals during
fan checks.
(c)  WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF BODY OR MATERIALS WITHIN 1
METRE
OF AN OPERATING FAN INLET GUARD.  Airflow strength 35 km/h.
9. Static Fan Checks for each fan.
(a) Confirm that both the fan and motor are electrically and
mechanically isolated prior to
commencing any work on the fan or the motor.
(b) Enter the fan inlet cowl via the entry cowl safety grill hatch.
(c) Examine the impeller for
(i) Dirt and foreign matter on the blades (clean if required)
[_ _]
(ii) Wear or damage on the blade tips   [_ _]
(ii) Wear or damage on the blade leading edges   [_ _]
(iv) Loose bolts and or blade fixings at the hub   [_ _]
(d) Examine the electrical cable for security of fixings, damage due
to fraying, scuffing or
similar and for damage at locations where the cables penetrate
panels or
housings.    [_ _]
(e) Check any grease discharged from the motor bearings, since the
last lubrication is not
excessive.   [_ _]
(f ) Examine the discharged grease for any noticeable colour change.
Ensure that the
grease nipples are clean.  [_ _]
(g)  Inspect the cable connections to the motor for evidence of
overheating.  [_ _]
(h) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and heater
windings.
(i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
(ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor
Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has been
isolated and is to remain
isolated.
(a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
(where connected) and
bridge heater terminals.
(b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
terminals.
(iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the motorwindings
and the
winding heater bridge.  Record the result in the ""Work
Done"" area.
(iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
connections and carry out
an Insulation resistance test between this common bridge
and earth.  Record
the result in the ""Work Done"" area.
(v) Remove all temporary connections.
(vi) Remove supply lines to the motor and carry out an
insulation resistance test
on the motor windings, Between phase winding to phase
winding and between
each phase winding and earth.  Record results in the Work
Done area of the
Job sheet.
(vii) If the heater was connected on arrival, then re-instate
the heater connections,
otherwise leave the motor winding heater terminations
isolated.
(viii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
(x)  Where any insulation resistance reading is less than 2
megohm, then Record
in the ""Work Done""area of the Job Sheet and raise a
new job for the outstanding
works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
""Related Job"" field as well
as in the alternate.  Notify the Team Leader or his
representative of any
outstanding works.
(i) On leaving the fan inlet cowl grill hatch, replace the hatch
cover immediately.  [_ _]
(j) Manually check the operation of the Rotork actuator and
associated linkages that
operate the exit dampers, use the local control panel switch.
(k ) Remove any mechanical interlocks blocking the fan operation.
[__]
10. Running Fan Check and Lubrication
CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
REQUIRED
AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
(a) When the Static Fan Checks are complete, return to substation
3and remove the
safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then
removethe fan motor isolation
at the MCC.
Note:  Ensure that all non-operational fans are isolated, in
accordance
TMI-3012-SA-0103, and that the only fan not
isolated, is the fan to be maintained.
(b) Return the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF position
to the AUTO position.
(c) Return to the ventilation room and have TCR start the fan,
thatis being maintained.
Note: The motor must not be started more that four times in
an hour.
(d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan starts.
(e) Lubricate the motor bearings with fresh grease, while the motor
running.
DE = 100 gr / NDE - 120 gr  Use Shell Stamina RL2 grease or
equivalent only.
(f ) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the bearings
using the retrieval
system.  Examine the grease for changes of colour.  [_ _]
(g) Monitor the fan and motor for abnormal noises.      [_ _]
(h) Stop the fan motor using Local EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
(i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
11. On completion, collect all materials and leave the fan room after
equalizing the
differential pressures.
12. In Substation No 3
(a) Remove all safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103,
then remove the
motor isolation for all the fans at the MCC.  Return all
theREMOTE/OFF/LOCAL
selector switches to the REMOTE position,  and the
AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector
switches to the AUTO position.
(b) Check that one fan is operational and no alarms are present
13. Record anything outside normal parameters in the 'Work Done' sectionof
the Job Sheet.
14. Notify the control room on the completion of the job.
EMERGENCY OPERATION
In the event of notification by TCR Operators that a tunnel incident
hasoccurred requiring the
use of fans for smoke extraction.
1. If the fan being checked is operating, advise the traffic control
room  that it is currently
operating under LOCAL control and will be returned to AUTO control.
Stop fan using
the Emergency STOP pushbutton adjacent to the fan.
2. Release the STOP pushbutton .
3. Leave the fan chamber immediately by either the north or south exit
ladders ensuring
that the door to the stairwell airlock is secured.
4. Advise the traffic control room when all personnel are all accounted
for and at the surface
adjacent to the Burnley Vent Stack.
5. In Substation 3 Switch the REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to the
REMOTE position,
as well switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN fan selector switch to the AUTO
position.
6. Switch the operational fan AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch to the AUTO
position and start
the fan.
7. Notify TCR Operators that they have control.
On completion of the job, the ""Hours Run"" detail, for each fan is to
be entered into the
hours run table in the Plant Item.  Select the Plant Item,  then right
mouse click, select
""Open"" and then select  ""Meter Readings"".  Select edit mode and
enter data.
Record Readings Below
Results Insulation Resistance Tests

phase to phase

o earth

01 M Check, Replace blown lamps in the Burnley Tunnel."
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Replace blown lamps in the Burnley Tunnel.  Sodium Lamps
required are 1070665 (TF000377) (150W), 1070666 (TF000378)
(250W), 1070664 (TF000376) (400W) and fluorescent lamps are
1070720 (TF000372) (35W).
(a) Priority given to replace lamps if the lamps in three
consecutive light fittings are not operational.

sheet is issued, priority is to be given to replacing
portal and ramp lighting.

carried out during the planned tunnel closures at six
monthly intervals, in May and November approximately.

and Translink Operations Procedure PR-RS-OP-IR-020 plan 27,
28 or 122 . (27 for LHL and Centre Lane, 28 for RHL and
centre lane, and 122 for tunnel closure).

remove the fuse for isolation.

both ran the same amount of hours.
7. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the Work
Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the attention of
the Team Leader Electrical or his representative.
8. Notify the TCR on completion of the work.

03 M Maint of Gantry Tolling Equipment
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Carry out the three monthly planned maintenance defined in
the CML RSE Users Manual maintenance schedule, document no.
M-MCL-ET-1225.
2. Perimeter access gate at technical shelter key required.
3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment
and or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to safety
instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 "Working on Gantry Structures
4. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
5. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plan PL-MCL-ET-100001.
Preventative Maintenance No.0301
When carrying out the cleaning of VDC sensors (in 0301),
inspect the area around the connectors for evidence of
corrosion.
If corrosion is evident, then clean the area as described
below.
Where cleaning is to be also carried out, use extreme care
to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter any
connectors.
The Fibre Optic Connector is to be only removed on the
12 Monthly  Cycle (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
Prior to removing any connector or cover socket, clean
surface corrosion and deposits from around connectors,
socket covers and the surrounding surfaces use a tooth
brush to assist if necessary.
Remove the three socket covers (remove only if possible
using fingers) and apply a light spray of silicon to
the three (3) socket covers, replacing and exercising
the threads.
With all caps and plugs re-installed apply a light spray of
silicon to the area around the plugs and caps.
Check for silicon overspray on the VDC sensor window and
clean if necessary.
Where connectors or socket covers cannot be easily removed,
record details in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and
report the fact to the Team Leader or his representative.
0301: Check image quality and
,,,, alignment with CML Clean glass regardless of image.
,,,, Lubrication of mounting bracket carried out on removal
,,,, only.  Lightly spray with lubricant.
0302: Clean external glass of front and rear VR sensors.
Inspect mounting brackets and lubricate as required.
Ensure pins are cleaned and lubricated using silicon
spray prior to installing.
0303: Check VR Illuminator that there are less than 10%
defective IR LEDs,Advice CML if suspect below 10%
0304: Clean front surface of TRX, inspect mtg bracket and
lubricate as required
0305: Clean outside of glass cover of VDC, Replace failed
lamps, Lubricate arms as required.
Inspect VDC arm locating pins and chains. Record any
works required and report any equipment that needs
repair.
0306: Road Markers: Inspect for clarity & Cleanliness.( High ,,
,, contrast between marker & road). (If road markers need
to be changed, inform the Team Leader.)
0307: Clean the glass of VSS sensor
0308: Inspect Distribution Cabinet for loose or damaged   ,,
cables. Clean cabinet for insects or moisture.
6. Record in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet any
outstanding works requiring further attention.  Create a
new Job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative of the outstanding works.
Record the New job number in the "Work Done" area of this
job sheet and in the "Related Job" field of both jobs.
7. Notify Control Room prior to departing from the Technical
Shelter."

03 M Maint of the Variable Message Sign
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in emergency lane.
2. Access keys required for Sound Wall Gate, to access VMS 07.
Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,
TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059
Plan 12 or 13 (Short term and low traffic volume).  Vic Roads
approval required prior to doing job.
Access to VMS 6 is from the car park below the elevated road.
3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment and
or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to Safety
Instructions  TMI-3012-SA-0101, Working  on Gantry
Structures.
4. Arrange with the TCR for a Test Message to be displayed on
the VMS.  Monitor operation and repair as required.  Monitor
the LED Arrays and the Flashers for failed LEDS and
record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet if the failed
LEDs exceed 10% of the array.
Arrange a new Job sheet for any outstanding works, recording
the appropriate Job numbers in the Related Jobs  field
and Notify the Team Leader or his representative
of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
5. Carry out visual inspection externally and internally of the
cabinets, sign, external cables and conduits for vandalism,
mechanical damage, water ingress, condensation or insect
infestation. Also check inside cabinets for tripped circuit
breakers, disconnected wires, burn marks from excessive heat.
[_ _]
6. Visually check for loose or missing nuts and bolts, and for
rusted areas, rusted nuts or bolts. Cleans with wire brush
and spray with Cold Gal or equivalent. This should be
done with care and to avoid overspray. [_ _]
7. Inspect the external face of the lenses (for each pixel) for
dirt and clean with Windex or equivalent  and clean rags
if required.[_ _]
8. Note any corrective action required in the Work Done area
of the Job Sheet and raise new Job Sheet if required.
9. Notify control room on departure.
"

selector switches to the REMOTE position,  and the
AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector
switches to the AUTO position.
(b) Check that one fan is operational and no alarms are present
13. Record anything outside normal parameters in the 'Work Done' sectionof
the Job Sheet.
14. Notify the control room on the completion of the job.
EMERGENCY OPERATION
In the event of notification by TCR Operators that a tunnel incident
hasoccurred requiring the
use of fans for smoke extraction.
1. If the fan being checked is operating, advise the traffic control
room  that it is currently
operating under LOCAL control and will be returned to AUTO control.
Stop fan using
the Emergency STOP pushbutton adjacent to the fan.
2. Release the STOP pushbutton .
3. Leave the fan chamber immediately by either the north or south exit
ladders ensuring
that the door to the stairwell airlock is secured.
4. Advise the traffic control room when all personnel are all accounted
for and at the surface
adjacent to the Burnley Vent Stack.
5. In Substation 3 Switch the REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to the
REMOTE position,
as well switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN fan selector switch to the AUTO
position.
6. Switch the operational fan AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch to the AUTO
position and start
the fan.
7. Notify TCR Operators that they have control.
On completion of the job, the ""Hours Run"" detail, for each fan is to
be entered into the
hours run table in the Plant Item.  Select the Plant Item,  then right
mouse click, select
""Open"" and then select  ""Meter Readings"".  Select edit mode and
enter data.

[ 1 ] - Excellent.

[ 2 ] - Good.

[ 3 ] - Fair.

works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
performing it's intended function to the full degree.

signs of deterioration that will require intervention
works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
intended function.

lane closure as per work instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002 and the
TLO procedure PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 17, 18 and Plan 12 for the
left hand side access.
Note: In locations where a rear gantry exists the 400W VDC
lamps are located and accessed via the rear gantry structure.
Note: Any changes made to the closure in Work Done area of
the Job Sheet.
4. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment and
or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.
Adhere to safety instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 ""Working on
Gantry Structures"".
5. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical Shelter.

Preventative Maintenance No:
1201: Inspect electrical Pump set
1202: No procedure to check bolts are tightened.  Visually
check accessible bolt markings to ascertain if any movement,
inspect for corrosion.
1204: Inspect cabinets for cleanliness, corrosion , damage,
evidence of possible electrical malfunction, Inspect for
corrosion, ingress of moisture, insect infestation, damage
and security of all fasteners
1205: Checking VDC sensors and connectors.
The following Task is to be also carried out using extreme
care to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter the Fibre
Optic connectors or cables, ensure sufficient fibre optic
cable is available to allow removal of the fibre optic
connector (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
NOTE: Ensure the fibre Optic Connector remains free of
foreign matter.
Carefully remove the Fibre Optic Connector, clean the
connector body of any deposits. Take care to not touch the
Fibre Optic pins within the connector (if touched or dirty,
clean pins with Fibre Optic cleaner).
Apply a light  coating of silicon spray to a cloth and wipe
onto the Fibre Optic connector body, replace and exercise the
Fibre Optic Connector release collar.
Where connectors cannot be easily removed, record details in
the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and report the fact
to the Team Leader or his representative.
1206: Clean VR Sensor Unit Vent with brush or similar
7. Record in the area of the Job Sheet below any outstanding
works requiring further attention.  Create a new Job sheet
for any outstanding works and notify the Team Leader or his
representative of the outstanding works.  Record the New job
number in the "Work Done" area of this job sheet and in the
"Related Job" field of both jobs.
8. Notify Control Room prior to departing from the Technical
Shelter.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

inspections of the Building
and Electrics, prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum

material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Rodent Bait Station
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Substations along with the attached UPS rooms for the cleaning,
inspections and
maintenance of the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Sub Station Low Voltage Equipment and rooms and attached UPS Rooms  )
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant Sub stations.
2. On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans, if
operating, to
reduce ambient noise.   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. At Sub Stations, fill-in the log-book [_ _]
5. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including
theoperational tube within
EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
6. (a) Visually inspect the Low Voltage (Main Circuit breakers) for
evidence of damage and
or corrosion.  [_ _]
(b) Visually inspect the Low Voltage (Bus Tie Circuit Breakers) for
evidence of damage
and or corrosion.  [_ _]
(c) Check for any external indicators or flags, reset any found
tripped.  [_ _]
(d) Read and record in the ""Work Done"" the number of operations of
the circuit breaker.
(e) Record anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and raise a new
jobsheet for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or
his representative is
informed of the abnormality.  [_ _]
7. (a) Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
accessibleequipment and
components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red
temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus 10°C should
be considered
abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of the
JobSheet and ensure
the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality.  Raise a
new job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
(b)  While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment
and components for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.
Record anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and raise a
new jobsheet for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader
or his
representative is informed of  the abnormality.  [_ _]
(c) Check and listen for relays and contactors that are chattering,
arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and
escutcheons for serviceability and general operation, lubricate asrequired.
Carry out
any required repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
actions.  [_ _]
9. Inspect single line drawings for legibility.  Record details of
drawings requiring
replacement in the ""Work Done"" area and report to the Team
leaderor his representative.
10. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
damage.  [_ _]
12. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
13. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
required.  [_ _]
14. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out repairs
or indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
[_ _]
15. PLC Equipment  shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
to indicate abnormal
conditions are to be logged in the ""Work Done"" area of the
job Sheet and a new Job
Sheet raised to investigate and correctr the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are
not loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush, ensure the enclosure
and PLC modules
are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
16. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
accumulation.
17. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for operation
and security.  Check
with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of
analarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
18.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work

Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this job,

the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
Inspect for source of
any water.  Record any details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job
sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and or
stored items.  Remove
any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets, ledges,
cable trays,
cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces,
e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
4. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved cleaning
materials .  [_ _]
5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light fittings,cable
trays and
ceilings.  [_ _]
6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
7. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  replace bait station
if bait is near
exhausted.  [_ _]
9. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.   Record
any abnormal
parameter in the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet.   Raise a new
jobsheet for any
outstanding corrective actions.  [_ _]
10. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.  [_ _]
11. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g. Fans,
Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
(d)  Generators in Tech Shelters to be left in a state of readiness
for operation.  [_ _]
(e)  UPS in Substations and Tech Shelters to be left in state of
readiness for
operation. [_ _]
12.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective actions.

the alternate Job.   [_ _]

01 W Inspect & report of Egress tunnel features
Before you start the inspection, make sure that you are carrying the
camera, so that you can take any photographs of your observations.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this work.
2. Have the Traffic Control Room turn all lights on.
3. Enter the Burnley Tunnel Emergency Egress Tunnel (EET) at the Burnley
Stairwell and
carry out the following inspections over the entire length of the
EET.
4. Visually inspect the EXIT signs for operation (12 off).  Record on
the form ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 any  EXIT
sign that is not functioning correctly.
5. Visually inspect the stairwell and EET lighting for operation.
Record  on the form
""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374
all instances of three (3) successive light fittings not functional.
6. Visually inspect all signage for cleanliness, damage and or damage
tofixings. Record
on the form  ""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly
Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374 any signage requiring further attention.
7. Visually inspect walls, floors and roofs for ground water leaks.
Record on the form
""Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""
TMF- 3012-OP-0374
any leaks. Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage), LEAK TYPE
(Drip, Spray,
Running), POSITION (Roof, North wall, South wall, Floor).
8. Visually inspect floor for Trip Hazards e.g. raised grates,
accumulated debris, deposits of
leak sealant, water puddles etc.  Remove temporary hazards and
recordall occurrences
of hazards and their location on the form  ""Emergency  Egress Tunnel
Inspection Record  -
Weekly Inspection"" TMF- 3012-OP-0374
9. Visually inspect
(a) and operate all emergency egress doors (e.g. Tunnel to EET - at
each cross passage
and
(b) doors within egress tunnel - for operation and or damage and
(c)  ensure all doors to equipment rooms are locked.  Record on the
form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""  TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the
door location and a description of the repairs required.
10. Visually inspect all drainage and pits for evidence of blockage and
water over the floor.
Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage) TYPE (Pit, Drain, Pipe)
POSITION (North side, South side, Centre).  Record on the form
""Emergency Egress
Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF- 3012-OP-0374
the location and
description of any blockage or flooding.
11. Visually inspect all EET and Stairwell fitments for damage,
corrosion, trip hazards,
obstructions (from walls or roofs) that are apparent.  Record on
the form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the location
and a description of the repairs and or obstruction.
12. Visually inspect for evidence of rodent infestation.  Record on the
form  ""Emergency
Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"" TMF-
3012-OP-0374 the location
of any sightings.
13. Remove all accumulated debris from the egress tunnel.
14. On completion have the Traffic Control Room switch all lights OFF.
15. Record in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet any abnormal

06 M Inspection of shared pathway sump pits & pumps
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate keys and access bollard padlock keys
are  required..
2. Provide signs warning the public of restricted pathway
access.
3. WARNING:  POSSIBLE SHARPS HAZARDS EXISTS.  Refer Work
Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0005.
4. Inspection and Cleaning of  the Bath Tub.
(a) Be aware that sump pits could constitute a confined space
and appropriate safety measures should be taken.
(b) Clean out the bath tub and remove all silt, rubbish and
debris.
(d) Check the pump outlet pipe is not blocked (clear blockage
if necessary).
5. Inspect the Pump Pit
(a) Electrically isolate the pump prior to its removal from
the sump.
(b) Clean out the pump pit and grate, remove all silt,
rubbish and debris.
6. Inspect Sump Pump
(a) Check that the visible parts of the pump e.g. lead,
enclosure, outlet pipe connection are in good condition.
(b) Check that the impellor can move freely.
(c) On completion of the check reinstate power supply to the
pump.
7. Inspect Pump Local Control Panel
(a) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of
control panel for damage, evidence of insect infestation,
ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as required).
(b) Check cable connections for tightness and signs of
overheating and inspect electrical contral equipment.
(c) Check for correct operation of level switch and alarm
light (Flashing Amber).
8. Record any corrective action required, in the "Work Done"
area of the job sheet.

01 M Inspection & test running of the WL TSH generators
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
Supply to ensure it is operating in the normal
standby-back-up mode.   [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
MODE.
4. Refer to reference manual Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
5.   (a) Check that the generator was left in  "AUTO" [_ _]
(b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuel and water.   [_ _]
(c) Check oil level.   [_ _]
(d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
(e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).   [_ _]
(f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts   [_ _]
(g) Record the battery voltage in the "Work Done" area
of the job sheet. [_ _]
(h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
Physically open the cap, as the gauge could be
misleading.  [_ _]
(j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours
with the last entry.  [_ _]
6. Reference manual, Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP
Electrical Pty Ltd Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI
[M-MCL-ME-20016]
7.  (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch on the generator
DC panel to "" RUN "" let the engine run for at least 5
minutes, then turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch
back to "" AUTO ""
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from "" AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" to ""EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST
"" run the generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared,
and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
[_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure,
water temperature.   [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back
to " AUTOMATIC CONTROL" the generator will continue to
run for about 8 minutes before stopping.   [_ _]
(g) Record the hours run, from the hours run meter,  in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet.
