03 M Check operation of the Tnl Emergency Paging System
This job is to be performed in conjunction with the testing of
the Fire Telephones at the Tunnel Fire Cabinets.
The manual announcement should be "The following is a Citylink test.
One, Two, Three, Four,Five, Six, Seven, Eight, Nine, Ten."
The message should last about ten seconds.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Traffic Control room prior to commencing this job.
2. Reference Manual: Australian Sound Service - Emergency Paging
System Manual - M-MCL-CU-20001.
3. Use vehicle arrow board and short term lane stoppage
Translink Procedure , PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 20, 22, 23.
4. This job involves whilst visiting all the odd numbered fire
cabinets to:
(a) listen to manual announcements over the emergency loud
speakers as well as
(b) at fire cabinet B23  listen to an automatic announcement
and
(c) at fire cabinet B45  listen to an ALL announcement.
(d) listen to the announcement, in each case, and evaluate
for:-
(i) Clarity - e.g. message should be clear and
understandable
(ii) Volume - e.g. Clearly hear message, hear above ambient
noise.  A suitable volume should be QUITE loud in the
tunnel.
(iii) Listen and be aware for non-functioning loud speakers
and loud speakers with degraded output.  The speakers
are mounted at 30m intervals throughout the tunnel
Record the result of  your evaluation on form TUNNEL
EMERGENCY PAGING SYSTEM - BURNLEY TUNNEL PA LOUD SPEAKER
TEST - TMF-3012-OP-0365
5. On completion of the Job, return  the Job sheet and Form
TUNNEL EMERGENCY PAGING SYSTEM - BURNLEY TUNNEL PA LOUD
SPEAKER TEST - TMF-3012-OP-0365 to the Electrical/Electronics
Supervisor or his representative for evaluation.
6. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the Job.
Works completed as above work plan

02 W Record Piezometer Readings BT water table pressures
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control prior to commencing the work.
2. Lane closures to access the Burnley tunnel shall be as per
Work Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and
Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 25 or 26.
3. Reference documents:
(a) Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE
TMI-3012-OP-0031.
(b) Melbourne CityLink Project, Southern Link, Operations and
Maintenance Manual Tunnel Drainage Stage 2. R-STG-EN-006
and Transfield Obayashi JV,
(c) Operations & Maintenance Tanked Tunnel Drainage Works
Report PSM407.R34 December 2000 R-SDG-TU-134.
(d) Transfield Obayashi Joint Venture, Burnley Tunnel Long
Term Monitoring of Twin Anchored Slabs.  Report
PSM407.R30 September 2000, R-SDG-TU-130.
(e) Transfield Obayashi Joint Venture Extensometer and
Piezometer Readings Procedures Report PSM500.R11  June
2001   R-SDG-TU-211  Rev A.
4. Location:
Eighty-six piezometers are located along the length of the
tanked section of the Burnley Tunnel.  Forty-three are
mounted on the south side wall, and Forty-three mounted on
the north side wall.  They highest test point is located up
to 3.5m above the road surface on the tunnel walls.
5. Purpose:
The Piezometer test points are used to monitor groundwater
pressures on the outside of the tunnel wall.  The pressure
reading is then directly related to the groundwater head.
6. Carry out Piezometer readings:
6.1 (a) Loosen the bolt on one side of the stainless steel cover
and rotate the cover to reveal the quick connect
pressure coupling behind.
(b) Wipe the quick connect pressure coupling clean with a
rag.
(c) A ladder will be required to reach the piezometers in
the central section of the tunnel.  A second person may
be required to hold the ladder in place.
6.2 (a) Prior to each reading, Vent the Druck digital pressure
indicator using the tap on the hose of the machine to
allow the pressures within the instrument to equalise.
(b) Connect the Druck digital pressure indicator to the
quick connect coupling.  Pull back the sleeve on the
Druck digital pressure indicator connection and then
push the connection of the Druck digital pressure
indicator connection onto the piezometer connection.
6.3 (a) Press the  I/O button to switch the unit on.
(b) Ensure the reading is set to Kilopascals (kpa) and set
to zero.
(c) To obtain consistent readings, hold the Druck digital
pressure indicator at the same level as the piezometer
tip during the reading.
(d) Allow the reading to stabilise, and record reading on
form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL - GROUNDWATER PRESSURE
TMF-3012-OP-0229.
Note that some of  the readings may stabilise in a few
seconds, although some other readings may require a few
minutes to stabilise.
(e) Vent the Druck digital pressure indicator between
readings.
6.4 Record the results on form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL -
GROUNDWATER PRESSURE"" TMF-3012-OP-0229.
6.5 Replace the stainless steel cover and re-tighten the bolt.
7. Repeat Step 6 for the balance of the piezometer test points.
8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet & also ,,
inform the Team Leader.
9. Notify the Control room on completion of the Job.
10. Ensure a copy of the completed form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL -
GROUNDWATER PRESSURE TMF-3012-OP-0229 is forwarded to the
Civil Team Leader or his representative for evaluation on
completion of the job.  Results that are not in accordance
with baseline values would indicate a change in the state of
the groundwater storage.  The operation of the Groundwater
recharge systems should be checked for correct operation.

03 M Inspect, Test & Clean Olympic Park Pump Station
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to leaving
the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths,
lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting,
Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon
Lubricant Spray, Rodent Bait Station
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the Pumps,
electrical installations and Control panel as well the cleaning,
inspections and maintenance of the related area.
B PUMP AND PUMP OPERATION
1. Notify the Control room prior to commencing this job.
2. Reference Manual TOJV Pump Station Operation and Maintenance
Manuals - M-STG-ME-20001. Volume 3.
3. WARNING: BOTH THE WET WELL AND THE VALVE PIT ARE DESIGNATED
CONFINED SPACES AND  MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED
SPACE CONDITIONS.
Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry
TMI-3012-SA-0015.
4. Inspect the Local Control Panel
(a) Check the switchboard, located in Sub-station 5, for
local alarm conditions.
(b) Carry out visual inspection both internally and
externally of the control panel for damage, corrosion,
evidence of insect infestation, ingress of moisture, dust
and grime (clean as required).   [_ _]
(c) Check the cable connections for tightness and signs of
overheating, inspect the electrical control
equipment.   [_ _]
(d) Record readings of the hour run meters,  for each pump, in
the Work Done area of the job sheet .   [_ _]
5. Inspection of pump wet well and valve pit.
(a) Remove the gatic covers from both the wet well and the
valve pit, inspect both the wet well and the valve pit
for general cleanliness and debris.  Clean if
required.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the external condition of  the pipework and
valves for evidence corrosion and leaks.  [_ _]
6. Switch the pump AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the MANUAL
position.
(a) Measure and record the operating current and compare with
the rated (80A) current.   [_ _]
(b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running or
vibration and abnormal noises. [_ _]
(c) Check that the cabling to the pump for damage and that it
is clear from possible damage.   [_ _]
CAUTION: Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
alarm point as lack of submergence may cause pumpset damage.
7. Start pump PSOPP1 (Pump A1 starter) by pressing the START
pushbutton.   [_ _]
(a) Record the operating current of the pump, in the Work
Done area of the job sheet.     [_ _]
(b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running, vibration
and abnormal noises.   [_ _]
(c) Observe the level controller readout for variations, with
respect to the operation of the pump.    [_  _]
(d) Observe that the pump drawdown rate is sufficient to draw
down the water level in the wet well.    [_ _]
(e) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton.  Check the
operation of the non-return (NRV), as the water flow
stops.  The NRV should close with a sharp audible
metallic sound, as well, backflow through the pump should
cease within 30 seconds.  If a faulty closure is
suspected, the pump should be re-started, operated
for 2 minutes and the operation of the NRV should then be
monitored again.  If a  faulty closure is still
suspected, record the details in the Work Done area of
the Job sheet, and report for corrective
maintenance.    [_ _]
8. Repeat step 7 for PSOPP2 (Pump A2 starter).    [_ _]
9. Repeat step 7 for PSOPP3 (Pump B1 starter).    [_ _]
10. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
position.      [_ _]
11. Check the operation of the float switches.  Manually trip
the floats from the valve pit by lifting up the High/High
float and the Low/Low floats respectively with a hook bar
and then checking that the alarms were received at the
Control Room.     [_ _]
12. When this job falls in either January, February or March.
Lift the level controller sensor out of the protective
conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in the sensor base
of all dirt and debris.   [_ _]
13. Test the operation of the isolating valves by partially
closing and the fully re-opening.     [_ _]
14. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the Pump Station and
equipment etc, in the Work Done section of the job sheet
and report to the Team Leader or his representative and
raise a new job for any repairs.
15. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area
of the job sheet.    [_ _]
16. Notify the control room that the inspection has been
completed.
C  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
1. On accessing the control panel(s), be aware of the
atmosphere, use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to
monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
2. Check the interior lighting of the control panel for
operation, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
3. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
and distribution panels.  Use an Infra-red temperature
sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus 10°C should be
considered abnormal and must be noted in the Work Done area
of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team Leader or his
representative is informed of the abnormality.  Raise a new
job sheet for any corrective action   [_ _]
4. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and components for evidence of burn
marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record anything
abnormal in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and raise a
new jobsheet for any corrective action.  Ensure the Team
Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality.  [_ _]
5.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
6. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,
gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general
operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
actions.  [_ _]
7. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
8. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for
dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
9. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.
Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
10. Inspect systems, mounted within the control panel(s), for
faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
actions.   [_ _]
11. PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators
found to indicate abnormal conditions are to be logged in
the work done area of the job sheet and a new job sheet
raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the
enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated dust
and debris.  [_ _]
12. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.
13. Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]
D. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the control panel interior for evidence of moisture
ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the control panel(s) are not obstructed by
furnishings and or stored items.  Remove any
obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets,
ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on
all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops of
cabinet doors, tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
4. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
cleaning materials .  [_ _]
5. Clean dust and cobwebs from cabinets, light fittings and
cable trays .  [_ _]
6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
7. Sweep and vacuum the floor surfaces at the control
panel(s).  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  Replace bait
station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
9. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of the
job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
corrective actions.  [_ _]
10. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b) All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
11. Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]
12. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.

12 M Inspection & calibration of WIM & TCS Systems
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Access keys for the WIM/TCS controller cabinets are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to accessing the WIM/TCS
equipment.
3. Set up short term emergency lane closure incorporating<(>,<)>
symbolic worker, lateral shift, vehicle arrow board and cones
as per Work Instruction , Traffic Control TMI-3012-OP 00002
and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12.
4. Reference Transfield Procedures TMI -3012-OP-0045  WIMS -
Speed Calibration and TMI-3012-OP-0046  Weigh in Motion
Calibration.
5. Re-calibrate the weigh sensor, using both a 6 axle
articulated vehicle and the Transfield Services street
sweeper vehicle.
6. Re-calibrate speeds using a hand held laser gun. Use the
average of ten runs per lane for each calibration vehicle.
7. At the counting sites, re-calibrate the speed using a hand
held laser gun.  Use the average of ten runs per lane for
each calibration vehicle.
8. The results of test are to be recorded on forms WIMS Speed
Calibration TMF-3012-OP-0361 and  Weigh in Motion
Calibration TMF-OP-3012-0362.  A copy of the results are to
forwarded to the Electrical Electronics Team Leader on
completion of the job.

parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.  [_ _]
10.Notify the control room  prior to departure from the WIM/TCS
site.

06 M Inspection of shared pathway sump pits & pumps
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate keys and access bollard padlock keys
are  required..
2. Provide signs warning the public of restricted pathway
access.
3. WARNING:  POSSIBLE SHARPS HAZARDS EXISTS.  Refer Work
Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0005.
4. Inspection and Cleaning of  the Bath Tub.
(a) Be aware that sump pits could constitute a confined space
and appropriate safety measures should be taken.
(b) Clean out the bath tub and remove all silt, rubbish and
debris.
(d) Check the pump outlet pipe is not blocked (clear blockage
if necessary).
5. Inspect the Pump Pit
(a) Electrically isolate the pump prior to its removal from
the sump.
(b) Clean out the pump pit and grate, remove all silt,
rubbish and debris.
6. Inspect Sump Pump
(a) Check that the visible parts of the pump e.g. lead,
enclosure, outlet pipe connection are in good condition.
(b) Check that the impellor can move freely.
(c) On completion of the check reinstate power supply to the
pump.
7. Inspect Pump Local Control Panel
(a) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of
control panel for damage, evidence of insect infestation,
ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as required).
(b) Check cable connections for tightness and signs of
overheating and inspect electrical contral equipment.
(c) Check for correct operation of level switch and alarm
light (Flashing Amber).
8. Record any corrective action required, in the "Work Done"
area of the job sheet.

06 M Jet Fan maintenance and lubrication.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1.  Works to be carried out on one jet fan at a time so as to
not affect the operation of total tunnel ventilation
2.  Notify control room prior to commencing work.
3.  Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002
and Translink Operations Procedure PR-RS-OP-IR-020 Plan 27
or 28.
4.  Reference Manual;  Witt & Sohn, Operations and Maintenance
Manual , Certificate 18. (M-STG-VE-29047 )
5.  In associated equipment room switch jet fan AUTO/OFF/MAN
selector switch to MAN and REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL switch to LOCAL
to enable control adjacent to jet fan.  [_ _]
6.  Running visual inspection
WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF BODY IN INLET OR OUTLET
AIR STREAM WHEN FAN IS RUNNING.
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN.
(a) Start fan locally by pressing the START button on the
panel adjacent to the fan.   [_ _]
(b) Check for any abnormal noise or movement from the
fan.  [_ _]
(c) Check the fan unit vibration mountings and safety rods
for loose nuts and bolts.  [_ _]
(d) Stop fan locally with the EMERGENCY STOP button.  [_ _]
(e) If any non-conforming items are found, investigate
further in the static fan inspection.  [_ _]
7.  Static fan inspection
(a) Ensure the local  EMERGENCY STOP button is engaged. [_ _]
(b) Conduct a thorough visual inspection for damage and
corrosion of the silencers, impeller, inlet cone, cable
connections, mounting frame and vibration attenuators.
Any cracks identified in the vicinity must be noted in
the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _] Photo of Cracks found
will be required.
Any damage, especially to surface protection, must be
noted in the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _]
(c) Carry out careful inspection of all supporting hardware
and screw connections, including the eight vibration bracket
installations and the four safety rod brackets.  Using a
torque wrench, ensure that the accessible supporting screw
connections are secured and fixed with the correct torque
settings.  [_ _]
NOTE: Torque Settings
M10 = 37Nm
M12 = 65Nm
M16 = 150Nm
M20 = 300Nm      as per reference manual
in step 4
Bolts with Nylon washers should only be checked for
tightness. Do not torque as nylon washer get damaged
Do not torque anchor bolts in tunnel roof. Check for
tightness only.
(d) If any non-conforming items are found, record in the
"Work Done" area of the job sheet and rectify immediately
where possible to the requirements of the Witt & Sohn ,
Operations and Maintenance Manual , Certificate 18.
(M-STG-VE-29047).   This inspection is carried out
externally via the inlet and exhaust ends using a
torch.  [_ _]
(e) Remove cover to motor junction box and check the cable
connections visually for tightness and evidence of
overheating.
8.  Lubrication
(a) Release the key operated EMERGENCY STOP button, restart
fan  locally.
(b) Regrease bearings using grease gun on nipples onside of
fan with  Mobilith SHC220 (TF000021) grease, 10 pumps of
hand grease gun per grease nipple.
Note:  Lubrication should be carried out between 3,000
and 4,000 hours running time when access is available.
Do not over grease.    [_ _]
(c) Stop fan using local EMERGENCY STOP button
(d) Release the EMERGENCY STOP button using a Key.  (Remove
the key)   [_ _]
9.  Equipment Room Control Panel.
(a) Switch fan REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to REMOTE to
enable control at panel
(b) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of the
control panel for damage evidence of insect infestation,
ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as
required).  [_ _]
(c) Check cable connections visually for tightness and signs
of overheating and inspect electrical control
equipment [_ _]
(d) Start fan with START pushbutton on panel and leave
running for approximately 5 minutes
(e) Check ammeter at electrical panel to verify fan is
operating within current limits FLC 100A.  [_ _]
(f ) Using an infra red thermometer check the temperature of
the connections and power cables to the motor.   Record in
the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet if the temperature
recorded is more that 10º to 15º C above ambient.   [_ _]
(g) Record the "hours run" from the Jet Fan hour run meter
on the panel door in the "Work Done"" area of the job
sheet.   [_ _]
Note:  Hour run meters are on the control panels for
non-reversing fans only.
Reversing fans hour run readings are obtainable
from the PMCS screens in the control room
10. Return the LOCAL/OFF/REMOTE switch to the OFF position and
the AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector switch to the AUTO
position.   [_ _]
11. Advise the Traffic control room operator that control of the
fan is returned to the control room.    [_ _]
12. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and bring to the attention
of the Team Leader Electrical or his representative.
13. Notify control room on completion of work.
14. Enter the hours run for the jet fan into the Plant item
screen, then select the usage tab.

01 W Mon, m'sure & report  Swan St pump stn flows
The measure of water flowing from the Swan Street pump station
is a measure of all the water collected in the Burnley Tunnel
drainage systems, from both dirty and Groundwater sources.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL
DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0031.
3. The Civil Team leader is to provide a copy of the previous
WEEKLY BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0233 for
detail of the previous readings.
4. At the Swan Street Pump Station Motor Control Centre, record
the Time and the Total flow in kilo litres for the pump
station on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233.
5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
6. Ensure a copy of the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
evaluation on completion  of the job.
Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
in excess of  0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
job to investigate to check the various bay flows for the
reason to the change in water flowrate.

04 M Insp/cln of  WL CCTV cams, EWP, emerg lane & Grdn bed"
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the emergency
lane or entering the garden bed area.
2. Access to this camera group is:
(a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
(b) Position 0 and 1.
(c) Lane Closure: Emergency Lane or on Garden Bed.
(d) Electrical Cabinet Location:
WL Tollway - exception CCAM 526 & 542 are behind the
noise wall.
SL Tollway - exception CCAM 914 & 915 are behind the
noise wall.
3. Set up the lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink  Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12, 13, 14, 143.
4. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,
Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
(a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
necessary.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
(c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,
re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
(d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
fastened to the PT300.
WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
(e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if
not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]
(f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
the signal from the camera using the WFM 90 meter.
(Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the
camera).
Ensure the   co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
module and is secure.  [_ _]
6. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
(unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
of the PTZ .  [_ _]
7. Camera and Camera Housing;
WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
ALIVE.
(a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation.
Surface insect spray may be applied if necessary to the
housing exterior but must not be applied to the interior
of the housing or to the housing glass.  If ingress of
moisture or insect infestation is evident then carry out
steps (d) and (e).  [_ _]
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
mounts. [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
Rain-X  cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm.
WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.
If the heaters are not warm, spray the heater
thermostat (HTR) with FREEZE IT, then again check the
operation of the heater. [_ _]
(e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
8. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
controller.   [_ _]
9. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait 2
minutes then check again.  [_ _]
10.On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.

03 M Inspect & Clean TSH Equipment and Bldgs
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the
cleaning and inspections of the Building and Electrics<(>,<)>
prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and
external lighting, Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material<(>,<)>
Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Rodent Bait Station
This job should be carried in conjunction with the Monthly
job at the Technical Shelters
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
electrical installations of Technical Shelters, as well the
cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the relevant
areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Technical Shelters TSH1-6, TSH10-14 )
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant Technical
shelters.
2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere<(>,<)>
use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
abnormal events.  [_ _]
3. At Technical shelters, fill-in the log-book [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation<(>,<)>
including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace
faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of
ambient plus 10°C should be considered abnormal and must be
noted in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all
cables, terminals, equipment and components  for evidence
of burn marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for any corrective action.
Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Inspect the surges diverters where applicable, and either
replace spent surge diverters when less than 80% or raise a
new Job Sheet for works to be carried out.   [_ _]
9. At Technical Shelters,  visually inspect external Lightning
Protection System connections for damage and or corrosion.
Record anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for any corrective
action.  Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is
informed of the abnormality.  [_ _]
10.Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware<(>,<)>
gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and
general operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out
any required repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any
outstanding actions.  [_ _]
11.Inspect single line drawings for legibility.  Record
details of drawings requiring replacement in the ""Work
Done"" area and report to the Team leader or his
representative.
12.Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating<(>,<)>
looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
13.Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally
for dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
14.Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of
obstructions.  Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
15.Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s)<(>,<)>
for faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
actions.   [_ _]
16.PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect  the PLC status and error indicators.
Indicators found to indicate abnormal conditions are
to be logged in the ""Work Done"" of the Job Sheet and
a new job sheet raised to invetigate and correct the
error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g.
plug connections, screw connections for security.
[_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush, ensure the
enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated
dust and debris.  [_ _]
17.Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.
18.Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for
operation and security.  Check with the Traffic Control
Room Operator to confirm the receipt of an alarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of
outstanding defects in the Work Done area of the Job
Sheet.  [_ _]
19.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective actions.
Include in the Related Job field of the new and this
job, the job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of
moisture ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record
any details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and
inform the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings
and or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Inspect the area of the generator in Tech Shelters and air
conditioning unit, for leaks of fuel, coolants or
lubricants.  Clean any spillage and if any leaks are
evident record in the ""Work Done "" area and raise a new
jobsheet for any corrective action required. Inform the
Team Leader or his representative of  these required
actions.  [_ _]
5. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets<(>,<)>
ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle
on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
6. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
cleaning materials .  [_ _]
7. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light
fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]
8. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
9. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
10.Carry out Exterior Checks of Technical Shelters.
(a) Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the
building (if applicable) for damage, erosion<(>,<)>
graffiti.  [_ _]
(b) Visually inspect the building (if applicable) walls<(>,<)>
roof, guttering and and downpipes for damage, leaks
and or blockages, remove any debris or materials
that could cause a blockage.  [_ _]
(c) Inspect (if applicable) the general area surrounding
the building for erosion and damage to surfaces<(>,<)>
fences, gates, pavements   [_ _]
11.Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  replace
bait station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
12.Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of
the job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
corrective actions.  [_ _]
13.Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.
[_ _]
14.Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
(d)  Generators in Tech Shelters to be left in a state of
readiness for operation.  [_ _]
(e)  UPS in Tech Shelters to be left in state of readiness
for operation. [_ _]
15.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this
job, the job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
16.Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
Work completed as above work plan
"

VMSW2B-COMMS FAILURE
12.09.2014 06:13:43 Brenton ROWE (ROWEB)
VMSW2B-COMMS FAILURE
* 12.09.2014 06:13:43 Brenton ROWE (ROWEB)
* VMSW2B-COMMS FAILURE
VMSW2B-COMMS FAILURE
Investigated fault, checked sign connected up with laptop could control
sign and send messages to sign through laptop and interface card. TCR
couldn't control sign still. investigated comms, found terminal server
EKI1522 not communicating and seemed to be faulty.
Contacted RSE to ping (Malcolm) sign he informed it could be pinged but
he couldn't connect to it and suspected it was faulty. Removed and
obtained new server from w/shop got Malcolm to program. re-installed on
site tested but still not working informed Malcolm and still not
working. he checked setting and found some settings wrong. adjusted then
he could log onto and control sign from VMs FEC but not from CCCS.
Assisted Malcolm and found port from CCCS to VMS FEC had locked up he
said he did what he called a tcp dump which in turn cleared fault on
sign. tcr could now control sign. all working ok all faults cleared.

03 M Inspection of Thytec UPS system in WL TSH's
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
3. Refer to Manual: Thytec 30KVA UPS 12 Pulse
[ M-MCL-ME20000/20011 ] Manual.
4. Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
charged ) record results in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
5. At By-pass Switch (Wall Mounted)
(a) Press the TRANSFER button, on the UPS control panel, to
transfer the UPS  to the by-pass mode.
(b) Wait until the amber By-Pass led is illuminated.
(c) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet<(>,<)>
to the OFF position, to isolate the batteries.
(d) Press the OFF button, on the UPS control panel,  to
switch OFF the UPS unit.
(e) Switch the EXTERNAL BY-PASS switch (wall mounted above
UPS) to the BY-PASS position.  The UPS unit is now
by-passed.
WARNING: DO NOT USE THE INTERNAL BY-PASS SWITCH, AS THIS
SWITCH IS NOT INTERLOCKED.
(f) Switch the EXTERNAL by-pass switch to the NORMAL
position.
(g) Press the ON button, on the UPS control panel.  An UPS
start is initiated.
(h) Wait for INV. ON green led to illuminate.
(i) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet<(>,<)>
to the ON position to connect the batteries to the UPS.
(j) After about 30 secconds the BYPASS led will go OFF and
the INVERTER led will illuminate, indicating the load is
on the inverter.  A noticeable change in the operating
noise of the UPS will also indicate the change of load.
6. UPS Unit.
(a) Do not operate the EMERGENCY STOP push button, on the
front of the UPS Panel, unless in extreme emergency, as
damage to the UPS electrical equipment can occur.
(b) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.
[_ _]
(c) Remove the air filter, clean and re-install, ( replace
air filter if necessary )   [_ _]
(d) Check for air flow above grills on top of the panel.
( with fan in operation )   [_ _]
(e) Visual Inspection of capacitors for any oil leaks.  [_ _]
(f) Switch OFF the ""MAIN UPS"" electrical supply.  The load
should then transfer to the UPS, supplying from the
batteries.
(g) Check and monitor, on the UPS display, the load current
(max. 42A per phase 30kVA UPS or max 55A per phase 40kVA
UPS).
(h) Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
discharged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
(i) Leave the UPS supply the load for at least ten minutes.
(j) Switch the Normal electricity supply isolator to the ON
position.  The load will revert to the Normal power
supply.
7. Battery Panel.
(a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
Batteries.
(b) Ensure the Circuit Breaker operating handle, on Panel
Door, is in the upright position and is not tripped.
[_ _]
(c) Measure and record the overall charge voltage across the
CB ( nominally 270V. )    [_ _]
8. Record any result outside normal parameters, in the "" Work
Done "" area of the job sheet.
9.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
10.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
Works completed as above work plan
Neil Cottee/ Thytec 16/9/14
"

06 M Jet Fan maintenance and lubrication.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1.  Works to be carried out on one jet fan at a time so as to
not affect the operation of total tunnel ventilation
2.  Notify control room prior to commencing work.
3.  Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002
and Translink Operations Procedure PR-RS-OP-IR-020 Plan 27
or 28.
4.  Reference Manual;  Witt & Sohn, Operations and Maintenance
Manual , Certificate 18. (M-STG-VE-29047 )
5.  In associated equipment room switch jet fan AUTO/OFF/MAN
selector switch to MAN and REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL switch to LOCAL
to enable control adjacent to jet fan.  [_ _]
6.  Running visual inspection
WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF BODY IN INLET OR OUTLET
AIR STREAM WHEN FAN IS RUNNING.
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN.
(a) Start fan locally by pressing the START button on the
panel adjacent to the fan.   [_ _]
(b) Check for any abnormal noise or movement from the
fan.  [_ _]
(c) Check the fan unit vibration mountings and safety rods
for loose nuts and bolts.  [_ _]
(d) Stop fan locally with the EMERGENCY STOP button.  [_ _]
(e) If any non-conforming items are found, investigate
further in the static fan inspection.  [_ _]
7.  Static fan inspection
(a) Ensure the local  EMERGENCY STOP button is engaged. [_ _]
(b) Conduct a thorough visual inspection for damage and
corrosion of the silencers, impeller, inlet cone, cable
connections, mounting frame and vibration attenuators.
Any cracks identified in the vicinity must be noted in
the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _] Photo of Cracks found
will be required.
Any damage, especially to surface protection, must be
noted in the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _]
(c) Carry out careful inspection of all supporting hardware
and screw connections, including the eight vibration bracket
installations and the four safety rod brackets.  Using a
torque wrench, ensure that the accessible supporting screw
connections are secured and fixed with the correct torque
settings.  [_ _]
NOTE: Torque Settings
M10 = 37Nm
M12 = 65Nm
M16 = 150Nm
M20 = 300Nm      as per reference manual
in step 4
Bolts with Nylon washers should only be checked for
tightness. Do not torque as nylon washer get damaged
Do not torque anchor bolts in tunnel roof. Check for
tightness only.
(d) If any non-conforming items are found, record in the
"Work Done" area of the job sheet and rectify immediately
where possible to the requirements of the Witt & Sohn <(>,<)>
Operations and Maintenance Manual , Certificate 18.
(M-STG-VE-29047).   This inspection is carried out
externally via the inlet and exhaust ends using a
torch.  [_ _]
(e) Remove cover to motor junction box and check the cable
connections visually for tightness and evidence of
overheating.
8.  Lubrication
(a) Release the key operated EMERGENCY STOP button, restart
fan  locally.
(b) Regrease bearings using grease gun on nipples onside of
fan with  Mobilith SHC220 (TF000021) grease, 10 pumps of
hand grease gun per grease nipple.
Note:  Lubrication should be carried out between 3,000
and 4,000 hours running time when access is available.
Do not over grease.    [_ _]
(c) Stop fan using local EMERGENCY STOP button
(d) Release the EMERGENCY STOP button using a Key.  (Remove
the key)   [_ _]
9.  Equipment Room Control Panel.
(a) Switch fan REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to REMOTE to
enable control at panel
(b) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of the
control panel for damage evidence of insect infestation<(>,<)>
ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as
required).  [_ _]
(c) Check cable connections visually for tightness and signs
of overheating and inspect electrical control
equipment [_ _]
(d) Start fan with START pushbutton on panel and leave
running for approximately 5 minutes
(e) Check ammeter at electrical panel to verify fan is
operating within current limits FLC 100A.  [_ _]
(f ) Using an infra red thermometer check the temperature of
the connections and power cables to the motor.   Record in
the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet if the temperature
recorded is more that 10º to 15º C above ambient.   [_ _]
(g) Record the "hours run" from the Jet Fan hour run meter
on the panel door in the "Work Done"" area of the job
sheet.   [_ _]
Note:  Hour run meters are on the control panels for
non-reversing fans only.
Reversing fans hour run readings are obtainable
from the PMCS screens in the control room
10. Return the LOCAL/OFF/REMOTE switch to the OFF position and
the AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector switch to the AUTO
position.   [_ _]
11. Advise the Traffic control room operator that control of the
fan is returned to the control room.    [_ _]
12. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable<(>,<)>
Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework<(>,<)>
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and bring to the attention
of the Team Leader Electrical or his representative.
13. Notify control room on completion of work.
14. Enter the hours run for the jet fan into the Plant item
screen, then select the usage tab.

03 M Electrical Inspection and Clean LV Switchboards
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning and
inspections of the Building
and Electrics, prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths,
lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,

material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Cold Gal, Wire Brush,

Rodent bait station
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Equipment Rooms, as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of
the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Equipment Rooms ERE01 - ERE 16 and ERW 01 - ERW 06)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Equipment rooms, Technical
shelters and
Substations.
2. On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans, if
operating (fans not
required to be  switched OFF in technical shelters and appropriate
equipment
rooms).   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including theoperational
tube within
EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all accessible
equipment and
components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus
10°C should be
considered abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of
the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. Raise a new
job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and
components  for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
raise a new jobsheet
for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or his
representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering,
arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and escutcheons
for serviceability and general operation, lubricate as required.
Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
damage.  [_ _]
10. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
required. [_ _]
12. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out
repairsor indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
[_ _]
13.  PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
toindicate abnormal
conditions are to be logged in the work done area of the job
sheet and a new job sheet
raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are not
loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the enclosure and
PLC modules
are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
14. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
accumulation, where applicable.
15. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for operation
and security.  Check
with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of
analarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
16.   Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective
actions.  Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and
thisjob, the job number
of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
Inspect for source of
any water.  Record any details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job
sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and or
stored items.  Remove
any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets, ledges,
cable trays,
cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces,
e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]
4. At equipment rooms (ERE03 - ERE16 & ERW 02 - ERW 05), replace
Absorbent.  [_ _]
5. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  Replace bait station
if bait is near
exhausted.  [_ _]
6. Check telephone for operation.  [_ _]
7. Inspect all metal work for corrosion, clean of corrosion and recover
with cold gal area
cleaned.   [_ _]
8. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved cleaning
materials .  [_ _]
9. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light fittings
,cable trays and
ceilings.  [_ _]
10. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
11. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
12. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.   Record
any abnormal
parameter in the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet.   Raise a
new jobsheet for any
outstanding corrective actions.  [_ _]
13. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.  [_ _]
14. Prior to leaving the site ensure:

(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]

Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any

Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this job,

the alternate Job.   [_ _] [_ _]

01 M Inspection & test running of the WL TSH generators
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
Supply to ensure it is operating in the normal
standby-back-up mode.   [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
MODE.
4. Refer to reference manual Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
5.   (a) Check that the generator was left in  "AUTO" [_ _]
(b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuel and water.   [_ _]
(c) Check oil level.   [_ _]
(d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
(e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).   [_ _]
(f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts   [_ _]
(g) Record the battery voltage in the "Work Done" area
of the job sheet. [_ _]
(h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
Physically open the cap, as the gauge could be
misleading.  [_ _]
(j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours
with the last entry.  [_ _]
6. Reference manual, Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP
Electrical Pty Ltd Main Switchboard O<(>&<)>M Manual Section PI
[M-MCL-ME-20016]
7.  (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch on the generator
DC panel to "" RUN "" let the engine run for at least 5
minutes, then turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch
back to "" AUTO ""
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from "" AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" to ""EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST
"" run the generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared<(>,<)>
and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
[_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure<(>,<)>
water temperature.   [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back
to " AUTOMATIC CONTROL" the generator will continue to
run for about 8 minutes before stopping.   [_ _]
(g) Record the hours run, from the hours run meter,  in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet.
8.  (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
9. Fill in the Generator Log Book and record anything outside
normal parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job
sheet.  Raise a new job for any works requiring further
repairs.  Priority High P1.
10.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
11.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
12.Record the Hours run in Mainpac under "Plant" use RH mouse
click then select "Open"      then select "Meter
Readings" in edit mode add the Meter Reading for the
appropriate TSH Generator.
Work completed as above work plan
Hours Run - 86.2
Battery Volts - 13.2
"

01 M Check of Swan St. Vent Station Axial Fans
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Works to carried out between 21:00 & 05:00. Three days notice of
pending works is to be
given verbally to the TLO Maintenance Manager.
2. Obtain a Permit to Work for entry to substation 3, the ventilation
rooms and to interrupt
operations. TLO Maintenance Manager to sign Work Permit and the works
are to be carried
out only within times specified on the Work permit..
3. Inform the control room prior to commencing the work and brief
TCRO'son interruptions
and expected alarms.  Maintain radio contact at all times.
4. Reference manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance
Instructions Manual
(M-STG-VE-26060).
5. At the PMCS in the control room.
(a) Check the motor balance vibration readings on the PMCS for all
fans.  If any reading is in
excess of 6.5mm/s, record the result in the ""Work Done"" area
of the job sheet for further
action.   [_ _]
(b) Check the trend log for the last month, looking for abnormal
events.  Record any
abnormalities in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job sheet.
report any events and or trends
to the Maintenance Superintendant that may suggest some
abnormal function.  [_ _]
(c) Check the running current and record in the ""Work Done"" area
if greater than FLC 403A.
(d) Check the drive and non drive end bearing temperatures for the
operating fan motor.
Record the details for those bearings with a temperature
greater then 80°C in the ""Work
Done"" area of the job sheet  for further action.  [_ _]
(e) Check the CO levels in the tunnel and the Swan St Vent Stack on
the PMCS screen in
control room and ensure less than 30 ppm prior to commencing
work.  [_ _]
6. Access to the Swan St. ventilation station is through double locked
doors at rear
of  Substation 2 and then by a ladder down the shaft.
(a) The fan inlet is on Level 4,
(b) The fan motor is accessed from level 5,
(c) The fan damper is accessed from level 6.
(d) Substation 2 can be accessed from ground level at Swan St.
WARNING:
DO NOT CARRY OUT THESE CHECK WHENEVER MORE THAN 2 FANS ARE
OPERATIONAL
DO NOT ENTER THE ACCESS AIRLOCK TO THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM ALONE.
TWO
OR MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT WHENEVER WORK IS BEING CARRIED OUT IN
THIS AREA.
OBSERVE ALL NOTICES ON THE AIRLOCK DOORS.
DO NOT ENTER A SMOKE DUCT UNLESS A PERMIT HAS BEEN OBTAINED FOR
WORKIN
THIS AREA.  TO CROSS A SMOKE DUCT A SERVICE LADDER MUST BE USED AT
ALL
TIMES.
7. In substation 2;
(a) Switch the Main Isolator for SFE 01 OFF.  (NOTE:- The order of
fan selection is dependant
on fan requirements.  A minimum of one fan must be running at
any time).  Open the
starter cubicle & inspect the cubicle & wiring connections.
Upon completion close the
door, and return the Main Isolator to the ON position.  [_ _]
(b) Switch the Main Isolators for all the other non operational axial
fans, one at a time SFE 02
and 03 to the OFF position, then inspect the starter cubicles.
Once the inspections
are complete, ensure the cabinet doors are closed and the
isolators are returned to the
ON positions.  [_ _]
8.1 Fan Room Access
(a)  Enter the fan room from the entry stairway after equalizing
differential pressure in
the airlock.
WARNING:
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN YOU ARE IN THE FAN
CHAMBER.
DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF THE BODY OR MATERIALS WITHIN 1 METRE OF AN
OPERATING
FAN INLET GUARD, AS THE AIR IS FLOWING AT APPROX 35kmh.
8.2 Static Checks
(a) Press the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton adjacent to the motor.
(b) Check the condition of anti-vibration mountings and ensure that
the rubber bushing
is moved freely, adjust if required.  [_ _]
(c) Examine the grease that has been discharged from the motor
bearings for any noticeable
colour changes.  [_ _]
(d) Open the local electrical junction box, inspect the electrical
wiring and connections,
inspect all glands for tightness.  [_ _]
(e) Visually inspect the motor for evidence of condensation,
whitepowder or similar.
Record in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet any
evidence of condensation,
powder and the like and notify the Team Leader or his
representative.  [_ _]
(f) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and
heater windings.
(i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
(ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor
Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has been
isolated and is to remain
isolated.
(a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
(where connected) and
bridge heater terminals.
(b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
terminals.
(iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the
motorwindings and the
winding heater bridge.  Record the result in the ""Work
Done"" area.
(iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
connections and carry out
an Insulation resistance test between this common bridge
and earth.  Record
the result in the ""Work Done"" area.
(v) Remove all temporary connections.
(vi) If the heater was connected on arrival, then re-instate
theheater connections,
otherwise leave the motor winding heater terminations
isolated.
(vii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
(viii) Where any insulation resistance reading is less than 2
megohm, then Record
in the ""Work Done""area of the Job Sheet and raise a
new job for the outstanding
works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
""Related Job"" field as well
as in the alternate.  Notify the Team Leader or his
representative of any
outstanding works.
8.3  Running Checks.
(a) Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton and contact the TCR to startthe
fan.  [_ _]
(b) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan starts.
(c) Check the fan for any abnormal noise or vibrations.     [_ _]
(d) Check the flexible connections for wear and leakage of air.  [_ _]
(e) Check anti-vibration mountings for operation and structural
soundness [_ _]
(f ) Check the operation of the local vibration monitor.   [_ _]
(g) Record any abnormalities in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job
Sheet for further action.  [_ _]
(h) Shutdown the fan motor using the Local EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
(i) Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
8.4 Running Fan Check and Lubrication
CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
REQUIRED
AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
(a) On completion of  the Static Fan Checks, return to
substation2, then remove the
safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then remove
the fan motor isolation
at  the MCC.
Note:  Ensure that only one non-operational fan is isolated at
any one time.
(b) Switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF
positionto the MANUAL and
the  REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch from the REMOTE position
to the LOCAL
position.
(c) Return to the ventilation room; there start the fan, that is
being maintained,  by                           releasing th e local
STOP pushbutton at the fan and then pressing START
pushbutton.
(d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan
starts.
(e) Add Shell Stamina RL2 grease or equivalent, to the bearings,
only while the fan is
running.  Ten pumps per bearing.
(f ) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the
bearings, using the retrieval
system.  Examine the grease for changes of colour.   [_ _]
(g) Check the fan for any abnormal noises or vibrations.     [_
_]
(h) Shutdown the fan motor using the local EMERGENCY STOP
pushbutton.
(i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
9. Repeat step 8 for fan SFE 02.  [_ _]
10. Repeat step 8 for fan SFE 03.  [_ _]
11. (a) Ensure all EMERGENCY STOP pushbuttons are disengaged.  [_ _]
(b) Collect all tools and materials, leave the fan room, again
equalise the corridor and the
fan room pressures.
12. (a) Check the lighting within the fan chamber for operation.  [_ _]
(b) Repair any light found to be not operating or raise a new
jobsheet for the repair of
the fan chamber lighting.
13. Record anything outside normal parameters in the 'Work Done'
sectionof the Job Sheet.
14. Notify the control room on completion of work.
15. Return to the control room and ensure all fans are operational.
EMERGENCY OPERATION
In the event of notification by TCR Operators that a tunnel incident hasoccurred
requiring the
use of fans for smoke extraction.
Note:  Depending on the position of an event, Substation 1 may be
inaccessible.
1. If Substation 2 is not accessible
(a). If a fan that is being checked is running,  advise the traffic
control room that the fan  is
running under LOCAL control. Unless advice is received, from
the control room,  that fan
should remain under LOCAL control.
(b). Vacate the ventilation fan chamber, ensuring the sliding door tothe
airlock is closed and
sealed.
(c). Advise the traffic control room when all personnel are in or
have left the air lock.
2. Substation 2 is accessible
(a) Ensure all EMERGENCY STOP pushbuttons are disengaged
(b) Return to substation 2 and switch all the fan REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL
selector switches to
the  REMOTE position and switch all the fan  AUTO/OFF/MAN
selector switches to the
AUTO   position.
(c) Notify the traffic control room operators that they have control
of the fans.

03 M inspect of LIEBERT AC units mounted within Mezz Lvl
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Access to the Mobile telephone rooms, RRB room, ERE 00 and
ERE01 is via the Grant Street Stairwell.  The rooms are
located on the mezzanine floor adjacent to ERE01.
The Air Conditioners and the condensers are separate units.
3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Unit
4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
vibration.   [_ _]
4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
temperature should be within 2 degrees of the
thermostat setting.   [_ _]
b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
the following steps
(i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
displayed)
(ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
(iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
setting.
(iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
(v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
(vi) Wait until unit cuts out,  and verify that
temperature shown on unit  is consistent with
new setpoint and verify temperature is consistent
with ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
original setting.   [_ _]
d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
point is reached and verify that the temperature is
consistent with ambient using the portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
4.4. Check the filters and replace if necessary
(a) RRB Room and ERE 01 - Filter type Liebert size
650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
(b) ERE 00 - Filter type Liebert size 500 x 450 x
50mm.   [_ _]
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm drain line is
clear.   [_ _]
4.6. Restart unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFFusing the local isolating switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the fan isolating switch.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
Unit.   [_ _]
6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
will collect dust deposits.   [___]
6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
Clear any blockages.
6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
7.0. Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record
the results on form Equipment Room Inspections
TMF-3012-OP-0347.  Ensure the form Equipment Room
Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347 is returned to the Electrical
Electronics Supervisor or his representative.  Raise a new
jobsheet for any outstanding works.
8.0 On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done section of the job sheet and
report to the Team Leader or his representative and raise a
new job for any repairs.
9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any

4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
setting.   [_ _]
b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
the following steps
(i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
displayed)
(ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
(iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
setting.
(iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
(v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
(vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that temperature
shown on unit  is consistent with new setpoint and
verify temperature is consistent with ambient
(+ or - 1 deg) using portable  thermometer.   [_ _]
c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
original setting.   [_ _]
d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when the new
setpoint is reached and verify that the temperature is
consistent with ambient using the portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
and that the control room receives the alarm..   [_ _]
4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary. - Filter type
Liebert size 650x590x75 mm
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
is clear.
4.6. Restart unit and set for remote operation.
5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local fan isolating
switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local fan isolator.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
Unit.   [_ _]
6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
will collect dust deposits.   [___]
6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
Clear any blockages.
6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and
rubbish.   [_ _]
7.0. Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record
the results on form Equipment Room Inspections
TMF-3012-OP-0347.  Ensure the form Equipment Room
Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347 is returned to the Electrical
Electronics Supervisor or his representative.  Raise a new
jobsheet for any outstanding works.
8.0 On completion of job, record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done section of the job sheet and
report to the Supervisor or his representative and raise a
new job for any repairs.
9.0. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

falling on top of motorists.

02 W Record Piezometer Readings BT water table pressures
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control prior to commencing the work.
2. Lane closures to access the Burnley tunnel shall be as per
Work Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and
Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 25 or 26.
3. Reference documents:
(a) Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE
TMI-3012-OP-0031.
(b) Melbourne CityLink Project, Southern Link, Operations and
Maintenance Manual Tunnel Drainage Stage 2. R-STG-EN-006
and Transfield Obayashi JV,
(c) Operations & Maintenance Tanked Tunnel Drainage Works
Report PSM407.R34 December 2000 R-SDG-TU-134.
(d) Transfield Obayashi Joint Venture, Burnley Tunnel Long
Term Monitoring of Twin Anchored Slabs.  Report
PSM407.R30 September 2000, R-SDG-TU-130.
(e) Transfield Obayashi Joint Venture Extensometer and
Piezometer Readings Procedures Report PSM500.R11  June
2001   R-SDG-TU-211  Rev A.
4. Location:
Eighty-six piezometers are located along the length of the
tanked section of the Burnley Tunnel.  Forty-three are
mounted on the south side wall, and Forty-three mounted on
the north side wall.  They highest test point is located up
to 3.5m above the road surface on the tunnel walls.
5. Purpose:
The Piezometer test points are used to monitor groundwater
pressures on the outside of the tunnel wall.  The pressure
reading is then directly related to the groundwater head.
6. Carry out Piezometer readings:
6.1 (a) Loosen the bolt on one side of the stainless steel cover
and rotate the cover to reveal the quick connect
pressure coupling behind.
(b) Wipe the quick connect pressure coupling clean with a
rag.
(c) A ladder will be required to reach the piezometers in
the central section of the tunnel.  A second person may
be required to hold the ladder in place.
6.2 (a) Prior to each reading, Vent the Druck digital pressure
indicator using the tap on the hose of the machine to
allow the pressures within the instrument to equalise.
(b) Connect the Druck digital pressure indicator to the
quick connect coupling.  Pull back the sleeve on the
Druck digital pressure indicator connection and then
push the connection of the Druck digital pressure
indicator connection onto the piezometer connection.
6.3 (a) Press the  I/O button to switch the unit on.
(b) Ensure the reading is set to Kilopascals (kpa) and set
to zero.
(c) To obtain consistent readings, hold the Druck digital
pressure indicator at the same level as the piezometer
tip during the reading.
(d) Allow the reading to stabilise, and record reading on
form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL - GROUNDWATER PRESSURE
TMF-3012-OP-0229.
Note that some of  the readings may stabilise in a few
seconds, although some other readings may require a few
minutes to stabilise.
(e) Vent the Druck digital pressure indicator between
readings.
6.4 Record the results on form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL -
GROUNDWATER PRESSURE"" TMF-3012-OP-0229.
6.5 Replace the stainless steel cover and re-tighten the bolt.
7. Repeat Step 6 for the balance of the piezometer test points.
8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet & also ,,
inform the Team Leader.
9. Notify the Control room on completion of the Job.
10. Ensure a copy of the completed form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL -
GROUNDWATER PRESSURE TMF-3012-OP-0229 is forwarded to the
Civil Team Leader or his representative for evaluation on
completion of the job.  Results that are not in accordance
with baseline values would indicate a change in the state of
the groundwater storage.  The operation of the Groundwater
recharge systems should be checked for correct operation.

03 M Maint of Gantry Tolling Equipment
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Carry out the three monthly planned maintenance defined in
the CML RSE Users Manual maintenance schedule, document no.
M-MCL-ET-1225.
2. Perimeter access gate at technical shelter key required.
3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment

equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to safety
instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 "Working on Gantry Structures
4. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
5. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plan PL-MCL-ET-100001.
Preventative Maintenance No.0301
When carrying out the cleaning of VDC sensors (in 0301),
inspect the area around the connectors for evidence of
corrosion.
If corrosion is evident, then clean the area as described
below.
Where cleaning is to be also carried out, use extreme care
to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter any
connectors.
The Fibre Optic Connector is to be only removed on the
12 Monthly  Cycle (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
Prior to removing any connector or cover socket, clean
surface corrosion and deposits from around connectors<(>,<)>
socket covers and the surrounding surfaces use a tooth
brush to assist if necessary.
Remove the three socket covers (remove only if possible
using fingers) and apply a light spray of silicon to
the three (3) socket covers, replacing and exercising
the threads.
With all caps and plugs re-installed apply a light spray of
silicon to the area around the plugs and caps.
Check for silicon overspray on the VDC sensor window and
clean if necessary.
Where connectors or socket covers cannot be easily removed<(>,<)>
record details in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and
report the fact to the Team Leader or his representative.
0301: Check image quality and
,,,, alignment with CML Clean glass regardless of image.
,,,, Lubrication of mounting bracket carried out on removal
,,,, only.  Lightly spray with lubricant.
0302: Clean external glass of front and rear VR sensors.
Inspect mounting brackets and lubricate as required.
Ensure pins are cleaned and lubricated using silicon
spray prior to installing.
0303: Check VR Illuminator that there are less than 10%
defective IR LEDs,Advice CML if suspect below 10%
0304: Clean front surface of TRX, inspect mtg bracket and
lubricate as required
0305: Clean outside of glass cover of VDC, Replace failed
lamps, Lubricate arms as required.
Inspect VDC arm locating pins and chains. Record any
works required and report any equipment that needs
repair.
0306: Road Markers: Inspect for clarity & Cleanliness.( High ,,,,
contrast between marker & road). (If road markers need            to be
changed, inform the Team Leader.)
0307: Clean the glass of VSS sensor
0308: Inspect Distribution Cabinet for loose or damaged   ,,
cables. Clean cabinet for insects or moisture.
6. Record in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet any
outstanding works requiring further attention.  Create a
new Job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative of the outstanding works.
Record the New job number in the "Work Done" area of this
job sheet and in the "Related Job" field of both jobs.
7. Notify Control Room prior to departing from the Technical
Shelter."
