12 M Routine Maint. of Burnley Vent Station Fan
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
WARNINGS:
1. CHECKS SHOULD NOT BE CARRIED OUT IF MORE THAN 2 FANS ARE OPERATING IN
THE SECONDARY VENT STATION.
2. NO PERSON SHALL ENTER THE ACCESS AIRLOCK TO THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM
ALONE.
TWO OR MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT AT ALL TIMES WHEN WORK IS BEING
CARRIED OUT IN THE AIRLOCK OR VENT STATION
3. TAKE HEED OF NOTICES ON THE AIRLOCK DOORS.
1. Obtain a Permit to Work for entry to substation 3,  the ventilation
rooms and to interrupt
operations.
2.  Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.  Maintain
radiocontact at all times.
3.  Reference manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance
Instructions Manual
(M-STG-VE-26058)
4. Access to the Burnley ventilation station is through a locked airlock(Key2-LV)
on the
stairway  adjacent to the south west corner of the Burnley vent
stack.
Access to substation 3 is via external doors adjacent to the Burnley
Portal.
5. Ensure the 3 monthly check of the fans, carried out at the PMCS,
havebeen completed.
6. At the MCC in Substation No 3
Select one axial fan to be operational while the maintenance is being
carried out on
the other fans.  The fan selected can be any fan other than the fan
to be maintained
(preferably a fan located the furthest from the fan to be
maintained).
(a) If the selected fan is not running, then have the TCR start the
selected fan.
(b) Isolate the remaining non-operational axial fans, by switching
the AUTO/OFF/MAN
selector switches to the OFF position.  Carry out the
electrical isolation procedures
as defined in the Work Instruction TMI -3012-OP - 0103,  Low
Voltage Isolation
Procedures.
7.  Electrical checks in Substation No 3
(a)  Measure the insulation resistance of the stator windings and
record in the ""Work Done""
section of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
(b)  Measure the current of the anti-condensation. Heater current
isapprox. 1 amp.
(c)  Visually inspect both internally and externally, the control
panel for damage, corrosion
as well as the ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as
required)
8. (a) Enter the fan room from the entry stairway after equalizing
pressure in airlock.
WARNING: HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION SHOULD BE WORN IN
VENTILATION
FAN CHAMBER
(b) Check CO levels in fan room through doorway before entering and
at intervals during
fan checks.
(c)  WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF BODY OR MATERIALS WITHIN 1
METRE
OF AN OPERATING FAN INLET GUARD.  Airflow strength 35 km/h.
9. Static Fan Checks for each fan.
(a) Confirm that both the fan and motor are electrically and
mechanically isolated prior to
commencing any work on the fan or the motor.
(b) Enter the fan inlet cowl via the entry cowl safety grill hatch.
(c) Examine the impeller for
(i) Dirt and foreign matter on the blades (clean if required)
[_ _]
(ii) Wear or damage on the blade tips   [_ _]
(ii) Wear or damage on the blade leading edges   [_ _]
(iv) Loose bolts and or blade fixings at the hub   [_ _]
(d) Examine the electrical cable for security of fixings, damage due
to fraying, scuffing or
similar and for damage at locations where the cables penetrate
panels or
housings.    [_ _]
(e) Check any grease discharged from the motor bearings, since the
last lubrication is not
excessive.   [_ _]
(f ) Examine the discharged grease for any noticeable colour change.
Ensure that the
grease nipples are clean.  [_ _]
(g)  Inspect the cable connections to the motor for evidence of
overheating.  [_ _]
(h) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and heater
windings.
(i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
(ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor
Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has been
isolated and is to remain
isolated.
(a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
(where connected) and
bridge heater terminals.
(b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
terminals.
(iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the motorwindings
and the
winding heater bridge.  Record the result in the ""Work
Done"" area.
(iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
connections and carry out
an Insulation resistance test between this common bridge
and earth.  Record
the result in the ""Work Done"" area.
(v) Remove all temporary connections.
(vi) Remove supply lines to the motor and carry out an
insulation resistance test
on the motor windings, Between phase winding to phase
winding and between
each phase winding and earth.  Record results in the Work
Done area of the
Job sheet.
(vii) If the heater was connected on arrival, then re-instate
the heater connections,
otherwise leave the motor winding heater terminations
isolated.
(viii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
(x)  Where any insulation resistance reading is less than 2
megohm, then Record
in the ""Work Done""area of the Job Sheet and raise a
new job for the outstanding
works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
""Related Job"" field as well
as in the alternate.  Notify the Team Leader or his
representative of any
outstanding works.
(i) On leaving the fan inlet cowl grill hatch, replace the hatch
cover immediately.  [_ _]
(j) Manually check the operation of the Rotork actuator and
associated linkages that
operate the exit dampers, use the local control panel switch.
(k ) Remove any mechanical interlocks blocking the fan operation.
[__]
10. Running Fan Check and Lubrication
CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
REQUIRED
AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
(a) When the Static Fan Checks are complete, return to substation
3and remove the
safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then
removethe fan motor isolation
at the MCC.
Note:  Ensure that all non-operational fans are isolated, in
accordance
TMI-3012-SA-0103, and that the only fan not
isolated, is the fan to be maintained.
(b) Return the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF position
to the AUTO position.
(c) Return to the ventilation room and have TCR start the fan,
thatis being maintained.
Note: The motor must not be started more that four times in
an hour.
(d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan starts.
(e) Lubricate the motor bearings with fresh grease, while the motor
running.
DE = 100 gr / NDE - 120 gr  Use Shell Stamina RL2 grease or
equivalent only.
(f ) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the bearings
using the retrieval
system.  Examine the grease for changes of colour.  [_ _]
(g) Monitor the fan and motor for abnormal noises.      [_ _]
(h) Stop the fan motor using Local EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
(i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
11. On completion, collect all materials and leave the fan room after
equalizing the
differential pressures.
12. In Substation No 3
(a) Remove all safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103,
then remove the
motor isolation for all the fans at the MCC.  Return all
theREMOTE/OFF/LOCAL
selector switches to the REMOTE position,  and the
AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector
switches to the AUTO position.
(b) Check that one fan is operational and no alarms are present
13. Record anything outside normal parameters in the 'Work Done' sectionof
the Job Sheet.
14. Notify the control room on the completion of the job.
EMERGENCY OPERATION
In the event of notification by TCR Operators that a tunnel incident
hasoccurred requiring the
use of fans for smoke extraction.
1. If the fan being checked is operating, advise the traffic control
room  that it is currently
operating under LOCAL control and will be returned to AUTO control.
Stop fan using
the Emergency STOP pushbutton adjacent to the fan.
2. Release the STOP pushbutton .
3. Leave the fan chamber immediately by either the north or south exit
ladders ensuring
that the door to the stairwell airlock is secured.
4. Advise the traffic control room when all personnel are all accounted
for and at the surface
adjacent to the Burnley Vent Stack.
5. In Substation 3 Switch the REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to the
REMOTE position,
as well switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN fan selector switch to the AUTO
position.
6. Switch the operational fan AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch to the AUTO
position and start
the fan.
7. Notify TCR Operators that they have control.
On completion of the job, the ""Hours Run"" detail, for each fan is to
be entered into the
hours run table in the Plant Item.  Select the Plant Item,  then right
mouse click, select
""Open"" and then select  ""Meter Readings"".  Select edit mode and
enter data.
Record Readings Below
Results Insulation Resistance Tests
Fan ID
phase to phase
t
o earth

-----------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------

03 M Maint of the Variable Message Sign
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

2. Access keys required for Sound Wall Gate, to access VMS 07.

Plan 12 or 13 (Short term and low traffic volume).  Vic Roads

and Notify the Team Leader or his representative

mechanical damage, water ingress, condensation or insect
infestation. Also check inside cabinets for tripped circuit
breakers, disconnected wires, burn marks from excessive heat.
[_ _]

if required.[_ _]

of the Job Sheet and raise new Job Sheet if required.

operations. TLO Maintenance Manager to sign Work Permit and the works

Instructions Manual
(M-STG-VE-26060).

starter cubicle & inspect the cubicle & wiring connections.

and 03 to the OFF position, then inspect the starter cubicles.

8.1 Fan Room Access

OPERATING
FAN INLET GUARD, AS THE AIR IS FLOWING AT APPROX 35kmh.
8.2 Static Checks
(a) Press the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton adjacent to the motor.
(b) Check the condition of anti-vibration mountings and ensure that
the rubber bushing
is moved freely, adjust if required.  [_ _]
(c) Examine the grease that has been discharged from the motor
bearings for any noticeable
colour changes.  [_ _]
(d) Open the local electrical junction box, inspect the electrical
wiring and connections,
inspect all glands for tightness.  [_ _]

whitepowder or similar.
Record in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet any
evidence of condensation,
powder and the like and notify the Team Leader or his

(f) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and
heater windings.
(i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
(ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor
Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has been
isolated and is to remain
isolated.
(a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
(where connected) and
bridge heater terminals.
(b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
terminals.

motorwindings and the
winding heater bridge.  Record the result in the ""Work
Done"" area.
(iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
connections and carry out
an Insulation resistance test between this common bridge
and earth.  Record
the result in the ""Work Done"" area.
(v) Remove all temporary connections.
(vi) If the heater was connected on arrival, then re-instate
theheater connections,
otherwise leave the motor winding heater terminations
isolated.
(vii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
(viii) Where any insulation resistance reading is less than 2
megohm, then Record
in the ""Work Done""area of the Job Sheet and raise a
new job for the outstanding
works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
""Related Job"" field as well
as in the alternate.  Notify the Team Leader or his
representative of any
outstanding works.

8.4 Running Fan Check and Lubrication
CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
REQUIRED
AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.

at  the MCC.

running.  Ten pumps per bearing.

system.  Examine the grease for changes of colour.   [_ _]
(g) Check the fan for any abnormal noises or vibrations.     [_
_]
(h) Shutdown the fan motor using the local EMERGENCY STOP
pushbutton.
(i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.

03 M Load test of the MGE UPS
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
2. Check with the control room if any UPS alarms are relevant.
3. Refer to MGE UPS Systems Manual, Galaxy User Manual
E-679380XT/FA, M-STG-EL-24009, and Schnieder Electric Tunnel
Electrical Services Training Notes, M-STG-EL-24001,
Section 9.
WARNING
THE UPS BATTERY POTENTIAL IS APPROXIMATELY 380 VOLTS AND IS
EARTHED.  THE BATTERIES CAN DELIVER A FAULT CURRENT OF
APPROXIMATELY 9000 AMPS.  EXPOSED BATTERY TERMINALS ARE
DANGEROUS AND MUST NOT BE TOUCHED.  IN THE VICINITY OF THE
BATTERIES USE ONLY TOOLS WHICH ARE FULLY INSULATED.
SAFETY GLASSES MUST BE WORN WHEN CARRYING OUT  MEASUREMENTS
ON THE BATTERIES.
4. Check the UPS control panel readout for alarms and or normal
status.  If an alarm is found, record the alarm in the Work
Done Area of the Job Sheet. Do Not Continue with this Job if
an alarm is present.  [_ _]
5. Record measurements on form 03 M MGE Uninterruptible Power
Supply Battery Inspection and Test, TMF-3012-OP-0099.
6. Measure and record the UPS room temperature.   [_ _]
7. Check and record DC voltage and AC ripple voltage for each
bank of batteries.  If a discrepancy is found then record in
the Work Done Area of the Job Sheet.  Do Not Continue
this job sheet if there is a discrepancy in the readings
recorded and the readings expected.  [_ _]
8. To simulate a power failure, Open Mains 1 Isolator (Q1), the
UPS operation will change to the batteries.  [_ _]
9. Operate the UPS, in this mode, for at least 10
minutes.  [_ _]
10. Measure and record the DC voltage for each shelf of the
battery banks.
11. Measure and record the DC current flow in each battery bank.
12. Return the UPS to normal operation by closing Mains 1
Isolator Q1.  [_ _]
13. With an Optical thermometer measure the temperature of the
batteries and their inter-connections.  Temperature readings
should approximate ambient room temperature.  When a
connection is found to having a temperature greater than 5
degrees above room  temperature, in the Work Done Area of
the Job Sheet, record the battery location, terminal
identification, measured  temperature.  [_ _]
14. With an Optical thermometer measure the average temperature
of the two (AC & DC) capacitor banks and record the result.
15. With an anemometer measure and record the airflow from each
of the UPS cooling fans.
16. With the Optical thermometer measure and record the
temperature of each of the UPS cooling fans.  [_ _]
17. Ensure Normal operation of the UPS.  [_ _]
18. Sweep and clean the UPS room:
Sweep the floor and remove accumulated webs from the
walls.   [___]
Sweep the control panel room floors as well, vacuum the
control panel enclosures and any surfaces that will collect
dust deposits.   [___]
Clean the front panel of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
19. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the UPS room and
equipment etc,  in the "Work Done"section of the job
sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
20. Leave a duplicate 03M MGE Uninterruptible Power Supply
Battery Inspection and  test form in the UPS room.  Compare
previously recorded data and record in the Work Done
Area of the Job Sheet any data that shows any degradation.
21. Notify the control room on completion of the job."

ALUSC2A - Comms Fault
Got a call from TCR about comms fault at LUMSC2A. I went out to the LUMS
and found no emerg lane and we have to return to w/shop to get closure
gear. While loading closure gear into truck i rang TCR to inform them
that we were going to start a closure soon to look at C2a. TCR informed
me that they remember this fault as a CCCS fault and if they silence the
alarm and unsilence the alarm the fault clearses. TCR did this and the
fault cleared. I removed the closure gear from the truck and put away
equippment.

03 M Inspection & test of the Standby elect supply
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering each technical
shelter.
3. Carry out this job on the UPS to exercise the system and
confirm UPS system operation.
4. Check the operational condition of the Technical Shelter 10
Uninterruptable Power Supply to ensure it is operating in the
normal standby-back-up mode and there are no alarms.  [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TEST IF THE UPS IS IN
THE BYPASS MODE.
5. Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP Electrical Pty Ltd
Main Switchboard O<(>&<)>M Manual Section PI [M-MCL-ME-20016]
(a) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from the "AUTOMATIC CONTROL" position to the "EMERGENCY
SUPPLY + TEST " position.  A changeover will occur and
the technical shelter load will be supplied from the
emergency power supply.  Operate the system in this
mode for 10 minutes.
(b) Measure the voltage and load current per phase.   [_ _]
(c) Using an optical thermometer, measure the temperature
of the terminals in the emergency power supply circuit.
Record in the Work Done any terminal whose temperature
increases unduly during this operation.   [_ _]
(d) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
back to the "AUTOMATIC CONTROL" position.  The
technical shelter load will revert to the main power
supply after a time delay has confirmed the normal
supply is healthy.   [_ _]
6. (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
7. Record anything outside normal parameters in the  Work Done
area of the job sheet.  Raise a new job sheet if there is
work requiring further attention.  Priority P1.
8. Fill in the Log Book in the Technical Shelter.
9. Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.

01 M Inspection & test running of the WL TSH generators
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
Supply to ensure it is operating in the normal
standby-back-up mode.   [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
MODE.
4. Refer to reference manual Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
5.   (a) Check that the generator was left in  "AUTO" [_ _]
(b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuel and water.   [_ _]
(c) Check oil level.   [_ _]
(d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
(e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).   [_ _]
(f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts   [_ _]
(g) Record the battery voltage in the "Work Done" area
of the job sheet. [_ _]
(h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
Physically open the cap, as the gauge could be
misleading.  [_ _]
(j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours
with the last entry.  [_ _]
6. Reference manual, Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP
Electrical Pty Ltd Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI
[M-MCL-ME-20016]
7.  (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch on the generator
DC panel to "" RUN "" let the engine run for at least 5
minutes, then turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch
back to "" AUTO ""
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from "" AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" to ""EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST
"" run the generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared,
and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
[_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure,
water temperature.   [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back
to " AUTOMATIC CONTROL" the generator will continue to
run for about 8 minutes before stopping.   [_ _]
(g) Record the hours run, from the hours run meter,  in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet.
8.  (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
9. Fill in the Generator Log Book and record anything outside
normal parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job
sheet.  Raise a new job for any works requiring further
repairs.  Priority High P1.
10.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.

12.Record the Hours run in Mainpac under "Plant" use RH mouse
click then select "Open"      then select "Meter

06 M Insp of Substation HV equip
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner,

A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of Substations as well the cleaning, inspections
and maintenance of the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
(Substations 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 - General )
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant Substations
areas.
2. A visual inspection of substations 1- 5 and substation 6
(Ground type outdoor) is to be carried out with attention
given to the following:
(a) On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF
ventilation fans, if operating, toreduce ambient
noise.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect for water in any cable trenches.
(c) Visually inspect for evidence of condensation in
buildings.  [_ _]
(d) Visually inspect equipment enclosures and metal
structures and fixtures for evidence of corrosion or
other environmental conditions.  [_ _]
(e) Any unusual smell which may indicate overheating.  [_ _]
(f) Listen for any noise which may indicate an electrical
discharge or looseness of components.  [_ _]
(g) Visually inspect the main earthing busbars and
connections for degradation and damage.  [_ _]
(h) Remove any rubbish, dust, debris, materials or equipment
that serves no purpose within or near substations.  [_ _]
(i) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet,
inspection results requiring further corrective actions.
Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works and
notify the Team Leader or his representative.  Include
in the Related Job field of the new and this job, the
job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]

04 M Inspect & clean of AIDS , EWP, emerg lane Grdn Bed"
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the emergency
lane.

(c) Lane closure: Emergency lane and LHL.
(d) Electrical cabinet location:
WL Tollway - Exceptions AIDs 525 (in landscaped area),
527 & 543 are behind the noise wall.
SL Tollway: - Exceptions AIDs 916 & 918 are behind the
noise wall.
3. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12, 13, 14, 142, 143, 145, 146.
4. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,
Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
(a) Check  for vandalism, damage,  corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
necessary.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect the cabinet and check that the equipment mounted
in the cabinet is secure. [_ _]
(c) Check the cables and terminations for signs of
degradation, re-terminate if necessary.
(d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and securely fastened
to the PT140 and the LED is green, if the LED is red
there is no signal from the camera.
WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF THE FIBRE
OPTIC CABLE, AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.  [_ _]

lit, if not record the fact, for later replacement. [_ _]

(Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the
camera).

module and is secure.  [_ _]
6. Isolate the 240V power supply to the camera heaters.
7. Camera and Camera Housing;
(a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, external
evidence of moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface
insect spray  may be applied if necessary to the housing

housing or to the housing glass.

then open camera housing and carry out steps 7. (d)
and (e)  [_ _]
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
mounts.   [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
Rain-X  cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
8. Re-instate the 240V power supply to the camera heaters. [_ _]
9. Check with the control centre that the AID camera is
functioning correctly and that the mask is aligned.   [_ _]
10.On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.

01 M Maint inspection of WL emergency roadside telephones
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
2. Use Vehicle arrow board and short term emergency lane
stoppage as per Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 13
or 14.
3. For northbound carriageway and at each emergency roadside
telephone:
(a) Inspect the telephone for graffiti, damage and or insect
infestation
(b) Clean the telephone of grime and residues, use spray-on
Nifty and a clean cloth.
(c) Test the operation of the telephone with the control
room.  Using the Emergency Roadside telephone, contact
the Traffic Control Room and confirm operation of the
phone communication then have the control room call back
to the ERT to check the reverse operation.
4. For southbound carriageway and at each emergency roadside
telephone:
(a) Inspect the telephone for graffiti, damage and or insect
infestation
(b) Clean the telephone of grime and residues, use spray-on
Nifty and a clean cloth.
(c) Test the operation of the telephone with the control
room.  Using the Emergency Roadside telephone, contact
the Traffic Control Room and confirm operation of the
phone communication then have the control room call back
to the ERT to check the reverse operation.
5. For each ERT
(a) record the result of the inspection
(b) that the ERT has been cleaned and
(c) the result of the communication test
for each telephone on the attached form METS Inspection
(Monthly) - Western Link Form No. TMF-3012-OP-0036.
6. Record the details of any further corrective actions that are
required in the comments area of the form.
7. Notify the control room on the completion of inspection.
8. Return the completed job sheet as well as the form METS
Inspection (Monthly) - Western Link Form No. TMF-3012-OP-0036
to the Electrical / Electronics Team Leader or his
representative.
9. The Electrical / Electronics Team Leader or his
representative is to raise a new job sheet for any corrective
actions required.

03 M Inspect & Clean LV Switchboards and rooms
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning and
inspections of the Building
and Electrics, prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths,
lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,
Rubbish bags, Filter
material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Rodent Bait Station
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Substations along with the attached UPS rooms for the cleaning,
inspections and
maintenance of the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Sub Station Low Voltage Equipment and rooms and attached UPS Rooms  )
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant Sub stations.
2. On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans, if
operating, to
reduce ambient noise.   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. At Sub Stations, fill-in the log-book [_ _]
5. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including
theoperational tube within
EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
6. (a) Visually inspect the Low Voltage (Main Circuit breakers) for
evidence of damage and
or corrosion.  [_ _]
(b) Visually inspect the Low Voltage (Bus Tie Circuit Breakers) for
evidence of damage
and or corrosion.  [_ _]
(c) Check for any external indicators or flags, reset any found
tripped.  [_ _]
(d) Read and record in the ""Work Done"" the number of operations of
the circuit breaker.
(e) Record anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and raise a new
jobsheet for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or
his representative is
informed of the abnormality.  [_ _]
7. (a) Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
accessibleequipment and
components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red
temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus 10°C should
be considered
abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of the
JobSheet and ensure
the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality.  Raise a
new job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
(b)  While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment
and components for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.
Record anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and raise a
new jobsheet for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader
or his
representative is informed of  the abnormality.  [_ _]
(c) Check and listen for relays and contactors that are chattering,
arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and
escutcheons for serviceability and general operation, lubricate asrequired.
Carry out
any required repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
actions.  [_ _]
9. Inspect single line drawings for legibility.  Record details of
drawings requiring
replacement in the ""Work Done"" area and report to the Team
leaderor his representative.
10. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
damage.  [_ _]
12. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
13. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
required.  [_ _]
14. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out repairs
or indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
[_ _]
15. PLC Equipment  shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
to indicate abnormal
conditions are to be logged in the ""Work Done"" area of the
job Sheet and a new Job
Sheet raised to investigate and correctr the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are
not loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush, ensure the enclosure
and PLC modules
are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
16. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
accumulation.
17. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for operation
and security.  Check
with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of
analarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
18.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this job,
thejob number number of
the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
Inspect for source of
any water.  Record any details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job
sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and or
stored items.  Remove
any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets, ledges,
cable trays,
cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces,
e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
4. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved cleaning
materials .  [_ _]
5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light fittings,cable
trays and
ceilings.  [_ _]
6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
7. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  replace bait station
if bait is near
exhausted.  [_ _]
9. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.   Record
any abnormal
parameter in the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet.   Raise a new
jobsheet for any
outstanding corrective actions.  [_ _]
10. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.  [_ _]
11. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g. Fans,
Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
(d)  Generators in Tech Shelters to be left in a state of readiness
for operation.  [_ _]
(e)  UPS in Substations and Tech Shelters to be left in state of
readiness for
operation. [_ _]
12.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this job, the
job number number of
the alternate Job.   [_ _]
13. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
"

Surface insect spray  may be applied if necessary to the
housing exterior but must not be applied to the interior
of the housing or to the housing glass.
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to
mounts.   [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
Rain-X cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(e) Only If there is evidence of moisture and or insect
infestation within the camera housing, then open the AID
camera housing.  Remove any moisture or insect
infestation and discard the previously used Silica Gel
packs and replace with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel
packs.    [_ _]
Only if it has been necessary to remove the camera
housing cover visually inspect the condition of cables
and connections and clean, if required, within the camera
enclosure    [_ _]
Carefully replace the cover and ensuring the enclosure
seal is effective.   [_ _]
8. If the power has been isolated, re-instate the 24V power
supply to the camera.  [_ _]
9. Check with the Traffic Control Room that the AID camera is
functioning correctly and that the MASK is correctly
aligned.   [_ _]
10. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
attention of the Electrical Supervisor or his
representative.  [_ _]
11. On completion of job, record any outstanding works that
require further corrective works in the Work Done area of
the job sheet, raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
works as required.
12. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

ASSET CONDITION RATING
Rate the Condition of the Asset.
Note:
[ 1 ] - Excellent.
Asset is new or in as new condition
[ 2 ] - Good.
Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing
it's intended function.
[ 3 ] - Fair.
Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
deterioration that will result is some intervention
works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
performing it's intended function to the full degree.
[ 4 ] - Poor.
Asset is functional and operational but showing major
signs of deterioration that will require intervention
works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
intended function.
CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]

in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

Rodent bait station
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Equipment Rooms, as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of
the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Equipment Rooms ERE01 - ERE 16 and ERW 01 - ERW 06)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Equipment rooms, Technical
shelters and
Substations.
2. On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans, if
operating (fans not
required to be  switched OFF in technical shelters and appropriate
equipment
rooms).   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including theoperational
tube within
EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all accessible
equipment and
components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus
10°C should be
considered abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of
the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. Raise a new
job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and
components  for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
raise a new jobsheet
for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or his
representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering,
arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and escutcheons
for serviceability and general operation, lubricate as required.
Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
damage.  [_ _]
10. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
required. [_ _]
12. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out
repairsor indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
[_ _]
13.  PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
toindicate abnormal
conditions are to be logged in the work done area of the job
sheet and a new job sheet
raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are not
loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the enclosure and
PLC modules
are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
14. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
accumulation, where applicable.
15. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for operation
and security.  Check
with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of
analarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
16.   Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective
actions.  Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and
thisjob, the job number
of the alternate Job.   [_ _]

1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
Inspect for source of
any water.  Record any details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job
sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and or
stored items.  Remove
any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets, ledges,

of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]

,cable trays and

parameter in the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet.   Raise a

completion.  [_ _]

the Work Done area of the Job Sheet only if the water
level is greater then 0.5 mts.  Water level is to be ,,,,,,
recorded by using the dip-stick.

01 M Inspection & test running of the WL TSH generators
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
Supply to ensure it is operating in the normal
standby-back-up mode.   [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
MODE.
4. Refer to reference manual Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
5.   (a) Check that the generator was left in  "AUTO" [_ _]
(b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuel and water.   [_ _]
(c) Check oil level.   [_ _]
(d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
(e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).   [_ _]
(f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts   [_ _]
(g) Record the battery voltage in the "Work Done" area
of the job sheet. [_ _]
(h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
Physically open the cap, as the gauge could be
misleading.  [_ _]
(j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours
with the last entry.  [_ _]
6. Reference manual, Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP
Electrical Pty Ltd Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI
[M-MCL-ME-20016]
7.  (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch on the generator
DC panel to "" RUN "" let the engine run for at least 5
minutes, then turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch
back to "" AUTO ""
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from "" AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" to ""EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST
"" run the generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared,
and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
[_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure,
water temperature.   [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back
to " AUTOMATIC CONTROL" the generator will continue to
run for about 8 minutes before stopping.   [_ _]
(g) Record the hours run, from the hours run meter,  in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet.
8.  (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
9. Fill in the Generator Log Book and record anything outside
normal parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job
sheet.  Raise a new job for any works requiring further
repairs.  Priority High P1.
10.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
11.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
12.Record the Hours run in Mainpac under "Plant" use RH mouse
click then select "Open"      then select "Meter
Readings" in edit mode add the Meter Reading for the
appropriate TSH Generator.
"

03 M Load test of the MGE UPS
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
2. Check with the control room if any UPS alarms are relevant.
3. Refer to MGE UPS Systems Manual, Galaxy User Manual
E-679380XT/FA, M-STG-EL-24009, and Schnieder Electric Tunnel
Electrical Services Training Notes, M-STG-EL-24001,
Section 9.
WARNING
THE UPS BATTERY POTENTIAL IS APPROXIMATELY 380 VOLTS AND IS
EARTHED.  THE BATTERIES CAN DELIVER A FAULT CURRENT OF
APPROXIMATELY 9000 AMPS.  EXPOSED BATTERY TERMINALS ARE
DANGEROUS AND MUST NOT BE TOUCHED.  IN THE VICINITY OF THE
BATTERIES USE ONLY TOOLS WHICH ARE FULLY INSULATED.
SAFETY GLASSES MUST BE WORN WHEN CARRYING OUT  MEASUREMENTS
ON THE BATTERIES.
4. Check the UPS control panel readout for alarms and or normal
status.  If an alarm is found, record the alarm in the Work
Done Area of the Job Sheet. Do Not Continue with this Job if
an alarm is present.  [_ _]
5. Record measurements on form 03 M MGE Uninterruptible Power
Supply Battery Inspection and Test, TMF-3012-OP-0099.
6. Measure and record the UPS room temperature.   [_ _]
7. Check and record DC voltage and AC ripple voltage for each
bank of batteries.  If a discrepancy is found then record in
the Work Done Area of the Job Sheet.  Do Not Continue
this job sheet if there is a discrepancy in the readings
recorded and the readings expected.  [_ _]
8. To simulate a power failure, Open Mains 1 Isolator (Q1), the
UPS operation will change to the batteries.  [_ _]
9. Operate the UPS, in this mode, for at least 10
minutes.  [_ _]
10. Measure and record the DC voltage for each shelf of the
battery banks.
11. Measure and record the DC current flow in each battery bank.
12. Return the UPS to normal operation by closing Mains 1
Isolator Q1.  [_ _]
13. With an Optical thermometer measure the temperature of the
batteries and their inter-connections.  Temperature readings
should approximate ambient room temperature.  When a
connection is found to having a temperature greater than 5
degrees above room  temperature, in the Work Done Area of
the Job Sheet, record the battery location, terminal
identification, measured  temperature.  [_ _]
14. With an Optical thermometer measure the average temperature
of the two (AC & DC) capacitor banks and record the result.
15. With an anemometer measure and record the airflow from each
of the UPS cooling fans.
16. With the Optical thermometer measure and record the
temperature of each of the UPS cooling fans.  [_ _]
17. Ensure Normal operation of the UPS.  [_ _]
18. Sweep and clean the UPS room:
Sweep the floor and remove accumulated webs from the
walls.   [___]
Sweep the control panel room floors as well, vacuum the
control panel enclosures and any surfaces that will collect
dust deposits.   [___]
Clean the front panel of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
19. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the UPS room and
equipment etc,  in the "Work Done"section of the job
sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
20. Leave a duplicate 03M MGE Uninterruptible Power Supply
Battery Inspection and  test form in the UPS room.  Compare
previously recorded data and record in the Work Done
Area of the Job Sheet any data that shows any degradation.
21. Notify the control room on completion of the job."

drainage systems, from both dirty and Groundwater sources.

DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0031.

WEEKLY BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0233 for
detail of the previous readings.

the Time and the Total flow in kilo litres for the pump
station on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233.

TMF-3012-OP-0233 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
evaluation on completion  of the job.

job to investigate to check the various bay flows for the

06 M Jet Fan maintenance and lubrication.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1.  Works to be carried out on one jet fan at a time so as to
not affect the operation of total tunnel ventilation
2.  Notify control room prior to commencing work.
3.  Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002
and Translink Operations Procedure PR-RS-OP-IR-020 Plan 27
or 28.
4.  Reference Manual;  Witt & Sohn, Operations and Maintenance
Manual , Certificate 18. (M-STG-VE-29047 )
5.  In associated equipment room switch jet fan AUTO/OFF/MAN
selector switch to MAN and REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL switch to LOCAL
to enable control adjacent to jet fan.  [_ _]
6.  Running visual inspection
WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF BODY IN INLET OR OUTLET
AIR STREAM WHEN FAN IS RUNNING.
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN.
(a) Start fan locally by pressing the START button on the
panel adjacent to the fan.   [_ _]
(b) Check for any abnormal noise or movement from the
fan.  [_ _]
(c) Check the fan unit vibration mountings and safety rods
for loose nuts and bolts.  [_ _]
(d) Stop fan locally with the EMERGENCY STOP button.  [_ _]
(e) If any non-conforming items are found, investigate
further in the static fan inspection.  [_ _]
7.  Static fan inspection
(a) Ensure the local  EMERGENCY STOP button is engaged. [_ _]
(b) Conduct a thorough visual inspection for damage and
corrosion of the silencers, impeller, inlet cone, cable
connections, mounting frame and vibration attenuators.
Any cracks identified in the vicinity must be noted in
the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _] Photo of Cracks found
will be required.
Any damage, especially to surface protection, must be
noted in the "Work done" area of the job sheet for
further investigation.   [_ _]
(c) Carry out careful inspection of all supporting hardware
and screw connections, including the eight vibration bracket
installations and the four safety rod brackets.  Using a
torque wrench, ensure that the accessible supporting screw
connections are secured and fixed with the correct torque
settings.  [_ _]
NOTE: Torque Settings
M10 = 37Nm
M12 = 65Nm
M16 = 150Nm
M20 = 300Nm      as per reference manual
in step 4
Bolts with Nylon washers should only be checked for
tightness. Do not torque as nylon washer get damaged
Do not torque anchor bolts in tunnel roof. Check for
tightness only.
(d) If any non-conforming items are found, record in the
"Work Done" area of the job sheet and rectify immediately
where possible to the requirements of the Witt & Sohn ,
Operations and Maintenance Manual , Certificate 18.
(M-STG-VE-29047).   This inspection is carried out
externally via the inlet and exhaust ends using a
torch.  [_ _]
(e) Remove cover to motor junction box and check the cable
connections visually for tightness and evidence of
overheating.
8.  Lubrication
(a) Release the key operated EMERGENCY STOP button, restart
fan  locally.
(b) Regrease bearings using grease gun on nipples onside of
fan with  Mobilith SHC220 (TF000021) grease, 10 pumps of
hand grease gun per grease nipple.
Note:  Lubrication should be carried out between 3,000
and 4,000 hours running time when access is available.
Do not over grease.    [_ _]
(c) Stop fan using local EMERGENCY STOP button
(d) Release the EMERGENCY STOP button using a Key.  (Remove
the key)   [_ _]
9.  Equipment Room Control Panel.
(a) Switch fan REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to REMOTE to
enable control at panel
(b) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of the
control panel for damage evidence of insect infestation,
ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as
required).  [_ _]
(c) Check cable connections visually for tightness and signs
of overheating and inspect electrical control
equipment [_ _]
(d) Start fan with START pushbutton on panel and leave
running for approximately 5 minutes
(e) Check ammeter at electrical panel to verify fan is
operating within current limits FLC 100A.  [_ _]
(f ) Using an infra red thermometer check the temperature of
the connections and power cables to the motor.   Record in
the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet if the temperature
recorded is more that 10º to 15º C above ambient.   [_ _]
(g) Record the "hours run" from the Jet Fan hour run meter
on the panel door in the "Work Done"" area of the job
sheet.   [_ _]
Note:  Hour run meters are on the control panels for
non-reversing fans only.
Reversing fans hour run readings are obtainable
from the PMCS screens in the control room
10. Return the LOCAL/OFF/REMOTE switch to the OFF position and
the AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector switch to the AUTO
position.   [_ _]
11. Advise the Traffic control room operator that control of the
fan is returned to the control room.    [_ _]
12. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and bring to the attention
of the Team Leader Electrical or his representative.
13. Notify control room on completion of work.
14. Enter the hours run for the jet fan into the Plant item
screen, then select the usage tab.

12 M Inspection of Cast Resin HV Transformers
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
All work on High Voltage equipment must be carried out in
accordance with Transfield's procedure number TMI-3012-SA-0102
High Voltage Safety Work Instructions.
1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2. (Cast Resin Dry Type Transformers 1A, 1B, 2A,2B, 3A, 3B, 4A,
4B, 5A & 5B)
The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to
be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
leader or his representative.
(a) Examine and clean all bushings, insulators, terminals,
cable connections, for partial discharge, ingress of
moisture or damage.
(b) Inspect Operation of the Winding temperature sensor.
Carry out functional testing to ensure correct Alarming
and trip operation via the PMCS to the Traffic Control
Room.
(c) Check tightness (Torque test) of all earthing and cable
connections (MEN, Bushings and tank) and inspect for
evidence of overheating of broken strands. Tighten
connections where necessary.
(d) Inspect transformer coils, core and frame, for evidence
of corrosion, dirt, or foreign material buildup.  Clean
coils , core and frame and treat and recoat any surface
rust spots.
3. Record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet, inspection
results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new
Job Sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative.  Include in the Releated Job
field of the new and this job, the job number of the
alternate Job.   [_ _]
The following torque settings are:
Connections of HV connectors - Connections tightening torque
on the HV terminal and the tapping link bars
Bolts             Tightening Torque Nm
M8                    9.8Nm
M10                  19.6Nm
M12                  34.3Nm
M14                  58.8Nm
Connections of LV connectors - Connection tightening torque
for the LV bars (Both Nut and Bolts).
M8                  12.25Nm
M10                 24.5Nm
M12                 44.0Nm
M14                 68.6Nm
M16                 98.0Nm

Perform this job at the same time as the CCTV, Speed cameras,
AID Equipment boxes and the AID Junction Boxes whilst a 2 lane
RHL closure of the tunnel is in place.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Work shall be carried out within designated times approved by
the TCRO.
2. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
3. Access to this camera group is:
(a) AID Cameras
801, 803, 805, 807, 809, 811, 813, 815, 817, 819, 821,
823, 825 and 827 are located over the right hand lane.
(b) Access Vehicle: EWP.
(c) Lane Closure: RH and centre lane
(d) AID Camera Equipment  Box Location:
Refer to Device Location Guide Ver 5.01 for locations.
4. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 28 (40 kmh) and 40 (60kmh).
5. Reference Manual, Traffic Management Systems - CCTV & AID
Systems - Operators and Maintenance Manual,  (M-MCL-TM-1 511)
6. If it is necessary to isolate the camera power supply (24Vac)
can be switched off at a GPO mounted in the junction box that
services up to four AID cameras mounted locally to the
cameras.
7. Camera and Camera Housing;
(a) Visually inspect for vandalism, damage, corrosion,
external evidence of moisture and any insect infestation.
Surface insect spray  may be applied if necessary to the
housing exterior but must not be applied to the interior
of the housing or to the housing glass.
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to
mounts.   [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
Rain-X cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(e) Only If there is evidence of moisture and or insect
infestation within the camera housing, then open the AID
camera housing.  Remove any moisture or insect
infestation and discard the previously used Silica Gel
packs and replace with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel
packs.    [_ _]
Only if it has been necessary to remove the camera
housing cover visually inspect the condition of cables
and connections and clean, if required, within the camera
enclosure    [_ _]
Carefully replace the cover and ensuring the enclosure
seal is effective.   [_ _]
8. If the power has been isolated, re-instate the 24V power
supply to the camera.  [_ _]
9. Check with the Traffic Control Room that the AID camera is
functioning correctly and that the MASK is correctly
aligned.   [_ _]
10. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
attention of the Electrical Supervisor or his
representative.  [_ _]
11. On completion of job, record any outstanding works that
require further corrective works in the Work Done area of
the job sheet, raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
works as required.
12. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

recorded by using the dip-stick.

01 M Maint inspection of WL emergency roadside telephones

stoppage as per Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 13
or 14.

telephone:
(a) Inspect the telephone for graffiti, damage and or insect
infestation
(b) Clean the telephone of grime and residues, use spray-on
Nifty and a clean cloth.
(c) Test the operation of the telephone with the control
room.  Using the Emergency Roadside telephone, contact
the Traffic Control Room and confirm operation of the
phone communication then have the control room call back
to the ERT to check the reverse operation.
4. For southbound carriageway and at each emergency roadside
telephone:
(a) Inspect the telephone for graffiti, damage and or insect
infestation
(b) Clean the telephone of grime and residues, use spray-on
Nifty and a clean cloth.
(c) Test the operation of the telephone with the control
room.  Using the Emergency Roadside telephone, contact
the Traffic Control Room and confirm operation of the
phone communication then have the control room call back
to the ERT to check the reverse operation.

(a) record the result of the inspection
(b) that the ERT has been cleaned and
(c) the result of the communication test
for each telephone on the attached form METS Inspection
(Monthly) - Western Link Form No. TMF-3012-OP-0036.

to the Electrical / Electronics Team Leader or his

representative is to raise a new job sheet for any corrective

03 M Electrical Inspection and Clean LV Switchboards
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning and
inspections of the Building
and Electrics, prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths,
lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,
Rubbish bags, Filter
material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Cold Gal, Wire Brush,
Thinners, Absorbent,
Rodent bait station
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Equipment Rooms, as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of
the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Equipment Rooms ERE01 - ERE 16 and ERW 01 - ERW 06)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Equipment rooms, Technical
shelters and
Substations.
2. On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans, if
operating (fans not
required to be  switched OFF in technical shelters and appropriate
equipment
rooms).   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including theoperational
tube within
EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all accessible
equipment and
components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus
10°C should be
considered abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of
the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. Raise a new
job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and
components  for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
raise a new jobsheet
for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or his
representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering,
arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and escutcheons
for serviceability and general operation, lubricate as required.
Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
damage.  [_ _]
10. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
required. [_ _]
12. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out
repairsor indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
[_ _]
13.  PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
toindicate abnormal
conditions are to be logged in the work done area of the job
sheet and a new job sheet
raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are not
loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the enclosure and
PLC modules
are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
14. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
accumulation, where applicable.
15. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for operation
and security.  Check
with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of
analarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
16.   Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective
actions.  Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and
thisjob, the job number
of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
Inspect for source of
any water.  Record any details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job
sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and or
stored items.  Remove
any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets, ledges,
cable trays,
cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces,
e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]
4. At equipment rooms (ERE03 - ERE16 & ERW 02 - ERW 05), replace
Absorbent.  [_ _]
5. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  Replace bait station
if bait is near
exhausted.  [_ _]
6. Check telephone for operation.  [_ _]
7. Inspect all metal work for corrosion, clean of corrosion and recover
with cold gal area
cleaned.   [_ _]
8. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved cleaning
materials .  [_ _]
9. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light fittings
,cable trays and
ceilings.  [_ _]
10. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
11. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
12. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.   Record
any abnormal
parameter in the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet.   Raise a
new jobsheet for any
outstanding corrective actions.  [_ _]
13. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.  [_ _]
14. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g. Fans,
Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
15.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this job,
thejob number of
the alternate Job.   [_ _] [_ _]
16. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
"

01 M Inspection & test running of the WL TSH generators
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
Supply to ensure it is operating in the normal
standby-back-up mode.   [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
MODE.
4. Refer to reference manual Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
5.   (a) Check that the generator was left in  "AUTO" [_ _]
(b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuel and water.   [_ _]
(c) Check oil level.   [_ _]
(d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
(e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).   [_ _]
(f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts   [_ _]
(g) Record the battery voltage in the "Work Done" area
of the job sheet. [_ _]
(h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
Physically open the cap, as the gauge could be
misleading.  [_ _]
(j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours
with the last entry.  [_ _]
6. Reference manual, Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP
Electrical Pty Ltd Main Switchboard O<(>&<)>M Manual Section PI
[M-MCL-ME-20016]
7.  (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch on the generator
DC panel to "" RUN "" let the engine run for at least 5
minutes, then turn the "" RUN / OFF / AUTO "" Switch
back to "" AUTO ""
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from "" AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" to ""EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST
"" run the generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared<(>,<)>
and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
[_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure<(>,<)>
water temperature.   [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back
to " AUTOMATIC CONTROL" the generator will continue to
run for about 8 minutes before stopping.   [_ _]
(g) Record the hours run, from the hours run meter,  in the
"Work Done" area of the Job Sheet.
8.  (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
9. Fill in the Generator Log Book and record anything outside
normal parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job
sheet.  Raise a new job for any works requiring further
repairs.  Priority High P1.
10.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
11.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
12.Record the Hours run in Mainpac under "Plant" use RH mouse
click then select "Open"      then select "Meter
Readings" in edit mode add the Meter Reading for the
appropriate TSH Generator.
Work completed as above work plan
Hours Run  - 126.0 Hrs
Battery Volts - 13.2 VDC
"

03 M Electrical Inspection and Clean LV Switchboards
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning and
inspections of the Building
and Electrics, prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths,
lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,
Rubbish bags, Filter
material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Cold Gal, Wire Brush,
Thinners, Absorbent,
Rodent bait station
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Equipment Rooms, as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of
the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Equipment Rooms ERE01 - ERE 16 and ERW 01 - ERW 06)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Equipment rooms, Technical
shelters and
Substations.
2. On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans, if
operating (fans not
required to be  switched OFF in technical shelters and appropriate
equipment
rooms).   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including theoperational
tube within
EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all accessible
equipment and
components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus
10°C should be
considered abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of
the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. Raise a new
job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and
components  for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
raise a new jobsheet
for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or his
representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering,
arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and escutcheons
for serviceability and general operation, lubricate as required.
Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
damage.  [_ _]
10. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
required. [_ _]
12. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out
repairsor indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
[_ _]
13.  PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
toindicate abnormal
conditions are to be logged in the work done area of the job
sheet and a new job sheet
raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are not
loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the enclosure and
PLC modules
are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
14. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
accumulation, where applicable.
15. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for operation
and security.  Check
with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of
analarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
16.   Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective
actions.  Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and
thisjob, the job number
of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
Inspect for source of
any water.  Record any details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job
sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and or
stored items.  Remove
any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets, ledges,
cable trays,
cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces,
e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]
4. At equipment rooms (ERE03 - ERE16 & ERW 02 - ERW 05), replace
Absorbent.  [_ _]
5. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  Replace bait station
if bait is near
exhausted.  [_ _]
6. Check telephone for operation.  [_ _]
7. Inspect all metal work for corrosion, clean of corrosion and recover
with cold gal area
cleaned.   [_ _]
8. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved cleaning
materials .  [_ _]
9. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light fittings
,cable trays and
ceilings.  [_ _]
10. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
11. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
12. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.   Record
any abnormal
parameter in the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet.   Raise a
new jobsheet for any
outstanding corrective actions.  [_ _]
13. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.  [_ _]
14. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g. Fans,
Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
15.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this job,
thejob number of
the alternate Job.   [_ _] [_ _]
16. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
"
