01 M L1 Inspect of fire doors within the Tunnel environs
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. This work is to be carried out by suitably qualified
personnel.
2. This work is for the various equipment rooms, substations and
refuges throughout the tunnel complex.  Access to sub-station
door shall be under the supervision of an electrical
electronics technician.
3. Inform TCRO prior to commencing work.
Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction Traffic
Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
Plan 20, 22 or 23.
In the work done area record:
(a) Any deviations from the plan.
(b) Lane closure start time.
(c) Lane closure finish time.
(d) Weather conditions.
4. Inspect the fire doors listed on:
TMF-3012-OP-0280 Substation 1 and Mezzanine level fire doors
TMF-3012-OP-0281 Substation 2, Swan St Shaft and Refuge 3
fire doors
TMF-3012-OP-0282 Substation 3 & Burnley Fan Chamber fire
doors
TMF-3012-OP-0283 Substation 4 & Yarra Crossing fire doors
TMF-3012-OP-0284 Substation 5, ERW 01 & Olympic Park Pump
Station
TMF-3012-OP-0285 Burnley Tunnel Fire Doors
TMF-3012-OP-0286 Domain Tunnel Fire Doors
to AS 1851.7 Type 1 inspection.  The inspection shall consist
of an examination of the condition of the doorset and a check
that it is operating satisfactorily.
In particular, the following routine should be followed for
hinged fire doors.
5.1 Inspect for any remedial work that is outstanding and
unfinished and record works to be completed in the comments
field.
5.2 Remove any obstructions or non-approved devices such as
wedges, heavy objects or hooks that are used to hold the
door open.
5.3 Check that the door and all it's components, hardware and
functions are correct.
5.4 While the door is open, check that all screws are firm in
the hinges, latchset faceplate, striking plate and door
closer body and bracket.
5.5 Inspect the door identification data notice, required by the
regulatory authority is firmly attached.  The notice is
mounted in the door edge and on the door frame.
5.6 Check the closing and latching action (on the closing), and
that the door stopping action (fully open limit) is
functioning (on the opening).
5.7 The door having closed, check that the leaf is a reasonably
even fit in the frame.
For sliding or doors that are suspended on rollers.
6.1 Inspect for any remedial work that is outstanding and
unfinished and record works to be completed in the comments
field.
6.2 Remove any obstructions or non-approved devices such as
wedges, heavy objects or hooks that are used to hold the
door open.
6.3 Check that the door and all it's components, hardware and
functions are correct.
6.4 With the door in both the open and closed position, check
that all screws are firm in the supports, handles, brackets<(>,<)>
rollers, runners, guides and counterweights.
6.5 Inspect the door identification data notice, required by the
regulatory authority is firmly attached.  The notice is
mounted in the door edge and on the door frame.
6.6 Check the closing and latching action (on the closing), and
that the door stopping action is functioning.
6.7 With the door closed, check that the door is a reasonably
even fit over the opening.
7. Record the inspection results and the sub-contractors Work
Report No. for each fire door on the appropriate inspection
forms:
TMF-3012-OP-0280 Substation 1 and Mezzanine level fire doors
TMF-3012-OP-0281 Substation 2, Swan St Shaft and Refuge 3
fire doors
TMF-3012-OP-0282 Substation 3 & Burnley Fan Chamber fire
doors
TMF-3012-OP-0283 Substation 4 & Yarra Crossing fire doors
TMF-3012-OP-0284 Substation 5, ERW 01 & Olympic Park Pump
Station
TMF-3012-OP-0285 Burnley Tunnel Fire Doors
TMF-3012-OP-0286 Domain Tunnel Fire Doors
8. Record any abnormal conditions in the Work Done area of the
Job Sheet.  Raise a new job sheet for any corrective action
that is required.   P2 - Medium Priority.
Work completed as above work plan

03 M Inspect of ERW06 & ERE02 Liebert wall mounted AC unit
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Access to equipments rooms ERE02 and ERW06 is via the Grant
Street Stairwell. The equipment rooms are located on the
mezzanine floor.  The Air Conditioner and the Condenser are
mounted in one integral unit.
3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
4. Check for unusual noise or vibration while the unit is
running.   [_ _]
5. Shut the unit down using the ON/OFF switch, and open the
front access panel.   [_ _]
6. Check the filters and replace if required.  Filter size
21 x 36.25 x 2 (1 reqd)  [_ _]
7. Check the blower for debris and dust buildup and clean as
required.  Check that the blower is tightly mounted on the
shaft, and it rotates freely without rubbing.   [_ _]
8. Check the refrigeration capillaries and supports to ensure
they cannot rub together through vibration.   Check for
leaks.   [_ _]
9. Check temperature settings by lowering the thermostat setting
and check equipment room temperature with a portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
10. Condenser
a. Clean the condenser coil when filter is replaced.   [_ _]
b. Check lines for leaks.   [_ _]
c. Check the coils for damage.   [_ _]
11. Switch the unit ON using the ON/OFF switch.   [_ _]
12. Check the condensate drain for blockage and damage.  Clear
any blockages.  [_ _]
13. Inspect the two fire dampers (Inlet and outlet) for damage,
corrosion or premature operation.   [_ _]   [_ _]
14. Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
(i) Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
(ii) Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces
that will collect dust deposits.   [___]
(iii) Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
(iv) Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
Clear any blockages.  Remove from site all accumulated debris
and rubbish.   [_ _]
15. Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record the
results on form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347.
Ensure the form  Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347
is returned to the Electrical / Electronics Supervisor or
his representative. Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
works.
16. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done section of the job sheet and
report to the Team Leader or his representative and raise a
new job for any repairs.
17. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

03 M inspect of Liebert A/C units accessed via the tunnel
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Set up the traffic control measures as per Work Instruction,
Traffic Control, MI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 20
3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
vibration.   [_ _]
4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
setting.   [_ _]
b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
the following steps
(i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
displayed)
(ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
(iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
setting.
(iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
(v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
(vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that temperature
shown on unit  is consistent with new setpoint and
verify temperature is consistent with ambient
(+ or - 1 deg) using portable  thermometer.   [_ _]
c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
original setting.   [_ _]
d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when the new
setpoint is reached and verify that the temperature is
consistent with ambient using the portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
and that the control room receives the alarm..   [_ _]
4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary. - Filter type
Liebert size 650x590x75 mm
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
is clear.
4.6. Restart unit and set for remote operation.
5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local fan isolating
switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local fan isolator.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
Unit.   [_ _]
6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
will collect dust deposits.   [___]
6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
Clear any blockages.
6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and
rubbish.   [_ _]
7.0. Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record
the results on form Equipment Room Inspections
TMF-3012-OP-0347.  Ensure the form Equipment Room
Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347 is returned to the Electrical
Electronics Supervisor or his representative.  Raise a new
jobsheet for any outstanding works.
8.0 On completion of job, record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done section of the job sheet and
report to the Supervisor or his representative and raise a
new job for any repairs.
9.0. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

of items on the form TMF-3012-OP-0314 - WL Traffic

12 M Routine Maint. of Burnley Vent Station Fan
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
WARNINGS:
1. CHECKS SHOULD NOT BE CARRIED OUT IF MORE THAN 2 FANS ARE OPERATING IN
THE SECONDARY VENT STATION.
2. NO PERSON SHALL ENTER THE ACCESS AIRLOCK TO THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM
ALONE.
TWO OR MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT AT ALL TIMES WHEN WORK IS BEING
CARRIED OUT IN THE AIRLOCK OR VENT STATION
3. TAKE HEED OF NOTICES ON THE AIRLOCK DOORS.
1. Obtain a Permit to Work for entry to substation 3,  the ventilation
rooms and to interrupt
operations.
2.  Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.  Maintain
radiocontact at all times.
3.  Reference manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance
Instructions Manual
(M-STG-VE-26058)
4. Access to the Burnley ventilation station is through a locked airlock(Key2-LV)
on the
stairway  adjacent to the south west corner of the Burnley vent
stack.
Access to substation 3 is via external doors adjacent to the Burnley
Portal.
5. Ensure the 3 monthly check of the fans, carried out at the PMCS,
havebeen completed.
6. At the MCC in Substation No 3
Select one axial fan to be operational while the maintenance is being
carried out on
the other fans.  The fan selected can be any fan other than the fan
to be maintained
(preferably a fan located the furthest from the fan to be
maintained).
(a) If the selected fan is not running, then have the TCR start the
selected fan.
(b) Isolate the remaining non-operational axial fans, by switching
the AUTO/OFF/MAN
selector switches to the OFF position.  Carry out the
electrical isolation procedures
as defined in the Work Instruction TMI -3012-OP - 0103,  Low
Voltage Isolation
Procedures.
7.  Electrical checks in Substation No 3
(a)  Measure the insulation resistance of the stator windings and
record in the ""Work Done""
section of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
(b)  Measure the current of the anti-condensation. Heater current
isapprox. 1 amp.
(c)  Visually inspect both internally and externally, the control
panel for damage, corrosion
as well as the ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as
required)
8. (a) Enter the fan room from the entry stairway after equalizing
pressure in airlock.
WARNING: HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION SHOULD BE WORN IN
VENTILATION
FAN CHAMBER
(b) Check CO levels in fan room through doorway before entering and
at intervals during
fan checks.
(c)  WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF BODY OR MATERIALS WITHIN 1
METRE
OF AN OPERATING FAN INLET GUARD.  Airflow strength 35 km/h.
9. Static Fan Checks for each fan.
(a) Confirm that both the fan and motor are electrically and
mechanically isolated prior to
commencing any work on the fan or the motor.
(b) Enter the fan inlet cowl via the entry cowl safety grill hatch.
(c) Examine the impeller for
(i) Dirt and foreign matter on the blades (clean if required)
[_ _]
(ii) Wear or damage on the blade tips   [_ _]
(ii) Wear or damage on the blade leading edges   [_ _]
(iv) Loose bolts and or blade fixings at the hub   [_ _]
(d) Examine the electrical cable for security of fixings, damage due
to fraying, scuffing or
similar and for damage at locations where the cables penetrate
panels or
housings.    [_ _]
(e) Check any grease discharged from the motor bearings, since the
last lubrication is not
excessive.   [_ _]
(f ) Examine the discharged grease for any noticeable colour change.
Ensure that the
grease nipples are clean.  [_ _]
(g)  Inspect the cable connections to the motor for evidence of
overheating.  [_ _]
(h) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and heater
windings.
(i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
(ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor
Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has been
isolated and is to remain
isolated.
(a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
(where connected) and
bridge heater terminals.
(b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
terminals.
(iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the motorwindings
and the
winding heater bridge.  Record the result in the ""Work
Done"" area.
(iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
connections and carry out
an Insulation resistance test between this common bridge
and earth.  Record
the result in the ""Work Done"" area.
(v) Remove all temporary connections.
(vi) Remove supply lines to the motor and carry out an
insulation resistance test
on the motor windings, Between phase winding to phase
winding and between
each phase winding and earth.  Record results in the Work
Done area of the
Job sheet.
(vii) If the heater was connected on arrival, then re-instate
the heater connections,
otherwise leave the motor winding heater terminations
isolated.
(viii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
(x)  Where any insulation resistance reading is less than 2
megohm, then Record
in the ""Work Done""area of the Job Sheet and raise a
new job for the outstanding
works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
""Related Job"" field as well
as in the alternate.  Notify the Team Leader or his
representative of any
outstanding works.
(i) On leaving the fan inlet cowl grill hatch, replace the hatch
cover immediately.  [_ _]
(j) Manually check the operation of the Rotork actuator and
associated linkages that
operate the exit dampers, use the local control panel switch.
(k ) Remove any mechanical interlocks blocking the fan operation.
[__]
10. Running Fan Check and Lubrication
CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
REQUIRED
AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
(a) When the Static Fan Checks are complete, return to substation
3and remove the
safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then
removethe fan motor isolation
at the MCC.
Note:  Ensure that all non-operational fans are isolated, in
accordance
TMI-3012-SA-0103, and that the only fan not
isolated, is the fan to be maintained.
(b) Return the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF position
to the AUTO position.
(c) Return to the ventilation room and have TCR start the fan,
thatis being maintained.
Note: The motor must not be started more that four times in
an hour.
(d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan starts.
(e) Lubricate the motor bearings with fresh grease, while the motor
running.
DE = 100 gr / NDE - 120 gr  Use Shell Stamina RL2 grease or
equivalent only.
(f ) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the bearings
using the retrieval
system.  Examine the grease for changes of colour.  [_ _]
(g) Monitor the fan and motor for abnormal noises.      [_ _]
(h) Stop the fan motor using Local EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
(i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
11. On completion, collect all materials and leave the fan room after
equalizing the
differential pressures.
12. In Substation No 3
(a) Remove all safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103,
then remove the
motor isolation for all the fans at the MCC.  Return all
theREMOTE/OFF/LOCAL
selector switches to the REMOTE position,  and the
AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector
switches to the AUTO position.
(b) Check that one fan is operational and no alarms are present
13. Record anything outside normal parameters in the 'Work Done' sectionof
the Job Sheet.
14. Notify the control room on the completion of the job.
EMERGENCY OPERATION
In the event of notification by TCR Operators that a tunnel incident
hasoccurred requiring the
use of fans for smoke extraction.
1. If the fan being checked is operating, advise the traffic control
room  that it is currently
operating under LOCAL control and will be returned to AUTO control.
Stop fan using
the Emergency STOP pushbutton adjacent to the fan.
2. Release the STOP pushbutton .
3. Leave the fan chamber immediately by either the north or south exit
ladders ensuring
that the door to the stairwell airlock is secured.
4. Advise the traffic control room when all personnel are all accounted
for and at the surface
adjacent to the Burnley Vent Stack.
5. In Substation 3 Switch the REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to the
REMOTE position,
as well switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN fan selector switch to the AUTO
position.
6. Switch the operational fan AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch to the AUTO
position and start
the fan.
7. Notify TCR Operators that they have control.
On completion of the job, the ""Hours Run"" detail, for each fan is to
be entered into the
hours run table in the Plant Item.  Select the Plant Item,  then right
mouse click, select
""Open"" and then select  ""Meter Readings"".  Select edit mode and
enter data.
Record Readings Below

phase to phase

2. Access keys required for Sound Wall Gate, to access VMS 07.

06 M BT Lighting Levels Measurement
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Carry out the six monthly Burnley tunnel lighting levels
inspection.
2. This job is to be carried out during a tunnel closure.
3. Check calibration date on light meter and spare battery,
thermometer and marker strips prior to carrying out lighting
levels measurement.
4. Location nominated for carrying out lighting measurement
includes the following fire box locations:
B9, B14, B19, B24, B30, B35, B41, B45, B49
To assist with identifying the exact points of measurement,
eight (8) marker strips should be laid out at 4m interval at
the location being measured. At each location, the 4m
intervals have been marked on site with studs embedded into
line marking on edge of the carriageway. The marker strips
should be placed adjacent to the studs.
5. Measurement area should be bollarded off.
6. At each measurement location:
a. Measure ambient temperature
b. Check for the following external factor prior to taking
measurements:
i.   Car Headlights - should be at least 120m (2 fire boxes)
from measurement location.
ii.  Headlights and flashing beacons on the work vehicle
should be switched off when taking measurement.
iii. Illuminated arrow sign boards should be used on work
vehicles and should be facing away from measurement
location.
iv.  Shadowing from people - no persons to be within 20m of
measurement point, except person taking measurement,
who should be in crouched position.
c. Measure Lighting Levels and record values on Form
TMF-3012-OP-0392.
7. Record any outstanding works required.
8. Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works.

06 M Inspect & Clean the Tunnel air velocity and Temp sensor
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1 Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
2. Reference manual Erwin Sick Operating Instructions - Flowsic 200
AirVelocity of Flow
Measuring Device - [M-STG-EL-24004].
3. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control
TMI-3012-OP- 0002 and
Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 23 & 24 (or to be defined).
4. Tunnel Sending/Receiving sensor units.
WARNING:
DO NOT LOOK INTO THE LASER LIGHT USED TO ALIGN TRANSDUCERS.  THE
LASER
LIGHT CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO EYES.
WARNING:
DO NOT PUT YOUR EARS INTO THE ULTRASONIC SIGNAL PATH.  ULTRASONIC
SIGNALS CAN DAMAGE HEARING.  IT IS ADVISED TO WEAR HEARING
PROTECTION
WHEN WORKING IN THE VICINITY OF THE TRANSDUCERS.
CAUTION:
FIT PROTECTIVE CAPS TO THE SAFETY TUBES OF THE SENDER AND RECEIVER
DURING CLEANING.
PROTECT THE ULTRASONIC  TRANSDUCER FROM WATER AT ALL TIMES.
DO NOT TOUCH THE ULTRASONIC TRANSDUCERS EITHER BY HAND OR WITH ANY
CLEANING MEDIUM.
(a) Inspect both the sending and receiving for damage and or
corrosion.  [_ _]
(b) Using a cap, cover the safety tube that protects the transducer,
then clean the external
surfaces of the Flowsic 200 with a cleaning cloth, optical
cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(c) Remove the safety tube cap, then clean the internal surfaces of
the safety tube as well
as the transducer surface using a gentle stream of air ONLY.
[_ _]
(d) Check that the cable connection to the sensor unit is tight and
that the cable is suitably
supported and secure.  [_ _]
(e) Check that the mounting bracket and the bolts holding the unit
are secure.  If any of the
bolts need to be tightened, the alignment of the sensors must
be checked.  Alignment
is confirmed using a laser pointer and must be within the
range of 1º in all planes.   [__]
( f) Check with the control room that system is functioning
correctly prior to leaving the
unit.  [_ _]
5.  Record anything outside normal parameters in the ""Work Done "" area
of the job sheet.
6.  Notify the Control room on completion of the job."

06 M Check of Vent Station Smoke Damper Actuators
These checks are carried out to verify the operability of the
Ventilation Station smoke duct damper actuators for each
Ventilation Station.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
2. In conjunction with Traffic Control Room Operators set TCR
PMCS system smoke damper actuator controls for manual
operation
3. Open a minimum of 4 smoke duct dampers upstream of the
ventilation station to prevent negative pressure being
generated in the smoke duct, from the normal ventilation
system, when smoke dampers are opened.
4. Open and close each damper at least  twice and observe the
panel for indications of non- standard operation such as
dampers that open or close sluggishly, or fail to open or
close completely.
5. Close the Ventilation station smoke duct dampers.
6. Close tunnel smoke duct dampers.
7. Record in Work Done area of the Job Sheet those dampers that
have suspect operation.
8. Notify the control room om completion of the job.

03 M Load test of the MGE UPS
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
2. Check with the control room if any UPS alarms are relevant.
3. Refer to MGE UPS Systems Manual, Galaxy User Manual
E-679380XT/FA, M-STG-EL-24009, and Schnieder Electric Tunnel
Electrical Services Training Notes, M-STG-EL-24001,
Section 9.
WARNING
THE UPS BATTERY POTENTIAL IS APPROXIMATELY 380 VOLTS AND IS
EARTHED.  THE BATTERIES CAN DELIVER A FAULT CURRENT OF
APPROXIMATELY 9000 AMPS.  EXPOSED BATTERY TERMINALS ARE
DANGEROUS AND MUST NOT BE TOUCHED.  IN THE VICINITY OF THE
BATTERIES USE ONLY TOOLS WHICH ARE FULLY INSULATED.
SAFETY GLASSES MUST BE WORN WHEN CARRYING OUT  MEASUREMENTS
ON THE BATTERIES.
4. Check the UPS control panel readout for alarms and or normal
status.  If an alarm is found, record the alarm in the Work
Done Area of the Job Sheet. Do Not Continue with this Job if
an alarm is present.  [_ _]
5. Record measurements on form 03 M MGE Uninterruptible Power
Supply Battery Inspection and Test, TMF-3012-OP-0099.
6. Measure and record the UPS room temperature.   [_ _]
7. Check and record DC voltage and AC ripple voltage for each
bank of batteries.  If a discrepancy is found then record in
the Work Done Area of the Job Sheet.  Do Not Continue
this job sheet if there is a discrepancy in the readings
recorded and the readings expected.  [_ _]
8. To simulate a power failure, Open Mains 1 Isolator (Q1), the
UPS operation will change to the batteries.  [_ _]
9. Operate the UPS, in this mode, for at least 10
minutes.  [_ _]
10. Measure and record the DC voltage for each shelf of the
battery banks.
11. Measure and record the DC current flow in each battery bank.
12. Return the UPS to normal operation by closing Mains 1
Isolator Q1.  [_ _]
13. With an Optical thermometer measure the temperature of the
batteries and their inter-connections.  Temperature readings
should approximate ambient room temperature.  When a
connection is found to having a temperature greater than 5
degrees above room  temperature, in the Work Done Area of
the Job Sheet, record the battery location, terminal
identification, measured  temperature.  [_ _]
14. With an Optical thermometer measure the average temperature
of the two (AC & DC) capacitor banks and record the result.
15. With an anemometer measure and record the airflow from each
of the UPS cooling fans.
16. With the Optical thermometer measure and record the
temperature of each of the UPS cooling fans.  [_ _]
17. Ensure Normal operation of the UPS.  [_ _]
18. Sweep and clean the UPS room:
Sweep the floor and remove accumulated webs from the
walls.   [___]
Sweep the control panel room floors as well, vacuum the
control panel enclosures and any surfaces that will collect
dust deposits.   [___]
Clean the front panel of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
19. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the UPS room and
equipment etc,  in the "Work Done"section of the job
sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
20. Leave a duplicate 03M MGE Uninterruptible Power Supply
Battery Inspection and  test form in the UPS room.  Compare
previously recorded data and record in the Work Done
Area of the Job Sheet any data that shows any degradation.
21. Notify the control room on completion of the job."

03 M Inspect and maintain Crosspassage 3 fans
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Obtain a lane closure approval for the appropriate tunnel.  [_ _]
2. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job as well as
entering the cross passage.
3. Refer to Maintenance Manual, ""Operating and Maintenance Manual for
Mechanical
Services - MCL Tunnels"" M-STG-ME-27400.
4. Refer to AS 1668.1 - 1991 Appendix A for detail and methodology of
Stair Pressurisation
Commissioning Tests.
5. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,
TMI-3012-OP-0002 and
Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 20 or 22.
WARNING:
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN YOU ARE WORKING IN THE
VICINITY OF AN OPERATING FAN.
6. (a) Check that both the supply air grill and the fire damper, over
the cross passage door,
are clear any debris that could restrict the airflow.  (use a
torch from the duct
hatch)   [_ _]
(b) Check the fire damper for damage, corrosion and that it has not
operated
prematurely.  [_ _]
7. Work plan confirming the operation of SF-TCP-04 (4A CPF P11 adjacent
to ERW 03)
(a)  Ensure the doors, from the cross passage to both the Burnley and
the Domain
tunnels are closed.
(b) Request the TCR operator to start the fan, ensure the air flow
is into the cross
passage.    [_ _]
(c) NOTE: The alarm to be raised will not call the fire brigade.  It
will register on the local FIP
and CCCS as a local alarm.
Remove the access cover over the smoke detector, direct
""test smoke"" from a smoke
generator, as specified on the container, onto the smoke
detector (on the duct). Check
that an alarm actuates on the local fire panel.  (The fan
will not stop due to a time
delay)  [_ _]
(d) Request the traffic control room operator to start the fan (if
stopped) .
(e) Remove the relay which is mounted in the rear compartment of the
fire indicator panel.
The relay is labelled
""Cross Passage 3E Fan Relay"" for the Burnley tunnel end, and
""Cross Passage 3W Fan Relay"" for the Domain tunnel end.
Check that the fan stops
after approx. two and a half minutes.   [_ _]
(f ) Replace the relay and request the traffic control room
operatorto start the fan
again.   [_ _]
8. Check the operation of controls and alarms.
(a) Open the cross-passage door farthest from the fan.  Confirm an
alarm at the TCR
workstation.   [_ _]
(b) Check the door for damage, as well check the rollers, runners,
handles, stops,
counter-weight ropes, tube and counter weights for efficient
operation.  [_ _]
(c) Chock open the door (at the farthest end of cross passage to the
fan), then using an
anemometer, measure the velocity of the air out of the open
door.  The reading is to be
with the door fully open and with no obstructions.  Record
results in Work Done Area
of the job sheet if less then 1 metre per second and advise themaintenance
superintendent for further investigation.   [_ _]
(d)  Arrange the door catches to be non-functioning, then using a
spring balance, measure
the force required to open the door.  Record results in Work
Done Area of the job
sheet if a force greater than 11kg is required .   Raise a new
job sheet  for any
outstanding corrective actions that are required..   [_ _]
(e) With the cross passage to tunnel door closed, measure the cross
passage air
pressure.
Record readings of less than 50Pa in the ""Work Done area of
the job sheet.  Advise
the superintendent for further investigation. Record the
traffic control room
reading also.   [_ _]
(f ) After closing the door, check the time taken for the cross
passage air pressure to return
to its static level.  Record in the ""Work Done"" area of the
job sheet if the time is greater
than 2 minutes.   Raise a new job sheet  for any outstanding
corrective actions that are
required.   [_ _]
9. Check the fire door and its operation.
(a) Remove all equipment installed to facilitate the above test.
Ensure the door functions
and closes correctly.  Confirm with the Traffic Control room
that the door status
indication in the control room is correct.   [_ _]
10. Run the fan for a further 5 minutes then request the traffic
controlroom operator to shut
down the down prior to leaving the cross passage.
11. Check the condition of the flexible duct connections. [_ _]
12. Check the fan flexible mounts for security of fastenings and
tension. [_ _]
13. Check the fan impeller, through the duct hatch, for build-up of
dirt, clearances from the
housing  and alignment.  [_ _]
14. Repeat steps 6 to 14 for SF-TCP-02 (1A CPF P03 adjacent to ERE 05)
15. Clean Cross Passage 3:
Sweep floor and stairs    [___]
Check that the water is flowing freely in the spoon drains   [___]
Check the steps and floor for pools of water, remove  water by
sweeping
into the drain  [___]
Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
16. On completion of job record anything outside normal parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of drain blockage
evidence of structural damage to stairs and handrails etc,  in
the ""Work Done""
section of the job sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
representative and
raise a new job for any repairs.
17. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal parameters
in the ""Work Done""
area of the job Sheet.   [_ _]
18. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

03 M Maint of the Variable Message Sign
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in emergency lane.
2. Access keys required for Sound Wall Gate, to access VMS 07.
Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,
TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059
Plan 12 or 13 (Short term and low traffic volume).  Vic Roads
approval required prior to doing job.
Access to VMS 6 is from the car park below the elevated road.
3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment and
or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to Safety
Instructions  TMI-3012-SA-0101, Working  on Gantry
Structures.
4. Arrange with the TCR for a Test Message to be displayed on
the VMS.  Monitor operation and repair as required.  Monitor
the LED Arrays and the Flashers for failed LEDS and
record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet if the failed
LEDs exceed 10% of the array.
Arrange a new Job sheet for any outstanding works, recording
the appropriate Job numbers in the Related Jobs  field
and Notify the Team Leader or his representative
of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
5. Carry out visual inspection externally and internally of the
cabinets, sign, external cables and conduits for vandalism,
mechanical damage, water ingress, condensation or insect
infestation. Also check inside cabinets for tripped circuit
breakers, disconnected wires, burn marks from excessive heat.
[_ _]
6. Visually check for loose or missing nuts and bolts, and for
rusted areas, rusted nuts or bolts. Cleans with wire brush
and spray with Cold Gal or equivalent. This should be
done with care and to avoid overspray. [_ _]
7. Inspect the external face of the lenses (for each pixel) for
dirt and clean with Windex or equivalent  and clean rags
if required.[_ _]
8. Note any corrective action required in the Work Done area
of the Job Sheet and raise new Job Sheet if required.
9. Notify control room on departure.
"

03 M Inspect & Clean TSH Equipment and Bldgs
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the
cleaning and inspections of the Building and Electrics<(>,<)>
prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and
external lighting, Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material<(>,<)>
Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Rodent Bait Station
This job should be carried in conjunction with the Monthly
job at the Technical Shelters
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
electrical installations of Technical Shelters, as well the
cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the relevant
areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Technical Shelters TSH1-6, TSH10-14 )
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant Technical
shelters.
2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere<(>,<)>
use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
abnormal events.  [_ _]
3. At Technical shelters, fill-in the log-book [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation<(>,<)>
including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace
faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of
ambient plus 10°C should be considered abnormal and must be
noted in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all
cables, terminals, equipment and components  for evidence
of burn marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for any corrective action.
Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Inspect the surges diverters where applicable, and either
replace spent surge diverters when less than 80% or raise a
new Job Sheet for works to be carried out.   [_ _]
9. At Technical Shelters,  visually inspect external Lightning
Protection System connections for damage and or corrosion.
Record anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for any corrective
action.  Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is
informed of the abnormality.  [_ _]
10.Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware<(>,<)>
gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and
general operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out
any required repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any
outstanding actions.  [_ _]
11.Inspect single line drawings for legibility.  Record
details of drawings requiring replacement in the ""Work
Done"" area and report to the Team leader or his
representative.
12.Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating<(>,<)>
looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
13.Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally
for dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
14.Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of
obstructions.  Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
15.Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s)<(>,<)>
for faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
actions.   [_ _]
16.PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect  the PLC status and error indicators.
Indicators found to indicate abnormal conditions are
to be logged in the ""Work Done"" of the Job Sheet and
a new job sheet raised to invetigate and correct the
error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g.
plug connections, screw connections for security.
[_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush, ensure the
enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated
dust and debris.  [_ _]
17.Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.
18.Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for
operation and security.  Check with the Traffic Control
Room Operator to confirm the receipt of an alarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of
outstanding defects in the Work Done area of the Job
Sheet.  [_ _]
19.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective actions.
Include in the Related Job field of the new and this
job, the job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of
moisture ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record
any details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and
inform the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings
and or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Inspect the area of the generator in Tech Shelters and air
conditioning unit, for leaks of fuel, coolants or
lubricants.  Clean any spillage and if any leaks are
evident record in the ""Work Done "" area and raise a new
jobsheet for any corrective action required. Inform the
Team Leader or his representative of  these required
actions.  [_ _]
5. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets<(>,<)>
ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle
on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
6. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
cleaning materials .  [_ _]
7. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light
fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]
8. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
9. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
10.Carry out Exterior Checks of Technical Shelters.
(a) Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the
building (if applicable) for damage, erosion<(>,<)>
graffiti.  [_ _]
(b) Visually inspect the building (if applicable) walls<(>,<)>
roof, guttering and and downpipes for damage, leaks
and or blockages, remove any debris or materials
that could cause a blockage.  [_ _]
(c) Inspect (if applicable) the general area surrounding
the building for erosion and damage to surfaces<(>,<)>
fences, gates, pavements   [_ _]
11.Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  replace
bait station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
12.Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of
the job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
corrective actions.  [_ _]
13.Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.
[_ _]
14.Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
(d)  Generators in Tech Shelters to be left in a state of
readiness for operation.  [_ _]
(e)  UPS in Tech Shelters to be left in state of readiness
for operation. [_ _]
15.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this
job, the job number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
16.Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
Work completed as above work plan
"

03 M Inspect of ERE16 & RRB03 Liebert AC units in Sub 3 Bldg
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Access to the air conditioners within equipment room ERE16
and RRB03, is via an external door situated on the Burnley
Tunnel walkway 20 metres west of Burnley Portal.
Access to the condensers is via external doors, on south side
of Bldg, into substation 3B.
3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne City
Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
vibration.   [_ _]
4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
setting.   [_ _]
b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
the following steps
(i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
displayed)
(ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
(iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
setting.
(iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
(v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
(vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that
temperature shown on unit  is consistent with new
setpoint and verify temperature is consistent with
ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
c. Repeat above steps to restore the setpoint to the
original setting.   [_ _]
d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
point is reached and verify that the temperature is
consistent with ambient using the portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary.   Filter type
Liebert size 650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm drain line
clear.   [_ _]
4.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
5. ACC Condenser Unit
5.1. Inspect the condensor unit and check for undue cycling
operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local isolating
switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the fan isolator.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
Unit.   [_ _]
6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
will collect dust deposits.   [___]
6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
Clear any blockages.
6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
7.0 Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record the
results on form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347.
Ensure the form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347
is returned to the Electrical / Electronics Supervisor or
his representative.  Raise a new jobsheet for any
outstanding works.
8.0 On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done  section of the job sheet and
report to the Team Leader or his representative and raise a
new job for any repairs.
9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

From: Roberts, Chris
Sent: Wednesday, June 27, 2012 2:12 PM
To: 'Tony Aquilina' ; Gourley, Warren

Subject: Yarra River Crossing - Minor Tunnel Leak
Tony<(>,<)>
Thank you for letting me know about the leak including the attached
photograph and location (as below). The location is in the Yarra River
Crossing located on the south bank as illustrated on the attached
annotated as-builts. The tunnel lid is 9m below sea level.
As indicated on SC2-ST-2838, the water has passed vertically down
through:
·         Three water stops
·         Joint seal between planks at top
·         Joint seal between planks at bottom (this one as shown on your
photo is not the as-builts.
Alternatively the water may have entered through the wall horizontal
construction joint and entered the vertical construction joint.
Either way, the leak cannot be practically repaired as it has entered
somewhere through the outer wall/lid where access is not possible.
-------------------------------------
Warren,
My recommendation is to let this small leak to continue and keep an eye
on it. If the flow becomes significant then we ought to look further
into it. In the meantime, if dripping onto windscreens etc is of
concern, then we could look at controlling the route of the water to
make it inconspicuous.

02 W Record Piezometer Readings BT water table pressures
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control prior to commencing the work.
2. Lane closures to access the Burnley tunnel shall be as per
Work Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and
Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 25 or 26.
3. Reference documents:
(a) Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE
TMI-3012-OP-0031.
(b) Melbourne CityLink Project, Southern Link, Operations and
Maintenance Manual Tunnel Drainage Stage 2. R-STG-EN-006
and Transfield Obayashi JV<(>,<)>
(c) Operations & Maintenance Tanked Tunnel Drainage Works
Report PSM407.R34 December 2000 R-SDG-TU-134.
(d) Transfield Obayashi Joint Venture, Burnley Tunnel Long
Term Monitoring of Twin Anchored Slabs.  Report
PSM407.R30 September 2000, R-SDG-TU-130.
(e) Transfield Obayashi Joint Venture Extensometer and
Piezometer Readings Procedures Report PSM500.R11  June
2001   R-SDG-TU-211  Rev A.
4. Location:
Eighty-six piezometers are located along the length of the
tanked section of the Burnley Tunnel.  Forty-three are
mounted on the south side wall, and Forty-three mounted on
the north side wall.  They highest test point is located up
to 3.5m above the road surface on the tunnel walls.
5. Purpose:
The Piezometer test points are used to monitor groundwater
pressures on the outside of the tunnel wall.  The pressure
reading is then directly related to the groundwater head.
6. Carry out Piezometer readings:
6.1 (a) Loosen the bolt on one side of the stainless steel cover
and rotate the cover to reveal the quick connect
pressure coupling behind.
(b) Wipe the quick connect pressure coupling clean with a
rag.
(c) A ladder will be required to reach the piezometers in
the central section of the tunnel.  A second person may
be required to hold the ladder in place.
6.2 (a) Prior to each reading, Vent the Druck digital pressure
indicator using the tap on the hose of the machine to
allow the pressures within the instrument to equalise.
(b) Connect the Druck digital pressure indicator to the
quick connect coupling.  Pull back the sleeve on the
Druck digital pressure indicator connection and then
push the connection of the Druck digital pressure
indicator connection onto the piezometer connection.
6.3 (a) Press the  I/O button to switch the unit on.
(b) Ensure the reading is set to Kilopascals (kpa) and set
to zero.
(c) To obtain consistent readings, hold the Druck digital
pressure indicator at the same level as the piezometer
tip during the reading.
(d) Allow the reading to stabilise, and record reading on
form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL - GROUNDWATER PRESSURE
TMF-3012-OP-0229.
Note that some of  the readings may stabilise in a few
seconds, although some other readings may require a few
minutes to stabilise.
(e) Vent the Druck digital pressure indicator between
readings.
6.4 Record the results on form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL -
GROUNDWATER PRESSURE"" TMF-3012-OP-0229.
6.5 Replace the stainless steel cover and re-tighten the bolt.
7. Repeat Step 6 for the balance of the piezometer test points.
8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet & also ,,inform the
Team Leader.
9. Notify the Control room on completion of the Job.
10. Ensure a copy of the completed form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL -
GROUNDWATER PRESSURE TMF-3012-OP-0229 is forwarded to the
Civil Team Leader or his representative for evaluation on
completion of the job.  Results that are not in accordance
with baseline values would indicate a change in the state of
the groundwater storage.  The operation of the Groundwater
recharge systems should be checked for correct operation.
Work completed as above work plan.

03 M Inspect and Test Swan St Ps pumps
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this work.
2. Reference manual TOJV, Pump Station Operation and Maintenance
Manuals - M-STG-ME-20001, Volume 3.
3. WARNING:  BOTH THE WET WELL AND THE VALVE PIT ARE DESIGNATED
CONFINED SPACES AND  MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED
SPACE CONDITIONS.
Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry
TMI-3012-SA-0015.
4. At Control Panel A
(a) Check the switchboard, adjacent to the pump room, for
local alarm conditions.  [_ _]
(b) Carry out visual inspections both internally and
externally of the control panels for damage, corrosion,
evidence of insect infestation, ingress of moisture, dust
and grime (clean as required)  [_ _]
(c) Check the cable connections for tightness and signs of
overheating, inspect the electrical control
equipment.  [_ _]
(d) Record in the Work Done area of job sheet, the hour-run
meter readings for each pump, these are to be obtained
from the PMCS.  To obtain the correct results:
(i) On  the CCCS System, click on the Entities button
(ii) In the entry field of the Entities Faceplate type SW
(iii) Then look for SWDW1RUN in the list.
(iv) Double click on the SWDW1RUN, then record the hours
run shown in the HOURS field.
(v) Repeat steps (d) (iii) to (d) (iv) for each of
SWDW2RUN, SWDW3RUN, SWGW1RUN, SWGW2RUN in
order. [_ _]
5. Repeat step 4 for Control Panel B.  [_ _]
6. Inspect the pump wet wells and the valve pit.
(a) Inspect the wet wells through the access ladder hatch for
general cleanliness and any accumulated debris, inspect
for any evidence of leakage.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the external conditions of the pipework and the
valves for corrosion (Rust).  Minor corrosion (rust) is
to be removed with a wire brush and the cleaned surface
painted with Coldgal.   [_ _]
(c) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet evidence of
leaks and any corrective works that are outstanding.
Raise a new jobsheet for any corrective works
outstanding.   [_ _]
(d) Lubricate Isolating Valves with Loctite Silver Grade Anti ,,
Seize Lubricant or Equivalent.  [_ _]
(e) Operate all pump manual isolating valves through AT LEAST
THREE (3) OPEN/CLOSED cycles to confirm valve
operationally.  Ensure the valves are left in the fully
open position on completion.  [_ _]
7. Test the operation of Hydrocarbon detector, by releasing a
small amount of gas from a small LPG bottle.     [_ _]
8. Work plan for the PSSWDP1, Dirty Water Pump 1
(a) Check the inlet tundish for any blockage or accumulated
debris, clean out if required.  [_ _]
(b) Check the triple interceptor trap for any evidence of oil
on the surface, turbidity and the correct operation of
the discharge valve.   [_ _]
(c) Check the operation of float switches.  To test lift the
High/High float and Low/Low floats respectively, then
check that the alarms are received at the Control
Room.  [_ _]
(d) Observe the level controller readout for variations, with
respect to the pump operations.   [_ _]
(e) Check the cabling to the pump for damage and that it is
clear from possible damage.   [_ _]
(f) When this job falls in either December, March, June or
September.  Lift the level controller sensor out of the
protective conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in
the sensor base of all dirt or debris.   [_ _]
9. Switch the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector to the MANUAL
position.   [_ _]
10. (a) Check and note the position of the pump non-return valve
(NRV) counterweight prior to starting the pump.  [_ _]
(b) Start the pump PSSWDWP1 by pressing the START push
button.
CAUTION: Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
alarm point as the lack of submergence may cause damage to the
pumpset.
(c) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work Done
area of the job sheet if the current reading is greater
than FLC 190A.  [_ _]
(d) Observe pump operation for smooth running, vibration and
abnormal noises. [_ _]
(e) Observe that the pump discharge rate is sufficient to
draw down the water level in the sump.   [_ _]
(f) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton. Check
the operation of the non-return valve (NRV), as the
water flow  stops.
(i) The NRV should close with a sharp audible metallic
sound
(ii) The counterweight returning to it's pre-start
position or lower, as well
(iii) backflow through pump should cease within 30 seconds.
(iv) If a faulty closure is suspected, the pump should be
re-started, operated for 2 minutes and the operation
of the NRV monitored again.    [_ _]
11. Repeat steps 8 through to 10 for pump PSSWDWP2.   [_ _]
12. Repeat steps 8 through to 10 for pump PSSWDWP3.   [_ _]
13. Return the  AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
position.       [_ _]
14. Switch the ground water pump AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch
to the MANUAL position
(a) Check the operation of the float switches.  To test, lift
the High/High float and Low/Low float respectively, then
check that the alarms are received at the control
room. [_ _]
(b) Observe the level controller readout for variations, with
respect to the operation of the pump  [_ _]
15. Start the pump PSSWGWP1 by pressing the START push button.
CAUTION: Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
alarm point as the lack of submergence may cause damage to the
pumpset.
(a) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work
Done area of the job sheet (FLC 50A).  [_ _]
(b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running or
vibration and abnormal noises. [_ _]
(c) Check that the pump discharge rate is sufficient to draw
down the water level in the sump.     [_ _]
(d) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton.  Check
the operation of the NRV.  Full valve closure will be
indicated by the backflow through pump ceasing within
30 seconds.  Excessive backflow (longer than 30 seconds)
occurring, may indicate that debris is jammed in the
valve preventing a full closure.  The pump should be
re-started, operated for a further 2 minutes and the
operation of the NRV monitored again.  [_ _]
If a faulty closure is still suspected, report the fault
for corrective maintenance.
(e) Re-grease Motor bearings and Pump main bearing using
general multi purpose grease.
(f) Clean bottom of pump housing where drain water is
collected.
16. Repeat steps 14 and 15 for pump PSSWGWP2.
17. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
position.  [_ _]
18. When this job falls in either December, March, June or
September.  Lift the level controller sensor out of the
protective conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in the
sensor base of all dirt or debris.   [_ _]
19. Check that the wet well ventilation system fan is
operational and moving air from the wet well.  [_ _]
20. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area
of the job sheet.  [_ _]
21. A Confined Space Entry permit is required prior to entering
the sump
22. At the pump motor control panel, switch the pumps from
Automatic Mode to Manual Mode and switch the two clean
water pumps to the OFF position.
DO NOT OPERATE THE PUMPS WITHOUT WATER COVERAGE.  THE PUMPS
NEED TO BE SUBMERGED TO OBTAIN ADEQUATE COOLING OTHERWISE
DAMAGE WILL OCCUR.
23. At the pump sump
(a) Inspect the triple interceptor for debris, silt
deposits and foreign objects, remove and clean if
required.
(b) Inspect the pump sump for debris, silt deposits and
foreign objects, remove and clean if required.
24. Ensure the Triple Interceptor bypass valve is OPEN.
25. (a) Close Valve GW1 & GW2.   Record the result of all tests
on form TMF-3012-OP-0273 - Burnley Tunnel Pump
Calibration
(b) Open valve GW1.
(c) Start Pump GW1 using the On/Off Push Buttons
26. (a) Record head pressure
(b) Record the flow rate (Large digits of Magmeter)
27. Close valve GW1 and Open valve GW2.  Repeat step 28 for
pump GW2.
28. Open valve GW1.  Repeat  step 29 for pumps GW1 & GW2.
29. Once the test is complete, ensure that the valves (GW1 &
GW2) are fully open.
30. Close the pressure gauge isolating valve and remove the
pressure gauge.
31. At the pump motor control panel, switch the pumps from
Manual mode to Automatic Mode.
32. Record the hours run for the pumps in the Work Done area of
the jobsheet .
The hour readings are obtained from the CCCs.
The entities are SWDW1RUN, SWDW2RUN, SWDW3RUN, SWGW1RUN &
SWGW2RUN
33. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the pump station and
equipment etc,  in the Work Done section of the job sheet
and report to the Team Leader or his representative and
raise a new job for any repairs.
34. Record in the Work Done area of the Job sheet any
outstanding works that require further work.  Raise a new
job sheet for any outstanding work that is required.
35. Notify the traffic control room on completion of the job.
36. Ensure the completed from TMF-3012-OP-0273 - Burnley Tunnel
Groundwater Pump Calibration  is returned to the Electrical
/ Electronic Team leader or his representative for recording
of the data.  Enter data into file at
G:\TFM\Operations\Tunnel drainage\Burnley Tunnel Drainage\
Swan St pump Flows.xls
\ Data Entry. Print Graph and forward to Maintenance
Operations Manager for information and forwarding to
relevant authorities.

12 M Lev 2 Inspect of HV system for operation & Faults
All TS procedures in TMI-3012-SA-0102 High Voltage Safety Work
Instruction.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2. The following work is to be carried by the sub-contractor
under the supervision of an electrical/electronics
technician.
3. Ensure that the Three monthly HV electric inspection has been
carried out and that
(a) The General Section of the above job has been completed
and
(b) Inspect the earthing conductors, earthing electrodes and
connections ensuring all cabling, connections and
installation meet the AS 3000 standard.
4. (Schneider SM6 Switchboard, Circuit Breakers and Isolators)
(a) Read and record the number of operation cycles for each
Circuit Breaker and Isolator.  [_ _]
5. (Substation Earthing Systems)
The result of all tests, inspections and observations
including date of test, ground and weather conditions are to
be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
leader or his representative.
(a) At each substation and HV switchroom, carry out an
earthing resistance test in accordance with AS3000.
(b) Examine each earthing system in turn and check for
tightness of connections, and the condition of system
components e.g. Earthing electrodes, earthing
connections, conductors etc.
6. (RMU Battery Supply and Chargers)
The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to
be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
leader or his representative.
(a) Inspect the battery compartment for damage, appearance
and cleanliness.
(b) Check that the charger is functional.
(c) Check the battery voltage on float charge.
(d) Check that the battery compartment ventilation vents are
clean and clear.
(e) Check the external battery connections for tightness and
corrosion.  Clean and tighten as required.
(f) Check battery cases and or covers are not cracked or
distorted.
(g) Carry out a performance test of the battery bank.
(i) Discharge the batteries, via a load, over a two hour
period. Record both terminal and battery voltage and
battery temperature prior to commencing the test as
well as at completion of test.  Where the battery or
terminal voltage at completion of test is less than
80% of nominal voltage, then the battery is
approaching the end of it's serviceable life and
replacement options should be recommended.
(h) Check and record the on-load charger output (Voltage and
current)
(i)  Check the charger electrical connections and wiring for
damage etc.
7. Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection
results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new
job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative.  Include in the Related Job
field of the new and this job, the job number of the
alternate Job.   [_ _]
8. At Substations fill-in the log book.   [_ _]

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Equipment Rooms, as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of
the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Equipment Rooms ERE01 - ERE 16 and ERW 01 - ERW 06)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Equipment rooms, Technical
shelters and
Substations.
2. On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans, if
operating (fans not
required to be  switched OFF in technical shelters and appropriate
equipment
rooms).   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including theoperational
tube within
EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all accessible
equipment and
components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus
10°C should be
considered abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of
the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. Raise a new
job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and
components  for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
raise a new jobsheet
for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or his
representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering,
arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and escutcheons
for serviceability and general operation, lubricate as required.
Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
damage.  [_ _]
10. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
required. [_ _]
12. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out
repairsor indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
[_ _]
13.  PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
toindicate abnormal
conditions are to be logged in the work done area of the job
sheet and a new job sheet
raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are not
loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the enclosure and
PLC modules
are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
14. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
accumulation, where applicable.
15. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for operation
and security.  Check
with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of
analarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
16.   Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective
actions.  Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and
thisjob, the job number
of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
Inspect for source of
any water.  Record any details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job
sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and or
stored items.  Remove
any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets, ledges,
cable trays,
cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces,
e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]
4. At equipment rooms (ERE03 - ERE16 & ERW 02 - ERW 05), replace
Absorbent.  [_ _]
5. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  Replace bait station
if bait is near
exhausted.  [_ _]
6. Check telephone for operation.  [_ _]
7. Inspect all metal work for corrosion, clean of corrosion and recover
with cold gal area
cleaned.   [_ _]
8. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved cleaning
materials .  [_ _]
9. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light fittings
,cable trays and
ceilings.  [_ _]
10. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
11. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
12. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.   Record
any abnormal
parameter in the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet.   Raise a
new jobsheet for any
outstanding corrective actions.  [_ _]
13. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.  [_ _]
14. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g. Fans,
Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
15.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work

Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this job,

switch.  (Perhaps see Andrew Butler for further information.)

01 M Inspection & test running of the generator
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
Supply  to ensure it is operating in the normal
standby-back-up mode.  [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
MODE.
4. General inspection. Reference: Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
(a) Check that the generator was left in  "" AUTO ""  [_ _]
(b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuels and water.  [_ _]
(c) Check oil level.  [_ _]
(d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
(e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).  [_ _]
(f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts  [_  _]
(g) Record the battery voltage in the Work Done area of the
job sheet.  [_ _]
(h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
Physically open the cap,as gauge could be
misleading.  [_ _]
(j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours
with the last entry.  [_ _]
5. Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP Electrical Pty Ltd
Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI [M-MCL-ME-20016]
(a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the RUN / OFF / AUTO Switch on the generator DC
panel to RUN let the engine run for at least 5 minutes,
then turn the RUN / OFF / AUTO Switch back to AUTO
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from AUTOMATIC CONTROL to EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST run the
generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared, and
that there are no unusual noises or vibrations. [_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure,
water temperature. [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back to
AUTOMATIC CONTROL, the generator will continune to run
for about 8 minutes before stopping. [_ _]
6.  Record the hours run for the generator (from the hour run
meter) and update the Plant Usage in Mainpac from Plant
RHMouse click select Open then Meter Readings in edit mode
add Usage   [_________hrs].
7. (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
8. Fill in the Generator Log Book  and record anything outside
normal parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
Raise a new job for any works requiring further repairs.
Priority High P1.
9. Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
10. Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.

01 M Maint inspection of WL emergency roadside telephones
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
2. Use Vehicle arrow board and short term emergency lane
stoppage as per Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 13
or 14.
3. For northbound carriageway and at each emergency roadside
telephone:
(a) Inspect the telephone for graffiti, damage and or insect
infestation
(b) Clean the telephone of grime and residues, use spray-on
Nifty and a clean cloth.
(c) Test the operation of the telephone with the control
room.  Using the Emergency Roadside telephone, contact
the Traffic Control Room and confirm operation of the
phone communication then have the control room call back
to the ERT to check the reverse operation.
4. For southbound carriageway and at each emergency roadside
telephone:
(a) Inspect the telephone for graffiti, damage and or insect
infestation
(b) Clean the telephone of grime and residues, use spray-on
Nifty and a clean cloth.
(c) Test the operation of the telephone with the control
room.  Using the Emergency Roadside telephone, contact
the Traffic Control Room and confirm operation of the
phone communication then have the control room call back
to the ERT to check the reverse operation.
5. For each ERT
(a) record the result of the inspection
(b) that the ERT has been cleaned and
(c) the result of the communication test
for each telephone on the attached form METS Inspection
(Monthly) - Western Link Form No. TMF-3012-OP-0036.
6. Record the details of any further corrective actions that are
required in the comments area of the form.
7. Notify the control room on the completion of inspection.
8. Return the completed job sheet as well as the form METS
Inspection (Monthly) - Western Link Form No. TMF-3012-OP-0036
to the Electrical / Electronics Team Leader or his
representative.
9. The Electrical / Electronics Team Leader or his
representative is to raise a new job sheet for any corrective
actions required.

03 M Maint of Gantry Tolling Equipment
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Carry out the three monthly planned maintenance defined in
the CML RSE Users Manual maintenance schedule, document no.
M-MCL-ET-1225.
2. Perimeter access gate at technical shelter key required.
3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment
and or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to safety
instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 "Working on Gantry Structures
4. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
5. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plan PL-MCL-ET-100001.
Preventative Maintenance No.0301
When carrying out the cleaning of VDC sensors (in 0301),
inspect the area around the connectors for evidence of
corrosion.
If corrosion is evident, then clean the area as described
below.
Where cleaning is to be also carried out, use extreme care
to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter any
connectors.
The Fibre Optic Connector is to be only removed on the
12 Monthly  Cycle (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
Prior to removing any connector or cover socket, clean
surface corrosion and deposits from around connectors,
socket covers and the surrounding surfaces use a tooth
brush to assist if necessary.
Remove the three socket covers (remove only if possible
using fingers) and apply a light spray of silicon to
the three (3) socket covers, replacing and exercising
the threads.
With all caps and plugs re-installed apply a light spray of
silicon to the area around the plugs and caps.
Check for silicon overspray on the VDC sensor window and
clean if necessary.
Where connectors or socket covers cannot be easily removed,
record details in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and
report the fact to the Team Leader or his representative.
0301: Check image quality and
,,,, alignment with CML Clean glass regardless of image.
,,,, Lubrication of mounting bracket carried out on removal
,,,, only.  Lightly spray with lubricant.
0302: Clean external glass of front and rear VR sensors.
Inspect mounting brackets and lubricate as required.
Ensure pins are cleaned and lubricated using silicon
spray prior to installing.
0303: Check VR Illuminator that there are less than 10%
defective IR LEDs,Advice CML if suspect below 10%
0304: Clean front surface of TRX, inspect mtg bracket and
lubricate as required
0305: Clean outside of glass cover of VDC, Replace failed
lamps, Lubricate arms as required.
Inspect VDC arm locating pins and chains. Record any
works required and report any equipment that needs
repair.
0306: Road Markers: Inspect for clarity & Cleanliness.( High ,,
,, contrast between marker & road). (If road markers need
to be changed, inform the Team Leader.)
0307: Clean the glass of VSS sensor
0308: Inspect Distribution Cabinet for loose or damaged   ,,
cables. Clean cabinet for insects or moisture.
6. Record in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet any
outstanding works requiring further attention.  Create a
new Job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative of the outstanding works.
Record the New job number in the "Work Done" area of this
job sheet and in the "Related Job" field of both jobs.
7. Notify Control Room prior to departing from the Technical
Shelter."
