01 M Inspection & test running of the generator
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
shelter.
3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
Supply  to ensure it is operating in the normal
standby-back-up mode.  [_ _]
DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
MODE.
4. General inspection. Reference: Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
(a) Check that the generator was left in  "" AUTO ""  [_ _]
(b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuels and water.  [_ _]
(c) Check oil level.  [_ _]
(d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
(e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).  [_ _]
(f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts  [_  _]
(g) Record the battery voltage in the Work Done area of the
job sheet.  [_ _]
(h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
Physically open the cap,as gauge could be
misleading.  [_ _]
(j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours
with the last entry.  [_ _]
5. Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP Electrical Pty Ltd
Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI [M-MCL-ME-20016]
(a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
(b) Turn the RUN / OFF / AUTO Switch on the generator DC
panel to RUN let the engine run for at least 5 minutes,
then turn the RUN / OFF / AUTO Switch back to AUTO
(c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
from AUTOMATIC CONTROL to EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST run the
generator for 10 minutes.
(d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared, and
that there are no unusual noises or vibrations. [_ _]
(e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure,
water temperature. [_ _]
(f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back to
AUTOMATIC CONTROL, the generator will continune to run
for about 8 minutes before stopping. [_ _]
6.  Record the hours run for the generator (from the hour run
meter) and update the Plant Usage in Mainpac from Plant
RHMouse click select Open then Meter Readings in edit mode
add Usage   [_________hrs].
7. (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
any unusual noises.  [_ _]
(b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant
leakages  [_ _]
(c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a
corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
8. Fill in the Generator Log Book  and record anything outside
normal parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
Raise a new job for any works requiring further repairs.
Priority High P1.
9. Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
10. Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.

A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Equipment Rooms, as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of
the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Equipment Rooms ERE01 - ERE 16 and ERW 01 - ERW 06)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Equipment rooms, Technical
shelters and
Substations.

operating (fans not
required to be  switched OFF in technical shelters and appropriate
equipment
rooms).   [_ _]

senses of sight, smell
and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including theoperational
tube within
EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all accessible
equipment and
components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus
10°C should be
considered abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of
the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. Raise a new
job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and
components  for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
raise a new jobsheet
for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or his
representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering,
arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and escutcheons
for serviceability and general operation, lubricate as required.
Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
damage.  [_ _]
10. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
required. [_ _]
12. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out

replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
[_ _]
13.  PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
toindicate abnormal
conditions are to be logged in the work done area of the job
sheet and a new job sheet
raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are not
loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the enclosure and
PLC modules
are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]

accumulation, where applicable.

and security.  Check
with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of

faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
16.   Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work

actions.  Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and

of the alternate Job.   [_ _]

12 M Lev 2 Inspect of HV system for operation & Faults
All TS procedures in TMI-3012-SA-0102 High Voltage Safety Work
Instruction.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2. The following work is to be carried by the sub-contractor
under the supervision of an electrical/electronics
technician.
3. Ensure that the Three monthly HV electric inspection has been
carried out and that
(a) The General Section of the above job has been completed
and
(b) Inspect the earthing conductors, earthing electrodes and
connections ensuring all cabling, connections and
installation meet the AS 3000 standard.
4. (Schneider SM6 Switchboard, Circuit Breakers and Isolators)
(a) Read and record the number of operation cycles for each
Circuit Breaker and Isolator.  [_ _]
5. (Substation Earthing Systems)
The result of all tests, inspections and observations
including date of test, ground and weather conditions are to
be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
leader or his representative.
(a) At each substation and HV switchroom, carry out an
earthing resistance test in accordance with AS3000.
(b) Examine each earthing system in turn and check for
tightness of connections, and the condition of system
components e.g. Earthing electrodes, earthing
connections, conductors etc.
6. (RMU Battery Supply and Chargers)
The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to
be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
leader or his representative.
(a) Inspect the battery compartment for damage, appearance
and cleanliness.
(b) Check that the charger is functional.
(c) Check the battery voltage on float charge.
(d) Check that the battery compartment ventilation vents are
clean and clear.
(e) Check the external battery connections for tightness and
corrosion.  Clean and tighten as required.
(f) Check battery cases and or covers are not cracked or
distorted.
(g) Carry out a performance test of the battery bank.
(i) Discharge the batteries, via a load, over a two hour
period. Record both terminal and battery voltage and
battery temperature prior to commencing the test as
well as at completion of test.  Where the battery or
terminal voltage at completion of test is less than
80% of nominal voltage, then the battery is
approaching the end of it's serviceable life and
replacement options should be recommended.
(h) Check and record the on-load charger output (Voltage and
current)
(i)  Check the charger electrical connections and wiring for
damage etc.
7. Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection
results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new
job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative.  Include in the Related Job
field of the new and this job, the job number of the
alternate Job.   [_ _]
8. At Substations fill-in the log book.   [_ _]

03 M Insp Thytec UPS System SL TSH's
03 M Inspection of Thytec UPS system in SL TSH's
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
3. Refer to Manual: Thytec 30KVA UPS 12 Pulse
[ M-MCL-ME20000/20011 ] Manual.
4. Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
charged ) record results in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
5. At By-pass Switch (Wall Mounted)
(a) Press the TRANSFER button, on the UPS control panel, to
transfer the UPS  to the by-pass mode.
(b) Wait until the amber By-Pass led is illuminated.
(c) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet,
to the OFF position, to isolate the batteries.
(d) Press the OFF button, on the UPS control panel,  to
switch OFF the UPS unit.
(e) Switch the EXTERNAL BY-PASS switch (wall mounted above
UPS) to the BY-PASS position.  The UPS unit is now
by-passed.
WARNING: DO NOT USE THE INTERNAL BY-PASS SWITCH, AS THIS
SWITCH IS NOT INTERLOCKED.
(f) Switch the EXTERNAL by-pass switch to the NORMAL
position.
(g) Press the ON button, on the UPS control panel.  An UPS
start is initiated.
(h) Wait for INV. ON green led to illuminate.
(i) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet,
to the ON position to connect the batteries to the UPS.
(j) After about 30 secconds the BYPASS led will go OFF and
the INVERTER led will illuminate, indicating the load is
on the inverter.  A noticeable change in the operating
noise of the UPS will also indicate the change of load.
6. UPS Unit.
(a) Do not operate the EMERGENCY STOP push button, on the
front of the UPS Panel, unless in extreme emergency, as
damage to the UPS electrical equipment can occur.
(b) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.
[_ _]
(c) Remove the air filter, clean and re-install, ( replace
air filter if necessary )   [_ _]
(d) Check for air flow above grills on top of the panel.
( with fan in operation )   [_ _]
(e) Visual Inspection of capacitors for any oil leaks.  [_ _]
(f) Switch OFF the ""MAIN UPS"" electrical supply.  The load
should then transfer to the UPS, supplying from the
batteries.
(g) Check and monitor, on the UPS display, the load current
(max. 42A per phase 30kVA UPS or max 55A per phase 40kVA
UPS).
(h) Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
discharged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
(i) Leave the UPS supply the load for at least ten minutes.
(j) Switch the Normal electricity supply isolator to the ON
position.  The load will revert to the Normal power
supply.
7. Battery Panel.
(a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
Batteries.
(b) Ensure the Circuit Breaker operating handle, on Panel
Door, is in the upright position and is not tripped.
[_ _]
(c) Measure and record the overall charge voltage across the
CB ( nominally 270V. )    [_ _]
8. Record any result outside normal parameters, in the "" Work
Done "" area of the job sheet.
9.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
10.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.

03 M Electrical Inspection and Clean LV Switchboards
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning and
inspections of the Building
and Electrics, prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths,
lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,
Rubbish bags, Filter
material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Cold Gal, Wire Brush,
Thinners, Absorbent,
Rodent bait station
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Equipment Rooms, as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of
the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Equipment Rooms ERE01 - ERE 16 and ERW 01 - ERW 06)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Equipment rooms, Technical
shelters and
Substations.
2. On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans, if
operating (fans not
required to be  switched OFF in technical shelters and appropriate
equipment
rooms).   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including theoperational
tube within
EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all accessible
equipment and
components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus
10°C should be
considered abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of
the Job Sheet and
ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. Raise a new
job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and
components  for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.  Record
anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
raise a new jobsheet
for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or his
representative is informed of
the abnormality.  [_ _]
7.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering,
arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and escutcheons
for serviceability and general operation, lubricate as required.
Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
damage.  [_ _]
10. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
required. [_ _]
12. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out
repairsor indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
[_ _]
13.  PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
toindicate abnormal
conditions are to be logged in the work done area of the job
sheet and a new job sheet
raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are not
loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the enclosure and
PLC modules
are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
14. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
accumulation, where applicable.
15. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for operation
and security.  Check
with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of
analarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
16.   Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the
Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective
actions.  Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and
thisjob, the job number
of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
Inspect for source of
any water.  Record any details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job

03 M Inspection of Thytec UPS system in WL TSH's
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
2. Notify the control room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
3. Refer to Manual: Thytec 30KVA UPS 12 Pulse
[ M-MCL-ME20000/20011 ] Manual.
4. Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
charged ) record results in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
5. At By-pass Switch (Wall Mounted)
(a) Press the TRANSFER button, on the UPS control panel, to
transfer the UPS  to the by-pass mode.
(b) Wait until the amber By-Pass led is illuminated.
(c) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet<(>,<)>
to the OFF position, to isolate the batteries.
(d) Press the OFF button, on the UPS control panel,  to
switch OFF the UPS unit.
(e) Switch the EXTERNAL BY-PASS switch (wall mounted above
UPS) to the BY-PASS position.  The UPS unit is now
by-passed.
WARNING: DO NOT USE THE INTERNAL BY-PASS SWITCH, AS THIS
SWITCH IS NOT INTERLOCKED.
(f) Switch the EXTERNAL by-pass switch to the NORMAL
position.
(g) Press the ON button, on the UPS control panel.  An UPS
start is initiated.
(h) Wait for INV. ON green led to illuminate.
(i) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet<(>,<)>
to the ON position to connect the batteries to the UPS.
(j) After about 30 secconds the BYPASS led will go OFF and
the INVERTER led will illuminate, indicating the load is
on the inverter.  A noticeable change in the operating
noise of the UPS will also indicate the change of load.
6. UPS Unit.
(a) Do not operate the EMERGENCY STOP push button, on the
front of the UPS Panel, unless in extreme emergency, as
damage to the UPS electrical equipment can occur.
(b) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.
[_ _]
(c) Remove the air filter, clean and re-install, ( replace
air filter if necessary )   [_ _]
(d) Check for air flow above grills on top of the panel.
( with fan in operation )   [_ _]
(e) Visual Inspection of capacitors for any oil leaks.  [_ _]
(f) Switch OFF the ""MAIN UPS"" electrical supply.  The load
should then transfer to the UPS, supplying from the
batteries.
(g) Check and monitor, on the UPS display, the load current
(max. 42A per phase 30kVA UPS or max 55A per phase 40kVA
UPS).
(h) Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
discharged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
[ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
a battery fault. ]
(i) Leave the UPS supply the load for at least ten minutes.
(j) Switch the Normal electricity supply isolator to the ON
position.  The load will revert to the Normal power
supply.
7. Battery Panel.
(a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
Batteries.
(b) Ensure the Circuit Breaker operating handle, on Panel
Door, is in the upright position and is not tripped.
[_ _]
(c) Measure and record the overall charge voltage across the
CB ( nominally 270V. )    [_ _]
8. Record any result outside normal parameters, in the "" Work
Done "" area of the job sheet.
9.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
10.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
Works completed as above work plan
"

03 M Inspection of ERW02 (adjacent to Sub 4) Liebert A/C
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Access to ERW02 is via the stairwell in Alexandra Avenue.
The equipment room is adjacent to Substation 4.
NOTE: Parking restrictions may apply between 7.00am and
5.30pm.
The airconditioning unit is located in equipment room ERW02
and the condenser unit is located in the riser, adjacent to
Substation 4.  Access for detailed inspection of the
condenser unit is restricted.
3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
4. Work plan for ACU-ERW2-1  - Air Conditioning Unit
4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
vibration.   [_ _]
4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
setting.   [_ _]
b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
the following steps
(i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
displayed)
(ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
(iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
setting.
(iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
(v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
(vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that
temperature shown on unit  is consistent with new
setpoint and verify temperature is consistent with
ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
original setting.   [_ _]
d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
point is reached and verify that the temperature is
consistent with ambient using the portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary   Filter type
Liebert size 650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
is clear.   [_ _]
4.6. Restart unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
5. The work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local isolating
switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local isolator.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
Unit.   [_ _]
6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
will collect dust deposits.   [___]
6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
Clear any blockages.
6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and
rubbish.   [_ _]
7.0. Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record
the results on form  Equipment Room Inspections
TMF-3012-OP-0347.  Ensure the form Equipment Room
Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347 is returned to the Electrical
Electronics Supervisor or his representative.  Raise a new
jobsheet for any outstanding works.
8.0 On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done  section of the job sheet and
report to the Team Leader or his representative and raise a
new job for any repairs.
9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

12 M Inspection of Cast Resin HV Transformers
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

accordance with Transfield's procedure number TMI-3012-SA-0102
High Voltage Safety Work Instructions.

2. (Cast Resin Dry Type Transformers 1A, 1B, 2A,2B, 3A, 3B, 4A,
4B, 5A & 5B)
The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to
be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
leader or his representative.

cable connections, for partial discharge, ingress of
moisture or damage.

and trip operation via the PMCS to the Traffic Control
Room.

connections (MEN, Bushings and tank) and inspect for
evidence of overheating of broken strands. Tighten
connections where necessary.

of corrosion, dirt, or foreign material buildup.  Clean
coils , core and frame and treat and recoat any surface
rust spots.

results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new

03 M Maint of the Variable Message Sign
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in emergency lane.
2. Access keys required for Sound Wall Gate, to access VMS 07.

Plan 12 or 13 (Short term and low traffic volume).  Vic Roads
approval required prior to doing job.
Access to VMS 6 is from the car park below the elevated road.

or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to Safety
Instructions  TMI-3012-SA-0101, Working  on Gantry
Structures.

the VMS.  Monitor operation and repair as required.  Monitor
the LED Arrays and the Flashers for failed LEDS and

LEDs exceed 10% of the array.

the appropriate Job numbers in the Related Jobs  field
and Notify the Team Leader or his representative
of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
5. Carry out visual inspection externally and internally of the
cabinets, sign, external cables and conduits for vandalism,
mechanical damage, water ingress, condensation or insect
infestation. Also check inside cabinets for tripped circuit
breakers, disconnected wires, burn marks from excessive heat.
[_ _]
6. Visually check for loose or missing nuts and bolts, and for
rusted areas, rusted nuts or bolts. Cleans with wire brush
and spray with Cold Gal or equivalent. This should be
done with care and to avoid overspray. [_ _]
7. Inspect the external face of the lenses (for each pixel) for
dirt and clean with Windex or equivalent  and clean rags
if required.[_ _]
8. Note any corrective action required in the Work Done area
of the Job Sheet and raise new Job Sheet if required.
9. Notify control room on departure.

03 M Inspect Clean Emergency stairways thru'out the project
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
and inspections of the Stairway and Electrics, prior to leaving
the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for
fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,
Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray,
Rodent bait station, Cold Gal.
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations and cleaning of the stairway areas.
A  INTRODUCTION
1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2. This Job is for the inspection and clean of the emergency
stairways e.g. External and Internal stairway to YC Pump Stn,
External Stairway to SUB 04, External Stairway to
SUB 05.   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,
use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
abnormal events.  [_ _]
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
1. Check the interior and external lighting for operation,
including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace or
repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
2. Clean lighting diffusers (including emergency and Exit
lighting) and lens of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
3. Check and clean cable trays for accumulated debris.  Record
anything abnormal in the Work Done area of the job sheet and
inform the Team Leader or his representative of outstanding
actions.  [_ _]
C  Stairway Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the relevant stairway(s) are not obstructed by
furnishings and or stored items.  Remove any
obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Check the doors for damage and operation, lubricate and
repair as required and record in the Work Done area of the
Job Sheet.  Inform the Team Leader or his representative
of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
4. Clean dust and remove cobwebs from interior walls and
ceilings.  [_ _]
5. Remove from site all accumulated rubbish and debris,
including accumulated leaves and debris at top of
stairways.  [_ _]
6. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces and stairs.  [_ _]
7. Clean hand rails (if applicable) of dust and dirt.  [_ _]
9. Visually inspect all metalwork for damage or corrosion.
Repair and or remove corrosion and clean then cover with
Cold Gal.  [_ _]
10. Carry out Exterior Checks of relevant area(s) (where
applicable).
(a) Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the building
(if applicable) for damage, erosion,  graffiti,
corrosion.  [_ _]
(b) Visually inspect the building (if applicable) walls,
roof, guttering and and downpipes for damage, leaks and
or blockages, remove any debris or materials that could
cause a blockage.  [_ _]
(c) Inspect (if applicable) the general area surrounding the
building for erosion and damage to surfaces, fences,
gates, pavements   [_ _]
11. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds
(where appropriate).  [_ _]
12. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
13. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.

below assumes SF-SS6-1 is the duty fan.
(a) At the switchboard, switch the fan OFF using the circuit
breaker in control panel (SUB6 A/C 6 MEB).  Isolate and
tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-01013, Low Voltage Safety
Work Instruction.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the fan housing and wall penetration flashing for
damage.    [_ _]
(c) Check the fan panels and fixings for damage, corrosion
and fixings that may be loose or missing.   [_ _]
(d) Check the fan cowls and grilles for debris blocking the
passage of air.   [_ _]
(e) Check the fan for free movement and any damage to the
blade.   [_ _]
(f) Switch the fan ON, using the circuit breaker in control
panel (SUB6 A/C 6 MEB).   [_ _]
(g) Check the fan for correct rotation.   [_ _]
(h) Check for fan and motor for unusual noises and
vibrations.   [_ _]
(i ) Check the motor bearings, lubricate if required.   [_ _]
SF-SS6-2
(k) Switch OFF the circuit breaker for the fan SF-SS6-2 and
tagout in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-01013, Low Voltage
Safety Work Instruction.
(l) Inspect the fan housing and wall penetration flashing for
damage.    [_ _]
(m) Check the fan panels and fixings for damage, corrosion
and fixings that may be loose or missing.   [_ _]
(n) Check the fan cowls and grilles for debris blocking the
passage of air.   [_ _]
(o) Check the fan for free movement and any damage to the
blade.   [_ _]
(p) Switch the fan SF-SS6-2 ON, using the circuit breaker in
control panel(SUB6 A/C 6 MEB).   [_ _]
(q) While fan SF-SS6-1 is running, operate the TRIP switch
mechanism, on the front of the circuit breaker, fan
SF-SS6-1 will go off and SF-SS6-2 will start.
(r) Check the fan for correct rotation.   [_ _]
(s) Check for fan and motor for unusual noises and
vibrations.   [_ _]
(t) Check the motor bearings, lubricate if required.   [_ _]
(u) Switch circuit breaker for fan SF-SS6-1 ON, fan SF-SS6-2
will go OFF and SF-SS6-1 will start.
4. Check the roof nmounted relief vent for damage and blockages,
repair or remove debris as required.   [_ _]
5. Check the fire dampers (3), at the fan inlet vents and the
substaion exhaust vent in back wall, for damage and premature
operation.   [_ _]
6. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.
7. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

03 M Inspect of Liebert A/C units at Substation 2.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Access to the Air Conditioning units in the Substation 2
building is via external doors into the SS02 building in Swan
Street. The condenser units are located on the roof of the
building.
3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
vibration.   [_ _]
4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
setting.   [_ _]
b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
the following steps
(i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
displayed)
(ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
(iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
setting.
(iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
(v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
(vi) Wait until unit cuts out,  and verify that
temperature shown on unit is consistent with new
setpoint and verify temperature is consistent with
ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
original setting.   [_ _]
d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
point is reached and verify that the temperature is
consistent with ambient using the portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary.   Filter type
Liebert size 650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
is clear.   [_ _]
4.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
5.1.  Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local fan isolating
switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean the condenser coils, if required using compressed
air.
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local fan isolator.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
Unit.   [_ _]
6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
will collect dust deposits.   [___]
6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
Clear any blockages.
6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
7.0. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the Equipment room and
equipment etc,  in the Work Done section of the job sheet
and report to the Team Leader or his representative and
raise a new job for any repairs.
8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

03 M Load test of the MGE UPS
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
2. Check with the control room if any UPS alarms are relevant.
3. Refer to MGE UPS Systems Manual, Galaxy User Manual
E-679380XT/FA, M-STG-EL-24009, and Schnieder Electric Tunnel
Electrical Services Training Notes, M-STG-EL-24001,
Section 9.
WARNING
THE UPS BATTERY POTENTIAL IS APPROXIMATELY 380 VOLTS AND IS
EARTHED.  THE BATTERIES CAN DELIVER A FAULT CURRENT OF
APPROXIMATELY 9000 AMPS.  EXPOSED BATTERY TERMINALS ARE
DANGEROUS AND MUST NOT BE TOUCHED.  IN THE VICINITY OF THE
BATTERIES USE ONLY TOOLS WHICH ARE FULLY INSULATED.
SAFETY GLASSES MUST BE WORN WHEN CARRYING OUT  MEASUREMENTS
ON THE BATTERIES.
4. Check the UPS control panel readout for alarms and or normal
status.  If an alarm is found, record the alarm in the Work
Done Area of the Job Sheet. Do Not Continue with this Job if
an alarm is present.  [_ _]
5. Record measurements on form 03 M MGE Uninterruptible Power
Supply Battery Inspection and Test, TMF-3012-OP-0099.
6. Measure and record the UPS room temperature.   [_ _]
7. Check and record DC voltage and AC ripple voltage for each
bank of batteries.  If a discrepancy is found then record in
the Work Done Area of the Job Sheet.  Do Not Continue
this job sheet if there is a discrepancy in the readings
recorded and the readings expected.  [_ _]
8. To simulate a power failure, Open Mains 1 Isolator (Q1), the
UPS operation will change to the batteries.  [_ _]
9. Operate the UPS, in this mode, for at least 10
minutes.  [_ _]
10. Measure and record the DC voltage for each shelf of the
battery banks.
11. Measure and record the DC current flow in each battery bank.
12. Return the UPS to normal operation by closing Mains 1
Isolator Q1.  [_ _]
13. With an Optical thermometer measure the temperature of the
batteries and their inter-connections.  Temperature readings
should approximate ambient room temperature.  When a
connection is found to having a temperature greater than 5
degrees above room  temperature, in the Work Done Area of
the Job Sheet, record the battery location, terminal
identification, measured  temperature.  [_ _]
14. With an Optical thermometer measure the average temperature
of the two (AC & DC) capacitor banks and record the result.
15. With an anemometer measure and record the airflow from each
of the UPS cooling fans.
16. With the Optical thermometer measure and record the
temperature of each of the UPS cooling fans.  [_ _]
17. Ensure Normal operation of the UPS.  [_ _]
18. Sweep and clean the UPS room:
Sweep the floor and remove accumulated webs from the
walls.   [___]
Sweep the control panel room floors as well, vacuum the
control panel enclosures and any surfaces that will collect
dust deposits.   [___]
Clean the front panel of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
19. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the UPS room and
equipment etc,  in the "Work Done"section of the job
sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
20. Leave a duplicate 03M MGE Uninterruptible Power Supply
Battery Inspection and  test form in the UPS room.  Compare
previously recorded data and record in the Work Done
Area of the Job Sheet any data that shows any degradation.
21. Notify the control room on completion of the job."

03 M inspect of LIEBERT AC units mounted within Mezz Lvl
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Access to the Mobile telephone rooms, RRB room, ERE 00 and
ERE01 is via the Grant Street Stairwell.  The rooms are
located on the mezzanine floor adjacent to ERE01.
The Air Conditioners and the condensers are separate units.
3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Unit
4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
vibration.   [_ _]
4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
temperature should be within 2 degrees of the
thermostat setting.   [_ _]
b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
the following steps
(i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
displayed)
(ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
(iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
setting.
(iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
(v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
(vi) Wait until unit cuts out,  and verify that
temperature shown on unit  is consistent with
new setpoint and verify temperature is consistent
with ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
original setting.   [_ _]
d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
point is reached and verify that the temperature is
consistent with ambient using the portable
thermometer.   [_ _]
NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
4.4. Check the filters and replace if necessary
(a) RRB Room and ERE 01 - Filter type Liebert size
650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
(b) ERE 00 - Filter type Liebert size 500 x 450 x
50mm.   [_ _]
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm drain line is
clear.   [_ _]
4.6. Restart unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFFusing the local isolating switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the fan isolating switch.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
Unit.   [_ _]
6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
thoroughfares:
6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
walls.   [___]
6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
will collect dust deposits.   [___]
6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
enclosure.  [___]
6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
Clear any blockages.
6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
7.0. Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record
the results on form Equipment Room Inspections
TMF-3012-OP-0347.  Ensure the form Equipment Room
Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347 is returned to the Electrical
Electronics Supervisor or his representative.  Raise a new
jobsheet for any outstanding works.
8.0 On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done section of the job sheet and
report to the Team Leader or his representative and raise a
new job for any repairs.
9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

03 M Load test of the MGE UPS
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
2. Check with the control room if any UPS alarms are relevant.
3. Refer to MGE UPS Systems Manual, Galaxy User Manual
E-679380XT/FA, M-STG-EL-24009, and Schnieder Electric Tunnel
Electrical Services Training Notes, M-STG-EL-24001,
Section 9.
WARNING
THE UPS BATTERY POTENTIAL IS APPROXIMATELY 380 VOLTS AND IS
EARTHED.  THE BATTERIES CAN DELIVER A FAULT CURRENT OF
APPROXIMATELY 9000 AMPS.  EXPOSED BATTERY TERMINALS ARE
DANGEROUS AND MUST NOT BE TOUCHED.  IN THE VICINITY OF THE
BATTERIES USE ONLY TOOLS WHICH ARE FULLY INSULATED.
SAFETY GLASSES MUST BE WORN WHEN CARRYING OUT  MEASUREMENTS
ON THE BATTERIES.
4. Check the UPS control panel readout for alarms and or normal
status.  If an alarm is found, record the alarm in the Work
Done Area of the Job Sheet. Do Not Continue with this Job if
an alarm is present.  [_ _]
5. Record measurements on form 03 M MGE Uninterruptible Power
Supply Battery Inspection and Test, TMF-3012-OP-0099.
6. Measure and record the UPS room temperature.   [_ _]
7. Check and record DC voltage and AC ripple voltage for each
bank of batteries.  If a discrepancy is found then record in
the Work Done Area of the Job Sheet.  Do Not Continue
this job sheet if there is a discrepancy in the readings
recorded and the readings expected.  [_ _]
8. To simulate a power failure, Open Mains 1 Isolator (Q1), the
UPS operation will change to the batteries.  [_ _]
9. Operate the UPS, in this mode, for at least 10
minutes.  [_ _]
10. Measure and record the DC voltage for each shelf of the
battery banks.
11. Measure and record the DC current flow in each battery bank.
12. Return the UPS to normal operation by closing Mains 1
Isolator Q1.  [_ _]
13. With an Optical thermometer measure the temperature of the
batteries and their inter-connections.  Temperature readings
should approximate ambient room temperature.  When a
connection is found to having a temperature greater than 5
degrees above room  temperature, in the Work Done Area of
the Job Sheet, record the battery location, terminal
identification, measured  temperature.  [_ _]
14. With an Optical thermometer measure the average temperature
of the two (AC & DC) capacitor banks and record the result.
15. With an anemometer measure and record the airflow from each
of the UPS cooling fans.
16. With the Optical thermometer measure and record the
temperature of each of the UPS cooling fans.  [_ _]
17. Ensure Normal operation of the UPS.  [_ _]
18. Sweep and clean the UPS room:
Sweep the floor and remove accumulated webs from the
walls.   [___]
Sweep the control panel room floors as well, vacuum the
control panel enclosures and any surfaces that will collect
dust deposits.   [___]
Clean the front panel of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
19. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the UPS room and
equipment etc,  in the "Work Done"section of the job
sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
20. Leave a duplicate 03M MGE Uninterruptible Power Supply
Battery Inspection and  test form in the UPS room.  Compare
previously recorded data and record in the Work Done
Area of the Job Sheet any data that shows any degradation.
21. Notify the control room on completion of the job."

(a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
(b) Position 0 and 1.
(c) Lane Closure: Emergency Lane or on Garden Bed.
(d) Electrical Cabinet Location:
WL Tollway - exception CCAM 526 & 542 are behind the
noise wall.
SL Tollway - exception CCAM 914 & 915 are behind the
noise wall.
3. Set up the lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink  Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12, 13, 14, 143.
4. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,
Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
(a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
necessary.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
(c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,
re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
(d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
fastened to the PT300.
WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
(e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if
not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]
(f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
the signal from the camera using the WFM 90 meter.
(Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the
camera).
Ensure the   co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
module and is secure.  [_ _]
6. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
(unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
of the PTZ .  [_ _]
7. Camera and Camera Housing;
WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
ALIVE.
(a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation.
Surface insect spray may be applied if necessary to the
housing exterior but must not be applied to the interior
of the housing or to the housing glass.  If ingress of
moisture or insect infestation is evident then carry out
steps (d) and (e).  [_ _]
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
mounts. [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
Rain-X  cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm.
WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.
If the heaters are not warm, spray the heater
thermostat (HTR) with FREEZE IT, then again check the
operation of the heater. [_ _]
(e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
8. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
controller.   [_ _]
9. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait 2
minutes then check again.  [_ _]
10.On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.

01 W Mon, m'sure & report  Swan St pump stn flows
The measure of water flowing from the Swan Street pump station
is a measure of all the water collected in the Burnley Tunnel
drainage systems, from both dirty and Groundwater sources.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL
DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0031.
3. The Civil Team leader is to provide a copy of the previous
WEEKLY BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0233 for
detail of the previous readings.
4. At the Swan Street Pump Station Motor Control Centre, record
the Time and the Total flow in kilo litres for the pump
station on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233.
5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
6. Ensure a copy of the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
evaluation on completion  of the job.
Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
in excess of  0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
job to investigate to check the various bay flows for the
reason to the change in water flowrate.
Work completed as above work plan.

03 M Maint of Gantry Tolling Equipment
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Carry out the three monthly planned maintenance defined in
the CML RSE Users Manual maintenance schedule, document no.
M-MCL-ET-1225.
2. Perimeter access gate at technical shelter key required.
3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment
and or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to safety
instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 "Working on Gantry Structures
4. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
5. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plan PL-MCL-ET-100001.
Preventative Maintenance No.0301
When carrying out the cleaning of VDC sensors (in 0301),
inspect the area around the connectors for evidence of
corrosion.
If corrosion is evident, then clean the area as described
below.
Where cleaning is to be also carried out, use extreme care
to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter any
connectors.
The Fibre Optic Connector is to be only removed on the
12 Monthly  Cycle (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
Prior to removing any connector or cover socket, clean
surface corrosion and deposits from around connectors,
socket covers and the surrounding surfaces use a tooth
brush to assist if necessary.
Remove the three socket covers (remove only if possible
using fingers) and apply a light spray of silicon to
the three (3) socket covers, replacing and exercising
the threads.
With all caps and plugs re-installed apply a light spray of
silicon to the area around the plugs and caps.
Check for silicon overspray on the VDC sensor window and
clean if necessary.
Where connectors or socket covers cannot be easily removed,
record details in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and
report the fact to the Team Leader or his representative.
0301: Check image quality and
,,,, alignment with CML Clean glass regardless of image.
,,,, Lubrication of mounting bracket carried out on removal
,,,, only.  Lightly spray with lubricant.
0302: Clean external glass of front and rear VR sensors.
Inspect mounting brackets and lubricate as required.
Ensure pins are cleaned and lubricated using silicon
spray prior to installing.
0303: Check VR Illuminator that there are less than 10%
defective IR LEDs,Advice CML if suspect below 10%
0304: Clean front surface of TRX, inspect mtg bracket and
lubricate as required
0305: Clean outside of glass cover of VDC, Replace failed
lamps, Lubricate arms as required.
Inspect VDC arm locating pins and chains. Record any
works required and report any equipment that needs
repair.
0306: Road Markers: Inspect for clarity & Cleanliness.( High ,,
,, contrast between marker & road). (If road markers need
to be changed, inform the Team Leader.)
0307: Clean the glass of VSS sensor
0308: Inspect Distribution Cabinet for loose or damaged   ,,
cables. Clean cabinet for insects or moisture.
6. Record in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet any
outstanding works requiring further attention.  Create a
new Job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative of the outstanding works.
Record the New job number in the "Work Done" area of this
job sheet and in the "Related Job" field of both jobs.
7. Notify Control Room prior to departing from the Technical
Shelter."

01 M Inspection of  Grant St. Vent Station Axial Fans
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Works to be carried out between 21:00 & 05:00. Three day notice of
pending works to
be given verbally to TLO Maintenance Manager.
2. Obtain the Permit to Work for entry to the ventilation rooms and to
interrupt  operations.
TLO Maintenance Manager to sign Work Permit and works to be carried
only within times
approved on the Work Permit.
3. Inform the control room prior to commencing the work and brief
TCRO'son interruptions
and expected alarms.
4. Reference Manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance
Instructions Manual
(M-STG-VE-26059).
5. At the PMCS in the control room
(a) Check the motor balance vibration reading on the PMCS for all
fans.  If any  reading is in
excess of 6.5mm/s record the result in the ""Work Done"" area
of the job sheet  for further
action.    [_ _]
(b) Check the trend log for the last month, looking for abnormal
events. Record any
abnormalities in the"" Work Done"" area of Job Sheet.  Report
any events and or trends to
the Maintenance Superintendent  that may suggest some abnormal
function.  [_ _]
(c) Check  the running current and record in the ""Work Done"" area
if greater than
FLC 349A for further action.[__]
(d) Check the drive and non drive end bearing temperatures for the
operating fan motor.
Record the details for those bearings with a temperature
greater than 80°C in  the
""Work Done"" area of the job sheet  for further action.  [_ _]
(e) Check the CO levels in the tunnels and the Grant Street Stack on
PMCS screen in the
control room and ensure less than 30ppm prior to commencing
work.  [_ _]
6. Access to the Grant St ventilation station, on the mezzanine level,
is via the Grant St.
stairwell adjacent to the vent stack.  Access to substation 1 is
through the mezzanine
level walkway, north of the smoke duct, then crossing over the smoke
duct twice using
the service ladders to the roof of the substation, then down a
serviceladder  to the tunnel
and then along the tunnel walkway to the substation.
WARNINGS:
DO NOT CARRY OUT THESE CHECKS  WHENEVER THERE ARE MORE THAN 2 FANS
ARE OPERATIONAL.
DO NOT ENTER THE AIRLOCK TO THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM ALONE. TWO OR
MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT WHENEVER ANY  WORK  IS CARRIED OUT IN
THIS AREA.  OBSERVE ALL NOTICES ON THE AIRLOCK DOORS
DO NOT ENTER A SMOKE DUCT UNLESS A PERMIT HAS BEEN OBTAINED FOR
WORK  IN THIS AREA.  TO CROSS THE DUCT A SERVICE LADDER MUST BE USED
AT ALL TIMES
7. Prior to entering the Grant St Stairwell, contact the TCR and requestthey
select manual
control for all Grant St fans and to lock in fan EFW 01 for
continuing operation.
(NOTE: There must be at least one fan operation at all times).
8. Fan Chamber  Access
(a) Enter the fan room airlock from the mezzanine floor, not the
smoke duct.  To open the
airlock doors will require considerable force.  Equalise
thepressure in the air lock
and the fan room using the hatches in the wall before
entering the fan room.   [_ _]
WARNING:
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN, WHEN YOU ARE IN THE FAN
CHAMBER.
DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF THE BODY OR MATERIALS WITHIN 1  METRE OF AN
OPERATING FAN INLET GUARD,  AS THE AIR IS FLOWING AT APPROX  35 kph
9. Work plan for fan EFW 02.
9.1 Fan Room Static Checks
(a) Engage the EMERGENCY STOP button adjacent to the motor.  [_ _]
(b) Check the condition of anti-vibration mountings and ensure
that the rubber bushing
is moved freely, adjust if required.  [_ _]
(c) Examine the grease that has been discharged from motor
bearings for any noticeable
colour change.   [_ _]
(d) Open local electrical junction box e.g. : 1A EFW 02 JB-2
Inspect electrical wiring and
connections, inspect all glands for tightness.  [_ _]
(e) Visually inspect the motor for evidence of condensation, white
powder or similar.
Record in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet any
evidence of condensation,
powder and the like and notify the Team Leader or his
representative.  [_ _]
(f) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and
heater windings.
(i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
(ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor
Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has been
isolated and is to remain
isolated.
(a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
(where connected) and
bridge heater terminals.
(b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
terminals.
(iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the
motorwindings and the
winding heater bridge.  Record the result in the ""Work
Done"" area.
(iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
connections and carry out
an Insulation resistance test between this common bridge
and earth.  Record
the result in the ""Work Done"" area.
(v) Remove all temporary connections.
(vi) If the heater was connected on arrival, then re-instate
theheater connections,
otherwise leave the motor winding heater terminations
isolated.
(vii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
(viii) Where any insulation resistance reading is less than 2
megohm, then Record
in the ""Work Done""area of the Job Sheet and raise a
new job for the outstanding
works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
""Related Job"" field as well
as in the alternate.  Notify the Team Leader or his
representative of any
outstanding works.
9.2 Running Checks.
(a) Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton and contact the TCR to
start the
fan.  [_ _]
(b) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan starts.
[_  _]
(c) Check the fan for abnormal noise.    [_ _]
(d) Check the flexible connections for wear and leakage.    [_ _]
(e) Check the anti-vibration mountings for operation and
structural soundness.    [_ _]
(f ) Check the operation of the local monitor.    [_ _]
(g) Record any abnormalities in the ""'Work Done"" area of Job
Sheet for further
action.    [_ _]
(h) Shutdown the fan motor using the Local EMERGENCY STOP
pushbutton.
(f  ) Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
9.3 Running Fan Check and Lubrication
CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
REQUIRED
AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
(a) On completion of  the Static Fan Checks, return to
substation1, then remove the
safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then remove
the fan motor isolation
at  the MCC.
Note:  Ensure that only one non-operational fan is isolated at
any one time.
(b) Switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF position
to the MANUAL and
the  REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch from the REMOTE position
to the LOCAL
position.
(c) Return to the ventilation room; there start the fan, that is
being maintained,  by                     releasing the lo cal STOP
pushbutton at the fan and then pressing START pushbutton.
(d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan
starts.
(e) Add Shell Stamina RL2 grease or equivalent, to the bearings,
only while the fan is
running.  Ten pumps per bearing.
(f ) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the
bearings, using the retrieval
system.  Examine the grease for changes of colour.   [_ _]
(g) Check the fan for any abnormal noises or vibrations.     [_
_]
(h) Shutdown the fan motor using the local EMERGENCY STOP
pushbutton.
(i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
10. Repeat step 9  for fan EFW 03.   [_ _]
11. Repeat step 9  for fan EFW 04.   [_ _]
12. Repeat step 9  for fan EFW 05.   [_ _]
14. Contact the TCR and request they start fan EFW 05.  [_ _]
13. Repeat step 9 for fan EFW 01.   [_ _]
15. (a) Ensure all EMERGENCY STOP pushbuttons are disengaged.    [_ _]
(b) Collect all tools and materials, leave the fan room, again
equalise the corridor and the
fan room pressures.  [_ _]
16. At Sub 1, inspect the fan starter cabinet for loose connections, hot
connections, accumulated
debris and any abnormal conditions.  [_ _]
17. Repeat step 16 for fan EFW 02.   [_ _]
18. Repeat step 16 for fan EFW 03.   [_ _]
19. Repeat step 16 for fan EFW 04.   [_ _]
20. Contact the TCR and request the TCR to start an additional fan from
EFW 01 to
EFW 04.  [_ _]
21. Once the additional fan has started, request the TCR to stop EFW 05.
[_ _]
22. Repeat step 16 for fan EFW 05.   [_ _]
23. (a) Check the lighting within the fan chamber for operation.  [_ _]
(b) Repair any light found to be not operating or raise a new
jobsheet for the repair of
the fan chamber lighting.
24. Notify the control room on completion of the work and advise that
the fan control has been
returned to the TCR and that automatic operation can be resumed.
[_ _]
25.  Return to control room and ensure all fans are operational.
EMERGENCY OPERATION
In the event of notification by TCR Operators that a tunnel incident hasoccurred
requiring the
use of fans for smoke extraction.
1. Ensure all emergency stop buttons are released and that all fans are
available for
operation.  [_ _]
2. Advise the TCR of any abnormal condition that will restrict
operationof any fan.  [_ _]
3. Vacate the ventilation fan chamber immediately, ensuring the sliding
door to the airlock is
closed and sealed.   [_ _]
4. Advise the traffic control room when all personnel are clear of the
air lock.
On completion of the job, the ""Hours Run"" detail, for each fan is to
be entered into the
hours run table of each Fan Item.  Select the Plant Item,  then right
mouse click, select
""Open"" and then select  ""Meter Readings"".  Select edit mode and
enter data.

01 M Check, Replace blown lamps in the Domain Tunnel.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Replace blown lamps in the Domain Tunnel.  Sodium Lamps
required are TF000377(150W),  TF000378  (250W), TF000376
(400W) and Fluorescent Tubes TF000372 (36W).
(a) Priority given to replace lamps if the lamps in three
consecutive light fittings are not operational.
(b) If a tunnel closure is planned for the month that the job
sheet is issued, priority is to be given to replacing
portal and ramp lighting.
(c) Light fitting diffuser cleaning, where possible, shall be
carried out during the planned tunnel closures at six
monthly intervals, in May and November approximately.
2. Notify TCRO prior to commencing work.
3. Set up lane closure as per Work instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002
and Translink Operations Procedure     PR-RS-OP-IR-020 plan
27, 28 or 123 . (27 for LHL and Centre Lane, 28 for RHL and
centre lane, and 123 for tunnel closure).
4. Use the EWP in the 'B' mode.
5. Before replacing faulty lamps either unplug from power box or
remove the fuse for isolation.
6. If one fluro is faulty in a fitting replace both as they have
both ran the same amount of hours.
7. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
attention of the Team Leader Electrical or his
representative.
8. Notify the TCR on completion of the work.

12 M Inspect and maintain DW T'ment Plant SAF
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. Refer to Maintenance Manual, Operating and Maintenance Manual
for Mechanical Services - MCL Tunnels M-STG-ME-27400.
3. Carry out the 3 monthly inspection and test the fan
functionality.
4. Notify TCR of intention to use local control of fan for
maintenance. [_ _]
5. Work plan for the DW T'MENT PLT SAF (Water Treatment Plant
Ventilation fan)
(a) At the switchboard (CITY LINK WATER MANAGEMENT PLANT
CONTROL PANEL), switch the fan selector switch
(VENTILATION FAN) to the MANUAL position.   Isolate and
tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low Voltage Safety
Work Instruction.  Circuit breaker K10 inside the panel
controls the fan [_ _]
(b) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
windings.  Record any results in the Work Done area of
the job sheet that does not meet specifications set out
in AS3000.   [_ _]
(c) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
anti-condensation heater.  Record any results in the Work
Done area of the job sheet that does not meet
specifications set out in AS3000.   [_ _]
(d) Check the fan and motor bearings, lubricate where
applicable.  [_ _]
(e) Check the condition of any  flexible duct
connections. [_ _]
(f) Check the fan mounting spring support fastenings and
tension. [_ _]
(g) Check the impellor for build-up of dirt, clearances from
housing and alignment.  [_ _]
(h) At the switchboard, remove the safety tags in accordance
with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then switch the AUTO/MANUAL/OFF
selector switch to the AUTO position.
(i) Run the fan for 5 minutes and monitor for any abnormal
conditions.   [_ _]
6. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job Sheet.   [_ _]
7. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

Perform this job at the same time as the CCTV, Speed cameras,
AID Equipment boxes and the AID Junction Boxes whilst a 2 lane
LHL closure of the tunnel is in place.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Work shall be carried out within designated times approved by
the TCRO.
2. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
3. Access to this camera group is:
(a) AID Cameras
802, 804, 806, 808, 810, 812, 814, 816, 818, 820,
822, 824, 826 and 828 are located over the Left hand
lane.
(b) Access Vehicle: EWP.
(c) Lane Closure: LH and centre lane
(d) AID Camera Equipment  Box Location:
Refer to Device Location Guide Ver 5.01 for locations.
4. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 27 (40 kmh) and 39 (60kmh).
5. Reference Manual, Traffic Management Systems - CCTV & AID
Systems - Operators and Maintenance Manual,  (M-MCL-TM-1 511)
6. If it is necessary to isolate the camera power supply (24Vac)
can be switched off at a GPO mounted in the junction box that
services up to four AID cameras mounted locally to the
cameras.
7. Camera and Camera Housing;
(a) Visually inspect for vandalism, damage, corrosion,
external evidence of moisture and any insect infestation.

infestation within the camera housing, then open the AID
camera housing.  Remove any moisture or insect
infestation and discard the previously used Silica Gel
packs and replace with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel
packs.    [_ _]

housing cover visually inspect the condition of cables
and connections and clean, if required, within the camera
enclosure    [_ _]

seal is effective.   [_ _]
8. If the power has been isolated, re-instate the 24V power
supply to the camera.  [_ _]
9. Check with the Traffic Control Room that the AID camera is
functioning correctly and that the MASK is correctly
aligned.   [_ _]
10. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
attention of the Electrical Supervisor or his
representative.  [_ _]
11. On completion of job, record any outstanding works that
require further corrective works in the Work Done area of
the job sheet, raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
works as required.
12. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

03 M Check operation of the Tnl Emergency Paging System
This job is to be performed in conjunction with the testing of
the Fire Telephones at the Tunnel Fire Cabinets.  The manual
announcement should be "The following is a Citylink test. One,
Two, Three, Four, Five, Six, Seven, Eight, Nine, Ten."
The message should last about ten seconds.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Traffic Control room prior to commencing this job.
2. Reference Manual: Australian Sound Service - Emergency Paging System
Manual - M-MCL-CU-20001.
3. Use vehicle arrow board and short term lane stoppage and
Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 20, 22, 23.
4. This job involves, whilst visiting all the odd numbered fire
cabinets to:
(a) listen to manual announcements over the emergency loud
speakers as well as
(b) at fire cabinet D11 listen to an automatic announcement
and
(c) at fire cabinet D17 listen to and ALL announcement
(d) listen to the announcement, in each case, and evaluate
for:-
(i) Clarity - e.g. message should be clear and
understandable,
(ii) Volume - e.g. Clearly hear message, hear above
ambient noise.  A suitable volume should be QUITE
loud in the tunnel.
(iii) Listen and be aware for non-functioning loud speakers
and loud speakers with degraded output.  The speakers
are mounted at 30m intervals throughout the tunnel
Record the result of  your evaluation on form TUNNEL
EMERGENCY PAGING SYSTEM - DOMAIN TUNNEL PA LOUD
SPEAKER TEST - TMF-3012-OP-0366
5. On completion of the Job, return the Job sheet and Form
TUNNEL EMERGENCY PAGING SYSTEM - DOMAIN TUNNEL PA LOUD
SPEAKER TEST - TMF-3012-OP-0366 to the Electrical/Electronics
Supervisor or his representative for evaluation.
6. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the Job.

01 W Mon, m'sure & report  Swan St pump stn flows
The measure of water flowing from the Swan Street pump station
is a measure of all the water collected in the Burnley Tunnel
drainage systems, from both dirty and Groundwater sources.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL
DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0031.
3. The Civil Team leader is to provide a copy of the previous
WEEKLY BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0233 for
detail of the previous readings.
4. At the Swan Street Pump Station Motor Control Centre, record
the Time and the Total flow in kilo litres for the pump
station on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233.
5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
6. Ensure a copy of the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
evaluation on completion  of the job.
Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
in excess of  0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
job to investigate to check the various bay flows for the
reason to the change in water flowrate.

01 M L1 Inspect of fire doors within the OMB
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. This work is to be carried out by suitably qualified personnel.
2. This work is for the OMB building.
3. Inspect the OMB fire doors to AS 1851.7 Type 1 inspection.  The
inspection shall consist of
an examination of the condition of the door set and a check that it
is operating satisfactorily.
In particular, the following routine should be followed.
3.1 Inspect for any remedial work that is outstanding and unfinished andrecord
works to be
completed in the comments field.
3.2 Remove any obstructions or non-approved devices such as wedges,
heavy objects or
hooks that are used to hold the door open.
3.3 Check that the door and all it's components, hardware and functions
are correct.
3.4 While the door is open, check that all screws are firm in the
hinges, latch set faceplate,
striking plate and the door closer body and bracket.
3.5 Inspect that the door identification data notice, required by the
regulatory authority is firmly
attached.  The notice is generally mounted on the door edge and
onthe door frame.
3.6 Check the closing and latching action (on the closing), and that
thedoor stopping action
(fully open limit) is functioning (on the opening).
3.7 With the door closed, check that the leaf is a reasonably even fit
in the frame.
4. Record the result of the inspection for each door on ""Operations
& Maintenance Building
Fire Door Inspection"" form TMF-3012-OP-0279
5. (a) Check the fire hydrant at the property front entrance for damage
,leakage.   [_ _]
(b) Trim plants and foliage to allow identification and access to
the hydrant.   [_ _]
6. Record the details of any further works required in the ""Work
Done""area of the Job Sheet.
7. Raise a new  job sheet for any corrective action that is required.
P2 - Medium Priority."

04 M Insp/cln of  WL CCTV cams, EWP, Centre of Road"
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the right hand
lane or mounting the median strip
2. Access to this camera group is:
(a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
(b) Position 0 and 1.
(c) Lane Closure: RHS lane
(d) Electrical Cabinet Location: Tollway
3. Set up the lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink  Procedure,
PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12.
4. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,
Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
(a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
necessary.   [_ _]
(b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
(c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,
re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
(d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
fastened to the PT300.
WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
(e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if
not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]
(f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
(Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the camera).
Ensure the co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
module and is secure.  [_ _]
6. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
(unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
of the PTZ .  [_ _]
7. Camera and Camera Housing;
WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
ALIVE.
(a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface insect
spray may be applied if necessary to the housing exterior
but must not be applied to the interior of the housing or
to the housing glass.  If ingress of moisture or insect
infestation is evident then carry out
steps (d) and (e).  [_ _]
(b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
mounts. [_ _]
(c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
"Rain-X " cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
(d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm.
WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.
If the heaters are not warm, spray the heater thermostat
(HTR) with FREEZE IT, then again check the operation of the
heater. [_ _]
(e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
8. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
controller.  [_ _]
9. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait 2
minutes then check again.  [_ _]
10. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job sheet.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
