12 M Maint of TSH tolling equipment
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Carry out the twelve monthly planned maintenance defined in
the CML RSE Users Manual maintenance schedule, document no.
M-MCL-ET-1225.
2. Perimeter access gate at technical shelter key required.
3. To access the 400W VDC lamps on the right hand side, set up a
lane closure as per work instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002 and the
TLO procedure PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 17, 18 and Plan 12 for the
left hand side access.
Note: In locations where a rear gantry exists the 400W VDC
lamps are located and accessed via the rear gantry structure.
Note: Any changes made to the closure in Work Done area of
the Job Sheet.
4. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment and
or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.
Adhere to safety instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 ""Working on
Gantry Structures"".
5. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical Shelter.
6. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plkan PL-MCL-ET-100001.
Preventative Maintenance No:
1201: Inspect electrical Pump set
1202: No procedure to check bolts are tightened.  Visually
check accessible bolt markings to ascertain if any movement,
inspect for corrosion.
1204: Inspect cabinets for cleanliness, corrosion , damage,
evidence of possible electrical malfunction, Inspect for
corrosion, ingress of moisture, insect infestation, damage
and security of all fasteners
1205: Checking VDC sensors and connectors.
The following Task is to be also carried out using extreme
care to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter the Fibre
Optic connectors or cables, ensure sufficient fibre optic
cable is available to allow removal of the fibre optic
connector (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
NOTE: Ensure the fibre Optic Connector remains free of
foreign matter.
Carefully remove the Fibre Optic Connector, clean the
connector body of any deposits. Take care to not touch the
Fibre Optic pins within the connector (if touched or dirty,
clean pins with Fibre Optic cleaner).
Apply a light  coating of silicon spray to a cloth and wipe
onto the Fibre Optic connector body, replace and exercise the
Fibre Optic Connector release collar.
Where connectors cannot be easily removed, record details in
the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and report the fact
to the Team Leader or his representative.
1206: Clean VR Sensor Unit Vent with brush or similar
7. Record in the area of the Job Sheet below any outstanding
works requiring further attention.  Create a new Job sheet
for any outstanding works and notify the Team Leader or his
representative of the outstanding works.  Record the New job
number in the "Work Done" area of this job sheet and in the
"Related Job" field of both jobs.
8. Notify Control Room prior to departing from the Technical
Shelter.

and connections and clean, if required, within the camera

8. If the power has been isolated, re-instate the 24V power
supply to the camera.  [_ _]
9. Check with the Traffic Control Room that the AID camera is
functioning correctly and that the MASK is correctly
aligned.   [_ _]
10. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
public address loud speakers and cables and any other
equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
(a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
attention of the Electrical Supervisor or his
representative.  [_ _]
11. On completion of job, record any outstanding works that
require further corrective works in the Work Done area of
the job sheet, raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
works as required.
12. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

06 M clean of tunnel lighting photometers
At the photometer **COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2. This job is to be carried out during a tunnel shut.
3. Clean the external surfaces, including glass window, of
accumulated dirt and dust.  Use Rain-x and soft cloth.
4. Visually inspect the mounting components for damage<(>,<)>
corrosion (Remove and repair any corrosion found) and
security of fixings.
5. Visually check the cabling to the photometer for damage or
any required repairs (Repairs as required).
6. Check the general alignment of the Photometer for accuracy.
Methodology for Alignment Check:
**The alignment point needs to be defined by taping the distance
betweenthe walls of the Tunnel entrance to identify the centre, then
taping from the pavement upto 1.5m above. The target needs to be this
point, taking into account that the laser beam would be generated
parallel to the centre of the photometer.
At the photometer, a laser level needs to be placed on top of the
photometer and the unit then needs to be adjusted until the beam hits
the target. The process must be repeated with the laser placed on each
side of the unit, meaning the adjustment on the target**
7. Record any outstanding works required.
8. Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works.
9. Notify the TCRO on completion of the Job

03 M Load test of the MGE UPS
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
2. Check with the control room if any UPS alarms are relevant.
3. Refer to MGE UPS Systems Manual, Galaxy User Manual
E-679380XT/FA, M-STG-EL-24009, and Schnieder Electric Tunnel
Electrical Services Training Notes, M-STG-EL-24001,
Section 9.
WARNING
THE UPS BATTERY POTENTIAL IS APPROXIMATELY 380 VOLTS AND IS
EARTHED.  THE BATTERIES CAN DELIVER A FAULT CURRENT OF
APPROXIMATELY 9000 AMPS.  EXPOSED BATTERY TERMINALS ARE
DANGEROUS AND MUST NOT BE TOUCHED.  IN THE VICINITY OF THE
BATTERIES USE ONLY TOOLS WHICH ARE FULLY INSULATED.
SAFETY GLASSES MUST BE WORN WHEN CARRYING OUT  MEASUREMENTS
ON THE BATTERIES.
4. Check the UPS control panel readout for alarms and or normal
status.  If an alarm is found, record the alarm in the Work
Done Area of the Job Sheet. Do Not Continue with this Job if
an alarm is present.  [_ _]
5. Record measurements on form 03 M MGE Uninterruptible Power
Supply Battery Inspection and Test, TMF-3012-OP-0099.
6. Measure and record the UPS room temperature.   [_ _]
7. Check and record DC voltage and AC ripple voltage for each
bank of batteries.  If a discrepancy is found then record in
the Work Done Area of the Job Sheet.  Do Not Continue
this job sheet if there is a discrepancy in the readings
recorded and the readings expected.  [_ _]
8. To simulate a power failure, Open Mains 1 Isolator (Q1), the
UPS operation will change to the batteries.  [_ _]
9. Operate the UPS, in this mode, for at least 10
minutes.  [_ _]
10. Measure and record the DC voltage for each shelf of the
battery banks.
11. Measure and record the DC current flow in each battery bank.
12. Return the UPS to normal operation by closing Mains 1
Isolator Q1.  [_ _]
13. With an Optical thermometer measure the temperature of the
batteries and their inter-connections.  Temperature readings
should approximate ambient room temperature.  When a
connection is found to having a temperature greater than 5
degrees above room  temperature, in the Work Done Area of
the Job Sheet, record the battery location, terminal
identification, measured  temperature.  [_ _]
14. With an Optical thermometer measure the average temperature
of the two (AC & DC) capacitor banks and record the result.
15. With an anemometer measure and record the airflow from each
of the UPS cooling fans.
16. With the Optical thermometer measure and record the
temperature of each of the UPS cooling fans.  [_ _]
17. Ensure Normal operation of the UPS.  [_ _]
18. Sweep and clean the UPS room:
Sweep the floor and remove accumulated webs from the
walls.   [___]
Sweep the control panel room floors as well, vacuum the
control panel enclosures and any surfaces that will collect
dust deposits.   [___]
Clean the front panel of all accumulated dirt and
dust.   [___]
Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
19. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the UPS room and
equipment etc,  in the "Work Done"section of the job
sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
20. Leave a duplicate 03M MGE Uninterruptible Power Supply
Battery Inspection and  test form in the UPS room.  Compare
previously recorded data and record in the Work Done
Area of the Job Sheet any data that shows any degradation.
21. Notify the control room on completion of the job."

03 M Inspect, Test & Clean of Yarra Boulevard Pump Station"
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to leaving
the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for
fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,
Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray,
Rodent Bait Station
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of the Pump Station as well the cleaning,
inspections and maintenance of the relevant areas.
B PUMP AND PUMP CONTROL OPERATION
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
2. Reference Manual, TOJV, Pump Station Operation and
Maintenance Manuals - M-STG-ME-20001. Volume 3.
3. WARNING:  THE WET WELL IS DESIGNATED A CONFINED SPACE AND
MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED SPACE CONDITIONS.
Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry
TMI-33012-SA-0015.  Ensure the vent fan has operated for a
minimum period of 15 minutes prior to entering the dry well.
4. At the Local Control Panel
(a) Check the switchboard, situated adjacent to the pump well
for local alarm conditions.   [_ _]
(b) Carry out visual inspections both internally and
externally the control panel for damage, corrosion,
evidence of insect infestation, ingress of moisture, dust
and grime (clean as required).   [_ _]
(c) Check the cable connections for tightness and signs of
overheating and inspect the electrical control
equipment.  [_ _]
(d) Replace any failed panel indicator lamps.  [___]
(e) Record the hours run reading in the Work Done area of
the job sheet.   [_ _]
5. Inspect the wet well.
(a) Remove the covers (gatic lifters required) from the wet
well.
(b) Inspect for general cleanliness and accumulated debris in
the wet well, hose down any pumpable materials and remove
any non-pumpable solids.   [_ _]
6.  Inspection of the dry well, pumps and valves.
(a) Inspect the dry well for general cleanliness and
accumulated debris, clean if required.   [_ _]
(b) The pipes, valves and pumps for corrosion and evidence
of leaks.   [_ _]
7. Check the water level in the low level pump area.  If the
water level is above the high level setting then manually
operate the sump pump to drain if necessary.   Record in the
Work Done of the job sheet and report for corrective
maintenance.   [_ _]
8. Switch the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to MANUAL
position.   [_ _]
(a) Check the cabling to the pump for damage and that it is
clear from possible damage.   [_ _]
9. Start the pump PSYBSWP1 by pressing the START pushbutton.
(a) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work
Done area of the job sheet.   [_ _]
(b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running, vibration
and that sufficient gland water flows regularly.  (One to
two drops per minute)   [_ _]
(c) Observe that the pump discharge is sufficient to drawdown
the water level.    [_ _]
CAUTION:  Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
alarm point as lack of submergence may cause pumpset
damage.
(d) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton. Check the
operation of non-return valve (NRV), as the flow stops.
The NRV should close with
(i) a sharp audible metallic sound
(ii) the counterweight returning to pre-start position or
lower, as well
(iii) backflow through the pump should cease within 30
seconds.
If a faulty closure is suspected, the pump should be
re-started and run for 2 minutes and  the operation of
the NRV monitored again.   [_ _]
If a faulty closure is still suspected, record in the
Work Done  area of the job sheet and report for
corrective maintenance.  [_ _]
10. Repeat steps 8 and  9 for pump PSYBSWP2.   [_ _]
11. Repeat steps 8 and  9 for pump PSYBSWP3.   [_ _]
12. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
position. [_ _]
13. Check the operation of the Taylor level controller, using
the wet well sight gauge situated on the wall of the dry
well.   [_ _]
14. Test the operation of each of the isolating valves, in turn,
by partial closing and fully opening again.    [_ _]
15. Check that the dry well ventilation system is functional by
checking the air flow and the filters for blockages.  [_ _]
16. On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters
e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
leaks
lighting faults
door damage
evidence of structural damage to the Pump Station and
equipment etc,  in the Work Done  section of the
job sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
17. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done
area of the job sheet.
18. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
C  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
1. On entering control rooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation
fans, if operating.   [_ _]
2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,
use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
abnormal events.  [_ _]
3. Check the interior and external lighting for operation,
including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace
faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
4. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient
plus 10°C should be considered abnormal and must be noted in
the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team
Leader or his representative is informed of the abnormality.
Raise a new job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
5. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and components  for evidence of burn
marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record anything
abnormal in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and raise
a new jobsheet for any corrective action. Ensure the Team
Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality.   [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
7. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,
gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general
operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required
repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
actions.  [_ _]
8. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
9. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for
dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
10. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.
Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
11. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for
faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp replacement
or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
actions.   [_ _]
12. PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators
found to indicate abnormal conditions are to be logged in
the work done area of the job sheet and a new job sheet
raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
module security screws are not
loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the
enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated dust
and debris.  [_ _]
13. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.  [_ _]
14. Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective
actions.  [_ _]
D. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform
the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and
or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
4. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets,
ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on
all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops of
cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
5. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
cleaning materials .  [_ _]
6. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light
fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]
7. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
8. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
9. Carry out Exterior checks of the Yarra Boulevard Pump station
building.
(a) Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the building
for damage, erosion, graffiti.  [_ _]
(b) Visually inspect the building walls, roof, guttering and
downpipes for damage, leaks and or blockages, remove any
debris or materials that could cause a blockage.  [_ _]
(c) Inspect the general area surrounding the building for
erosion and damage to surfaces, fences, gates,
pavements   [_ _]
10. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  Replace bait
station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
11. Check for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
Record any positive infestations in the Work Done area
of the job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
corrective actions.  [_ _]
12. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.  [_ _]
13. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g.
Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b) All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
14. Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
Leader or his representative of any corrective
actions.  [_ _]
15. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.

01 M Trunk test of the Fire T'Phones in the Burnley tunnel
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. This job can be carried out at the same time as the RHL
BT ERTs job is done in the Burnley Tunnel.  The fire phones
are at the fire cabinets.
2. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.

Work Instruction Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and
Translink Procedure , PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 20, 22, 23.

- Fire Telephone System  M-STG-FS-20002.

(a) Visually check the phones for damage and or vandalism.

communication.
(ii) Have the control room return the call and confirm two
way communications.

following inspection.

evidence of damage and or leaks.

communication tests on the form Fire Telephone Trunk Test -
Burnley Tunnel - TMF-3012-OP-0085.

required in the comments area area of the form.

Telephone Trunk Test - Burnley Tunnel - TMF-3012-OP-0085 to
the Electrical / Electronics team Leader or his
representative.
10. The Electrical / Electronics Team Leader or his
representative is to raise a new job sheet for any
corrective actions required.

04 M Insp & clean of WL CCTV cams, 23 Boom emerg lane etc."
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the emergency
lane.

PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12.

5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
(a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation, clean if necessary.
[_ _]
(b) Inspect the cabinet and check that  the equipment mounted
in the cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
(c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,
re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
(d) Check the fibre patch leads for damage and that they are
securely fastened to the PT300.
WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC

7. Camera and Camera Housing;
WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
ALIVE.
(a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
moisture and any insect infestation. Surface insect spray
may be applied if necessary to the housing exterior
but must not be applied to the interior of the housing or
to the housing glass. If ingress of moisture or insect
infestation is evident then carry out steps (d) and
(e).  [_ _]

thermostat (HTR) with FREEZE IT, then again check the
operation of the heater. [_ _]
(e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
8. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ controller.
[_ _]
9. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
full movement and pre-programmed positions. If camera fails
to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait 2
minutes then check again.  [_ _]
10.On completion of job record anything outside normal
parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.

03 M Maint of Gantry Tolling Equipment
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Carry out the three monthly planned maintenance defined in
the CML RSE Users Manual maintenance schedule, document no.
M-MCL-ET-1225.
2. Perimeter access gate at technical shelter key required.
3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment
and or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to safety
instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 "Working on Gantry Structures
4. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
5. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plan PL-MCL-ET-100001.
Preventative Maintenance No.0301
When carrying out the cleaning of VDC sensors (in 0301),
inspect the area around the connectors for evidence of
corrosion.
If corrosion is evident, then clean the area as described
below.
Where cleaning is to be also carried out, use extreme care
to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter any
connectors.
The Fibre Optic Connector is to be only removed on the
12 Monthly  Cycle (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
Prior to removing any connector or cover socket, clean
surface corrosion and deposits from around connectors,
socket covers and the surrounding surfaces use a tooth
brush to assist if necessary.
Remove the three socket covers (remove only if possible
using fingers) and apply a light spray of silicon to
the three (3) socket covers, replacing and exercising
the threads.
With all caps and plugs re-installed apply a light spray of
silicon to the area around the plugs and caps.
Check for silicon overspray on the VDC sensor window and
clean if necessary.
Where connectors or socket covers cannot be easily removed,
record details in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and
report the fact to the Team Leader or his representative.
0301: Check image quality and
,,,, alignment with CML Clean glass regardless of image.
,,,, Lubrication of mounting bracket carried out on removal
,,,, only.  Lightly spray with lubricant.
0302: Clean external glass of front and rear VR sensors.
Inspect mounting brackets and lubricate as required.
Ensure pins are cleaned and lubricated using silicon
spray prior to installing.
0303: Check VR Illuminator that there are less than 10%
defective IR LEDs,Advice CML if suspect below 10%
0304: Clean front surface of TRX, inspect mtg bracket and
lubricate as required
0305: Clean outside of glass cover of VDC, Replace failed
lamps, Lubricate arms as required.
Inspect VDC arm locating pins and chains. Record any
works required and report any equipment that needs
repair.
0306: Road Markers: Inspect for clarity & Cleanliness.( High ,,
,, contrast between marker & road). (If road markers need
to be changed, inform the Team Leader.)
0307: Clean the glass of VSS sensor
0308: Inspect Distribution Cabinet for loose or damaged   ,,
cables. Clean cabinet for insects or moisture.
6. Record in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet any
outstanding works requiring further attention.  Create a
new Job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative of the outstanding works.
Record the New job number in the "Work Done" area of this
job sheet and in the "Related Job" field of both jobs.
7. Notify Control Room prior to departing from the Technical
Shelter."

03 M Inspect & Clean LV Switchboards and rooms
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning and
inspections of the Building
and Electrics, prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum
Cleaner, Cloths,
lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,
Rubbish bags, Filter
material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Rodent Bait Station
A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Substations along with the attached UPS rooms for the cleaning,
inspections and
maintenance of the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Sub Station Low Voltage Equipment and rooms and attached UPS Rooms  )
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant Sub stations.
2. On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans, if
operating, to
reduce ambient noise.   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. At Sub Stations, fill-in the log-book [_ _]
5. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including
theoperational tube within
EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
6. (a) Visually inspect the Low Voltage (Main Circuit breakers) for
evidence of damage and
or corrosion.  [_ _]
(b) Visually inspect the Low Voltage (Bus Tie Circuit Breakers) for
evidence of damage
and or corrosion.  [_ _]
(c) Check for any external indicators or flags, reset any found
tripped.  [_ _]
(d) Read and record in the ""Work Done"" the number of operations of
the circuit breaker.
(e) Record anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and raise a new
jobsheet for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or
his representative is
informed of the abnormality.  [_ _]
7. (a) Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
accessibleequipment and
components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
Use an Infra-red
temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus 10°C should
be considered
abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of the
JobSheet and ensure
the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality.  Raise a
new job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
(b)  While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment
and components for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.
Record anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and raise a
new jobsheet for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader
or his
representative is informed of  the abnormality.  [_ _]
(c) Check and listen for relays and contactors that are chattering,
arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and
escutcheons for serviceability and general operation, lubricate asrequired.
Carry out
any required repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
actions.  [_ _]
9. Inspect single line drawings for legibility.  Record details of
drawings requiring
replacement in the ""Work Done"" area and report to the Team
leaderor his representative.
10. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
damage.  [_ _]
12. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
13. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
required.  [_ _]
14. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out repairs
or indicator lamp
replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
[_ _]
15. PLC Equipment  shall be inspected for the following
(a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
to indicate abnormal
conditions are to be logged in the ""Work Done"" area of the
job Sheet and a new Job
Sheet raised to investigate and correctr the error.  [_ _]
(b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
connections, for security.  [_ _]
(c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are
not loose.  [_ _]
(d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush, ensure the enclosure
and PLC modules
are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
16. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
accumulation.
17. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for operation
and security.  Check
with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of
analarm.  Repair
faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
18.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this job,
thejob number number of
the alternate Job.   [_ _]
C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
Inspect for source of
any water.  Record any details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job
sheet and inform the
Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and or
stored items.  Remove
any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets, ledges,
cable trays,
cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces,
e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
4. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved cleaning
materials .  [_ _]
5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light fittings,cable
trays and
ceilings.  [_ _]
6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
7. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  replace bait station
if bait is near
exhausted.  [_ _]
9. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.   Record
any abnormal
parameter in the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet.   Raise a new
jobsheet for any
outstanding corrective actions.  [_ _]
10. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.  [_ _]
11. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
(a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g. Fans,
Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
(b)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
(c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
(d)  Generators in Tech Shelters to be left in a state of readiness
for operation.  [_ _]
(e)  UPS in Substations and Tech Shelters to be left in state of
readiness for
operation. [_ _]
12.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the Job
Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective actions.
Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and this job, the
job number number of
the alternate Job.   [_ _]
13. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
"

03 M Maint of Gantry Tolling Equipment
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Carry out the three monthly planned maintenance defined in
the CML RSE Users Manual maintenance schedule, document no.
M-MCL-ET-1225.
2. Perimeter access gate at technical shelter key required.
3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment
and or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to safety
instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 "Working on Gantry Structures
4. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical
Shelter.
5. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plan PL-MCL-ET-100001.
Preventative Maintenance No.0301
When carrying out the cleaning of VDC sensors (in 0301),
inspect the area around the connectors for evidence of
corrosion.
If corrosion is evident, then clean the area as described
below.
Where cleaning is to be also carried out, use extreme care
to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter any
connectors.
The Fibre Optic Connector is to be only removed on the
12 Monthly  Cycle (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
Prior to removing any connector or cover socket, clean
surface corrosion and deposits from around connectors,
socket covers and the surrounding surfaces use a tooth
brush to assist if necessary.
Remove the three socket covers (remove only if possible
using fingers) and apply a light spray of silicon to
the three (3) socket covers, replacing and exercising
the threads.
With all caps and plugs re-installed apply a light spray of
silicon to the area around the plugs and caps.
Check for silicon overspray on the VDC sensor window and
clean if necessary.
Where connectors or socket covers cannot be easily removed,
record details in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and
report the fact to the Team Leader or his representative.
0301: Check image quality and
,,,, alignment with CML Clean glass regardless of image.
,,,, Lubrication of mounting bracket carried out on removal
,,,, only.  Lightly spray with lubricant.
0302: Clean external glass of front and rear VR sensors.
Inspect mounting brackets and lubricate as required.
Ensure pins are cleaned and lubricated using silicon
spray prior to installing.
0303: Check VR Illuminator that there are less than 10%
defective IR LEDs,Advice CML if suspect below 10%
0304: Clean front surface of TRX, inspect mtg bracket and
lubricate as required
0305: Clean outside of glass cover of VDC, Replace failed
lamps, Lubricate arms as required.
Inspect VDC arm locating pins and chains. Record any
works required and report any equipment that needs
repair.
0306: Road Markers: Inspect for clarity & Cleanliness.( High ,,
,, contrast between marker & road). (If road markers need
to be changed, inform the Team Leader.)
0307: Clean the glass of VSS sensor
0308: Inspect Distribution Cabinet for loose or damaged   ,,
cables. Clean cabinet for insects or moisture.
6. Record in the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet any
outstanding works requiring further attention.  Create a
new Job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative of the outstanding works.
Record the New job number in the "Work Done" area of this
job sheet and in the "Related Job" field of both jobs.
7. Notify Control Room prior to departing from the Technical
Shelter."

12 M Lev 2 Inspect of HV system for operation & Faults
All TS procedures in TMI-3012-SA-0102 High Voltage Safety Work
Instruction.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2. The following work is to be carried by the sub-contractor
under the supervision of an electrical/electronics
technician.
3. Ensure that the Three monthly HV electric inspection has been
carried out and that
(a) The General Section of the above job has been completed
and
(b) Inspect the earthing conductors, earthing electrodes and
connections ensuring all cabling, connections and
installation meet the AS 3000 standard.
4. (Schneider SM6 Switchboard, Circuit Breakers and Isolators)
(a) Read and record the number of operation cycles for each
Circuit Breaker and Isolator.  [_ _]
5. (Substation Earthing Systems)
The result of all tests, inspections and observations
including date of test, ground and weather conditions are to
be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
leader or his representative.
(a) At each substation and HV switchroom, carry out an
earthing resistance test in accordance with AS3000.
(b) Examine each earthing system in turn and check for
tightness of connections, and the condition of system
components e.g. Earthing electrodes, earthing
connections, conductors etc.
6. (RMU Battery Supply and Chargers)
The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to
be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
leader or his representative.
(a) Inspect the battery compartment for damage, appearance
and cleanliness.
(b) Check that the charger is functional.
(c) Check the battery voltage on float charge.
(d) Check that the battery compartment ventilation vents are
clean and clear.
(e) Check the external battery connections for tightness and
corrosion.  Clean and tighten as required.
(f) Check battery cases and or covers are not cracked or
distorted.
(g) Carry out a performance test of the battery bank.
(i) Discharge the batteries, via a load, over a two hour
period. Record both terminal and battery voltage and
battery temperature prior to commencing the test as
well as at completion of test.  Where the battery or
terminal voltage at completion of test is less than
80% of nominal voltage, then the battery is
approaching the end of it's serviceable life and
replacement options should be recommended.
(h) Check and record the on-load charger output (Voltage and
current)
(i)  Check the charger electrical connections and wiring for
damage etc.
7. Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection
results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new
job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
Leader or his representative.  Include in the Related Job
field of the new and this job, the job number of the
alternate Job.   [_ _]
8. At Substations fill-in the log book.   [_ _]

current HV vicinity permit.
The water management plant toolbox is located inside Sub 2.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Check with the TCR and confirm if there is any discharge from
the Waste Water Management Plant to the sewer in progress.
If a discharge is in progress then disregard this job for
this week.
2. (a) Check the water level in the Storage Tank and record in
the Work Done area of the Job Sheet only if the water
level is greater than 0.5 mts.  Water level is to be ,,,,,,
recorded by using the dip-stick.
(b) Ensure the gatic cover is replaced correctly on
completion.  [_ _]
3. (a) Check  the water level in the Batch Tank and record in
the Work Done area of the Job Sheet only if the water
level is greater then 0.5 mts.  Water level is to be ,,,,,,
recorded by using the dip-stick.
4. Check that valves V2, V5 & V6 are fully closed and that they
are locked in the closed position.  If the valves are not
closed and locked then close and lock the valves.
5. Return the completed job sheet to the Civil Team Leader or
his representative who will forward any readings greater that
0.5 mts to the TLO Environmental Manager .
Enter Recordings Below
Storage Tank    ___________________  mts.
Batch Tank       ____________________  mts.

01 M Inspect of O & M B Comp Room Air Conditioning Units
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
2. Reference manual A E Smith, Operating & Maintenance Manual for
Mechanical Services
serving Melbourne City Link project Southern Link. Operations &
Maintenance Building
Balston Street Sth Melbourne.  M-OMB-OM-20000.
3. This job is to be carried out by the sub-contracter under the
supervision of the Electrical
Electronic Technician.
4. Work plan for the EDP Processing Room - Air Conditioning Unit No. 2
4.1. Check the filters for blockages,  install new filters if required.
[_ _]
Filters:
AC 2 & 3 - 750mm x 460mm x 100mm (2off)
AC 4 & 5 - 790mm x 760mm x 100mm (2off)
4.2. Check the V-belt for deterioration.  Install new belt and
re-tension, if required.    [_ _]
4.3. Check the pulleys for alignment and undue wear.  Realign and
install new pulleys if
required.    [_ _]
4.4. Check the fan bearings, as well as check that the fan can rotate
freely.   [_ _]
4.5. Measure the fan motor current and compare with the rated current.
[_ _]
4.6. Clean the condensate tray of accumulated dust and debris.  Clean
the tray and the drain
if required.    [_ _]
4.7. Check the humidifier bottle and electrodes for scale. Descale if
required.    [_ _]
4.8. Check the electrical connection to the electrodes, for spacing,
isolation and security.    [_ _]
4.9. Check the steam hoses for support and condition.    [_ _]
4.10. Check the manual flush operation.    [_ _]
4.11. Clean accumulated dirt and debris from the humidifier tray , and
ensure the drain is
clear.    [_ _]
4.12. Charge the humidifier with clean water and check the time taken toboil.
[_ _]
4.13. Check that the wet floor sensor is mounted securely, and clear of
all debris that may
restrict its operation.    [_ _]
4.14. Check that the control panel functions correctly.    [_ _]
4.15. Check for any loose connections.    [_ _]
4.16. Check the connections of the electrical heater mounted in the AC
unit, repair if
required.    [_ _]
4.17. Measure the phase currents of the heaters and record any readings
out of
parameters.    [_ _]
4.18. Check the heater mounts for security.    [_ _]
5. (a) Repeat step 4 for Toll Computer Room Air Conditioning Unit - AC
3.    [_ _]

6. On completion of the job, record anything outside of normal

01 W Mon, m'sure & report  Swan St pump stn flows
The measure of water flowing from the Swan Street pump station
is a measure of all the water collected in the Burnley Tunnel
drainage systems, from both dirty and Groundwater sources.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL
DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0031.
3. The Civil Team leader is to provide a copy of the previous
WEEKLY BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0233 for
detail of the previous readings.
4. At the Swan Street Pump Station Motor Control Centre, record
the Time and the Total flow in kilo litres for the pump
station on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233.
5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
6. Ensure a copy of the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
TMF-3012-OP-0233 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
evaluation on completion  of the job.
Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
in excess of  0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
job to investigate to check the various bay flows for the
reason to the change in water flowrate.

01 M Replace faulty carraigeway & ramp street lighting
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the Traffic Control room prior to commencing works
2. Setup traffic management as per Work Instruction, Traffic
Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure
PR-PS-IR-059.  Traffic management for short term low traffic
volumes such as plans 13, 17 and 18 can be used as situations
require.  Record traffic plan number used along with the
weather conditions and any changes to the traffic management
plans in the work done area of the jobsheet.
3. Personnel are to wear a safety vest as minimum, vehicle with
rotating vehicle hazard lights are a minimum requirement.
Vehicle hazard lights must be operating when travelling in
the emergency lane.
4. Replace lamps in street and ramp lighting and where necessary
repair faulty light fittings.  Priority to be given to where
there is two or more consecutive malfunctioning lamps.
5. The latest completed inspection form SOUTHERN LINK NIGHT
STREET LIGHTING INSPECTIONS TMF-3012-OP-0087 can be used to
assist in identifying areas requiring attention.  Record the
light pole numbers and the works that was carried out in the
Work Done area of  the jobsheet.
6. Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding corrective actions
that require further attention.
7. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of this work.

06 M Inspect of HV RMU batteries and chargers
Vacuum Cleaner and Thermometer required for this task
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1.  Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2.  Refer to M Brodribb Model D5414 24V 10A DC Charger
System manual M-STG-EL-24028.
3.  Check the RMU battery charger in the sub-station by:
(a) Check general appearance and cleanliness of the battery
charger area and ventilation  louvres.  Remove accumulated
dirt and debris,  Clean cabinet by vacuuming if
required.  [_ _]
(b) Check charger output current and that out put voltage is
present.  Record Volt and current levels in Work Done Area
ofthe job sheet.  [_ _]
(c) Check batteries for cracks, bulges and or
damage.  [_ _]
(d) Check the terminals and connections for tightness or
corrosion. Remedy as required   [_ _]
(e)  Check that the float voltage is within 27.9V to 28.8V
range.  [_ _]

above Ambient  [__]

outstanding works requiring further attention.  Raise a job
sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team leader
or his representative.  Include in the Related Jobs field to

6.  Notify the TCRO when the job is completed.

01 M Trunk test of the Fire T'Phones in the Burnley tunnel
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. This job can be carried out at the same time as the RHL
BT ERTs job is done in the Burnley Tunnel.  The fire phones
are at the fire cabinets.
2. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
3. Use vehicle arrow board and short term lane stoppage as per
Work Instruction Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and
Translink Procedure , PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 20, 22, 23.
4. Reference Manual: Siemens Melbourne City Link Tunnel Project
- Fire Telephone System  M-STG-FS-20002.
5. At the Burnley Tunnel fire cabinets
(a) Visually check the phones for damage and or vandalism.
(b) Using spray-on Nifty and a clean cloth, clean the
telephone of dirt and accumulated grime.
(c) At each Fire telephone;
(i) Dial 311(the control room) and confirm two way
communication.
(ii) Have the control room return the call and confirm two
way communications.
(iii) Ensure the fire cabinet door is closed correctly
following inspection.
(d) Visually check the fire cabinet and surrounds for
evidence of damage and or leaks.
6. Record inspection result, cleaning and results of
communication tests on the form Fire Telephone Trunk Test -
Burnley Tunnel - TMF-3012-OP-0085.
7. Record the details of any further corrective actions that are
required in the comments area area of the form.
8. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
9. Return the completed Job Sheet as well as the form Fire
Telephone Trunk Test - Burnley Tunnel - TMF-3012-OP-0085 to
the Electrical / Electronics team Leader or his
representative.
10. The Electrical / Electronics Team Leader or his
representative is to raise a new job sheet for any
corrective actions required.
Work completed as per above work plan.

24 M Inspect the HV system for operation & Faults
All TS procedures in TMI-30.2-SA-0102 High Voltage Safety Work
Instruction.
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
2. Refer to Manual Merlin Gerin Masterpact Instruction Notice
M-STG-EL-24030
3. Read the maintenance indicator on main circuit breakers on
the MCC and MDB and record the result in the Work Done area
of the Job Sheet.  If the reading is greater than 100, then
raise a job sheet to have the .  [_ _]
4. Following the maintenance indicator reaching 100 or when it
has again incremented by 100, since the replacement of
contacts.
(a) Visually inspect the condition of switching contacts.
Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet if contacts
are damaged.   [_ _]
(b) Visually inspect the condition of the Arc Chutes.
Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet if the Arc
Chutes are damaged.   [_ _]
Create a new job sheet for the any outstanding works and
inform the team leader of any damage and or outstanding works
found.
5. Annually, when the HV transformer is tested, open and close
each main circuit breaker:
(a) Locally
(b) Remotely from the Traffic Control room using the
different auxiliaries successively.  [_ _]
Create a new job sheet for the any outstanding works and
inform the team leader of any oustanding works found.

01 W Weekly inspection of WL 1 tollway  - Off Pavement
**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Inspect Off-Pavement Tollway assets weekly as listed on
Regular Weekly  Inspection Report TMF-3012-OP-0002.
Record maintenance requirements.   Reference procedure
TMI-3012-OP-0001.
2. Personnel to carry safety vest, maintenance standards and
rotating vehicle hazard light and a tape recorder as a
minimum requirement.  Vehicle hazard light must be operating
when travelling in the emergency lane.
3. Notify control room if you are required to stop in emergency
lane to carry out further inspections
4. Check by 'drive-by' inspection  using a systematic approach
to encompass all inspection targets, these can be carried
out on separate days of the week ie; drainage and pits one
day and landscape on another, fencing one day and graffiti
on another etc.
Road Reserve pits/culverts for damage and blockage
Road Reserve drainage for blockages or flooding
Shared pathways
Delineators
Noise Barriers
Guard Rail
Fencing & access gates
Litter
Graffiti
Landscape areas
Record any other requirements outside specified maintenance
levels.
5. Make temporary repairs to unsafe items if possible, and if
safe to do so.  (  ie:  sweep stones and any ponding water
from pathways.)
6. Raise new job sheet or add to running jobsheets, any major
corrective maintenance action.
7. Ensure that any minor routine action identified is noted for
action on the current fortnightly litter and landscape
jobsheet.
8. Off-Pavement Inspection

Wed [      ]      Thurs [      ]
